Text: These pumpkin seeds were so yummy. At first I thought they were too small, but I was wrong. They are the perfect size. They come in 4-oz bags which makes them perfect for taking in the car and snaking. The kids loved them too. They were not overly salted, just lightly. The best part, they were crispy, not soft and bland like they have been on a shelf somewhere for ages. Just perfect. Will buy again.

Summary: Closest to homemade as you can get!
Text: These seeds have the perfect amount of salt and crispiness. Truly taste like pumpkin seeds you'd bake yourself! Huge step up compared to the typical bleached, too salty seeds that others sell. I definitely recommend this brand.

ProfileName: LaughingLion "I am Lion, read me review!"
Text:
One of the the things I hate about buying snack food is most companies can not get the right amount of salt on to foods.

That was not a problem here.

Great flavor, nice sized packets.
I love these pumpkin seeds!  The bag is resealable, so I can just take a small handful and keep the rest fresh.  They are really crispy and the taste is amazing too.  Try them!

Summary: Don't know why others are raving
Text:
I was going to give these seeds a 3-star rating until I realized, they're not good enough to order again. I'm sure I don't want them again so I'm closer to "I don't like" than "OK".

The good:
The salt content IS pretty good. On par with how we season our own.
They're crisp.

The bad:
Seeds are pretty small which means the ratio between seed and shell is not great.
Small seeds means you almost can't shell them, you HAVE to eat the shells.
Too many seeds have a sour taste which ruins the hole experience.
Per ounce they're more expensive than any others I've tried.

I wish David's Seeds put out a lighter sea salt version. Their seeds are much larger so you can peel the shells if you want. They just have too much salt. I remember eating the Indian brand when I was a kid. They had a great tasting seed but unfortunately even more salt than Davids.

These are fantastic. I bought two cases of them. They are not too salty, just enough to be able to eat as many as you like without getting overly salty.  I will likely buy more when I run out. These crispy seeds are hard to find in grocery stores. I found them someplace like a convenience gas station but cannot remember where that was so I checked here for them.

Summary: Energy Club Crispy Pumpkin Seeds, 3.50-Ounce Bags
Text: Energy Club Crispy Pumpkin Seeds, 3.50-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)My favorite pumpkin seeds to snack on. Lightly salted and very crunchy with good flavor.

It's difficult finding pumpkin seeds in my area so I turned to Amazon. I usually eat David pumpkin seeds, but when searching for them on Amazon (which the site does carry) I came across these. The reviews seemed decent enough so I decided to give them a try. I'm not disappointed. The seeds are crispy and lightly salted; a perfect snack. If you like taking the seeds out of their shell, then this product isn't for you, but if you like eating them whole...then you should try these.

Summary: Just like you made them yourself
Text: These are the best if you like the kind of seeds you make yourself during Halloween.  If you like the white ones that you find at the gas station stores you won't like these.  They taste fresh out of the oven, brown and lightly salted.  These are by far the best I've ever had.
These seed taste really good.  I wish they were a little bigger- if they were I would have given them a 5 rather than 4.  Enjoy!

I had just gotten home from my weekly bowling league to find my fiancee in bed with our neighbor.  You know how they say that a mother has so much adrenaline pumping through her system when her child is in danger that she can just about lift a car off of it?  When I saw those two desecrating my queen-sized air mattress in the corner, I got so worked up that I could have taken that mother and her child, locked them up in the trunk of that car, and tossed it onto the roof of of the self-storage facility around the corner, the one with the orange hangar-style doors.  That's three stories high.  Anyway, the two fled out the back door and I went into a rage.  I broke everything in the house that reminded me of her.  The toaster-oven she used to make me pepperoni bagel-bites for breakfast each morning, the ironing board that we trimmed the legs down on so that it could double as a coffee table during that Pawn Stars marathon last July.  After about 45 minutes, I was totally drained from breaking stuff.  I took the truck down the road to the Citgo station to refuel and got a sleeve of those mini-powdered donuts and a Redbull Zero because my doctor says that too much sugar will make my Diabetes flare up.  It's a lot less syrupy than the regular Redbulls, but it definitely perked me back up.  On the way home, that Mr. Mister song about Broken Wings came on and I knew it was a sign because my heart was broken and Redbull gives you wings.  At that point, I knew I had to forgive her.  We've been happily married for 8-months now with a little one on the way, and I can honestly say that without Redbull Zero, I may have never gotten up the courage to patch things up.  I highly recommend this product to anyone going through a rough patch in their relationship.
I love dried fruit, and these apricots are some of the best I have ever had. Moist, favorful and of the best quality.

Summary: Solid addition to the K-cup portfolio
Text:
This is a nice smooth coffee, a part of the Keurig K-cup portfolio. This is labelled "extra bold." Not sure that that is the case. This has a nice smooth, albeit rather mild (and even bland) flavor.

However, some K-cups have a harsh, almost acidic, quality to them and are not particularly pleasant. This produces a nice cup of coffee.

I order this pearl sugar to make liege waffle.
I looked up other Belgian pearl sugar too but it was way to big granulate.
This sugar has just right size and amount for my waffle.
I definitely will order again later when I need it.

I can't imagine how you could mess up sugar and this product is exactly what it's supposed to be. I tried the recipe for kanelbullar from the box and it was a little dry and dense. Then again, that was the first thing I've baked in about 20 years so it could have been me!

Used these in a waffle recipe that said they would dissolve and make air pockets that had some sweetness, resulting in a light, crispy waffle.  They did not dissolve but became burned clusters that got stuck to the waffle iron grids.  The waffles were like lead, were sickening sweet and basically the worst ones I've ever eaten.  I certainly would not recommend this Pearl Sugar to anyone.

Summary: Harves of creamy spices and flavors
Text:
Mayonnaise is an interesting product, cool, smooth and creamy it's the lush counter partner of the low cal mustard but it's of those things people think they don't like until they taste it in the proper way and that's all it takes for a secret love affair with luxe sauces and recipes that can be made with it to start.

I am a big fan of sandwiches and any new way I can spruce them up, especially with nice sauces and spices is always at the top of my new ideas to make for lunch or to fill into an interesting menu on the weekends. The Rouille is spicy, that I deducted just from looking at the angry orange color in the jar, the color of auburn harvest on a stormy night. The taste is of cream immersed in a sea of chili peppers and garlic with a peppery background. My favorite way to eat it is in a sandwich with a leftover cold coconut breaded chicken cutlet with some crisp romaine in between two toasted crusty slices of bread smeared on the inner sides with the Rouille spicy mayonnaise . The taste is a tropical rendition of a Caesar Chicken Sandwich I get at Hale and Hearty here in NYC but much easier since I made it at home and it took no effort.

Great on bread, meat or as a condiment to any afternoon snack or smeared on some California roll for a spicy finish. There is no end to the amount of uses this product provides.

- Kasia S.

Summary: Perfect for Popsicles and Italian Ices
Text:
Barry Farms is known for their quality and rare, hard-to-find ingredients. Xanthan Gum is no exception, but anything can be found on Amazon, right? Barry Farms to the rescue!

Xanthan Gum is used to modify the viscosity of liquids, on a very low scale (typically 1/3 tsp per 1 gallon). Because of the difficulty in combining Xanthan Gum to a liquid evenly, you should mix this into your liquid very slowly, in a blender at full speed, and it should be one of your steps (before adding other ingredients, including Guar Gum).

Many ice creams and popsicles, even Italian ices, call for two main ingredients: Xanthan Gum and sometimes Guar Gum (also available from Barry Farms: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00015UC5M?tag=a52-20&ie=UTF8). Both of these gums behave quite differently, and Xanthan Gum can be harder to mix into your liquid solution (again, mix in slowly via blender running on high), but both are effective means to preventing crystallization of liquids, which is the secret to making softer ice cream and popsicles instead of rock hard ice!

Another interesting characteristic of Xanthan Gum is its ability to thin out when subjected to forces such as shaking (called shearing), which makes it great for poured sauces, as it will thicken back up after having exited the bottle. It can also prevent oils from separating from liquid-oil emulsions (think salad dressing). It is also more stable under a wider range of temperatures and pH than other gums.

Xanthan Gum can also be used to give dough the stickiness that is needed in gluten-free baking, as gluten is usually what gives that sticky characteristic to dough. And no matter the use, Xanthan Gum will always remain colorless and flavorless, so it can be used for just about any need that suits it.

Summary: Glood product for gluten free baking.
Text: Well, that says it all...add some to anything as a thickener / tiny bit - works wonders.  Fast delivery from family run farm/store (nice folks) - average pricing.

Was very happy to find this at such a resonable price and I am sure it will a very good product.  The unfortunate part is they seem to charge shipping according to the price of an item, not the weight.  By the time you add up shipping and price of the xanthan gum you will pay the same anywhere.  Not a savings!

I dont know how anyone can complain that this product is pricey.Walk into any healthfood store and be prepared to pay 14$ for the same size of xanthan gum.Also Barry Farms has the best selection of every imaginable food product,gluten-free or not and very good prices.I was very happy when I ordered from them previously.My little bag of xanthan gum has lasted me over a year and I bake alot.

The Xanthan Gum works great as a thickening agent when cooking hot meals or even smoothies in the blender.  It takes the place of corn starch or flour when I am making a stew.  I've tried buying this product at health food stores but could only find it on Amazon.  A tiny bit goes a long way, so even though the bag is small, it will last a long time.
I used this product to make my own lubricant, and it works wonders.  I'm not sure what else it's used for, but it makes great lube!
We have celiac disease and make most of our foods from scratch.  This product can be very difficult to find in the average store.  Super fast shipping.  I never run out!
This was shipped to me quickly and in good condition. They were exactly what I wanted/needed for my Gluten Free lifestyle! Thanks!
It works great for gluten free flour. I was able to make 100% Spelt bread because of this product. I can't complain.
I bought this online because it was much cheaper than in my local health-food store.  Then I got slapped with a $7 shipping charge!  For a teeny envelope of product!  I'll buy from the store, thanks.

This baby food was fine. I usually make my own, but for traveling and to add variety I bought some of these packets. My son didn't seem to dislike this flavor, but I could tell it wasn't his favorite. The packets are kind of annoying. They open at the top and can be re-sealed with a zip-lock. However, it's a small pouch and my son only ate about 1/3 at a time, so we would try to pull out some of the food and reseal it, but it was messy. It's not a huge mess or inconvenience, but the other packets with the nozzle just work better for us. Even though we don't have the boon spoon.

This baby food was really thick and my baby wouldn't eat it.  Every other stage 2 food that I've gotten may have been a bit thicker, but this was really very thick, nearly the consistency of regular mashed potatoes, it also seemed very paste like.  All the other food I've gotten from Sprout has been fantastic!
Will buy again in the future...my baby girl (11 months) loved it! Great thicker food for babies learning to eat chunkier textures.
I don't often give my daughter packaged baby food, just in emergencies.. I let her try this and she loved it.. I'll probably try other sprout varieties as well.

Over the past five years, I have upped the use of balsamic vinegar quite a bit. It adds a nice element to cooking and to creating dressings for salad.

Monari Federzoni Balsamic Vinegar of Modena serves me nicely. It is not a fancy high-priced product, but it takes care of my cooking needs well enough.

I have never really cared much for salads, but went on a diet that required me to eat a lot of spinach. I mixed the spinach with greens, onions, and yellow peppers and added this vinegar with a little olive oil and it is so good that I feel like I am having a dessert! I have only used it as a salad dressing, but am sure it would be great used in various ways. (I saw someone say it was good to dip strawberries)

My local newspaper did a gourmet test on balsamic vinegars.  Of all the vinegars they tested, this one came out best. Here was their trick, they simmered the bottle of vinegar in a sauce pan and reduced the liquid in half. The result is a rich syrup with incredible, concentrated flavor.

Summary: Great Tasting Chips that are a bit healthier.
Text: These are great tasting and while they aren't good for you per se, they are much healthier than most brands. They are fresh tasting and crunchy. My only complaint would be that the chips are small, not too many good sized ones in bag. The smaller 1.5oz bags were better as they stay fresher better. I will buy these again.

I love most of the chips that this company makes. When I say "most", the pepper, and the garlic are a bit much for me, but if you like a big jolt of either, these would probably be for you. I'm very health conscious, and these are simply potatoes, avacado, or olive oil, and a few seasonings. So many chip brands have ingred. a mile long, and made with oils that equate to motor oil, in my book ... ugh! The "Good Health Chips" are the only ones I'll grab. They cost more that most, but worth the price, in my opinion. The Barbeque, vinegar/salt, and Chilean Lime are my favs.

I bought a pack of this and the Chilean Lime. My wife likes the lime, which are good, but strong tasting. On the other hand, these BBQ chips have a relatively subtle BBQ flavor; nothing like a bag of Lays for instance. The potato taste comes through more than the seasoning. I like them a lot. I'm not sure about the "health" value, but I'm a fan!

ProfileName: J.D. "Student, teacher, music, and book lover"
Text:
I've had one bag but it was Wayyy too salty. I couldn't enjoyably eat it. Maybe it was a bad batch. Will update if any other bags taste better. Overall disappointed.

UPDATE: I must have had a weird bag because the rest were not as bad. They're actually good. A bit high in calories but a great oil alternative.

I have been taking this product for about two months and dropped 14 pounds without a hard diet. I continue to eat all food groups but in moderation.
No huge meals but dinot have to avoid carbs either. You may not see a huge weight loss in pounds but pay attentionto the fat decreasearound your waist and neck if you have that problem. I take one oune in the morning and one ounce before or afer dinner.
I was bying from GNC but Amazon has a much better prize so from now on I will take advantage of my Amazon Prime. :-)

I ordered 3 bottles to give it an honest try because I didn't think one bottle would give me enough time to honestly review it. One bottle lasts approximately 15 days. I just opened up my 3rd bottle and I still haven't really noticed much of anything. The taste isn't too bad.

The following comment is for the person who previously reviewed the product: I believe that what you were looking at was NOT the expiration date but rather the date it was made. I bought this product as well and was worried that I would have the same problem as you described until I realized that it had an expiry date as well as a production date. The production date was dated as "something/something 2011." And incidentally, the expiry date on my product was shown to be "something/something 2013" so that also prompts me to think that you probably looked at the wrong date and mistook 2011 for the expiry date.

ProfileName: I Love Amazon Prime "Live, Love, Give, Hugs"
Text: I have been purchasing this product from GNC and love it--my appetite was curbed and I had more energy, but not the bad jittery type of energy.  The product I received from Amazon was rancid and it looks like the seal was glued back on.  I had a co-worker compare the taste of the product I purchased from GNC and the product I received from Amazon, just to be sure, and she agreed that there was definitely something wrong with the juice I received from Amazon.  If you've never tried this juice, I would suggest you first purchase a bottle from GNC so you know how it's supposed to taste.

Summary: AMAZING RESULTS AT A GREAT PRICE!
Text: I was told about this product a couple of months ago, but with so many "crazy products" out there, I must confess, I was not a believer, but when I saw the person who told me about it, looking not only "amazing", but her skin was glowing, her belly was gone and her hair looking better than ever. I had to order it, I read the reviews, did the basic research and ordered 2 bottles. I was amazed, glad and happy when I received them the very next morning. "WOW!", I thought, this is "great service!". I have been drinking it for 2 days and it does what it says, it suppresses your appetite, gives you energy and boost the metabolism. The one thing I have noticed, and most likely the reason it has not worked on some people is because this would not suppress your anxiety, and if you are an emotional eater as I am, you are going to have to teach yourself how to eat in smaller portions, eat healthier and control yourself. This really helps and it really works, you will get results if you follow the directions. Hope this help you make the right choice for your health and your future new self.

When it comes to weight loss, there is no such thing as one size fits all.  I don't care what the bottle looks like and I am not going to deduct points because it took an extra day or two to get to me.  What really matters is 1-Does it work? and 2-Are there any side effects?  My co-worker started taking this and based on the reviews, I figured it was another gimic. Then I tried it.  I literally felt the energy burst about 15 minutes after taking it.  As I left the office for the day, it dawned on me that I did not eat my normal morning or afternoon snack because I was not hungry.  At lunch, I only ate half of my sandwich and (believe it or not) even turned down the brownie tray.  This is huge!  I like the taste, I like the ingredients, and even after taking a shot before dinner - fell asleep at my normal time.  I'm sold and will make this a regular part of my plan.  This product does exactly what it says it does - appetite suppressant.
I was disappointed with this product. It arrived quickly but does not work for me. Feel it was a waste of money.

I read about this in a magazine. It was recommended for weight loss, and cholestrol control. I don't know if it helped so much with my weight loss, but it did lower my cholstrol by 20 points!My Dr. told me to stay on it. It tastes good, and I got it here much cheaper than my first order elsewhere. It also lists a standerdized extract on the bottle, many of this in pill form do not.
I would recommed it to try to anyone.

Summary: Did not curb appetite, but gave me a seasonal allergy type reaction
Text:
Anyone else have seasonal allergy type reactions? This stuff, for me, is hayfever allergies in a bottle.

I performed a little test and here are all the details:

- after taking it Monday twice each day, I thought I suddenly had caught a cold or developed seasonal allergies... I was REALLY bad Tuesday. I had to resort to aspirin and Benadryl to get through the day. It was truly awful and I wanted to go home early for feeling so sick. Headache, itchy eyes, watery mouth, constantly stuffed and runny nose, tired...

- After staying up quite late and finally falling asleep with the window open and the fan on, blowing in whatever pollen or cold air was outside, I woke up today (Wed) feeling totally fine. This is when I knew something was up. No cold or seasonal allergies disappears overnight with the window open and a fan on you.

- So, I did an experiment today. I waited until halfway through the day (2pm) to take the first dose of African Bush Mango juice... the recommended dosage of 2 tbsp. A half hour after drinking this stuff, a mild headache came on, then within the next hour my eyes began itching and my throat felt scratchy and my mouth started feeling watery and, finally, I started sneezing and blowing my nose again.

No doubt about it, this produces a seasonal allergy type reaction for me. Only other time ingesting anything ever did something like this was when I thought I would just go ahead and throw the beet stems in my juicer to be "extra healthy." I am not allergic to beets, but beet stems made my eyes run green snot. This stuff produces almost as bad a reaction. So... throwing away the full $18 bottle when I get home.

I started on this juice about 6 weeks ago with reservation. Did not think it would work, but have noticed a vast difference in fat loss. I take it with every meal consisting of balanced proteins, carbs and fats. Sometimes if I go overboard and overeat I definitely make sure I use it before I engage in a heavy meal.I now have a lot of loose body fat particularly around my waist and upper back area. I look forward to going to the gym to do my cardio and toning excercises to tighten up the loose skin. This juice has definitely made a difference in losing my ab fat. This was my most difficult area to lose. I am a size 10 at the top but wear a size 4 in skirts and pants. Obviously my most stubborn and difficult areas are my abs, back and upper body.I like the taste of this particular brand. I did try another brand but did not like the flavor as much as I like this one. That's the only reason I am able to continue using because the flavor is great. I will continue to use this brand until I reach my goal of fat loss. I've tried alot of products but this seems to be working the best for right now.

Summary: I think it's going to work
Text: I just tried this product 2 days ago and within a few minutes of taking it, I felt a difference. I can't explain how it felt. It definitely suppresses your hunger and it's like you get a bolt of energy within a few minutes. I rated this 3 star because it's only been 2 days but I will keep updating as I go along. My aunt also started this..she didn't get "a bolt of energy" as well as I did but she says it's kept her from being hungry so I guess we will see!
IT helped me lose weight but it was expired it was 2010 and i purchased it not to long ago i could have gotten really sick!!!!
I have been taking this for six weeks.  I have not lost any weight.  If I were you I would save my money.
I love the Flake Dipped (I used to live in England).  This is the best price I've found, and they arrived quickly.  I'll reorder soon!

well, they are stated on line as chips then when order they are stixs, and I received expired food product expiration date Dec. 2012....great wonder what they would tasted like fresh.  Will not be ordering from Good Health agin.
I was expecting more nuts but this is mostly gel, in fact some pieces have no nuts at all--also a bit on the too-sweet side for me but if that is what you like then go for it.

I boil the water, add cereal and simmer for 1 min then remove from heat and add frozen blueberries, rasberries and walnuts, cover and let sit until fruit is warm. Very good cereal and sticks with me till lunch.

If Amazon would get on the ball and offer this cereal with free shipping, I'd order it regularly!  It's the best gluten free hot cereal!  Reminds me of eating cream of wheat and malt-o-meal!  But if I have to pay for shipping, I'm better off buying it at the store.  Come on Amazon!!

I can see how people who eat oatmeal would like this, but I was hoping for something more like cream of wheat.  It's too slimy for me.  Not sure if it was because I cooked it too long (10 minutes per the directions).  There is a recipe on it for muffins that I haven't tried yet.

This is an excellent gluten free alternative to oatmeal.  The taste is really not like any other hot cereal, the buckwheat isn't dominant but compliments the corn.  Sort of like a variant of grits, but I like it with maple syrup, cinnamon and apple chunks.
My family simply loves this ceral! We will always purchase it through Amazon. Bob makes great products! My child will only eat this most mornings.

I don't have to eat a gluten free diet but I still like this!  It's a great way to consume a variety of whole grains. You can dress it up many different ways and it doesn't get old. We like it with a little peanut butter, agave nectar, and cinnamon! Yum! I'll try it soon with banana also  :  I don't usually pay good attention to the time but I'm pretty sure I usually undercook it some.

I love this stuff.  I would eat it even if I was not gluten free.  It is high in fiber, and low in calories, and tastes really good.  Something that is truly hard to find for those of us that don't consume gluten.

I first had this tea at a convention several years ago and took a few samples, Then my mother-in-law ordered it for me for Christmas. And now I am ordering for myself. Its really smooth and light tasting and fruity and much better then the Herbal Lipton that I purchased by mistake. This one is really good and I make it each night before bed. You can also put a little Splenda or Honey in it as well. I tend to drink it plain, but sometimes I add the Honey or the Splenda. Enjoy !!!

Even though I know its supposed to be good for me, I am not a huge fan of most herb teas. Mighty Leaf - African Nectar is THE exception. I was first served this tea at my hair spa. What caught my attention was the smell; flowery, sweet, a touch of herbs, then the taste, not bitter, not sweet, but refreshing. In addition the smell doesn't fade, and the tea doesn't grow bitter if left with the tea bag in for a longer period than recommended!
This tea is fairly expensive as herb teas go, but it IS worth it. I have plenty of half used packets in my pantry of other failed tea experiments. This time I have one which is a keeper.Mighty Leaf Herb Tea, African Nectar, 15-Count Whole Leaf Pouches, 1.32 Ozs. (Pack of 3)

Summary: One of the Best Teas I Own
Text: This tea makes my top three list for flavor and tea I like to drink.  It is a full-bodied tropical fruit flavor that smells great even before you brew it.  A wonderful blend of roobios tea that I highly recommend.

I had to give up coffee and I do not enjoy tea.  However, I had this African Nectar tea at a restaurant and fell in love with it.  I found it on Amazon so ordered 2 boxes of it.  I have been sharing it with my friends who rave about it and my husband is drinking it also.  It has a wonderful bouquet and a slighty fruity flavor.

We were turned on to African Nectar by our son, who gave us a couple of bags. Now we drink it everyday. Although the Mighty Leaf brand can be a pricey, we find that we can make two or more pots of tea from a single bag. Most herbal teas only make one cup per bag before running out of flavor. African Rooibos leaves, combined with other herbs, makes a herbal tea that's very flavorful. It's hard to compare it with other herbal flavors.

I agree with all the other positive reviews here.  I too discovered this blend from a single pouch offered as part of a selection at a restaurant.  It has the flavor of black tea without the acidity.  The notes of fruit offer just a hint of sweetness, and does not dominant the flavor, which I like (I'm not a fan of fruity herbal teas). After brewing, I mix this dark, rich tea with warm milk to make a tea latte for morning tea.  I don't think I could make this a blend I drink every day but I do enjoy having it around for variety.

This tea is really wonderful but vary expensive in the stores.  It is still expensive buying from Amazon but less so than in the stores.  I will continue to purchase the African Nectar tea from Amazon--a less expensive addiction than wine.  Finding good herbal teas is a hobby of mine.  This one qualifies as one of the best.

My work has all the flavors of mighty leaf. This is by far the worst flavor. It tastes kind of like one of those cheap flea collars, and tobacco. No one orders it again, or compliments it. Some people ask to try another bag. I would recommend trying it in a sample pack, so if you hate it.. you only have to ditch two bags, and not a whole box.

This is my first herbal tea that I have tried. Let me tell you that the taste is just perfect. The pouch for the tea bag is something I have never seen before. It is some type of cloth material which when steeped, releases all the flavors and is very good for the environment.

I drink this tea usually after dinner because it just relaxes my mind and body. The tea doesn't need any sugar to be added because of the sweet orangy taste. I would highly recommend this tea to beginner tea drinkers and also because of the many health benefits.
Very flavorful herbal tea. Just a hint of sweetness. It is my daily morning beverage. What more can I say?

I buy my Mighty Leaf Teas from Amazon - can't go wrong!  The Organic African Nectar is a much more robust tea.  It is especially good with Leighton's Orange Blossom Honey.  I like this tea in the morning and throughout the day.  It is very satisfying.

Summary: great mightyleaf tea_ nice 3 box packaging
Text:
I am a fan of mighty leaf teas and it is a good deal over here to buy three boxes,
I am happy with the purchase

This tea is awesome. Love it's smoothness... Reminds me of the smoothness of Asaam. It's very light in taste and comforting without hints of bitterness. I love it plain but when the mood strikes, I've added drops of honey, grated ginger or even lemon juice and peels. My bro happened to have it at a fine restaurant several years ago and recommended I try it - been hooked ever since. When friends come over and choose a non-caffeinated tea, they usually choose this one; even the ones who don't usually do teas. So imagine my grin at finding this three-pack on Amazon.

True story: Gave this to a good friend a couple years ago whose mom is a tea connoisseur, highly selective of her loose-leaf brews and doesn't do tea bags. I've heard it sung she rather enjoyed this Mighty Leaf... and ended up taking my friend's whole stash.

I am a black tea (with caffeine) fan. Still I like the aroma of this tea. Not a bad flavor either. Goes well with honey (even fresh ginger, if you like ginger) But, as some other reviewer said, it is better to try it (I did) before you order 45 tea bags.

Summary: Slightly fruity, soothing decaf red tea
Text: I've had to cut back on caffeine, so I've been trying out various herbal teas. This so far is my favorite. It has a slightly fruity, vanilla and mild tobacco scent and flavor to it. Coffee was giving me heartburn, but this tea is nice and mild, and since it's decaf it can be enjoyed throughout the day. I drink it plain since it has natural sweetness - it is a wonderful calorie-free treat!
This is one of my favorite teas. Had it at a restaurant, bought some online, and I'm NOT dissappointed! You'll love it.

I drink a variety of black, green, and herbal teas. This is my favorite flavor.  First got introduced to this tea when I had a bad sinus infection.  I drove by a little place called "Joe Beans" in Virginia and asked them to recommend a hot tea to soothe my sinuses, and this is what they recommended.  It's awesome with honey! I haven't tasted another tea yet that beats this flavor.

This is an absolutely great tasting tea. It has lots of flavor and just smells good even before you taste it. You can enjoy it with out sugar or sweetners (neither is good for you). It has a calming effect and does not contain caffine. A friend in Washington, D.C. turned me onto it, I went shoping for it as soon as I got home to the Bay Area. I continue to not only buy more but also to throughly enjoy it and turning others onto African Nectar from Mighty Leaf.
I love this tea - it's organic, it goes nicely with either milk (I use almond milk) or with lemon / honey. It has a very pleasant sweet fruity/floral flavor.

Although I'm not generally a tea drinker, I was introduced to this tea by a friend. Immediately I loved it. It has a fresh and fruity flavor that I find both refreshing and soothing at the same time. I drink it in the evenings because it contains no caffeine and it helps me to unwind after a long day. I highly recommend it for both it's taste and quality.

Summary: some of the best tea ever
Text: Enticingly fragrant and delicious, you will undoubtedly enjoy this pick -- the silk bags are biodegradable, and the leaf strength is often enough for me to reuse the bags three times and still enjoy the flavor!
This tea is unreal. It smells just as great as it tastes. I never need to add sweetener or sugar because it is perfectly sweetened and delicious. It is always a must have in my household!!!

My family has been drinking this tea for a while, but I never really knew what it was all about. When I was offered a cup of this, I instantly fell in love with the rich flavor and aroma. The African Nectar is a great variety as well as the Green Tea Tropical. You will love this no matter how much you know about tea. Great, great product.

I've been buying this tea for about 6 years now and it is my all time favorite.  The silk like pouch the tea comes in allows the flavors of the tea to come through without the papery taste you get from other tea bags.  This tea is worth the extra expense.

I was recently introduced to Green Mountain's Country Blend. A friend sent me several flavored K-cups to try, and one of these was in the package. This coffee is hard to explain exactly. All I can say is they hit it on the head with it's name. It reminds me of a diner I ate breakfast at last time I was up in Vermont. The only way I can impart how this tastes and smells to you is to say that it's like Coffee Peoples Donut Shop coffee (my standard), but made with the mineral-rich water of Vermont, so it's VERY full-bodied. Like brewing it with Dasani bottled water, if that makes any sense to you. It's a VERY pleasing cup of coffee, but maybe not for everyone as it's a touch saltier (but not salty).

If you don't like it, I'm sure you'll find someone on the K-Cup Exchange at Yahoo Groups who will trade it for something you do like, or will buy it from you at a fair price. It's an AWESOME K-Cup web site
H T T P [...]

I brewed this in my B40 @ the 7.25 cup size. I drink my coffee with a liquid creamer and a sugar substitute; just so you will know where I'm coming from.

I received this Kcup in a trade in our Yahoo group who had put together a nice variety pack. I keep a journal of all the Kcups I have tried and I found this to be very pleasant cup of coffee with low acidity little after taste and no bitterness. If I didn't have so many kcups right now I would purchase this wonderful blend.

Summary: A compromising blend for the masses (i.e. your office)
Text:
Length:: 1:31 Mins

Listed as one of Green Mountain Coffee's "most popular blends," the Vermont Country Blend offers a safe choice if your Keurig serves a larger audience, such as an office environment.

The coffee has a pleasing aroma, with hints of fruit and caramel, and a gentle finish. While Green Mountain's website describes this as "an engaging blend that reveals itself in layers" but that was not my experience. It is a pleasant, middle-of-the-road blend, but not the type of K-cup I'll reach for first in the morning.

One reason the Vermont Country Blend didn't blow my socks off was that it arrived at the same time we ordered Green Mountain Coffee's Nantucket Blend. Of the two blends, my wife enjoys Vermont Country lighter roast more. I prefer the more complex tones in the Nantucket Blend. We both tried the Vermont Country Blend black, using Keurig's small mug (7.25 oz) setting.

Added bonuses:
Vermont Country Blend is certified kosher by the Orthodox Union.
Vermont Country Blend is Fair Trade Certified.
Vermont Country Blend is organic.

Rating: Four stars.

BTW: Here's my recent K-cup coffee reviews for Amazon:
5 stars: Green Mountain Coffee Nantucket Blend
5 stars: Coffee People Donut Shop Medium Roast
5 stars: Van Houtte Chocolate Raspberry Truffle
4 stars: Green Mountain Coffee Lake & Lodge Blend
4 stars: Green Mountain Coffee Wild Mountain Blueberry
4 stars: Tully's Coffee Kona Blend
4 stars: Green Mountain Coffee Dark Magic
3 stars: Green Mountain Coffee Breakfast Blend
3 stars: Green Mountain Coffee Fair Trade Gingerbread

Got 6 of this variety in a K-Cup Sampler and didn't like it.  I made 2 cups on the strongest setting (6oz.) and it tasted incredibly weak and watered down.  What flavor it did have was kinda strange.  It was sort of woody and mushroomy.  Love my k-cups, just not this one.  So far, the Timothy's Columbian has been my fav.  The Green Mountain Donut house is good as well.
This is an excellent coffee - not too strong and not too weak. Perfect blend and is great any time of day. No weird flavor or aftertaste.

Summary: Suited to its purpose, if not quite its goal...
Text: If you like the classic taste of a good margarita, it's likely you'll find Baja Bob's Margarita Mix to be an acquired taste at best and a cruel joke at worst.  Not that it tastes horrible, but like most contests between similar products that are sugar-based and sugar-free, the recipe for which you already have a preference is going to win despite the competition's particular and sometimes overwhelming merits.  Since I've decided to limit my sugar intake but not my affection for margaritas, this tequila mixer is best suited to take care of the problem, so I've decided to stick with it and learn to like it.  Over time I've at least grown accustomed to the taste (adding extra Triple Sec helps), even if I can't say it's the best improvement to margaritas since the salt rimmed glass.  Splenda certainly works better in some things than others.  In this case it's a qualified success with taste taking a subjective second place to functionality.  I don't love it or hate it, but I don't miss the sugar either.  To that end Baja Bob's Margarita Mix does what it's supposed to do very well.

Summary: Good margarita mix - other flavors noted in review
Text:
As a type 2 diabetic I've always resigned myself to drinking just straight scotch or bourbon when imbibing on occasion as mixed drinks are loaded with carbs and the few sugar free ones either weren't so much carb free ("sugar alcohol" from maltatol or the like) or they tasted just awful. I tried the original Margarita mix from Baja Bob and was very pleasantly surprised by how great it was. I then went a little nuts and ordered 1 of just about every flavor offered off their site (not all flavors are available on Amazon but they are a few bucks cheaper here than off Baja's site directly when you order in sets of 3). Here's the short rundown on my take:

The lime margarita mixes (both the original and the Key Lime) are fantastic - both blended with ice and on the rocks they hold their own with any Margarita mix I've tried. I prefer the original since it's a little more "tart" the way I think a lime margarita should be in my book. For folks here that complain about it being too limey they may want to try the key lime - it's a little milder.

The strawberry margarita mix was ok - a bit sweet for my taste but to be fair I'm not really that big of a strawberry margarita guy to begin with.

The Pina Colata mix was very good and even my wife liked that one as well and she _never_ partakes in cocktails with me. Note that there are around 4 carbs per serving with this instead of the usual zero for the rest of their mixers. The coconut cream in the mix has a few carbs - but totally worth it. Creamy and smooth blended with ice in a good blender. Very nice.

The mojito mix is decent. I can make a pretty passable sugar free mojito myself but this is pretty good. I probably wont bother to stock up on it because it's not a must have mixer for me.

All the martini mixes were just awful in my book. Other folks seem to like them, maybe it's just not my thing. The apple and cranberry tasted like medicine to me and I promptly tossed the rest of the bottles after the first taste. The lemon was pretty poor and I gave it a couple shots before throwing the rest out.

I didn't care for the hurricane mix and tossed the rest - but again, to be fair I'm not really a hurricane fan to begin with so I'm not necessarily a good judge on this one.

The sweet and sour mix made a nice whiskey sour. Not the best I've had by any stretch but perfectly servicible in my book.

Finally the Mai Tai was pretty good - Not my favorite drink in the world but this was as good as any I'd had.

So they're batting around .500 give or take. Definitely worth picking up a few bottles and testing out - I think some folks that are skeptical, particularly about the margaritas and pina colatas will be pleasantly surprised.

Summary: Decent, but super strong and acidic
Text: You have to cut this down with Sprite Zero or water (Sprite Zero preferably), because it's SO strong - super limey and acidic.  Better than the Finest Call Carb conscious (which has sugar alcohol in it and makes you feel kinda sick), but not better tasting.

In principle a Splenda Margarita mix sounded like a great idea. The execution was terrible. I poured both of my two bottles down the drain. You would have to be pretty desparate, or otherwise never have had a decent margarita if this was your choice. I would rather skip altogether, as one of the other reviewers had suggested as well. The market has a long way to go to support less sugar in drinks.

Summary: Baja Bob's Drink Mixes - DON'T BOTHER
Text: I would be the first to applaud these products if they were good.  Unfortunately, I would rather give up drinking that have to drink this tasteless slop.  There is a very nasty, artificial acrid, too citrusy, while at the same time too sweet, taste to these products. The strawberry margherita mix has a very faint taste of strawberry, but no amount of doctoring could make it drinkable.  I poured the mix out.  The Mai Tai mix -- poured it out.  I bought several bottle/dry drink mixes of all their varieties without trying them first.  BIG MISTAKE!  I am either going to pour them out or throw them out, since the folks at Baja Bob's web site have refused to even respond to my request that I return the unopened products for a refund.  You will also note that on their web site's "fan club" page, there are 0 entries.  Save your money unless you are totally desperate.  You'd be better off using Crystal Light Ruby Red Grapefruit.  Now, that tastes pretty good mixed with Vodka.

I think Baja Bob's is terrific!  I took another reviewer's advice and added a little Triple Sec to the Tequila and mix and it was fabulous.  Surely, anyone who is ordering this has tasted diet drinks before.  If you are used to drinking only drinks with real sugar, you might not like it.  It is perfect for anyone who is trying to cut back on their carbs and still wants a Margarita.  THANK YOU BOB!!
I gave the Pina Colada mix one star because it was pretty bad, but the citrus ones I find to be quite drinkable.

I'm not sure what the people expect who do not like this product.  I use this as well as the OTB 0 calorie mix you can buy at grocery store and I think they are both great.  I love the margarita but had all the calories.  Give it a try and you will not be sorry!

Although not stated in the ingredients, it has a subtle yet definitive taste of cumin. I assume it is in the mix they call spices. I think it's brilliant. A full flavor sauce that goes with everything. Has a fair amount of heat.

I've been drinking Yellow Label Tea since the 80's. This is an excellent and versitile tea, makes for a good hot tea and also a refreshing iced tea. A bit stronger than regular "brisk lipton" tea typically found in the U.S. I used to have to wait until I traveled to the British Virgin Islands or the Bahamas to find this tea, but now it's on Amazon (darn, my excuses to travel are dwindling!). This is an Orange Pekoe tea in 200g bags. You can find different varieties of tea marked with the "Lipton Yellow Label" brand, usually loose leaf teas. For instance I have a Sri Lanka-packed metal tin of "Pure Ceylon," a box of "Coarse Black Tea" packed in Mumbai, and another "new bright & rich" Mumbai variety which is a blend of "Assam teas." These other varieties can be found in middle eastern, Indian, and Asian markets here in the US. All good teas, but this Orange Pekoe in the bags is the most convenient and has the smoothest flavour.

Summary: Why this isn't a common US tea is beyond me.
Text:
Traveling world wide, I've come to much prefer good tea to bad coffee, and good teas are so much more common.

Yellow Label is one of the most popular teas in the world because it has a rich, clean flavor without bitterness. Its clear distinctive red color makes it also one of the prettiest. The only supermarket teas I've found in the US that taste similar are the "English Breakfast" labels. If you like these, or like strong black tea flavor without the bitterness or muddiness of overbrewing the usual black teas, you should try Yellow Label.

I first enjoyed Yellow Label in the Caribbean 20 yrs ago and have since in travels worldwide been looked at oddly at groceries as I purchased 20 boxes to take home. There it was only tea, in the US it wasn't available...or oddly in London which appears on the label. A letter to Lipton 6 years ago gave no explanation for not marketing in the US, just "coupons to try our other brands". Finally, Amazon has it and even better a market in Chinatown here in NYC.
What makes it great? It's the only black tea that is full flavored but not bitter. It's so smooth that you literally can make a pot of it, leave the bags in, reheat it the next day and still have no bitterness. This is a tea lover's tea that I have turned numerous travel companions onto for life and something I would be lost without.

I was first given a box of this Yellow Label from a co-worker who had traveled to China.  I instantly fell in love with the smooth flavor.  I found it in a Food Max in Stockton, Ca but then the store closed down.  I have been on a search for the last two months because my loose leaf is almost gone also.  I was brewing the tea for the staff in my office and they all love it, so when I ran out of tea bags they all wanted to know where I got the tea from.  The flavor is so smooth that you almost do not need any type of sweetner at all.  This should be made available in the states in at least one major grocery store.  I am buying enough to share with my friends.....

Summary: Even if you don't like tea . . .
Text: . . . you'll love this one. I fell in love with this black tea blend when I lived in Europe, and was disappointed when I returned to America that I couldn't buy it here. One taste of this smooth tea and you might change from coffee. It's the best cup of tea you'll ever drink.
It has a distinct taste that differs from the regular Lipton. I wish it were more readily available in the stores in US.

I drink lots of hot tea. Don't confuse this with the Lipton Tea you find at the grocery. There is no comparison. This is the good stuff. I bought this at a local farmers market(Atlanta) and since they closed, no one else carries it, so I ordered it from Amazon. Specify "Yellow Label Tea".

Summary: Does not taste like Lipton Yellow Label tea sold in Italy, possibly stale, no expiration date on pkg.
Text:
This is a repeat of the same review I left for another Amazon listing for the same tea (but at a significantly different price). Despite the price difference, both listings appear to be for the same item and are sold by the same Indian Grocery. From reading the other reviews, it is clear that at least one other customer had the same bad experience as I did.

I was initially excited to find Lipton Yellow Label Tea on Amazon, as I just got back from Italy and fell in love with it there. The Lipton Yellow Label Tea in Italy doesn't taste anything like the weak, poor-quality Lipton we get in the U.S., but the tea I ordered on Amazon (sold by Simply Beautiful) is actually manufactured for India and tastes bitter and/or stale. You can't see from the photo, but the writing on the packages I received is not in English and says it was manufactured in Canada for India. It is hard to tell whether the variety sold in India just tastes different than the kind in Italy, or if the tea was in fact stale, because there is NO sell-by or expiration date on the package (very disturbing), and the bags are NOT "foil-wrapped for freshness" as described on Amazon. I was extremely disappointed in the taste of this tea from India, having looked forward to the lovely, full-bodied Lipton Yellow Label tea bags that I brought home from Italy. Not to mention the fact that I would never want to buy imported groceries that don't have an expiration date, so there is no way to know how long they've been sitting in the warehouse, if they are stale, or when they will go stale after opening (especially since they are not individually wrapped). I returned both boxes of tea and hope to get an Amazon refund soon. I am very bummed.

The Lipton Yellow Label tea is a step above the "regular" Lipton sold here in the States. This is your basic, everyday black tea but it is much more flavorful and bolder than the Lipton variety sold in supermarkets here. It brews a good, bracing cup of tea. I recommend it over the supermarket variety any day. I have used this to make iced tea as well and while it's good over ice, it is best served hot.

I recv'd this tea in great condition. The packing and timeliness were great. I love this tea. It takes me back to when I had our son in an Italian hospital near Pisa, Italy. They brought me Lipton Yellow Label Tea. That was many years ago and I never forgot how good it tasted or stopped looking to buy more once we left Europe. Hubby and I were talking about it and I thought of Amazon! It was right here. I'm enjoying it in the afternoon for a pick me up! Good stuff!

I must echo the praise of Lipton Yellow Label tea.

I don't know how this label may differ across countries, but recently I spent several month-long trips to Pakistan, where Lipton Yellow Label is pretty much all the black tea they serve, and tea is served all the time. After getting around the initial shock of their custom of putting up to four teabags into 16 ounces of water there, I came to like the Yellow Label tea. Then when switching a few times to Twinings tea at the hotel business center, I realized that Yellow Label is much better than all the tea I'd been drinking heretofore. Comparing Yellow Label to other Litpons, other tea available in America, and even Twinings, which I considered the top of the heap, Yellow Label was clearly better. A Pakistani friend who travels to the U.S. says that American tea is "insipid" and refuses to drink it. I now agree, and think that Lipton Yellow Tea is the best tea I have ever had. Now I've got to figure out where to buy it. As far as I'm concerned, Yellow Label is the tea most worth drinking, which no doubt accounts for its popularity in Pakistan.
I discovered yellow tea while on vacation in Thialand. I drink it daily now instead of coffee.  In the summer, it makes a great sun tea.

This is a brand of orange pekoe black tea that is drunk all over the world. Lipton sells it in many countries, and while the product might have the same smooth, almost inoffensive base note, to me the UK version tastes very different than the Indian version, which is perceptable stronger and has a more "citrusy" note. While it doesn't hold up to some premium orange pekoe teas, it is distinctly better than the Lipton tea available in US supermarkets.

Summary: A great tea by Lipton. Just as in France.
Text: My wife loves this tea, so I was pleased to be able to order it for her so easily in North America. It arrived promptly, and in good condition.
The company did do a refund for the tea. It looks the same as the box that comes from London. However, it is produced in India and has a very strong, almost bitter taste.
I first had this tea in Egypt.  It is so superior to the Lipton sold in the states that I was grateful to find a source online.

Summary: Better than US marketed Lipton Brisk tea
Text:
Discovered Yellow Label while on a trip to Japan. I had arrived in Nagoya for a meeting, and had time to wonder around a market...really just rubber-necking.

I bought the familiar Lipton label as well as several other teas. Yellow Label has a little more pronounced flavor than the US marketed Brisk Lipton tea. If you are a tea drinker, you will probably enjoy the flavor. The worst part of brewing and drinking Yellow Label...trying to get rid of the box of US standard Lipton Brisk tea I already have sitting in the pantry.

I've been buying primarily whole leaf, oolong, pu'er, jasmine teas from a wholesale tea market in Beijing (Malian St). Though the price is far cheaper than the Ten  Fu (Ten Ren) teas and other retailers, the discernment in quality seemed questionable. I am a simpleton concerning tea. So rather than purchase $90/kg for the base Assam tea, I went to Carre4 and bought an under $5/box of Lipton Yellow label Black tea 100 bags for the consistant quality.

After running out of my usual every-day tea, Trader Joe's brand of "Irish Breakfast Tea," I found this Yellow Label first at my local Chinese supermarket in the tea aisle. I had only had the "brisk" version before and wasn't such a Lipton fan, but I needed tea and bought it.

Contrary to the rather dusty, mild (watery??) taste of the "brisk" American version, Yellow Label has a good flavor and no bitterness, even when brewing for 6 min (I brew a small pot with three bags in the morning). Not quite as rich as Assam tea when mixed with milk and sugar, but a good substitute. And you can't beat the price. A very nice, full every-day tea.
This is the perfect maple sugar candy...melts in your mouth. The price was also extremely fair. I would buy this again, and recommend it to my friends.
I found Lysanders product while waiting for steaks to be cut on South Padre Island.  Really a great product line, not just the chicken rub.  Check out the other seasonings as well.

I have been using this rub for a few years now it is wonderful on chicken (not to mention no msg and all natural).
I usually just cut up a whole organic bird and sprinkle it on evenly bake for 30 minutes and it comes
out delicious every time (I do spray it with oil during the bake to keep it moist and crisp).
All of my kids love it they ask for the "good chicken"
all the time. It is how I got them off only fried. My local store didn't have it in stock
so I came here. have to have it.

We like the pop-top lid on the canned foods eliminating the can opener wrestling match and test of dexterity. Opening the can of Artemis, one sees a solid dog food, light in color with bits of foods like carrots, peas, and potatoes readily visible.

Our three pooches like Artemis and their parents do also. The ingredient list is commendable with no fillers and none of those horrendous animal scraps found in cheaper dog foods. Mostly I like seeing the inclusion of potatoes in the mix. We like the density of the canned food; those runny canned products with high liquid content tend to dirty and stain the canine whiskers and beard. One user of Artemis commented that her dog had much less gas and fewer stools. I'll have to monitor our girls more closely to see if this is the case with them. I do notice a welcome firmness in Evie's stools though. If you're looking to try a premium pet food, give Artemis a try.

More reasons to try Artemis -

Natural DHA
Superior grade protein (human grade)
Multi protein source
Select vegetables and fruits
Custom vitamin and mineral package
Balanced level of omega 3 & 6
Probiotic/prebiotic
Skin and coat conditioners
Natural - contains no added chemicals, preservatives, artificial additives, or by-products.
No wheat or corn
Guarantee- Artemis guarantees your pet will thrive and be satisfied or 100% money back.
Usually when you buy a duo of oils, one is usually way better than the other but both are pretty good.  I've had slightly better black truffle oil at this price but I thought the white was very good.

Summary: Great tea and an even better bargain
Text: I'm a lifetime fan of Lipton tea so, there was no risk in this purchase for me.  A 20 count box of Lipton green tea bags is $2.99 at the local Kmart which makes the 240 bags in this box, a $36 retail value, a steal at $20.  The only negative in this review is that once brewed, the tea looks nothing like a green tea.  Instead, it has a nice golden brown appearance like the normal Lipton product.  I bought a bottle of Lipton diet green tea as a comparison and found the 1.5 liter bottle to be good, but too sweet for my taste.  Instead, 6 tea bags and four packets of splenda make the same amount of tea, but much more palatable.  At six bags per bottle, I can make forty bottles of a tea that was about $2 retail for just $20.  If you're intent on having a tea that is a pale light green then this product is not for you.  However, it's a good value, if not exactly the product being advertised.
I have used this product for a long time as Lipton has always been a trusted brand.  I do go through A LOT of tea, so buying it on Amazon was quick, and more affordable then other stores.

My husband drinks a lot of green tea, and this is one of our preferred brands.  I also appreciate that the tea is naturally decaffeinated.  He drinks probably up to half a gallon of tea a day, and I appreciate that he doesn't have a large caffeine intake.

I am so happy I switched from coffee to Lipton Decaff Green Tea.
Coffee had been giving me an acid build up which is secreted through my skin, causing burning rashes.
Not that I don't love coffee, but the Lipton Decaff Green, of which I drink sometimes 2 pots a day,
causes no acid build up. So join the happy tea drinkers. GO GREEN!!!!
AMAZON HAS THE LOWEST PRICE ON THIS ITEM......BELIEVE IT!!!!

Summary: Lipton Green Tea, Decaffeinated, Tea Bags, 40-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)
Text: Packed well with other purchases. Free shipping, too. Great quality product. Fresh, tasty, healthy. Hot or iced. Will purchase again!
I like green tea, especially when I'm sick, and this did the trick. I think Lipton is the best Green Tea. Fast delivery, as promised.

Summary: Easy on the stomach and doesn't keep you awake
Text:
Let it be said that I am one who absolutely LOVES my coffee, perhaps a little too much, because for awhile I was drinking about a whole pot (!) a day by myself.

It was when I got a stomach ulcer though that I was forced by my doctor to severely cut down on my intake of coffee permanently. I still enjoy 2-3 small cups a day but no more.

Thank heavens Lipton Decaffeinated Green Tea was there to come to the rescue in my case for the desire to drink more beyond that. I am a huge music fan and am usually listening to my vast CD collection when not at work and seem to always want a hot, soothing beverage to sip to pass the hours by as I listen. Lipton Green Tea is great for that. It's extremely easy to make, good for you, naturally decaffeinated and has that clean, pure taste that all Lipton tea has come to be known for. I think I'm hooked for life on buying the 40-packet boxes at my local store and highly recommend it to those like me wishing to cut down on or even completely eliminate their daily dose of traditional caffeinated coffee.

Getting this product through Amazon has been a pleasure.  The pricing is better than typical retail and it's delivered to my front door free of charge.  I selected to get it sent to me once a month and I can still monitor it and make any changes if necessary.  Again, highly recommended.

No problems. Delivered promptly. . .

But I wish i could have the equivalent in bulk, to save money, as I am an avid user of decaffeinated green tea and this habit runs into money.

Summary: Average - good value when Amazon offers Lipton on sale
Text: We combine with decaf Large Lipton Ice Tea Bags to make iced tea.  Good value on Amazon when special (happens aboug 2x per year) on Lipton purchases $15-$20 off.  We drink a lot of iced tea in Florida so quantity is no issue for us.  Besides keeps fresh until you open the package.

Summary: Very nice tea, like the caffeine free!
Text: I use this tea quite a bit.  It's good hot and cold, makes great iced green tea, and you don't have to worry about the caffeine.
I have tried other green teas, but always come back to Lipton as it has the taste I most prefer.

I have become a Decaf Green Tea addict.  Green tea is so good for you and since I cannot stand caffinated drinks this decaf green tea is perfect.  I have to go easy on coffee as it contains too much caffine even in the decaf kind.  This green tea has really helped with my blood pressure and I found out the caffine can cause it to rise.  As long as I stay off too much salt in the diet and decaf, low fat I have been able to stay off medication for high blood pressure.  I can keep that steady with the decaf green tea, this was a bargain for a case lot.  Having the shipping free and delivery in two days it is a saving all around.

Lipton Decaffeinated Green Tea is the perfect thing to drink when you want a soothing hot or cold iced beverage. It works wonders to combat laryngitis as well. The tea bags contain decaffeinated tea which means you'll never lose a night's sleep from drinking this! SMILE

Moreover, there are no additives nor are there preservatives. You can use these tea bags a very long time after you bought them in a store or here at Amazon.com online. Amazon states that this tea has antioxidants and in fact it does--but the antioxidants are in the form of flavonoids which are all natural antioxidants. Some evidence suggests that flavonoids reduce the risk for coronary heart disease at the same time that they lower your risk of several types of cancers. Tea flavonoids can also improve your body's immune system.

I normally find this green tea most useful for those nasty winter months when I inevitably catch a miserable cold. I heat the water until it's almost at a boiling point; then I put the water and the tea bag into my cup. I let it steep for a few minutes before I add milk and one packet of "sweet and low." It's absolutely delicious!

Overall, this is a fine quality green tea that will not over stimulate you with caffeine. It is an aromatic hot beverage for when you have a cold and it also makes a delicious iced tea drink on a baking--hot summer's day. Pick some up and try it--you will not be disappointed.

SMILE

Summary: Great Green Tea, but how many bags are in this order...
Text:
I really like this green tea. I find it to be much better than the other brand. I add a little lemon and splenda to mine and enjoy it hot or cold.

What I wonder is if it is 6/40 count boxes like the title reads or 6/20 count boxes which is in the description??? Hmmm.....If it is 40 counters then this is a great deal.
This is a good alternative to caffeine. I like the taste of it.Lipton Green Tea, Decaffeinated, Tea Bags, 40-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)

I work with fondant a lot and I use to buy just white then color it, but that takes a lot of time, is messy, and the colors always turn out different. I discovered Fondarific and I love it!! They have tons of different colors and different flavors. The taste of this is good, the only problem I have is the color is a little darker than I would have liked and when I mix it with white for a lighter purple color it looks more pinkish purple than true purple.
Initially I did not like the color, but once I kneaded it, it was fine.  Good flavor.  Item was shipped as expected.

Summary: Best Fondant EVER! Great for Newbies!
Text: Easy yummy fondant. great for beginners! i love this fondant! wonderful color.. always makes great cakes!  I have used on several cakes. Even the Justin Beiber Cake!
I absolutely love fodarific. This is the third one I've bought and I will continue to buy. It taste really good, and is so easy to work with! Definitely worth the money. Thanks!!
This product made my poor dog sick! I never seen her so sick before. I DO NOT recommend this product at all!
I get the raw seeds to use in homemade granola -- so the seeds don't over-toast -- and I found this brand of excellent quality -- a good value too.
I had no idea that totally "organic" could mean totally "tasteless." The best thing that these can be used for is in cooking oriental dishes or making salads.
thought i would try these new hansen beverages in island blast smoothie;worth the trial! So yummy I have everyone at work wanting some
Rich garlic flavor.  This is why I ordered it and I am not disappointed!  Generous amount provides enough to last awhile.
This is the best mochi i have had so far! It was very fresh and tasted amazing and it shipped super fast!

I just received my shipment of this mochi yesterday and it tasted weird, not good at all. For clarification, I got the red bean and it comes with six in the package (I couldn't find anywhere how many were inside). I ate the first one, didn't like it, tried another and then threw the rest away. I'll stick to my Kohaku kind, just figured I would try out another brand now I know better.

I was disappointed because it was not like mochi that I have had (and enjoyed) in the past.  The rice cake and bean paste were of about the same consistency, and about equally sweet.  And it didn't have the nice flavor of either the rice cake or the bean paste.

I didn't get these to gross out my family or friends; just curious about the environmental and nutritional advantages Entomophagy. These should eradicate the fear instilled into me by society and pesticide companies :-D

I think I got an expired sampler pack because they tasted rancid and the added flavors are indistinguishable between each of the packs (bland). There isn't an expiration date on any of the boxes so I don't know if dry crickets or the ingredients go bad after a while.

Next on my list, worms :-)

Just what it says and perfect for grossing out your 3rd graders! The flavors, though, leave something to be desired. But really, how flavorful do you really need your halloween prop to be? It was fine and good for the purpose I needed.
Even my 8 year old, who was super excited to eat bugs agrees.  These taste terrible, just disgusting.  Not even worth it for a kid who's happy to be eating bugs.
My son really loves these. He has been watching a lot of those survival tv shows where the need to eat bugs.  While they are way too expensive for what you get, it is quite a novelty gift.
Crystal Light Peach tea give me the type of drink I like and also the amount of water that I have to drink.  I do NOT like to drink water, so the crystal lite is the way to go...

My dog has always loved these, but because they were cheaper and available at the local market - for a while I was buying her generic biscuits. Well, it turns out the poor dog has major food allergies! Now these are all I get for her. She knew best!

I recommend this product because it is a larger size than anything I've seen available through pet stores.
Perfect for my 13 week old Lab who wants to chew on EVERYTHING.  Takes her quite a bit to get thru these which is why I bought the "large" size treat.  Healthy, cleans her teeth.  Highly recommend

I'm writing this review, however, if my dog could write it, or say it, she would positively rave about this treat! I have a 6-year-old Bichon Frise who loves these dog biscuits - or as she knows them, "cookies"!  She loves the flavor of peanut butter, which is why I bought these originally to try. However, I was pleased to know that the other ingredients in these dog biscuits are oatmeal, eggs, apples and carrots and that everything is made natural. I want my dog to have good snacks (and food!) - and I want her to enjoy what she's eating, too. I have made my third purchase of this product as she loves them - she never hesitates to gobble the "cookie" quickly. She loves them and I know they're good for her - we're both happy! And to top it all off - the price is definitely right! I buy the mini-size as my dog is small. I highly recommend this high-quality dog treat!

Exceptionally wonderful transaction. There was a mix-up in items, but 1 contact with the seller & the issue was resolved so simply & easily. I'll tell you, if you have a mix-up, then you REALLY get to know how professional the seller is, and this one is top notch!

I used this last night by sprinkling some of this on pork chops along with the usual salt and pepper. It is a nice pick me up. I see this on anything really, roast potatoes, etc. If you like experimenting w/different foods and spices, this is an easy one to start with.  Then you can move up to fennel POLLEN, a bit pricier, but also good. I like this brand of spices b/c I have a toddler granddaughter that has serious food allergies to dairy, eggs, peanuts...this brand is totally free from those ingredients and others (wheat, fish, tree nuts, milk, soy) that can cause problems. No MSG, no artifical color, no preservatives, no sugar, non-GMO, non irradiated, and it's even kosher...what more can you ask for.

My dog is a fussy eater. The small bites were perfect for her since she's only 6 1/2 pounds. I'd give it 5 stars if she woofed it down. She didn't but that's not unusual. She's picky.  However, if it weren't worth four stars she'd have not eaten it at all. :)

My two Italian Greyhound puppies prefer Royal Canin Mini puppy which unfortunately is higher priced.
The quality is probably as good but just not their favorite.

I got my pup from the pound she came with good quality dog food but she still itching a lot from what the vet said was dry skin. Our Vet said to try this brand but at Petco was about $18 per 5lb bag not on sale. I wish I had thought about looking into Amazon along time ago would have saved me a lot of time and money.
If switching your dog's food go half and half for a while.. I am sure everyone else knows this but in case :)

I got this as a try out, before committing to a larger bag. Dogs love it, as they do all the products from this company. They have eaten the biscuits, and the meat rolls are gobbled up. The meat rolls help a lot with giving meds, as my dog is one smart cookie when it comes to meds. Anyway, I like this dog food in the small bites, as my older dog is having a hard time chewing. So with this, the bites are smaller and easier for her to break up, and sometimes she just swallows them without chewing, with no problem.The larger sizw also helps with her chewing as they are flat round pieces and easy for her to bite thru. I recommend this product for your pets.

I have two small doggies and they both love this food.
I love all the benefits of the nutrition they get from it.
This is a highly recommended diet for any dog.
DMTJ W. Warwick, RI

This food used to come in a plastic package that was very good for keeping the product fresh.  Now the product comes in a lower quality bag that is not as good.  This food is formulated for small dogs and it takes about a month to eat through the full bag.  I am concerned that the food will be stale when we reach the end of the bag due to the lower quality packaging.  To be fair, the food itself is very good quality and my dog has been on it for 3 years with no problems.

This food did help lessen the itchiness my beagle suffers from, however, she hated it. She begrudgingly ate it because I wouldn't give her anything else until it was gone. I have since discovered Natural Life dog food. She hardly ever scratches anymore and actually seems to like this kind. I buy it at Wal Mart.

My dog HATES this dog food. She turns her head away from it and refuses to even put it in her mouth. I bought a 1-lb bag at a local pet store(I thought they were treats) and she LOVED it. But they were not small bites. There is something different between the regular and small bites. The only difference mentioned on the labels is duck, but my dog loves duck. So, it must be something else. I don't know what it is, but my dog knows. I bought this 5 lb. bag as treats to sprinkle on her more nutritional mainstay brand or to hand feed because she loved the one from the pet store so much. But I'm not even going to bother with this stuff. I figure there has to be a reason why the dog hates it. So, bottom line, I got bagged.

These are delicious, handy snacks that are enjoyable, low calorie and fat- and sugar-free.  Because each serving is divided into many tasty chewy squares, it lasts a long time and makes the perfect take-along or any time snack.  Thank you, Matt!

I love these things!  Yes, they are expensive for a one ounce snack but only 40 calories a package!  Great snack to tide you over between meals.  The coconut sets the mood and transports you to Hawaii while the mango finish brings it all home!

I am on the SCD diet, and have been looking for snacks that I can take with me anywhere, and perhaps most importantly, taste good.  Matt's Munchies is definitely both! The flavors are really nice, and are reminiscent of the tropics. I disagree with a previous reviewer that there is too much coconut.  I feel the flavors are nicely balanced.  I love that they are packaged in bite size squares, as well.  I plan on ordering this regularly in the future!

Summary: Had them before and they were good, but now they aren't
Text: They were bad enough that I returned them. These are VERY expensive snacks. They should at least taste good. These tasted like they were old and stale. I don't recommend buying these. At lease not in the Island Mango flavor.

I used to love this snack but recently they changed the inside packaging and it appears the quality also changed.  The fruit leather used to be much thicker but now it is very thin and covered in too many coconut flakes for the amount of mango.  I wish they would go back to how it used to be!
What a delicious treat! These are the BEST cashews I have ever had in my life! I will be a repeat customer!

Received as a gift that I had researched/requested. Surprised that it contained 50% broken pieces (mostly tiny), where the photo online shows only whole nuts. Not recommended, unless you don't mind broken pieces.

The first shipment was truly colossal in taste and size, The second shipment was colossal in taste but at least 1/2 of the can is pits and pieces. Very disappointed-had bought the can to use for entertaining. Very hesitant to buy again.

Got these for the hubby for Father's Day, they are not bad, but Plow and Hearth have the best cashews, crunchy & flavorable. These were passable but if you are a cashew nut, I would not recommend them.

Summary: Size Great, Flavor Good, Condition Fair, Value Meh
Text: First off, these cashews are huge -- the biggest I've seen. And they taste good. What bothers me is that, for this much money, I want absolute perfection and they fail in that regard. For the price a lot of broken nuts and "nut dust" just aren't acceptable and that is what I've seen in three cans (I wasn't hasty in my judgement). For a similar price-per-ounce I can buy smaller but always-whole-never-smashed nuts locally that taste just as good and that is what I'm going to do from now on.
Loved these cashews. Vacumm packed, whole and full of flavor. Will order again. Shared with others that love cashews and they also agreed.
Hugh.  Delicious.  Perfect for me.  Will buy again. Would make a great gift.  I had all whole cashews, no pieces.

Summary: My bassett hound LOVES his food now...
Text:
Canidae has definetly proven to be a tasty, balanced source of food for my dog.

Initially i had started my new pup on IAMS because of its popularity - but after reading the ingredient list and hearing the the IAMS corporation had just been sold (therefore not keeping the quality of their product) I decided I needed to provide my hound with a heathier source of nutrition.

I volunteer at the local Human Society Shelter and a friend of mine there suggested that I try "Canidae". At first I was hesitant because of the cost - but when i read the nutrition facts and saw REAL, all natural ingredients, i felt confident enough that the price was worth it.

Before i started feeding my bassett Canidae he would only eat once a day (placing a full bowl of food down for him in the early morning on my way to work...he would wait until late at night to eat AFTER I had my dinner and slowly munch on a couple bits here and there). The first morning i put Canidae in his dish (at 5:30am) he scarfed the entire bowl down in a matter of minutes!!!!! It was such a relief to know that my dog was actually enjoying his food.

Now i feed him once in the morning and once at night and he eats every bit as soon as I put it down everytime. Occasionally I will cook up some frozen vegetables with an egg and mix it in his food for a little variety, but I havent had to do that in a while.

If you love your dog and care about his/her nutrition, I suggest giving Canidae a try.

Summary: Good price for a highly rated dog food
Text: I feed three large dogs and one small dog with this dog food.  I've used it about three months.  Formerly I used a well-known brand that I assumed was good since it was well-known and readily available at stores everywhere.  I decided to change when I did some internet research showing my old brand was considered to have inferior ingredients.  I have to say that I have seen good reviews on the ingredients of this dog food, but I cannot say I notice anything in particular about my dogs since changing other than they seem to enjoy it more and seem to be satisfied with less of it.  Perhaps one dog who has skin problems is better, but I can't swear the dog food is the cause.  So, relying almost entirely on internet proclamation of quality, I give this a hearty recommendation.  And, the price is competitive to lesser rated dog foods.  And it comes directly to your door.
