Text: Perhaps these snacks are ten years old;  I tried, but failed, to find an expiration date.  These Fruit Snacks are firm with an almost crispy outer surface -and not much flavor to boot.  I bought these because Global Brand's Strawberry Fruit Snacks are pretty good (if not stellar);  I would steer shoppers toward that flavor or another product entirely.

Good price for the Chex Snacks.
Quick delivery and arrived in good condition.
Will order again...I have been quite pleased with the Amazon Grocery purchases I've made over the last few months.
This is the tastiest snack I have ever eaten.  And, it's low in calories.  It has little pretzels, small cheese crackers, chex mix and other little crackers. Very delicious.
Can't find these in the grocery store any more, so please keep them here on Amazon! Great snack!!  I Love them!!!
Cold not find it in local stores.  One of my favorite snacks and only 100 calories per pack.  Excellent price.

This chocolate mousse is delicious! The directions are simple and easy to follow. It is truly a restaurant quality mousse that I would be proud to serve to anyone. It is also very versatile. I have used it for pastry filling and have even made little frozen mousse pops out of it. You  will love it!!

This mousse is so good that I'm giving it to everyone on my Christmas list! This mousse is to die for. Everyone I have ever served it to licks the glass clean. It is very easy to make and lives up to its claims.

Delicious and super easy! Made it for guests and they thought I was a genius.
Definitely worth trying out (plus, its fair trade and organic if you do want to give away your secret).

Nigella in Arabic are the Seed of Blessing. The flavor is deep and savory, like a peppered oregano and something you just cannot put your finger on. Musky and warm, it is pungent and cozy. They are used from Spain to Pakistan. If you have had them, it is most likely in string cheese, often from Armenia. If you are from New York, they were frequently used in stead of caraway in rye bread.

If you are a baker, try studding your crust with them, especially if you are using an egg wash. Nigella love all starch, pasta, potato, rice and bread. As before, they also fancy cheese. If you cannot find Armenian string cheese, there are several domestic ones made without the seeds. But they tend to be on the krafty side. Trader Joe's may be the best of that lot. Or go to your mexican market and get Oaxaca cheese, the kind you stuff chilies with, which is a good place to use them since they go with tomato sauce. Middle Eastern halloumi or akawi work well.

Or, go with farmers' type curded cheeses, whole milk cottage will do. Just warm a spoon of seed in virgin olive oil until it hits your nose, but do not use high heat or you will burn the fat in the oil. Cool and stir into the cheese. Crumbled feta or blue are good. Let it sit overnight or so if you want, just take it out of the refrigerator for an hour or so to bring it back to room temperature.

Switch out the pepper for Nigella in your next ratatouille. My favorite: use a table spoon of seed in two of oil and two of butter, warm as before and fold in 200 grams or so of gorgonzola (dolce is decadent) and toss with a hot pot of your just drained fettuccine or pappardelle or even black squid ink pasta. Just do not be too zealous in draining. Some pasta water is nice. Add a spoon or two if that is easier. Garnish with fresh oregano, marjoram or basil.

Prefer rice? Use feta and kalamata olives or feta and small shrimp with blanched spinach.

Get to know this seed. You might see them labeled as charnushka. Zamouri is a first rate source of highest quality and freshness.

I recently ordered several varieties of flavored stevia, and liked them for the most part. The orange is a little bitter when used in drinks.

It works to sweeten, but thn you don't taste much orange. If you use enough to taste the orange, your drink is very bitter from too much sweetening. It's a great concept though!

Summary: Full of orange flavor, sweet with no aftertaste
Text: I recently switched from Splenda to Stevia.  I purchased Sweetleaf sugar packets with fiber, which are great, and now decided to try a flavored drop.  This one is very good!  Nice orange flavor, almost like a mandarin rather than an orange, and again, just like the packet, no aftertaste.  Very good, makes me want to try other flavors.  I only put 2-3 drops per 16oz, no more.  With Sweetleaf stevia, seems less is more, otherwise, you may get bitter taste.  Why did I switch from Splenda?  Turns out Splenda's glycemic index, a measure of the effects of carbohydrates on blood sugar levels, is higher than sugar!

I have been very happy with this product!  I have tried almost all the  flavors, but the Valencia Orange is my favorite.  I feel it is the most versatile of the flavors available.  I have been using this for over a year now and enjoy it on a daily basis in my water bottle and also add it to my tea, iced or hot.  A little goes a long way.  It is not too sweet but very light and refreshing.  Highly recommended!

Summary: My Favorite Way to Kill The Taste of Water!
Text: I am not a fan of plain drinking water and this product is my saving grace.  Even fresh squeezed lemon doesn't do the trick for me!  A clear glass of water over ice with a few droppers of this makes you think you are drinking something sweet and exotic.  What a treat!  You have to be careful not to get it too strong, or it becomes almost "bitter".  I also always put a few drops of Valencia Orange in my water bottles to take with me before I leave the house!  This is a can't do without product for me.  I usually buy 2-3 of these a month and was absolutely THRILLED to find it on Amazon as a Subscribe and Save item.  I'm out in the country and always have to plan ahead to keep my supply going.  I have tried the Lemon Drop and Root Beer flavors, and while they are good, this is the one that I prefer!  You might even be able to break a child's juice or soda habit by using this or one of the other flavors!  This is much more economical and eco-wise than buying the fancy flavored bottled waters that abound in the market place.  I drink out of a quart Mason jar and recycle the empty bottle when I'm done!  It is also a good way to flavor and sweeten hot tea!

SweetLeaf Liquid Stevia, Valencia Orange is a great sweetener for my tea-hot or iced! I use about one drop per ounce of beverage so a bottle lasts about as long as it takes me to drink the tea from a box of 100 tea bags. It is the same product I had been purchasing from a health food store but buying a pack of 2 as a subscription item from Amazon.comStevia Clear Valencia Orange 2 Ounces is a wonderful bargain with free shipping too!
Great product! Lasts for a very long time and is ideal for the HCG diet! Tastes wonderful, really good with sliced lemons!

Valencia Orange has a pleasant orange aroma, but that's where the appeal ends.  It takes quite a few drops just to attain any noticeable level of taste, and it ends up very bitter.  For me, this product doesn't live up to the positive hype, and I won't be buying this one again.

I use this with SodaStream to make flavored seltzer water and it tastes much better than SodaStream's brand. I have tried the vanilla, orange, and root beer and all have been great. Amazon price, especially on subscription is much cheaper than Sprouts; if I recall the cost of 1 was almost double the cost of 2 on Amazon.

Summary: fine, but not too citrus flavored
Text: I expected this to have more of a citrus flavor, but I don't know what it is...  It does taste good in green tea.
Plain water is just so "Bla". Now it has a great orange taste, and I'm drinking more of it. Just add a few drops and enjoy!!!  This has taken the place of drinking soda, now that's a "good thing".

I have tried several flavors of Sweetleaf products, and have had no problems. The ones I recently received seem to be watered down. I used to be able to sweeten a one liter bottle of seltzer with two full squirts of the stuff. Now with two squirts, i barely taste it. My friend noticed the same issue with the Berry flavor i purchased for her!

Summary: A good addition to a healthy diet
Text: I occasionally like to add a little flavor to my club soda or mineral water & this gives me a healthy choice. For me it's very sweet, because I really restrict my carb intake. It only takes a couple of drops in a 16 oz. bottle of water, to satisfy me.

This is a great tasting sweetener. Compared to sugar there are no calories, and it doesn't give any of us stomach aches like artificial sweeteners often do.

Between this and a SodaStream I have managed to kick a 4 can a day coke habit. It's not the same as a Coke, but it's something tasty and fizzy that I can drink liters of a day. We have the subscription for two bottles a month and use it up just before the new one comes.

My daughter loves her orange water.  As a no sugar family, I was looking for a way my kids could still have a little sweetness in their life besides fruit.  This does the trick.  I am on super shipper saver even though I have prime because it comes automatically and I never run out!  This is a good price too. I originally bought this at a store and it was double the price.
I got this to add to water, to help my son drink more. he hates it...and I dont like it either leaves a funny after taste

This stevia valencia orange is great.  I put a few drops in my water bottle as I hate to drink water and it really lightens up the taste and therefore I drink more water.  Like the lemon stevia drops also.

Summary: OK for sweetener, but not much orange flavor
Text:
SweetLeaf Liquid Stevia Valencia Orange works fine as a sweetener. In fact, it's very sweet, almost cloying. But it doesn't do much to provide orange flavor. I would put it in the category of a sweetener, not a flavor enhancer. I thought I could add a few drops of this to a glass of water and have a refreshing orangey beverage, but what I get is a super-sweet glass of water with a barely detectable hint of orange. I may use this in hot or iced tea on occasion but doubt I will use it as a stand-alone flavor enhancer.

If you're looking for a sweetener and are familiar with the super sweetness of Stevia, this is worth trying. But if you're looking for something with a strong orange flavor, you won't find it here.
Love the orange flavor in my tea,smoothies and mixed with fresh lemon water. Sweetleaf is one of the best tasting stevias. Shipping was fast and wrapped securely.
I'm trying to get away from the sugar substitutes but love the flavors in my tea and coffee.  These stevia flavors are wonderful.

I've been using Stevia as my sweetener for over 10 years. I've always used the KAL white powder Stevia, as I like the taste best of all. Now I found the SweetLeaf Luquid stevia, and at first I tried the Hazelnut flavor (yummy), and then I gave a try to Chocolate-Raspberry and Orange flavor. I love love the orange flavor in my coffee, oatmeal or Greek yogurt. It gives just gentle touch of orange, but you can definitely taste it.
It's okay, but the citrus flavor is not as pervasive as I expected. Tastes fake. Some of the Sweet Leaf flavors are excellent, this one is merely average.

These Sweetleaf "flavored" products are only for people who want something really sweet with just the very barest whiff of some flavor (you probably won't even be able to tell which one it is). If you're looking for a product that's about half sweetness and half flavor, THIS ISN'T IT. I urge you to save your money and look for another solution.

Excellent in every way,and the Amazon price is better than what you can find at a store ( if you can find this better-than-best version).

I love to use the Fasta Pasta ( pasta cooker, also at Amazon) with this product--fast, and cooks to perfection.

Kraft did an excellent job with this-- people LOVE it!

ENJOY!

The best macaroni and cheese ever. Thank goodness for Amazon,can't find this in the grocery stores where I live. The bacon just adds a little something extra to set it aside from regular macaroni and cheese.
It's got the creamy, cheesy flavor of the original with the added smokiness of bacon!  Quick, easy, delicious!

There is something just completely wrong with the way the bacon bits that are packaged with the Velveeta Shells and Cheese taste.  Additionally the cheese sauce does not taste the same as the regular Shells and Cheese sauce, and not in a good way.  Stick with the original.

Summary: The best of the best in salt!
Text: This salt is a salt lovers dream come true. It is amazing on everything I've tried. I reccommend this salt for every home that has taste buds.

Summary: This by far is the best tasting Stevia
Text: This by far is the best tasting Stevia I have tried. I have tried different brands but they leave a bad taste in my mouth. Wisdom brand I have used for 6 years and have not been dissapointed. One thing to keep in mind is one tsp equils one cup of sugar approximately. I use a little less than a tsp of stevia to equal a cup of sugar. If you get a bitter taste you are using to much stevia. I use this primaryly to make Kool-Aid. Its cheaper than pop, all natural, zeor glycemic value, zero calories. I would recommend Wisdom brand stevia to anyone looking to cut processed, artifical sugar. Google Wisdom to find all products and recipe books.

It didn't come with any recommended amounts to use to sweeten any foods. I had to look it up online. I thought it tasted ok, but my husband and brother thought it left a very bitter aftertaste. I didn't notice the taste and neither did my sister n law.

LOVE IT!LOVE IT!LOVE IT!LOVE IT! Great gift for any FOODIE or anyone who is looking to cut back on other condiments. We use it on almost everything. Plus the croc it comes in looks very nice. Good value. YUmmy stuff.

I love this mustard. I first received it as a gift and got hooked on it. I put it on everything. It makes a better gift than the traditional bottle of wine when going to someone's  house for dinner. That's how I discovered it. It is hard to find in stores but easy to find on Amazon. The first that I had came from a fiend who brought it from France.

ohhhh... this stuff is WONDEFUL!!! Nothing else is quite like it. The exquisite flavor not only adds to any mouthful of food but also wakes up the flavors of everything else you're eating. Best mustard to go with prime beef. Best mustard for sandwiches with lean meats, lettuce and fresh sprouts. Best mustard with crackers and gourmet cheese (or, hey, just with crackers!). A little goes a long way, and you feel coddled whenever you have some.

We used to live near a gourmet food store where we could buy this whenever we ran out. We got spoiled, and now it's VERY hard to find. So great to see it on Amazon -- wow!!!!
This is my favorite gourmet mustard.  It's a perfect recipe addition and condiment.  I buy it as a gift all of the time.

These mints repulsed me after a whiff at a local candy, but I decided to get them anyway since they didn't have any latte mints. Once I tried them it was like:

A unicorn
pooping glitter
whilst dancing on a rainbow
at a One Direction concert.
great to pack in my kids lunch, and is a great way not to sit down and eat a whole pack at once...wish it was cheaper though

lapsang souchong tea is some of my favorite tea. it has a very distinct flavor, owing to it being smoked dried with pinewood. the bags of tea say they make 20-25 cups of tea, but as this tea has a strong flavor to it, i used only a tiny bit of tea leaves per cup and managed to get ~35 cup with the one bag i've used so far.
overall im very satisfied with this purchase.

I love this tea. Ahmad tea is just a perfect cup of tea. English Tea No. 1 is my tea of choice. It's perfectly balanced and never bitter, no matter how long it's brewed.

Incidentally, if you want to purchase English Tea No. 1 in it's loose form, you have to buy "English Afternoon Tea" loose. Please note, however, that in teabag form, English Afternoon and English Tea No.1 are two distinct blends. But in loose form, English Afternoon and English Tea No.1 are on in the same. I don't know why that's the case, but that's what a representative from Ahmad Tea told me when I emailed them to ask where I can buy English Tea No. 1 in loose form.

I purchased loose English Afteroon Tea (aka Eng. Tea No. 1) from another online purveyor, and the loose version of the tea is just as delicious (maybe even more so) than the bagged version. the loose tea is whole leaf tea, which is hard to find in a black tea. usually, loose black tea is very finely shredded, not altogether different from its bagged form. but the loose Ahmad black tea is whole leaf, which just goes to show how high the quality is at Ahmad tea.

all in all, a terrific tea, and highly recommended.

My family is from England and we love tea. We were given this tea as a gift. We were skeptical at first, but fell in love with it as soon as we tasted it. Truly a perfect tea! We love it as both hot tea or Sun tea!

ProfileName: C. Riley "C Riley-reader of any and all books"
Text: I received this tea in a house-warming basket and it is wonderful.  I could (and have) drink it all day.  I was so glad to find it on amazon but I think next time I will go straight through eurogrocer and save a couple of bucks.  But it is worth it!

This is the smoosthest blend of tea that I can remember drinking. I have been a tea drinker for about 30 years. We got a 10 pack in a gift basket for Christmas from my son and his wife. I am ordering more and it is not even noon Christmas day !!

Remember drink responsibly, Hope you had a Merry Christmas
This is the best tea I have ever had. It is smooth and delicious! I highly recommend it.
I love this tea, the full bodied flavor and aroma is smooth and relaxing. Order the two packs of one hundred, the shipping is much less.

I have been buying this tea for a while now from another store, so I already knew how good it is. In fact, I think this is the best tea one can get. I'm kind of hooked on it; I'm not even awake before I have my first cup in the morning.

Anyway, this is a very convenient packaging for someone who drinks a lot of tea - 100 bags in one package. The package arrived really quickly, no problems whatsoever.

I originally received this tea in a holiday gift basket.  I've been a tea drinker all my life, so I'm rather opinionated as to what I like and what I don't.  This is by far the best tea I've ever had!!  I can't find it locally, but have been lucky enough to find it on-line.  It has a very unique flavor that you just can't find in your typical Lipton or Red Rose tea.

We received a gift basket with this tea in it for Christmas. When my wife tried it she couldn't get over how great it tasted. Being a tea drinker all of her adult life and fancying herself as knowing a good tea from a bad she just had to have a supply of this tea. We couldn't find a local store that carried it so we went to Amazon to order some. The company that we ended up with wasted no time in getting the tea to us without difficulty. Of course once you add in the shipping the price of the tea goes up, but that's a small price to pay in order to make my wife a happy woman.

If you like tea, this is a tea that I think you will like very much. I love it. I am basically caffeine free, but on the weekends I indulge. I first tasted it from a collection of several teas that my cousins gave me for Xmas. I went looking for it here at Amazon, and was so glad to have found it.
Makes the best tasting Iced tea, one of the best iced teas I've had. It also is a good hot tea. Great company
This has become my favorite everyday tea. It's a great price and shipping is very reasonable.
The only problem with this tea is that you going through it too FAST:)Great flavor!Love it!!!

We love this tea. Being of English extraction, we are used to drinking a strong English "breakfast" type tea. This has a very nice flavor, not overly strong unless you steep it a long time, with just a hint of bergamot to liven up the strong tea taste (much less bergamot than in Earl Grey). After reading another review of this tea from someone who said that Ahmad's English Afternoon loose tea is actually the same as their English Tea No. 1 in teabags, we also bought this in 7 oz tins from another vendor, and it does taste pretty much the same. I use the loose tea in my teapot, and the bags when making a quick "cuppa".
Since I was diagnosed with type II diabetes, This is the only drink I drink. It taste great and has enough sweetness to it to be very satisfying.

Summary: Good product, good price, always arrives in great condition
Text:
I don't personally eat this product so I can't vouch for the flavor and texture. I do, however, buy it here and buy it often as I donate it regularly to my church for their special dinners for the homeless, those in need, and fundraiser suppers.

The pastor tells me that those who do the cooking for the church, as well as those being served enjoy it a lot and many ask for 'seconds'. The pastor advises me it makes a great side dish and helps to fill up hungry tummies while being so easy to make. On occasion, the church cooks will add their own additional onions and celery, but it isn't necessary as this stuffing includes all that and more. And,because this is a 'herb' flavor, adding chicken stock or turkey stock vs. water makes it even more complimentary to a chicken/turkey meal.

The price here at Amazon is better than that at the local grocery stores, esp. with my Prime for free shipping. I can also get it in 1-2 days if the church needs extra with short notice. Good deal, good product, prompt service.

Edit: 2-25-10 (after-thought). All one needs to add to this product is butter and water. Depending on how moist/dry one prefers stuffing, simply add more/less water. Our church roasts turkeys and hen turkeys in large quantities very often and we strain and freeze the 'au jus' from them in 12 oz plastic containers. Occasionally, rather than using up our butter supply for stuffing, we substitute the defrosted au jus from the turkey. This seems to be the preferred 'flavor' by those enjoying the meals.

This is boxed stuffing which -- as in all boxed foods -- in my mind is the equivalent of bland, bleh food. My husband, though, actually prefers this over my (sometimes) labor intensive homemade stuffing so I like to keep a quantity of it in the house for him. Making this according to the directions isn't something I've ever done so I can't really comment on that but I can say that with a quick few additions and substitutions, I can actually eat and enjoy this as well.

First, I always use stock (usually chicken/duck -- whatever I have in my freezer) instead of water and add some sort of vegetable to it as well. Usually it's sauteed, grated carrots or zucchini but I've put everything in it at one point or another. I also add to the seasoning with whatever I think will taste good (sage is always great as well as any sort of chicken seasoning and I always add parsley if I have it fresh on hand).

Here are some more suggestions to add to make your stuffing better that I've tried and liked:

-- Cooked sausage -- breakfast sausage is always good but I've used brats and italian sausage as well and it's equally as good.
-- Bacon
-- Chicken livers (or turkey or duck or whatever you might be cooking)
-- Ground beef
-- Or you could go the fruit way and add apple, dried cranberries, raisins or even substitute some of the water for cider
-- Nuts (chestnuts and walnuts are what I've used)
-- Veggies -- Like I said above, grated carrots or zucchini is my standby but I always add onions, garlic, and sometimes celery or mushrooms as well.
-- Cheese -- parmesan in particular

I also have a friend who swears by adding white rice to it as well but I haven't tried it (and personally think that that's an awful lot of carbs!)

Also, as another reviewer has said, this is a fantastic donation item because it's easy to make as well as being very filling.

The Maxwell House filter packs are a Great Idea for people moving Fast in the Morning. Four Cups a pack and you're Gone.

Recently, Each Supermarket shopped has discontinued the De-Caf version of this product.
Found it on Amazon to my astonisment and order from them ever since.

I purchased the decaf and the regular because sometimes I need less caffeine or no caffeine. When I want a full pot I put one of each in it and have a full pot of half regular and half decaf. Amazon has the best price around and I hope they continue to carry this product.

This product is ideal - I use it all the time.  It's just perfect for an afternoon or evening coffee break for 1 or 2 people, especially those who might be sensitive to caffeine later in the day.  I always keep this on hand.  The taste is rich, but not bitter like some of the newer coffee blends on the market.

My husband loves the Maxwell House coffee in the filter packs because there is no measuring and he can just put one in the coffee pot and he's got coffee. He had come across these filter packs while living out of town so when he came back home he wanted the Maxwell House filter packs.  With several grocery stores in our area we could never find this item.  I thought I'd check with Amazon.  What the heck?  Well there it was and it was cheaper than we'd ever seen it before.  Got him 4 boxes and no shipping.  He's happy as can be because I found a place to get his favorite coffee. Will be ordering again for sure!!
This coffee is not only delicious but convenient too.  It's so easy to use and not messy at all.  I think it's great.

My Mom & Dad are at the age where they need things to be easy and this fits the bill. My Mom loves this no mess way to make coffee and my Dad loves that there are in no grounds in his coffee, which is a problem with the small coffee makers. The best thing is that it is every bit as good if not better than the loose coffee.

Our local supermarkets dropped the decaf version, so happy I found it here and love that it is shipped right to their door.
It was so wonderful to see that I could get my loved Maxwell House Coffee to come to my house every two months for less than I could buy it in the store!  Great deal!  Great coffee!  Thanks, Amazon
The stereotype of decaf coffee is a bitter taste, but not with Maxwell House. This decaf coffee is flavorful and robust. And it is great to drink before bed.
The convenience of this filter pack is essential...and makes it easier for me to brew coffee in spite of my disability.

This works real well for since I am unable for find Maxwell decaffeinated coffee in the local stores in or around Plano, Texas. Also I am the only coffee drinker in our house so with the pack it makes just the right amount for me to have my two cups in the morning. The fact that I have it on automatic reorder helps also.

Summary: Weak coffee if you brew one pouch and 24 oz. water (4 cups)
Text: Coffee portions (cups) are 6 oz. If you like your coffee strong, you'll get one large 12-14 oz cup with one pouch. The flavor of this coffee is very good.  If you own a hotel type 4 cup coffee brewer like the Jerdon First Class, these work far better than trying to use #2 cone filters. Cone filters aren't meant to be used in hotel type round pouch brewing containers, the cone collapses and some grinds leak out. I gave up on square pouches with coffee, the square pouches let hot water drip by (in the round brew container) which dilutes the coffee. These are the best 4 cup round coffee pouches I've come across. These pouches are somewhat expensive per cup, but I only drink 2 cups a day.

This is one of many of Fancy Feast's diverse selections on "the menu".

Short version: cat diagnosed with diabetes, insulin & Hill's prescription food not stabilizing glucose levels despite increasing insulin weekly over 4 weeks, switched food to Fancy Feast Classic Turkey and Giblets Feast, glucose levels normal after 1 week, decreased insulin dose dramatically, glucose still stable. May go off insulin completely soon. Thank you Fancy Feast. Please read full review below to learn why you should start feeding your cat (even if healthy) only Fancy Feast Classic Turkey, Chicken, Beef, or another WET food that has practically no plant based ingredients and has less than 10% of the calories from carbohydrates.

Even if your cat isn't diabetic please read this review and the wealth of information by a vet at catinfo.org. My 12 year old cat was diagnosed with diabetes about 2 months ago. He is a big cat and about a year ago he weighed 22 pounds. Two months ago we noticed that he looked thin, so we took him to the vet. They discovered that he had lost 7 pounds (a third of his body weight in one year), was walking on his forepaws, and based on this checked his blood glucose. It was around 450, which is more than 400% higher than the normal level of less than 100.

The vet followed the normal procedure for treating diabetic cats: insulin and "prescription" cat food (Hill's MD, dry). She did talk me into Lantus insulin, which is new (and more expensive), but has a chance of stimulating your cat's beta cells to start producing insulin again.

We started my cat on 3 units of insulin, twice daily. I fed him the exact amount of Hill's I was supposed to. Came back for checkup a week later, glucose still off the charts. Up'd insulin to 4 units twice daily. Recheck: still through the roof. Up'd insulin to 5 units. At this point wife and I started reading online and found wealth of info at catinfo.org by a vet who specializes in treating diabetic cats. This vet is a crusader of sorts against the horrible diet we feed our cats. Cats are obligate (strict) carnivores. This means there diet should be almost 100% protein and fat, from animal ingredients. Your cat should have no more than 10% of there calories from carbohydrates. DRY FOOD, OF EVEN THE BEST QUALITY, CONTAINS MUCH MORE CARBS THAN YOUR CAT SHOULD HAVE. We discovered the Hill's food we were feeding had about 17% carbs (the canned version is about the same, so don't be fooled).

After doing much comparison, we settled on Fancy Feast Classic Turkey & Giblets, because: (1) has only about 6% calories from carbs (2) first ingredient is turkey, other ingredients are liver, by-products, that is, proteins & fat (3) it is sold everywhere, unlike high end canned foods (4) it is less expensive than high end canned foods (5) unlike the Fancy Feast Classic chicken or beef, it has no fish. Looking at (2) you may think "eww...by-products," but for a cat, animal by-products, which are protein and fat from an animal, are better than plant based proteins and much better than carbs. Looking at (5), cats should not be fed fish very often, because the trace amounts of mercury in fish will build up in your cats body over time. But if your cat won't eat the Turkey, the chicken or beef would be the next best options. Make sure it is the CLASSIC style, as the other Fancy Feast brands have too many carbs.

Back to my cat. So now we were up to 5 units of insulin, twice a day. Recheck: glucose still above 400. I tell my vet that we are switching to Fancy Feast and she agrees to keep insulin at 5 units. Recheck a week later: GLUCOSE LEVELS COMPLETELY NORMAL! Go down to 4 units, twice daily. Recheck: still normal. Down to 3 units, twice daily. Still normal.

We are now down to 3 units of insulin, once a day. There is a good chance he will be off the insulin completely in the next few weeks. My cat has gained 2 pounds, has stopped drinking water and urinating constantly, and acts four years younger. Another bonus, on the expensive dry food we used to feed him he would throw up almost every single day. Now he only throws up occasionally when he has a hair ball. We also now feed are 18 year old cat this food only. She seems much more spry and happy.

I know this is just one anecdote (although there are more on the web) and that the Lantus insulin may be the real reason for this turn of events, but I do believe personally that it was Fancy Feast that saved my cat.

Summary: My cat no longer needs insulin because of this food
Text:
I have diabetic cat. My cat started exhibiting symptoms and I went to my vet who started him on insulin. He progessively got worse, as the insulin doses steadily increased. My super smart, very litter trained cat got completely out of his mind one night and climbed on top of a shoe box and peed. Poor thing didn't know where he was or what was going on.

At that, I went to the internet and found yourdiabeticcat.com. I started reading and was so skeptical but out of pure desperation I started doing what the people on the boards there suggested. I started tracking my cat's blood sugar daily at home myself. I took him off of dry food and started feeding him fancy feast classics. His blood sugars eventually started leveling out.

I went back to my vet and informed her of my changes with my cat and she was amazed. I asked her to research some concerns I had with the fancy feast. She researched it for me and told me the fancy feast is fine. My cat no longer gets insulin shots. I honestly couldn't believe it myself. He is back to his normal self: smart, energetic, and using his litter.

I now buy this food automatically off of amazon in three different flavors for variety. I have two cats and they both love all three classic flavors that I buy. (Turkey, Chicken and Beef) I highly recommend this food for the health of your cat.

Also, I have two large male cats and they eat an average of 3 cans a day each. Hopefully that will help you figure out how much you need for your cat. If for some reason, they get full and don't finish a full can in one sitting I have to cover up the left overs. They will not eat them if they have dried out, but they will eat them if I have covered them and allowed them to retain their moisture.

Summary: The good, the bad and the ugly:?
Text: I purchased this food because I am trying to feed my cats a near grain free diet and this is one of the few I could find.  That's the good part, well that and this is the only one of the purina fancy feast classics that didn't contain fish either!  Now, the bad part is that my cat would eat this about one can in twenty meaning there is a quality control issue.  After the some research on this matter, I came across the ugly....check out the reviews at consumeraffairs.com (just google consumeraffairs purina -- sorry but amazon site stripped the link when I inserted into the review).  So, be careful as Purina is the major supplier of most pet foods and after reading those HUNDREDS of complaints....they will never again get my business.

My cats enjoy the Turkey & Giblets Feast from Fancy Feast.  I treat them once in a while and it's affordable on Amazon through the subscribe and save, especially when you keep an eye on the price and it drops below $12/24 cans (subscribe and save).  I noticed that the cats do not care for the grilled or sliced types, but they never turn down this "pate" or original style and it just disappears.  For us, it's a treat that supplements their regular dry food diet.

Summary: My cats love the classic styles
Text: I wish Amazon would get more of the "classic" pate varieties of Fancy Feast.  My cats won't eat the other types (shreds, lumps, pieces).  But they love the pate "classic" varieties.  Please get more flavors, Amazon!  I will buy them all!

This one was the reject surprise of the day.  Both cats wouldn't touch it at all - surprised me because one in particular is a turkey junky.  Can't figure this one out - it smells nice in the can, not strange odors that I can detect anyway.  It's pretty expensive to just toss but well, that's what I had to do.  It is healthy for your cat and it is a pate, not chunks.  However, that said, they don't care for the chunky Fancy Feast turkey variety either.  Not sure why - they gobble up the Friskies turkey and cheese like there's no tomorrow.  Not sure what to recommend here but to try it and see if your cat likes it.  Maybe it's just too boring! :)
My cats really love this.  I have 4 cats and they all munch down. I have been buying it at Walmart but they seem to be changing their product line and sometimes I can't get it.

Summary: Chicken Soup for the Cat Lover's Soul Dry Cat Food for Senior Cat, Chicken
Text: My Cats love it, I will order again.Chicken Soup for the Cat Lover's Soul Dry Cat Food for Senior Cat, Chicken Flavor, 18 Pound Bag

package received was involved in the Diamond foods voluntary recall of Spring 2012.
I returned to a local store for replacement. So much for SAFE, EASY online orders.

I have three cats all varying in age. My oldest cat 9 yrs old gets allergies due to weather and well just about everything, he will tear his fur out if I give him cat food with filler, leaving little bald spots all over him. With this food he has stopped pulling his fur out, You have no idea how happy I am with this. I used to just give him cortizone shots at the vet to help his allergies but not anymore. I've tried many cat foods and so far this is the best! My other cats love this food as well. I tried the light chicken flavor of this food, however it gave two of my cats the runs, though my older cat still wasn't pulling his fur out. This current food for senior cats makes two of my cats stool not runny but not super solid either, but I will accept this change if it stops my cat from ripping his fur out and being all twitchy. All of my cats seem more healthier with this food, I've been feeding them this for about 6 months now just forgot to write a review.

We have a 10 year old cat who will eat anything, people or dog food included, but then gets sick.  We have tried every kind of cat food on the market and this is the only one she can eat daily and not get sick off of.  It is also wonderful at preventing hairballs.  The only time we find her getting sick is if she has been out of dry food for a few hours and then pigs out when we refill it.  I think that is just her eatting to fast and trying to jam in to much food at once.  Otherwise, by far the best food.  We also use the wet food and give her a small tablespoon size serving as a "treat" when the dog get his breakfast and dinner.  She then has access to this dry food all day and night long.  Give it a try.  We couldn't believe it but are so glad we gave it a shot.

We have tried several brands (Iams, Blue Buffalo, Science Diet, Royal Canin, Wellness Core, etc) and formulas (Digestive Health, Sensitive Stomach, etc.) over the past six years and nothing helped Mollie's daily vomiting. For months on end, we would scrub mounds of throw up. Finally, after doing some research, I decided to give Chicken Soup a try. She loves it, and the mounds are almost non-existent! We feel relieved to have finally found something that works with and for Mollie.

I ordered the product for adult cats but what I got was for seniors so maybe that has made a difference. I have two cats and neither of them like it very much. I bought an 18 pound bag and will continue to give it to them and hope they change their minds,because the ingredients make a nice healthy cat food.

I absolutely love this gum. The whole calcium from milk idea is perfect for gum that is meant to help take care of your teeth. This together with xylitol makes this, by far, my favorite gum to buy.

The one reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is I REALLY wish Trident would get rid of the Aspertame. The gum would be sweet enough without it, especially with the flavorings and xylitol already in it. If Trident did that one thing, this would be the standard of all dental care gums.

=========

ALSO, what's the deal with the high price for this 12 pack on here? Someone else already pointed this out in the reviews, but it definitely needs to be mentioned: This is listed at about $1.74 per pack when buying in bulk, but my local grocery store sells the stuff individually for about $1.50, and I've even seen it on sale for $0.99. The price really needs to come down.

=========
the gum lasts a long time and tastes great.worth the money if you like sugarless gum.

For the health-conscious - read the ingredients.

Aspartame:

Aspartame accounts for over 75 percent of the adverse reactions to food additives reported to the FDA. Many of these reactions are very serious including seizures and death. A few of the 90 different documented symptoms listed in the report as being caused by aspartame include: Headaches/migraines, dizziness, seizures, nausea, numbness, muscle spasms, weight gain, rashes, depression, fatigue, irritability, tachycardia, insomnia, vision problems, hearing loss, heart palpitations, breathing difficulties, anxiety attacks, slurred speech, loss of taste, tinnitus, vertigo, memory loss, and joint pain.

According to researchers and physicians studying the adverse effects of aspartame, the following chronic illnesses can be triggered or worsened by ingesting of aspartame: Brain tumors, multiple sclerosis, epilepsy, chronic fatigue syndrome, parkinson's disease, alzheimer's, mental retardation, lymphoma, birth defects, fibromyalgia, and diabetes.

Aspartame is made up of three chemicals: aspartic acid, phenylalanine, and methanol. The book "Prescription for Nutritional Healing," by James and Phyllis Balch, lists aspartame under the category of "chemical poison."

[...]

I loooooooooove this tea! It is simply delicious; I have shared it with many friends, and it's always a hit. Anyone who loves ginger will love it. The Tulsi adds a wonderful depth to the flavour that seems to mix very well with the ginger (I have also ordered the Organic India Tulsi Jasmine tea and was very disappointed; the Tulsi tasted kind of odd... I got used to it, but it was far from 'delicious'.) If you like sweet things, add honey. Summary: Just Like From a Candy Store!
Text:
I was somewhat dubious when I ordered these sour belts as a Christmas gift for my (candy-addicted) younger brother, as I have repeatedly had my heart broken in the past by sour belts that were decidedly... UN-sour.

(Nothing is worse than craving the acidic, tangy *pop* of sour candy, only to have your taste buds duped by a too-sweet, sugary let-down of flavor.)

Well imagine my delight when these sour belts slapped my tongue with tartness like a cranky old granny at a Church luncheon! Just as sour as the ones you find at the mall candy shops, and incredibly convenient, as they come in large tubs.

Totally delicious and totally recommended.

Beware, though: Since there are so many belts in a single tub, you may find yourself over-indulging and burning yourself from an excess of the citric acid on these babies... If this happens, you'll be left with a raw, stinging tongue that may take a couple of days to heal. Granted, this only happens if you eat like, thirty-five in a single sitting, but still... it's possible. I speak from (shameful and disgusting) experience.

Still, when eaten in moderation, these are a great snack, a great replacement for love, a great way to gain weight, and a great way to spend your time!

Grab them by the fistful and shove them in your face!!!

Hi again,

I will just say, you will love these sour belts.

Take care
Very fresh you can not find the watermelon very often in the store.If you do they cost per pc 10 to 20 cents each. Love them <3

Don't get me wrong, I'm a huge Sour Power fan...

Peach, Strawberry, Strawberry Bananna, Green Apple, Blue Raspberry, I love them all.

But this is my first time trying the watermelon flavor...and it just has some major problems.

Or really, just one big problem.

The sour coating on the outside is classic Sour Power, which is great...but the belts themselves have a REALLY off putting plastic flavor that comes as a part of the watermelon flavoring. If you get it you'll know what I mean. None of the other Sour Power belts have this taste, it literally tastes like plastic and watermelon perfume compressed themselves into a belt and rolled in Sour Power powder.

I love Sour Power as much as everyone, but next time I buy a HUGE tub (probably quite soon), it'll be of any other flavor.

Summary: Not what I thought it was, but for my purposes it'll do.
Text:
Let me preface this by saying that this is NOT peppermint oil even though it comes up if you search on the phrase "peppermint oil".

I make peppermint bark every year for Xmas and I usually get peppermint oil for it because some non-oil based extracts can cause the melted chocolate to seize up. However, I had decided to make peppermint bark fudge this year so the fact that it's not oil isn't a big factor.

The flavour is quite strong and you won't have to use much to get a good peppermint flavour.

I highly recommend it as a flavouring, but if you're making chocolate candy and don't have much experience, I would suggest you find actual peppermint oil if you don't want to risk seizing.

I have had a hard time finding really good decaf.  (Or good at all for that matter, especially flavored.) I stumbled across this company while searching and tried them out a while ago and fell in love.  I cannot say enough about this company and the coffee.  Excellent customer service and the coffee is great.  I just keep coming back.  I highly recommend this company and their coffee.  The maple coffee is great.  I would recommend trying many flavors as I have found them to be excellent!!

I tried this after trying (and loving) the Tea's Etc Organic Coconut-Almond add-on. This is a very good tea. It's a little mild for my tastes, as I was expecting the tea and ginger to have bolder flavors. (I'm not astute enough about tea to know if this is a blend issue or a freshness issue. Given the strong aroma I suspect the former.) That said, I really do enjoy it and just find myself using a pinch more and letting it seep longer to achieved the desired outcome. The aroma is wonderful and I think this is a perfect afternoon tea. (Who doesn't feel more energized after getting a whiff of citrus?!). The fact that the flavor isn't overpowering also makes it a good choice for folks who want to ease into drinking green tea. I'll order this again, but it will be awhile. These "small" 3-oz packages last an impressively long time even with daily consumption!

Update 9//11/12: I paid $8.62 for this item. I see it's now selling for less than $2...

The coffee itself is mellow, not pungent like most espresso, but it still packs a decent kick. I definitely prefer it to the other locally available brands that are already ground (Bustelo and company.) My only complaints are that the ground seems a little coarse for espresso (although you wouldn't know it after brewing, the crema is excellent!), and that there isn't a whole bean version, which would be a very nice addition for espresso lovers. I also think that the Amazon page for this product could use a little more flair, it's a bit uninformative!

My mother had just gotten out of the hospital so I sent this to cheer her up and boy did it work.  She loved it!  She is a retired nurse so the doctor's kit was just the thing to put a smile on her face and the treats lifted her spirit.

Summary: Just What The Doctor Ordered - Get Well Gift Basket
Text: Great gift. Fast delivery. Quality product.

I ordered this for a custodian at the high school I teach at, she was still working while on the wait-list for a liver transplant.  It was so cute, and I knew it would really be a pick-me-up for her.  It was supposed to arrive in ten business days, but never came at all, not while she was still working, or even after she got worse and was home bound waiting.  I know this is true, because I didn't know her home address, so I told them to deliver it to the school....so I know it never came.  I have e-mailed the company several times, and they have never replied, although they still spam me with info on new items...as if I would ever order from them again.  Buyer beware - the company I bought mine from was a total rip-off!

I sent this to a sick friend and she really appreciated it(not that she would've told me if she hated it).  It's thoughtful, as any gift basket is, but also cute, and perfect for the get-well scenario.  Hey, if you're going to be sick, you might as well get presents, right?
Within a week..I recieved my order...food and snacks are fresh. Very good quality. Nothing stale. Great for gifts and it is worth it. My finance' loved it.

I really enjoyed this product. It was delicious. Even the candy floss came in good condition which was a suprise. They glue everything in place, which is a bit annoying when you are trying to take out an item and it breaks and sticks to everything, but at least it keeps everything in place during shipping. Overall an excellent product.

For $40.00 - $50.00 save your $$$

it's okay, but really take 5 minutes and go to your local CVS, Rite Aide, etc - and put something together.

It's just my opinion -
Nice and chunky with real peanut flavor. Use this in place of smooth peanut butter in your next batch of cookies. A real treat.
Very pleased with my Jif Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter.  This is great for baking Peanut Butter Cookies.  There are so many crisp and fresh peanuts in every cookie.  My family just loves baking day.

Jif Extra Crunchy Peanut butter is the best tasting buy far. We have tried many brands and have settled on this one as our favorite. We like the big chuncks of peanuts and just like to just eat it by the spoonfull as a snack. Yum!

JIF Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter 40 oz Jar (2 Pack) I got hooked on Jif decades ago. I have tried many others,but I still rate this tops. The only bad thing I can say about my last order, is that it arrived with one of the plastic jars, and its top broken. I think that is was dropped on the warehouse floor before boxing. I wanted the product NOW, so one was opened and enjoyed while one went into the trash. That ended up being the most expensive peanut butter ever bought. I just savored what I had.

I used this to make a sugar-free pie for a diabetic co-worker. I mixed it with ice water and non-fat powdered milk. It was low-fat and low-carb and everyone loved it.

I'm watching my calories so I previously had bought the Sans Sucre Chocolate Cheesecake Mousse. It was OK, but this is MUCH better.
I really like the cheese flavored, but usually end up throwing out the pretzel ones. It makes for an expensive snack, but the cheese ones are sooooooo good!
Cheddar and pretzel just go together. This bag of Goldfish is definitely the best of the Mix-Ups, and I truly think they're the best flavorway of the snack that I've probably tasted.

ProfileName: Jolly Green Giant "You can try Birchbox too! ...
Text:
This is my new favorite salad dressing. I went to an upscale Italian restaurant and fell in love with their homemade house dressing. In fact, I had to go there twice in a two day period just because I found myself craving the dressing.

I went to the grocery store in search of a a similar dressing and scored a home run with this one. I'm not sure if the restaurants house dressing was better, or this one, but this one is really good.

I like to marinate chicken in it, top a green salad with olives, tomato, and cucumbers, or even just drizzle it over a stuffed pita sandwich. I also like to finely dice carrots, cucumbers, green peppers, and tomatoes and top it with this dressing for a quick salad or healthy topping after marinating in the refrigerator for a couple of hours. It's also good for dipping grilled chicken breast strips.

The calories are low on this dressing at only 60 calories per serving. Unlike thick dressings like ranch or honey mustard, this one really does only require the suggested serving of two tablespoons since it's thinner and coats everything very well.

Diabetics will be glad to know there is only one gram of sugar per serving, and it also has no trans fats.

For an Italian salad dressing, this is my top pick.

These are good garbanzo beans.  Just your basic canned beans.  I ordered them from Amazon to have for summer salads and had them delivered to my door without having to haul them home from the supermarket.
When I cook a beef roast, I add several mixed packages of this brown gravy afterwards when I transfer the roast to a pyrex glass bowl, serve and keep leftover in fridge covered with blue lid.

So many soup and stew recipes I use call for bay leaves--they add such a subtle taste nuance. But I'm overwhelmed by the price for a small jar at the grocery store. I bought this .62 oz bottle online and saved a bundle without sacrificing quality. Thanx, Amazon and McCormick's!

Dassant Vanilla Scone Mix is the best scone mix I have ever used.......It is a basic mix and can be used by adding other ingredients, ie, raisins, choc chips, dried fruit----I like to top it with an almond drizzle-----it is always a winner---this product cannot be duplicated nor beaten---it is #1, in the scone department.

Gave these for gifts to three people recently and all three raved about how good and authentic these tasted and how nice the packaging was (gourmet looking apparently).  Haven't had any myself but got the suggestion from another friend who regularly puts a scone package, a coffee cup, a good paperback and some coffee beans in a gift bag.

I love this scone mix! My family is from the U.K. and I thought I would never find anything as good as mums scones...but now I have! I first purchased this at a henrys/sprouts (grocerie store) and then it was  no longer carried. So now I stock up here on amazon! Served these at a party and gave a box to each guest and everyone has said how EASY they are to make. Really splendid! I plan to buy them again!
Everything Dassant makes is delicious...in under 30 minutes you can make scones plain or with all kinds of fruit added.  Terrific hot out of the oven with a cup of coffee on a Saturday Morning.

I received a box of this mix for Christmas and just now made the scones, thinking, "um, scones?  I've never been overly impressed with them..."  I have to admit that these were absolutely delicious!  I'm not a baker but these were very easy to make, once I got the hang of flouring my work surface.  I ate two of the eight right out of the oven, and it was all I could do to save the rest for another breakfast.  Yum!

when I made these scones they have a hint of vanilla,my family really likes vanilla so i added an extra 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla flavoring,also made a slight "dent" in top of scone befor baking and added just a littles strawberry jam.the results were a mouth watering delious scone,very moist ,very good taste,will buy again.

Summary: like eating a slice of apple pie (minus the crust)....
Text: Okay, I'm exaggerating.  But, in all seriousness, this is a great snack product!  These little rectangular leather snacks are great.  "Wild Apple" has cinnamony undertones and just enough bite to make you purse your lips in joy.  You can taste the squeeze of lemon juice that they added for tanginess.....very nice.
Stretch Island makes the best fruit leathers ever!!All natural product with great flavors.  Quick shipping is a definite plus!
Mt Terriers love these and it's a good way for them to have a healthy snack.

Summary: One twin pack not 2!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Sold by J. Russo
Text:
From reading the title of the product I was under the impression it was 2 twin packs,
meaning 4 jars. It is not which makes this a horrible buy at $25. I have no issue with JIF it is a great peanut butter.
This product arrived on time and everything was intact. I highly recommend this merchant to anybody shopping at Amazon.Com
jif peanut taste great it has a good peanut taste to it i like a lot i use everyday of the week
Quick filler-up if your on the go when your in a hurry to be some where, just open, slab and eat... BAM!!

Both my wife and I like peanut butter! But like in most things we have a different opinion. I love the extra crunchy style while she likes the creamy style. They both have that great JifÂ® taste and they are a good source of protein and fiber. JifÂ® is the top brand out there and the make a very tasty product.

We like it on toast or crackers for a snack or for breakfast. We still even like PB&J sandwiches for a fast meal. If you like peanut butter, you'll love JifÂ®.

Love Jif Peanut Butter and placed an order through Amazon for the 2 48oz jars for $19.00 then visited my local Walmart and found 2 40oz jars for $9.24.  I like the concept of buying through Amazon with no shipping and no tax.  But I got taken on this order.
You can buy this product at costco for 6.00 and that will get you two 48 oz jars, you do the math 9.00 a jar or 3.00 ajar.  Duh 40oz or48oz
It is Jiff, what can I say?  What is great is that I can send this to an APO address for my contractor spouse in Afghanistan and satisfy his peanut butter cravings postage free!
Same exact product is available at Sams Club for $8.77. Wow! My Prime Membership is really paying off on this product...

Summary: It's Peanut Butter. It's 96 oz. It's delicious.
Text:
If you don't like peanut butter, then why are you even looking at this item?

Peanut Butter is delicious, and if you need 96 ounces of it at once, this is the best way to get it. Of course, I prefer Chunky, and maybe you do too, but if you need 96 ounces of Creamy peanut butter, you're at the right place.

I looked for 96 ounces elsewhere, and though I was able to locate it, I was not able to find it for a better price. Thanks to Amazon Prime, I got this 96 ounces of creamy peanut butter shipped to me in two days for free. Perfect for peanut butter shortage emergencies.

My mum and her brother absolutely love this peanut butter, and they have since gotten other family members hooked as well. So even tho you can get the same for cheaper, for me its worth the price when I'm letting them know I'm thinking of them when I'm so far away.

Personally I'm not a peanut butter fan, so I can not give any details in that area, but considering how quickly other family members get hooked I guess its pretty good flavor wise. The product ships quickly and I havent had any complaints about how it arrives :-)

Summary: Better than the box rice by far!
Text:
Whether or not it's right for you is up to you and your pediatrician to decide. We began adding it to our son's formula at 2 months because of health related issues. We currently use 1 scoop (scoop from Gerber formula can) of rice to 2 scoops of formula, and 4-5 oz of water. It mixes exceptionally well and is not "goopy" nor does it leave "rice-sludge" at the bottom of the bottle after feeding.
We love this, and buy it over the box cereal every time now. Even our daycare has commented on how much they like this over the traditional flakes of rice cereal. The can fits better in the pantry than the box, and is much cleaner since it isn't leaking flakes from the corners and the fold down spout. The cans stack easily, and are the same size and shape as Gerber's formula cans.
We initially purchased this from my wife's work, and when they ran out we switched back to box rice. It's cheaper from Amazon than it is at the local grocery stores. We're switching back to the can.

Pros
-It contains DHA to boost development.
-Dissolves better; its more of a powder than the flakes you get in the box of Gerber rice cereal.
-Because it dissolves better it is easier for the infant to drink, and easier to clean the bottle after feeding (large undissolved flakes don't clog the bottle).
-Packaging is much cleaner than the boxes of rice cereal available from Gerber.

Cons
-It's not Vegan (if you care, I don't, but some other posters obviously do).
-It does not come with a scoop. This is only a very minor inconvenience, as we, like the other poster, used the scoop from the can of Gerber formula that we use.

I highly recommend this product.

Summary: Oatmeal, so much better than the Rice Cereal
Text:
Very good deal when Subscribe and Save which we have delivered every 1-2 months.

Oatmeal DHA Cereal is not easy to find. Not available in most stores like Walmart, Walgreens, CVS, Target, etc. I don't know why they carry the DHA Rice, but not the DHA Oatmeal Cereal.

Oatmeal Cereal my son eats mixed with breast milk and has no constipation issues like he had with the Rice. He started this cereal at 4 months old. Now he's 11 months. Really enjoys eating this still.

The 8 ounce canisters are better packed than box cereal I've opened. I will definitely keep feeding him this.

This is a great additive to my daughters formula.  It keeps her filled up more than formula alone.  The can is very handy, only wish they had included a scoop.  I just use the scoop from the formula can and it works great too.  This is much easier to measure and a lot less messy than the box rice and oatmeal cereals!

My son loves this oatmeal, and we go through it so quickly that I'm glad to be able to order it in a pack of six canisters. I've previously bought this same product in boxes, and the canister design works so much better than the boxes. With the boxes, I always felt that I was having to throw away the last several tablespoons, because the packaging was so poorly designed. The canisters work well, and they can double as a cheap toy when the oatmeal is gone.

The taste seems to be good (though I often add some cinnamon for good measure), and I'm glad to know my son is getting DHA in his regular diet. Those with food allergy concerns should be aware that this product contains B Lactis cultures.

Plus:
- Good deal on the price and love the convenience of free delivery.
- Subscribe and Save saves money.
- Son ate it.
- Not always in stock at stores so online good buy.
- Like the 8 ounce size containers.

Minuses:
- Son gets constipated with the Rice cereal, the Oatmeal is much better.
- Uses to much breast milk when mixing together.
- If you mix by directions won't be the right consistency to feed baby.

I would buy one package first and see how your child reacts to the Rice before you buy the pack of 6 like I did.

Summary: Amazon, you guys did a very job.  I will always come back
Text: love the cereal and on our packages, we bought 5 cases and there was some issue with the expired date (only 3 months).  when i contact Amazon team they got our issue resolve in less then 3 hours.  GREAT JOB, Amazon.

Summary: Great Product, but hard to find.
Text: I love this oatmeal, and so do my kids, but recently its been harder to find.  Wal-mart in all their infinate wisdom removed it from their shelves at our local store when they did their last store makeover.  You can get it at Target, if they have it on the shelves.  Since I found it on Amazon I just buy it by the case.  My 1 and 2 year olds both love it for breakfast and I think its way better for them than regular oatmeal.  I hope amazon never stops carring it. :)

Of course, it is nice that this cereal is in a canister (so there is less mess), but I also love knowing my son is getting DHA. We used this cereal exclusively with my 2 1/2 year old when she was a baby.

Seriously, how does a baby cereal touted as a good choice as a first baby food contain these big NO-NO ingredients?! How can it be labeled as "single grain"? There's no reason "oat flour" should contain wheat... I bought this thinking I could avoid supplementing with probiotics & dha... should have read more closely before purchasing.. Forget it, I'm going back to simply grinding up my own oatmeal.. sick of over paying for 'baby' cereal anyways...

Summary: My daughter hasnt noticed a differ in taste.
Text: I feed it because I know its good for them. If they dont eat it due to taste it may be the texture. My daughter loves it and cant drink her bottle without it. We were forced to give her rice in her bottle because she has such had acid reflux but every since we changed her formula and gave her this she does great!

I use a small amount in my formula for my 8 week old son. He always woke up VERY VERY hungry and it really wares everyone down. So I did some research and tested it out and it worked!!!! 8-10 straight hours of sleep for everyone. You have to be very careful on how much you put in since it can cause constipation and make hard poops. Once we got the right nipples and measurements everything was a big relief! Also, don't use it for every feed. I only use it midday and that's it. I have no worries of him choking because it blends very well. I don't shake my formulas I use a chop stick and swirl it around till its blended completely, it really helps with reducing bubbles.

This is the first and only baby cereal that I have tried and I have no reason to try any other kind. My doctor recommended mixing baby apple juice with the cereal to make it taste better. My son after 2 days eats all the cereal in his bowl. Wonderful product and so nice that I can buy in bulk since we go through it so fast.
I believe it's good for my child. Though he does not like it very much, he still accept it. However I believe oat is a kind of good food.

I have been giving this rice cereal to my now 10 month old daughter since she was 6 months old! She loves it! She loves it plain. I did buy Happy Belly brown rice cereal but she doesn't like it. Also Gerber mixes really smooth, Happy Belly is very lumpy when mixed. I will be buying this again!
This is the first and only rice cereal I ever used(because I don't know any others),my baby like it never had any problem,Pls it has DHA and its oatmeal.
I have used this oatmeal with all three of my children and they love it. I am glad Amazon sells it because our local Walmart stopped carrying it. Thanks Amazon :)

I gave this to my baby thinking the DHA and probiotic aspects were a plus. In theory, they are.

We originally started with another brand's organic rice cereal. It listed only a few ingredients: Rice, Rice Bran Extract, Tocopherols (Vitamin E), alpha-Amylase (Enzyme), Electrolytic Iron. Gerber's DHA/Probiotic rice cereal has a very long ingredient list, I think because of all of the vitamins it is fortified with. Well, that is fine. Wish it were more basic, but ok.

My son loves "normal" rice cereal. With this DHA rice cereal, he will tolerate it, but he definitely noticed the difference. He kind of scrunches up his face. Today his made a gagging face and acted like he was going to throw it up. I don't know if that is because he doesn't like the weird flavor or what. I tasted it too, and I can't stand the fishy sense I get when I eat it. It isn't a strong or overpowering fishy flavor, but there is definitely a weird aftertaste going on. You can still notice it when you mix in fruit or sweet potatoes to try and cover it up.

I don't think I will finish the can we started. Back to the other brand for us. Bummer, Gerber. Wish they could use algae based DHA rather than Tuna oil.

I bought several case of it, thinking my little baby girl will like it. Nope, she does not like it mixed with water or milk. It does not mix well with soup. Since it has a mild sweet taste to it, it will ruin the flavor of the soup. She is picky, what can I say.

Finally, after many tries, we finally figured out a way to feed her the cereal: mix the cereal with formula/milk; pour into a pan and warm it up on the stove; while heating it up, stir constantly to ensure they are mixed together; once well mixed, let it cool and then pour into bottle to feed. I had to cut the silicone nipple in order to accommodate the thick liquid.

We feed her this mix once or twice daily. As she grows, formula/milk alone do not last as long as they used to. To keep her stomach content, night time feeding is essential, so she does not awake from hunger in the middle of the night. A bit of work, but I think it is worth it.
I switched from the box cereal to this particular kind thinking it was better and it made my son have diarrhea!!!!  I'm switching back to the box cereal.

Unfortunately, Gerber is using tuna oil as a source of DHA. This is very bad for the environment - tuna is severely over-fished and people should not really be eating tuna at all. They should switch to a plant- or algae-based source of DHA. Until then, I suggest that you avoid this product if you care about the environment. By the way, a fish-based source of DHA does have a higher chance of being contaminated by toxic chemicals like mercury. This is one of the reasons why people seeking higher DHA levels in their diet have switched to plant-based sources such as flaxseed oil.

My baby really did not like eating this. I got this for the DHA thinking it would be so refined it wouldn't taste fishy. Well, my son usually takes regular rice cereal fine. I fed him this and at first he would gag and most if it came right back out. I tasted it and holy crap is it gross. It definitely has essence of fish. I tried his other rice cereal before too. It was just bland, rice cereal. This was just disgusting. Although, it might not be the taste that's making him gag. This stuff has a seriously weird texture. It must be the gelatin. It was really frustrating to me to mix up. I'd get it to what I thought was a good consistency and a few minutes later it would turn into this runny mess, sort of like paste. Awful! I threw the rest of the can away and went back to the regular stuff.
As a previous reader commented this product does have gelatin in it.  I called and Gerber said the source of the gelatin is pork.

Summary: 6 month old vomits after eating this
Text: My sweet 6 month old might have food allergies - he's thrown this up about three times now (last time I'll try with this.) He's been exclusively breastfed until now, and I've introduced sweet potato, pears, applesauce, squash, carrots and mixed veggies with no drama. I've noticed that this ceral not only contains rice, but soy, tuna, and pork-based gelatin. Going to a pediatric allergist tomorrow to check out what's going on. Poor baby! Would love to hear if anyone else has a similar story.

This was the first container of rice cereal that our baby has tried. He took to it very well, and I thougth buying the DHA formula cereal was a smart choice for his development as opposed to the regular.

Unfortunately, I realized just as the container was almost gone (and I had already bought another container) that this product has tuna oil, as well as gelatin in it. It is the source of DHA. It's my fault for not reading the label more closely, but I really would have never guessed that a single grain baby cereal would have fish oil in it! The formula we use also had DHA, but it is algae-based. Just wondering why this has to be from a fish. Gross.

I bought these for my food stash in case of crisis so I can't rate how they taste. The shelf life was attractive and butter & cheese are harder to preserve so this was the alternative. The problem was that 3 of the 12 cans were dented...so they were shipped that way or poor packaging was involved. We all know dented cans are what we avoid at the grocery store...
Arrived in a vacuum pac foil pouch.  An excellant price at six bucks for one pound--much better than the grocery store.

Frontier product has always been reliable.  The bag of turmeric had a small tear in the side of the bag and the supplier put a piece of scotch tape over the tear to keep it from leaking, which I was a bit skeptic about.  All in all the turmeric is working well.  I am putting it in capsules and using it for pain.
Came exactly as described.  It's great that it's in a dark metallic bag, but a reseal zip-top type would have been a really good help.  Would absolutely buy from this seller again.

Summary: Cans instead of jars as advertised.
Text: The product was advertised as resealable jars but was actually cans. The slices were mushy/soft. Its difficult to store the product once the cans are opened. The product quality,in general, is poor.

the noodles are super al dente and bouncy, unlike any instant noodle I've ever had. Comes pretty close to real noodle soup actually. The soup base is similar to the original horuruk. Not the best ramyun I've ever had, but certainly not too shabby either.
Apparently there is a second version of this, as evidenced by the "2", as in "React 2".  The 2 version is pretty bad compared to the non-2 version, IMO.  5... what a horrible idea.

As of today January 26th 2012, the description says (pack of 20) this is incorrect. Currently the unit price comes down to 1.36 a pack. Probably more expensive than the local grocery stores value 3 pack of 2.99

Summary: Fabulous product at an incredible price.
Text:
Until I discovered this case product on Amazon, I had been buying the "Taste of Thai" brand coconut milk at my local grocery for more than $2 per can. This is just over $1 per can, which is amazing. The quality of the milk is equal to the more expensive brand and the nutrition information is comparable, meaning that it hasn't been watered down to produce more milk (some brand do this).
Cooked well and came out in a homogenized milk form rather than a clump of milk fat followed by coconut water. I am very pleased.
Since Amazon doesn't list the ingredients, here they are: coconut milk, water, sodium metabisulfite, polysorbate 60, sodium carboxymethylcellulose, and guar gum. That alone speaks volumes to me.

Not quite as thick and flavorful as regular coconut milk, but soooo much more healthy that it's worth it to me. With regular, I only want to use a little bit in recipes and make the recipes less frequently. With this lite, I feel free to indulge in those recipes that benefit from coconut milk.
Delivered as promised. It's coconut milk. I can't say it's any different that other types. I just liked that it was Lite and the price was right :)

I use this when cooking a variety of dishes like Thai curries.  I haven't tried the non-lite variety but I don't feel like I'm being deprived by this 'lite' product.  Easy to use and has a good flavor.

Summary: Not super thick, but thick for 'lite'...
Text: I tried a couple different brands; one being Thai Kitchen which is very, very thick (really good, but hard to get out of the can at times).  I wanted a lighter brand which would actually pour out of the can more easily.  I ordered this case and I am pleased with the taste (not as flavorful, but still very good)and thickness. I'll be stocked for a while...I may just give some to family.  I am quite happy with my purchase.  I have been using this in my coffee for a healthier change.

I ordered this product believing it was a good product at a great price.

The package arrived just now via UPS. The box had been torn open and was barely being held together at the bottom by a half removed strip of packing tape. Almost all of the cans were damaged, from a single dent to a can that was nearly crushed in two.

I and most consumers do not use dented cans of food or food products. I can't rate the quality of the product because I will not jeopardize my health and safety and that of my family by opening one and ingesting the contents.

The entire case is a total loss and as it is not accepted for returns I have to just kiss my money good bye.

I am disappointed with Amazon, it was packaged by Amazon in one of their boxes, and they won't allow me to recoup any of my loss.

I am out $27.10 and no one is liable. BUYER BEWARE!
Been using this product for over a year. Excellent. My cat thinks so too.

Best kind of dog food I've ever used - the only kind that my dogs can eat without having "allergies" i.e. itchy skin and coat.  Supreme!  Reccommended for anyone tryign to give their pet a longer, healthier life.

My Dalmatian mix has severe skin allergies. This food has helped reduce her problems by about 50%. Fewer visits to the vet and less scratching at home.

I have been using Wysong products for about 5 years. They make a quality product at a reasonable price.

This kibble has been the staple diet of my 80 lb Great Dane Mix (named Kobe) for the past year. He came to me two years ago from a rescue group who transports black dogs from the southern U.S, where black dogs have a very high kill rate, to the nortern U.S. to be adopted. He was about 5 yrs old at the time I adopted him, sight unseen, from Arkansas. Severe alleries were included among the miriad of issues that afflicted him. This manifested itself in runny eyes, full body skin yeast infection resulting in what the vet termed "elephant skin" on his abdomen, throat, elbows, and haunches. Also bald spots over his neck, throat, thighs, and toes from constant scratching and biting at himself. In many places the "elepant skin" was perpetually split/cracked, infected, and bleeding. After treating the bacterial and yeast infections with both topical and oral agents which did clear up the bacteria but left the yeast as a chronic secondary infection of the allergies, I searched for other remedies. Along with seasonal, environmental, and other allergies to dust, fabrics, vegitation, etc. I also found a lot of good information about food allergies.
Taking this information into consideration I scouted around for an "allergenic" kibble that was made by a company that has never had a recall, does not do animal testing, provides appropriate nutrition, and is somewhat affordable. Wysong seemed to fit the bill. Anergen has been a key part of Kobe's allergy treatment program for the past year. Along with "therapeutic baths", Ketokonazole lotions, hydrocortisone lotions, diligent laundering of doggie coats/bedding/linens (no wool), and oral antihistamines Kobe's skin is soft and smooth without splits/cracks/infection; his bald spots have shrunk to half the size; and his eyes only run occasionally. He still does scratch and bite at himself intermittently. I notice this usually happens when I deviate from the Anergen diet, giving him rawhide chews, beef bones with marrow, or cookies (organic) with mixed ingredients.
I don't really know what else, short of steroids, can be done to help him. I have avoided steroids due to their own detrimental health effects. Anergen seems to be the food solution to his allergies, which is a good thing! I add water to the kibble and let it sit about 10 minutes to form a kind of "gravy". He likes this better than the straight dry kibble and it also helps to keep him hydrated.
Note: My other dog, a 9yr old husky-shepard mix eats Wysong Maintenance and is strong and svelt; and the cats eat Wysong Uretic.

Okay, so my cat doesn't like this alone BUT when I mix it with her other food it stops her from overeating/eating too fast and vomiting her food.  I'm all for it because of that.  No more messes on the floor after she eats too fast.
Cat hates this as she will not even go near it.  I wish I did not buy 36lbs of this but oh well.

I have been using these herbs on everything.  They are especially flavorful on roasted veggies and meats. This is also a great value.  You get 8 oz. which, I am sure I would not even be able to use up in 1 year.

If it weren't for the expiration, this would get 5 stars. My one-year old daughter loves this food, and I love it because it's super convenient for on-the-go. Just make sure to check the expiration of the product when you get it no matter where you get it from. I received this on May 29 and it had expired Feb 26 this year.

Summary: nice healthy & organic alternative to applesauce
Text: my daughter loves squeeze applesauces, but I would like her to get more variety in her diet. These are great - she loves them just as much!
