I ordered this to try a varity of samples to see which flavors I would like, instead I get only 4 flavors there you'd be no more than two f a kind to get a good cross sampling of flavors.

I was very disappointed when I received the product(s).  The 35 K-cups were loose in the packaging box.  The product is described as a pack of 35. I am uncomfortable that the K-cups are not in a sealed box from the manufacturer.  How do I know these cups were not discarded leftovers from serveral variety packs?  I doubt I'll use the K-cups and there are no returns.  Buyer beware.

Although the title doesn't say it, the product description states multiple times that this product is 100% decaf. Of what I received, I counted 9 of the 35 to actually be decaf (25%). Looks like a nice selection of teas, but it's not all decaf. Buyer beware.

-------------

Update - 30 DEC: it appears that the product description has been updated.

i recieved a different flavor than what i ordered but tried it and it was terrible
i wished i returned it at the get go
only 12 more ugh bottles left
It is very difficult to find red pistachios in stores, so I was thrilled when I found them online.  They were fresh and delicious.

Summary: You have to be 'nuts' to not buy from Superior
Text: Since our local grocery stores no longer carry 'red' pistachios, I went on the internet to find them and fortunately, I discovered that Superior Nut Company has them available to purchase online.  I ordered the 5 pound bag and they arrived quickly, were very fresh, well packaged and yes, they were actually red.  We have been enjoying these and when they are close to being fully consumed, I will not hesitate to re-order from Superior.

Summary: Best Mint Bars on the Market
Text: Organic, dark chocolate and Fairly Traded -- what more could you ask for?  These are the best mint chocolates on the market -- the mint "crisps" are so much more fun than just plain old mint.  In my efforts to have a heatlhier lifestyle and diet, this is one treat I still allow without feeling any guilt!  Try these, you'll agree.  The only thing better would be to putthem on subscribe and save!!  Thanks Amazon.

Summary: Abi loves this! Uh the cat too.
Text: I had my dog on Nutro Nutro Natural Choice Lamb Meal & Rice Formula Small Bites Dog Food- net wt. 40 lbs.but after trying Kevin Trudeau's diet for myself I figured having a food that stopped her from pooping so much maybe wasn't a good idea for her. It gives her the same benefits as her previous diet, but without ruining her future health. She loves the dry and canned food and often has to protect it from the finicky cat.
yum I haven't had these for years, they were actually fresh and not old blow pops like some I have bought before. good price too
These are great in a salad. Great price (when I bought them). Would buy again.

Fructose is fructose. It's a simple sugar found in plants, both fruits and vegetables. Buying fructose is like buying salt. Brand names don't matter much. I'm sure there are conspiracy theories about fructose, but as an old woman I'm tired of hearing "The sky is falling! The sky is falling!" First it's "Don't eat butter." Then it's "Butter is good for you." Etc. Etc.

Getting away from health issues, I have to say that if you want to buy fructose, this Amazon item is a bargain. You get a LOT of fructose for the money. I think it's less expensive, pound for pound, that the fructose I get from Publix.

This product is what all should be using instead of the refined sugar that is everywhere. It's sweeter, you use less and it's easy to store and keep. The seller of this item got the package with 3 bags to me in record time and for that alone deserves 5 stars. Highly recommended to all

This product states on the label "Fructose FRUIT Sugar," but the fructose in this product is in fact not made from fruit; it is made from corn.  Corn is not a fruit product.  I think it is deceptive of NOW to label their fructose sugar as "Fructose Fruit Sugar" when it's not.

This review is intended to help buyers make an intelligent decision as to the reason for buying this product. I emailed Now Foods requesting information concerning the mercury content of their granulated fructose because I consume so much of it. Their response was "mercury is less than 400 parts per billion". For myself this is unacceptable because I eat fructose and mercury is poisonous. I wish they would bring it down to a reasonable level or better yet find a new way of distilling fructose that is as economical as the Castner-Kellner process.

I was a bit surprised by the previous review, the reviewer obviously didn't do their research. We highly recommend this product - we settled on this one after we lost two beloved dogs to the Chinese poison in dog food incident a few years ago. We did our research and found this to be the best available.

This is a very healthy base to which you add protein. Our two Aussies are thriving on this - it has been their main meal for over a year, and they are strong, active, and healthy due in part to the food we give them (we eat organic and healthy, and our dogs do too). It does smell like alfalfa, but even the most cursory examination reveals a great variety of good, organic foods.

Summary: Great Nutritious Product, But Need Other Ingredients
Text:
I usually use Only Natural Pet Easy Raw dehydrated food, however I wanted to try Honest Kitchen's brand just to see how it compared, it looked & smelled like a pile of mush grass. My dogs avoided it like the plague even my little girl who eats anything that is not nailed down. I was panicking thinking I just wasted a huge chunk of money on something my fur kids won't eat when the Mail
Man rang and my delayed shipment of Only Natural brand freeze-dried chicken & beef patties came. I was soooo happy!!!! I ripped open a bag of chicken, took a sniff, OMG it smelled so good!!! I quickly crumbled the patty into the pile of green mush and my dogs scarfed it down in 5 minutes. This food is so great & convenient. Since it is expensive, I'm going to use it as a flavor enhancer in combination with other raw foods. The Honest Kitchen food is very nutritious and easy to rehydrate. However, it needs to be enhanced or combined with other ingredients such as meats (beef,turkey,chicken,buffalo, etc). I also add fish oil for shiney coats and sometimes add a raw egg as well.

I have tried several of the premix bases for dog food. My dog is on a raw diet. When this bag of premix arrived, I was terribly disappointed. It was like receiving a bag of mulched grass. There was very little fruits or vegetables as claimed on the label. It smells like a bag of fresh cut hay. From the look and smell, it's almost all alfalfa. There are other premixed bases available that are much better. I am mixing it with other mixes to make it more appealing to my dog.
I drink multiple different flavors of Nuun all day long. This is a nice refreshing, not too sweet flavor. When I race and will only have water, I use this for a flavor change.

Length:: 1:25 Mins

These are unbelievably strong. I love blueberries. The taste is stunning and overpowering. My wife's eyes got really big on the first try and she exclaimed "wow, you can really taste the blueberries" (I didn't have to tell her it was supposed to be blueberry). After the first one, I am in deep fear of eating the whole bag in seconds, but due to the molasses and "natural flavor", they seem so overpoweringly sweet, so after 4 of them (about 35 calories total), I can't take another. This is good because it's a sweet that prevents me from wanting more.
This is for those who like things intense. you like things intense.

Ingredients:
===========
Molasses, wheat flour, blueberry puree, citric acid, natural flavor, licorice extract

No fat, 8.7 calories per piece, 10 grams per piece.

Serving size of 15 pieces (4 times more than I want to eat in 1 sitting):
130 calories: 21 g sugars out of 30 g carbs with 1 g protein.

Video Comments
=============
The video is a taste test with my 3 year old son. The first is Darrell Lea's strawberry (his least favorite), followed by Twizzler's strawberry, followed by Darrell Lea mango (not shown), then Panda's blueberry. My goal has been to find something that does not have Twizzler's Red-40. His little sister did not like them at all.

i have not had other panda flavors, but i do really like the blueberry licorice.  good ingredients such as molasses, wheat flour, blueberry puree to name a few.  like a good licorice, it's soft and chewy.  there's roughly about 40 pieces in a 6 oz bag.  although i usually don't like black licorice because of it's strong taste, the licorice flavor here is more subtle.  i highly enjoy and recommend this licorice treat for a quick snack.  it's good!
Great tasting licorice the best I have found on the market in this flavor.  And it is more healthy then regular licorice by far!!

First of all, let me start this review by stating just how much I love Panda Licorice. Period. They are the best brand of licorice, hands down, in my humble opinion. This particular breed of licorice - their new blueberry flavor - doesn't disappoint. You taste that beautiful blueberry puree, and it just makes you smile. I ordered the six pack in the baggie, and I am already halfway done with them, if that gives you a sense of just how much of a licorice fan I am. Yum.

I've enjoyed Zhena's teas in the past and decided it was economical to begin purchasing as loose leaf.  This has not disappointed the leaves are in good shape, minimal dust and the aroma is incredible.  Would highly recommend.
Slightly over powering for me do like to blend it with others and for the value you can't beat it.

ProfileName: MagnoliaSouth "As soon go kindle fire with sn...
Summary: Good, but too pricey at Amazon
Text:
My kids love this. It's cheap and tastes like chicken noodle soup. I could care less about the nutritional facts. Anyone can look that up online for themselves. Thing is, kids love it and it IS cheap. Great for budgets.

That said, watch that price! This very brand can be had at most local Walmart stores. I just bought a case, this very day, at Walmart for $1.82. One case contains 12 individual 3 oz. packages, so that's $0.15 per package.

Here Amazon says "24 count, 3 oz." and I have no idea what that means. I can only assume that they mean 24 individual 3 oz. packages. Today Amazon says it is $22.95 which means that each 3 oz. package is $0.96 per package. That is nearly 6 1/2 times the price at Walmart!!!!

I have used ONLY this Brand and This Roast Chicken Flavor Ramen Soup's As What I mainly do is brake up the Noodle's and add to Canned Soup's And make as directed, but add about 1 to 2 cup's more Water and the Flavor Packet. Makes the canned soup make a larger Pot, and is just wonderful with this ROAST Chicken Flavor packet.
Try this and I think you will really Enjoy!!!

ProfileName: Lonnie E. Holder "The Review's the Thing"
Summary: Chicken Noodle Soup with LOTS of Noodles
Text:
There was a time when we would buy chicken ramen because it was inexpensive. The flavor is very good and the soup has a lot of noodles compared to canned chicken noodle soup. This soup is reasonably easy to prepare, and begs to have a few extra vegetables thrown in. The soup is so simple that even an elementary school child should be able to prepare it.

While the soup is relatively low calorie (190 calories), as with many soups it does have a fair amount of salt, with 850 mg of sodium. If you eat few other foods with much salt, this soup could be a perfect balance.

Maruchan Chicken Ramen has been and continues to be a family favorite. The large quantity of noodles and tasty broth make it perfect for a lunch or dinner meal, especially when you are looking for something a little different.

Eight dollars a can for an item that normally sells for around four dollars a can is a total rip off. This product was available from Amazon a few months back, but hasn't been in inventory in recent months. Regardless, you can purchase at your local grocery for a little over $4 and on-line in quantity for under that. The price this vendor is attempting to charge is indicative of their lack of business ethics - and Amazon's as well, for letting this vendor do business through their site. The product is wonderful, the vendor is evidently a crook.
I guess when you go to bed dreaming about your next cup of coffee that means you really love it. That describes my relationship with Maxwell House International Coffee's Cafe Vienna.

Have always loved the product - great taste/not as sweet as all the other flavors....
HOWEVER, it did not go unnoticed that the 10 oz. can is now 9 0z. for the same price as the 10 oz. can........even though the actual can is the same size.....did they think we wouldn't notice??????

I have been drinking this coffee for over 25 years and still like it best. I was dismayed to find it no longer sold in food stores I frequent.

The postage is too high and am shopping around for a store still carrying this coffee.

Summary: The Product is Good... The Price Not So Good...
Text:
My wife loves this product and has enjoyed it for years. The product is
the only coffee I will drink as I am not a coffee drinker.

Having said this, the price it is offered at is NOT so good.

We have purchased it for under three dollars a tin and regularly
buy it, not on sale, for three twenty-eight a tin as of 12/2010.

I consider the previous reviewer's comments legitimate as I can
get a better deal at the local "Stuff Mart". It is a deal once it
gets below three dollars a tin.

My first experience with 3in1 San Mig Coffee was in Davao City Philippines. I dont drink much coffee but tried this at the hotel I was staying and found the taste to be a great satisfying morning drink. I brought some home and plan to introduce my employees to this quick and easy idea for those who have to have coffee in the mornings or throughout the day. Quick and easy and satisfying.
I'm very pleased with this purchase, my mother and my nephew love picking marshmallows from cereal. These taste just the same, and I loved the price. Thanks! :]

Since my husband and I met 16 years ago, there has been an ongoing struggle with the lucky charms... I hate the cereal and love the marshmallows and try and Ii might, when there was a box the house, I would invariably eat most of those sweet, crunchy, yummy marshmallows.  Now that there are kids in the picture, the problem has become more serious- they don't take my raids so well!  So I gave my mother-in-law a project (she loves projects).  She freeze dried a bag of mini marshmallows in her machine.  We thought it would be fast but it took 36 hours.  And they didn't taste quite right.  After all that my lovely husband said "did you look on Amazon?". Well, no I hadn't!  I found these (liked the individual bags to keep them fresh) and placed my order. A few days later I surprised everyone with this special dessert. Rave reviews all around. In fact, they are going in my favorite things holiday gifts!  Love them!
These marshmallows were great! They taste just like the ones out of a box of Lucky Charms. I add these every morning to my bowl of Lucky Charms!

Summary: Mmm..these are just like lucky charms!
Text: My husband is the one who found out about these and we just HAD to get them. It makes all of your cereals..well...magically delicious! It tastes just like the lucky charms marshmallows. They come in individual bags just like shown on the picture and they are all crunchy little marshmallows, no problems with them being stale here! We will be buying more when we run out.

Summary: Love Love Love!!!  WIll be ordering more soon!!!
Text: Loved these.  They got here undamagaed and are all about gone.  WIll be making another purchase soon! I was skeptical at first, but they do indeed taste exactly the same as the ones in the cereal.

Summary: great concept but gross 5 Minutes after opening them.
Text: They taste great when opened then 5 minutes later stale and stick together. Not as good as the ones in the cereal.
I'm not even a fan of Chocolate, but I love this and you can only find it in stores during the holidays.  So I had to get some.

I was so happy to find this tea available on the web. I was afraid that Dynasty had discontinued it.

When I lived in California, I just picked this tea up weekly, at the grocery store. A while back I moved to a very rural area of the Missouri Ozarks. Nobody carried this particular Dynasty tea, which has always been a favorite of mine.

I refused to use the last 2 bags I had... until my Amazon shipment arrived. Just in case I had a tea emergency. I cannot list any specific health benefits of this tea, I just know how it makes me feel. It makes me feel better, when I am coming down with something... and it cheers me up, when I am sad. The mild blend, and the soothing aroma, can be the best part of a very rough day. It is so good, I drink it ICED in the summer.

I did not buy from this seller, however. The $4.00 per box price is double what the retail selling price of the tea is... and the $6.00 shipping (FOR ONE BOX!!!) is more than what I paid to have a whole case shipped to me.

I purchased a full case of 12 boxes of 16 ct. teabags, for around $24. And I couldn't be happier. Please continue to sell this tea. It is GREAT!!! Sellers, please be reasonable with the prices and shipping.
The ingredients say oolong, jasmine and green teas but I always think there is a bit of sesame mixed in there, too.

Summary: This is not the tea I like in restaurants!
Text: This tea is ok, it's not bitter but it is so disappointing. I have been searching for a jasmine oolong that I had in a Japanese restaurnat that was so good. This tea is not it. You can't even really smell the jasmine in this tea. The tea I had at the restaurant was a golden color with a slightly sweet taste and aroma of Jasmine. I have bought so many teas trying to find it. The saleslady at the fancy tea shop assured me that this was the tea I have been looking for. NOT! Years ago, I had a manager that came from Japan and she took me to a restaurant which her family and friends frequented and I have not had tea like that since. HELP, I want to enjoy tea like that in my own home.
I didn't know you needed a special machine to make this frothy.  I does make a good instant coffee though.  I just poured it into an empty coffee creamer container to store it.

Yummy but NOT frothy... this is purposed for Latte Cafe machines usually at gas stations like QT/RaceTrack/etc.

Having purchased this previously at a Closeout Store, I was thrilled to see it on Amazon for a decent price. I use it like "brand name la-di-da" French Vanilla Instant Coffee Beverage that comes in those cute little rectangular tins for a higher price. Just as good and somewhat cheaper, depending on selling price (Amazon cheapest = 6.19 a bag). This size is equivalent to FOUR tins purchased at local stores. Those la-di-das on clearance cost about $2.50 EACH.

DIRECTIONS: Use 1.5 - 2.0 Tablespoons French Vanilla Instant Coffee Beverage Mix per 8ozs of Hot Water and Stir.
Psst, no matter how much or fast you stir, it will not be frothy :)

My husband does not drink coffee, but he will drink this.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000YVM5DA/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_title
I have tried other kinds of Cappuccino, and none of them have been as good.
I will buy this again and recommend it to friends.

My father a Holland native loves his Leyden cheese!! Every year we struggle to find a place to get it and ship for a reasonable rate. For the first time this year we went through amazon.com/ an excellent choice.  The vendor whom the cheese came from shipped promptly and the experience was more than satisfactory.  Especially pleasing since I ordered days before CHristmas and expected delivery after Christmas, but somehow it arrived on Christmas Eve.... fantastic service and great quality!!!

Summary: Excellent Product, Poor price and packaging options here
Text:
My daughter (toddler) Is allergic to dairy and soy. We tried goat's milk to no avail and have finally happily settled on Rice Dream Enriched Original. She loves it and Even I like the taste. It's a little sweet and she picked it right up after a year of breastfeeding. With the addition of a multivitamin each day, my pediatrician has approved it's use.

We purchase the 64 ounce size for $3.24 at a local store (about $0.05 an ounce.) I came online to look for a better price when purchasing in bulk. The price for these small 8 ounce containers is $0.16 per ounce and causes MUCH more packaging waste. I appreciate the convenience of having it in a small package for dining out, etc... but It's just as easy to take an insulated sippy cup and be more environmentally conscious.

The Rice Dream Website sells the 32 ounce size but their price is $0.10 an ounce, without shipping costs. Not much advantage to purchasing online so far. I was hoping that Amazon would have a decent cost on the larger sizes with free super saving shipping, because I could stop shopping at Wal-Mart entirely.

I have contacted Amazon to request that they carry the larger 64 ounce size in cases. The first time I called, the Customer Service Rep
s computer locked up and she requested that I call her back. The second time I called I was told to leave feedback on the product and that all feedback is read by Amazon and that it could make a difference and might increase the chance that the product would be carried in a larger size, due to demand.

Summary: Not gluten free.  Way to go Amazon, for making them list it.
Text:
Earlier this year, the FDA enacted a new rule forcing companies to take the gluten-free label from anything that has more than 20 ppm gluten. (I'm looking at you, Arrowhead Mills and Bob's Red Mill.)

However, you can be right at 20 ppm, which makes a lot of celiacs sick, and still label yourself, "gluten free". (The rule should have said, "less than 20 ppm", not "20 ppm or less".)

This is where Amazon is fantastic--they made the company list the gluten in this, so we know it's NOT gluten free. (I have yet to find a Hain's food product that was actually gluten free, although some of them are legally gluten free. Look for their name on the labels so you know what to avoid, even if they are hiding behind the federal law and they have labeled their products gf.)

Pacific Rice Milk and Whole Foods' store brands of rice milk are gluten free, though. Buy those instead.

Rice Dream has a light, refreshing taste. You can drink this alone unlike soy milk which only tastes good when combined with other foods like cereal.

The price here is outrageous though, especially for only 8oz containers.

Summary: Was a great product, now there are better alternatives.
Text:
I used Imagine Rice beverages for many years. I favored them for high quality ingredients, excellent flavor, reasonable price, and wide availability. I find milk and soy products cause digestive distress, rice beverages have no such effect, no cholesterol, very little fat, and taste great.

However, Imagine now uses the cheaper canola oil in their rice milk products. Canola oil contains erucic acid, a toxic chemical. The FDA has limited canola oil to no more than 2% erucic acid to protect our health, and do not allow it in infant formula. In additon, studies show the erucic acid it contains is toxic (see below). I have not been able to find any long term longitudinal controlled studies on humans to prove its safety as far as all the adversely affected organs.

Rice Dream has two Healthwise Rice beverage products, that use safflower oil and no canola oil, have half as much sugar, and include plant sterols that may lower serum cholesterol levels. Good Karma Whole Grains Ricemilk is organic and also canola and sugar free. It has a thicker, richer and creamier body and flavor, less watered down. The vanilla flavor is a delicious drink. Westsoy Rice Beverage has a similar consistency to Rice Dream with a little more body and milky flavor, and is canola free.

The same canola issue (as well as sugar) also applies to the Imagine frozen desert products.

Because there have been Internet rumors about Canola that are based on misinformation, I provide some citations of scientific papers and government publications below.

Studies on erucic acid in rats and piglets show heart lesions, decreased red blood cell count, and other tissue and organ damage. Erucic acid crosses the blood-brain barrier and is known to affect nerve cells. Check out this small sample of government and peer-reviewed medical journal articles documenting my statements, available online.

United States Legislation on Low Erucic Acid Rapeseed Oil, Federal Department of Agriculture, 1985, article 184.1555, sections 3 and 4.
Growth Rate, Lipid Composition, Metabolism and Myocardial Lesions of Rats Fed Rapeseed Oils J. K. G. Kramer et al., The Journal of Nutrition, 103 (12):1696-1708, December 1973.
Dietary factors affecting the incidence of dietary fat-induced myocardial lesions. Clandinin MT, Yamashiro S., J Nutr. 1982 Apr;112(4):825-828.
Nutritional characteristics and food uses of vegetable oils, R.O. Vles and J.J. Gottenbos; In: G. Robblen, R.K. Downey and A. Ashri, Editors, Oil crops of the world, McGraw Hill, New York, USA (1989), pp. 36-86.
ERUCIC ACID IN FOOD: A Toxicological Review and Risk Assessment, TECHNICAL REPORT SERIES NO. 21, FOOD STANDARDS AUSTRALIA NEW ZEALAND, June 2003.
Uptake and metabolism of plasma-derived erucic acid by rat brain, Mikhail Y. Golovko and Eric J. Murphy, The Journal of Lipid Research, 47, 1289-1297, June 2006.

If you like Rice Dream, try the Healthwise products that are much healthier!

update: Recent research shows that rice plants concentrate arsenic, which occurs naturally in the soil and also is left from past use of DDT and other pesticides. As a result the UK recently warned against feeding rice milk to children. This problem applies to brown and organic rice as well as white rice. I have switched to Pacific All Natural Hemp Non-Dairy Beverage.
Tiny boxes of rice milk averaging $1.00 a box. It also had a weird taste. I buy Rice Dream rice milk all of the time and we like it, but these tiny drink boxes taste weird. A total rip off.
The price for this item is three times what you would pay at the store.
I like Rice Dream. This, however, is too high a price for too small a container. Smaller containers waste more packaging materials per ounce of product too!

The switch to organic is a good step, but Rice Dream rice milk is chalky and too sugary - 23 grams of carbohydrates per serving!  That's close to the sugars in a soda.  A person could get a sugar high or go into sugar shock (if diabetic) with this level of sugar.  I finally stumbled upon unsweetened Almond Breeze vanilla which has 4 grams of carbs and So Delicious vanilla coconut milk which has 9 grams of carbs.  I still have half a dozen sugary rice milks that I'm watering down with homemade almond milk just to reduce the terrifying sugar level.  Unsweetened Almond Breeze tastes smooth and nutty, and regular so Delicious both tastes smooth and somewhat coconutty.  You can even mix the two and even add some rice milk, but rice milk alone is too high in sugars.

Rice milk isn't my favorite non-dairy milk, but I still occasionally drink it. It's a lot thinner than soy milk, so sometimes I like to cook with it. Unless you get non-sweetened, I feel like Rice Dream really adds too much sugar. It's hard to drink straight, sometimes I like to mix it with a non-sweetened variety. It might be good for sometime new to the non-dairy milk world.

You can get a better deal purchasing a carton from Walmart or an organic store (Roots) nearby.

I agree with the other reviewer. Amazon should carry the 64 ounce containers!!!

Wonderful product and great shelf life...love the small individual packets...I place two at a time in the fridge; when cold, they taste just like milk for cereal etc..I am lactose intolerant..perfect product..

I had to leave a review after reading some of the negative ones. I can't use soy or dairy so finding a milk substitute has been interesting. Many of the soy alternatives still list some soy in their ingredient list. This particular Rice Dream rice milk (organic, enriched, original) does not. Further, it is the closest to dairy milk that I have found and doesn't add it's own flavor to whatever you cook like almond (I like almond milk for some things) or hemp milks do. You certainly can live without the 8 ounce size but they sure are convenient. I do hope that Amazon gets this size back again.

Rice Dream is a great alternative to cow's milk. It is lactose free and has a great, somewhat sweet, and refreshing taste. My wife and I are addicted to it. It is also shelf safe and does not have to be refrigerated until opened. Rice Dream is perfect for travel, camping, and fishing trips.

Peter
Memphis, TN
I like the small containers because they do not need to be refrigerated which makes it easy to take along in the car.

I find these great for school lunches and on the go activities for my son who is allergic to dairy. Arrived quickly and was packaged well.  Pricing with Amazon came out a bit lower than what I find in local supermarkets.

Summary: Why don't they carry the 32 oz package?
Text: I drink Rice Dream rice milk every single day, but the 8 oz packages are too wasteful and expensive.

Summary: Love the enriched original rice, milk, not price/packaging
Text: We like this item, but wish that it was available in larger sizes, these are way too expensive......

so glad I found this product. I'm lactose intolerant, and regular milk grosses me out anyway. I've tried soy, but don't like the taste. This rice dream rice milk truly is a dream :) SO glad I found/tried it. Love it to eat with my wheaties.
I send a small Rice Dream box daily with my 5 year old to kindergarten.  Thanks for giving him and his allergies a safe alternative.
couldn't live without it - amazing - and they just came out with an unsweetened version which makes my life easier - doesn't get any better than this

As a mom of a child with dairy allergies, it's very hard to travel without this product. The small boxes are very convenient, and being that many times the original formula of this milk is hard to find, I'm assured that I have it available when we are out. Yes, a little pricey, but worth it.
This rice drink is healthy and delicious. A great dairy and soy alternative, this rice drink is great to drink by itself, to use in baking, and to use as a creamer in tea and coffee drinks.
Great product.  I use it at work for ceral.  Some reviewers mentioned that these tasted different from the larger size, but I do not notice that at all.

Summary: Not Gluten Free - Pacific Rice Milk is Gluten Free
Text: Thank you, Amazon for listing barley in Rice Dream's ingredients.  It is sad that Rice Dream does not list the barley on their packages.  My 15-month-old son has to be on a gluten free diet.  Rice Dream was sabotaging our efforts.  As a thank you to Amazon.com, I purchase cases of Pacific Rice milk from Amazon.  I also save money from purchasing it online than locally.  We have enjoyed Rice Dream for years but if you need to be on a gluten free diet, this is not the product for you.  Purchase Pacific Rice milk.

Not only is this tea good tasting, but it works great as a laxative.  I don't drink this tea every day, but only when I need to restore regularity when I travel.  I always bring a few convenient to pack tea bags with me when I expect to be out of town for more than a few days.

I bought this tea as a way of helping to regulate my system and perform a cleanse. Wow, this tea is gentle, and certainly does the trick. I highly recommend to anyone wanting to perform a cleanse, and enjoys the taste of chamomile tea.

This is an excellent tea, I use to use another brand but it caused my stomach to ache and have several loose bowel movement, with smooth move i have a normal soft free of pain move without the diarrhea and the stomach ache. This is a good product especially if you have hemorrhoids .
This extract has a very strong alcohol aroma, so much so that it is difficult to discern any pistachio flavor. You might as well use a liquer instead- you'd probably get a better flavor.

These are nice and at $28, a good value.  They taste yummy and are pretty satisfying.  They're vegan, preservative free, and have only a half gram of monounsaturated fat each.  My only issue is that the calories are a bit high and the nutrients a bit low.  Each (appx) 5x3" cracker is 70 calories and has only 2 grams of fiber.  Aside from phosphorous and magnesium (6 and 4% RDA respectively) the only health benefit is 2 grams each of protein and iron.  For a cracker, they are pretty filling but it's still easy to go through a LOT of calories in a short time.  With a thick, no-sugar spread a couple of these would probably suffice for a heavy breakfast or light lunch.

Summary: Fruit Crunch is better - in my opinion
Text: I've been a Ryvita fan for a number of years, and the Fruit Crunch version is my favorite. They are just sweet enough to satisfy my sweet tooth (and keep me from making a disasterous vending machine raid) and filling enough so that I can get by eating 1 or 2. I don't need any spreads or goop on the cracker....they are fine without. Anyway, I thought I'd try these Fruit & Seed Crunch crackers since amazon had a Friday promotion. The currants are much smaller and not even obvious vs larger pieces in the Fruit Crunch that add some pleasant chewiness. The seeds aren't plentiful...these taste more like a sweetened rye cracker. If given the choice, I'd still choose Fruit Crunch over Fruit & Seed Crunch.

Summary: Are these supposed to be blackened?
Text: Not what I expected, nothing like the illustration on the package.  I have enjoyed Ryvita products previously, but will not purchase this item again. Two seeds and one raisin per brick of corrugated meal do not make the pain of eating one of these worthwhile. Food should not break into shards and try to stab you. Also, the image suggests that the product is toasty golden.  No evidence given of fireblasted blowtorch charring. Tag suggestions: good god I can't feel the roof of my mouth.

My local store has not carried this flavor is years.
There is a subtle hint of sweetness which I cannot
compare to anything else available at my local
stores. I consider this a real treat and I'm glad
to have it available to me.

Summary: and our mice love it too
Text: Not only pretty tasty for humans but, after mice in our basement found their way inside a stored box, I discovered they are the ideal bait (in crushed form) for a humane mouse trap. Six and counting in two days.

These are awesome!! Whole grain, sweet, but not much sugar. So as a diabetic, I am happy, happy, happy.
A friend (not a diabetic) had one, then two, then three. He begged to buy a box from my secret stash as even in Seattle I can't seem to find a store that stocks them as regular merchandise. They are perfect to pack for a day trip, a late night snack, or any other time something crunchy seems appropriate. Yummmm!

Summary: At least you "feel" like you are eating something healthy
Text:
My first taste and I was disappointed. I and a daughter have gone through 4 boxes at this point and this is what I've found:

Taste is like those huge pillows of shredded wheat cereal pounded down into a hard, thick crackery crispbread. Not even close to the amount of seeds in the picture and maybe 1 or 2 currants per crispbread. The added brown sugar gives it the allusion of being sweetened with currants when they are so "absent" that the sweetness is definitely the sugar. I've found 1, possibly 2 currants per cracker. Needed at least a tiny bit of sodium as is lacking in taste. It's much more blackened..much...than the picture which I suppose hides the fact it has very few seeds.

It tastes best microwaved for about 15 to 20 seconds then covered with a thin layer of cream cheese. Doing this makes it a tasty treat. But then covering anything in cream cheese makes it a tasty treat. Not enough nutritional value and taste for me to purchase something so odd like this again, unfortunately.
Although these are yummy, I have guilt about the brown sugar in them. Not actually necessary, and they do have wheat flour whereas regular or multigrain Ryevita just has Rye flour in them.

Summary: Great snack food, took a chance and I am very happy I did.
Text:
What a find! these crackers, I mean crispbreads, are great. My boys love them as they have just enough fruit and nuts to add a more spalsh of flavor but not so much to overwhelm the taste buds.
We have already gone through two boxes, and that was in a week. I hope Amazon gets more of their flavors.

These crackers are quite unique. Interesting that they are called "Fruit and Seed Crunch," because the only fruit in the product is 14% currants, which adds a bit of a tang to the taste, nothing else. As a Vegan treat, these are quite satisfying. I smear some peanut butter on two; and that's breakfast.

Imported from Great Britain, these crackers are made with whole grain rye and wheat flour and then lightly dusted with pumpkin and sunflower seeds. Honestly, one of these things is quite filling. The fiber content is good, too.

As part of a healthy diet plan, these crackers are excellent. Substitute these for bread and see how you like it!
They make me think of what Styrofoam would taste like with seeds and raisins.  But I guess they are a good choice if you are desperate for a healthy snack.
absolute right choice for me! I feel so good with the texture of fiber and pure flavor from seed!
I love the product.  The case I received had short dates, Jan 2013.  Inquire before you order. I'm not sure how easy this would be to do.

This is an excellent choice for a morning meal or an afternoon snack. I was pleasantly surprised with the sweetness from the fruit in it. The best benefit is the fiber! Here is something that tastes great & you still get the nutrition.Ryvita Fruit and Seed Crunch Crispbreads, 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 10)

I love these! I actually don't care for any other flavors of crispbreads, but these make a really nice snack just on their own. I am not a health nut by any means, but these are a great alternative to reaching for typical sweets or snack foods when you need an afternoon snack.
These crackers are so good and good for you!  peanut butter is good on them too! With the sweet of the fruit and crunch it satisfies.
I was at my friend's house in Syracuse. I bought these crackers in Wegmans. I loved them, but Hannaford at home doesn't have them so ordered from Amazon. Now all my friends love 'em too!

Summary: The Taste is Not the Same
Text:
I don't know what the maker of this wonderful cracker has done to these crackers but the taste is not the same. It's not as good. When I take the first bite, it tastes bland. I believe they have eliminated the amount of currents they previous put in them. Ryvita Fruit and Seed Crunch Crispbreads, 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 10) They are still a wonderful source of fiber and you can still fill the sweet tooth void but there is something missing or "not enough of" which is lacking in the cracker.
Thank you.
Anita Shahda

Not sure why I can never find this flavor in the grocery stores (none!) RYVITA makes delicious crackers, but this one takes the prize. Spread creamy goat cheese or cream cheese on it and your in heaven.

Just sweet enough to be a snack and satisfying enough that I don't need to eat half the box to feel satisfied. No guilt here.

I'll definitely buy these again!

As a nutritionist and author,I was always looking for a quality cracker, one with fiber and flavor.  Ryvita Fruit Crunch is it! I've been recommending this cracker to my clients forever, and was shocked to learn that recently they were no longer carried in supermarkets.  Thank goodness for Amazon!  I bought a pack of ten boxes and have been giving them to my clients --and of course keeping some for myself.  Remember that two crackers is the equivalent of having a slice of bread when you have them with perhaps a cup of tomato soup, an ounce of cheese and a little salad for lunch or dinner.

Summary: Best damned fiber crackers in the supermarket
Text: Ryvita Fruit and Seed Crunch crispbreads are not too sweet but not so dry and dissicated that you want to smother it in peanut butter (although they taste great with PB!!!).  I eat these straight up as a snack at work or with a morning cup of coffee/tea.  Just the right amount of crunch and sweet.  Lots of fiber and lower in carbs than many others.  Can not beat these crunchy crackers.

I love this product and was thrilled to see if offered as a subscription.  It makes a great snack just by itself or a light meal with your favorite nut butter or cheese.  For those of you who use Weight Watcher points 2 crispbreads=1 very filling point

Summary: Looks NOTHING like the box picture!! No seeds or goodies on cracker!
Text:
I can't stand false advertising >:-(
The crackers are two mostly plain solid layers with stuff in between. I think there may be some seedy and fruity things inside, in between the layers...not really consistent fruit 'filling', but just randomly distributed small fruit/seed bits. Cracker tastes good when your bite happens to catch a fruit thing, but that happens like 3x per a cracker. (Each cracker is the size of a regular index card.)

Basically, CRACKERS ARE NOT SINGLE LAYER COVERED BY TONS OF SEEDS AND FRUIT BITS like you see in the picture!!! Don't expect that!

With that said, they weren't that bad. NOT sweet (unfortunately), and taste kinda fibery. Pretty regular dry healthy crackers. They are not filling, unless you tend to be filled up by index-card sizes of crispy dry whole wheat bread. But they may help curb your appetite for a short while?
I enjoyed them of cheese and honey on top :-) Yummy.

Summary:
- cracker= 2plain layers with very little fruit/seed bits in between
- feels healthy
- tastes okay.

I thought the addition of fruits & nuts would soften the cracker & not be as tough as most of all the other Ryvita "crispbreads", but ney!

They're crispbread for horses!

Summary: Hamster food in disguise!  No thanks
Text: Well... looks like hamster food, smells like hamster food, oh yeah and it TASTES like hamster food!  These crispbread crackers are nothing short of disgusting.  Health food does not mean that it needs to taste bad! I find nothing wrong with all-natural foods that actually taste good.  There are plenty of alternatives that offer whole grain and fiber and are much more flavorful.  The no sodium aspect is difficult to ignore but unless your tastebuds have suffered some sort of great catastophre than I warn you to look elsewhere for something more palatable...

You can get one pack (2count) at Kroger for .97 and at walmart for .94  and if you are signed up for coupons you get $1 off 3 or 4 packages. These are price slightly high. If you like convince of not leaving your home, then go for it.

So far I've purchased the flavors peas, carrots, butternut squash, pumpkin, and green beans.  My baby loves them all.  What's more is the convenience of purchasing them online and having them delivered in bulk to my home -- so easy!

Summary: This is 2x the price from the prices in Walgreens.
Text:
I was thinking of buying from here but then I thought of checking out the price in Walmart or Walgreens first.
Indeed, the price in Walgreens is half of the price here. As of this writing, the Amazon price is $10.69, while the Walgreens price is only $5.00 for a pack of 8.

please be care full with this as i just complained to gerber as i found black powder inside sweetpottato tubs that i got from BJs , just a word of caution as im yet to find out what it is from gerber .upon calling gerber they said it could be charcoal from overburnt product & they are saying " as far as seal is intact its safe" hellooo plz dont tell me charcoal or rust or whatever it might be found in a tub sealed can be safe? im now going to be carefull while giving it to my baby .. so please u also be just carefull to see if no black powder is in .. if so discard it .
These carrots are a great first food for baby. They are pretty watery so it's easy to mix them in with rice cereal to introduce vegetable flavors to baby.
This is great for your little one, no artificial flavors or additives. But I found out after buying the stage 1, that stage 2 is cheaper & you get more.
This is great for your little one, no artificial flavors or additives. But I found out after buying the stage 1, that stage 2 is cheaper & you get more.
This is great for your little one, no artificial flavors or additives. But I found out after buying the stage 1, that stage 2 is cheaper & you get more.
This is my 7-month old's favorite food right now. I think it tastes great as well. Gerber did a great job with this one!
My daughter loves this. It helped her get hooked onto solids. The price with Subscribe and Save is at par with Walmart.. so I believe as cheap as it gets.
Tastes great. My babies think it is desert.  I like that it is only squash and water, nothing added.

Summary: I don't like it only because Son won't eat it.
Text:
It tastes fine to me, but my son will take 1-3 spoonfuls then spits it out. Green beans and Spinach he can't keep down. Hot or Cold he doesn't like this.

I still try now and then hoping he'll change his mind. He's 11 months now since we started him at 5 months and still doesn't like this. He does like steamed green beans I cook, but not this.

I've mixed this with other foods is the only way to get him to eat some because I know its good for him.

Good price and value, but not worth it if your child won't eat it.

Summary: Lot of food for a little one
Text: I got 3 sets of food for my 6 month old to have some variety.  I didn't realize kids are on stage 1 foods for a very brief period so we had to mix these stage 1 foods in with stage 2 and 3 foods to use them. I'm sure these are great if you have multiple children, but for one child, these packs are too large to get more than one, but one box doesn't provide variety...
Came on time and is perfect, I miss the box but these are still cute.  Highly recommend for classroom or even office usage. I will probably order this again next year as well.

On my last trip to Costco, I picked up a 26-oz. bag of Wild Roots coastal berry blend trail mix. It consists of almonds and cashews along with dried blueberries, cranberries and yogurt chips, It's somewhat high in fat and calories, but it's good vegetable fat. The taste is quite excellent. It's a good product and my only gripe was that the nuts were a bit stale, although the product had an expiration date of Feb. 2013. Well, the Trail Mix was good enough that I bought a second bag at Costco and it was nice and fresh and quite excellent.

Gary Peterson
My husband loves these.... we were getting them from Costco but they are about an hour away so Amazon delivery is perfect.  These are addicting so watch out!
Perfect mix for me - lots of nuts and dried fruit.  I was buying it at Costco for under $9.00 but much as I really like it I hesitate to pay twice at much on line.

We actually get this from Costco, which is only about 10 min from home and less than 5 min from work for me.

It just helps to buy these at a much lower price at about $9.99
Delicious.  Just plain delicious.  Wish I could afford a pound.  Arrived promptly and well chilled.  On toast points with creme fraiche it is a perfect delectable snack.

Summary: do NOT drink unless you can pass out!
Text:
This stuff is incredible. I picked up a few bottles for my husband who's a big Marley fan and also happens to enjoy tea... Before he got to them, I had about half a bottle one afternoon while we were playing with our kids. I sat down on the couch and ended up taking a nap (which is something I never ever do). Guess I should have read the label first! I thought it would just relax me, not put me to sleep - so now I drink a half bottle before bed. Sounds cheesy, but it quiets my anxious mind. I sleep SO well with this tea and I wake up feeling happy and refreshed (not weighed down and grumpy as I usually am in the morning). Keep in mind, I'm a lightweight at 117lbs and 5'4.

NOTE: I found this at the store at 1.50/bottle... I'm really bummed that Amazon jacked up the price here.

Summary: I think Marley might be on to something guys...
Text: The flavoring is very good, not harsh at all and very easy to drink. However I can go down to my local grocery and get it at $1.50  a bottle, still making it much cheaper for a 12 pack there.

Summary: 12 pkg Marley's Mellow Mood Black Tea Peach Raspberry passion fruit
Text: I was given this by my daughter in law, and it works as I slept through the night, rare for me. Plus it is sweet nectar.  She bought it for me from a party store.  Your price is high in comparison to the party store.  1.79 a bottle vrs 2.60 per bottle when bought in a case of 12 for 31.19. I'm tempted to pay it, but will check out the local stores first.

I visited my mom in California over the holidays and she had some of this in her fridge. One night I decided to try it. Usually I get on the laptop and stay up for hours researching whatever might be on my mind...usually until 2 or 3 in the morning! While drinking this tea I fell asleep in the middle of my research before 10pm, before even finishing the bottle! I finally went to bed and had the best night's sleep. I woke up at 730ish and never felt so refreshed that early (I'm obviously not a morning person).

Unfortunately, the prices here are a bit high, and I don't think I can get these where I live. In my opinion, though, unless you can find them locally for cheaper, the $31 is still very much worth it!

Summary: Better than the best stuff on earth.
Text: the greatest tea ever. i actually am a distributor of this product the only one in so. cal but not being one sided. better than any prescription drug on the market. and better for you in the long term.

I have to get up at 4AM, and the longer the days get, the more difficult it is to fall asleep at a reasonable hour. Not with these wonderful tasting drinks! I am out cold within an hour. . . tops. I have tried Neuro, Zen Serenity, and now these, and these are the best by far (taste, effectiveness, etc.). I wake up feeling great; not like when you take a sleeping pill. Also, I ordered from Marely's (I assume this was a typo), and their customer service was SUPERB when I had a slight issue. As far as the price, a night's worth of sleep without taking a pharmaceutical drug, is worth every penny to me.

Summary: Both Tasty and a Great Sleep Aid
Text:
The only problem that I have with this item is that it does not in fact put you in a mellow mood. It knocks you out completely. Within an hour of drinking this, I have a really hard time staying awake. That's why I purchased it though, to relax and eventually help get me to sleep. I have also not noticed any side effects with my sleep, when drinking this multiple nights in a row and then stopping, like most sleep aids.

It is also really tasty. It holds up extremely well against any other fruit beverage. This may be a con though as constantly wanting to drink a beverage that knocks you out can't be good for your social or work life.

Summary: Love it! Black Tea preferred! Prepare to get sleepy though!
Text: I didn't know that this drink did more than just taste good the first time I drank it. I knocked out (fell asleep!) The taste is great, and we prefer the Black Tea over the green tea version. It is hard to find but we have found it at Sprouts Market and also some Shell Gas Stations. Check MMM's website for Store Locators. Walmart also sells it online but my local Sprouts store is cheaper than any online outlet so far. Good drink! Wish they also made the drink without the sleep effects.

Recently found Bob Marley's tea at a few select stores. It is very refreshing and has a nice clean taste to it. It is very relaxing but in no way put  me out. I can drink it any time of the day. I tried both the black tea and the green. The green one is the best and it is sweet but not too sweet. I thought I might be able to get a better deal on Amazon but doesn't come close to the $1.50 or $1.70 that I find them for.

Summary: been 2 months and still have not received the product
Text: Ordered the product in the middle of june and i have yet to receive the product despite contacting customer service

This is a delicious tea that will help you relax before sleep time. Unfortunately, it is hard to find; I did not find it in major retailers and grocers in my area and it's expensive to purchase on-line.

This is by far the best TASTING sleep drink I've had. In fact, I find myself frequently wishing they made a "non drowsy" formula so I could sip it during the day, it's really that good! However, if you're a full blown insomniac (such as myself) looking for 8 hours of sleep in a bottle, this may not be for you. It's great if you need to catch a long nap, like 3-4 hours, but if you're looking for a full night's sleep I recommend Neurosleep! A little pricier, but that will take you out for a good 7-8 hours.

I bought this from my local grocery store just to see what it was about. Looked cool, and I drank a few sips as the can said it might make you drowsy. I definitely felt a "head change" the first time i drank it, and immediately went for a red bull to balance out the effects. That night I was having trouble sleeping and was laying awake at 1:30am. I remembered I still had a can of this in the fridge and drank the whole thing.. Within 10 minutes I was out.

Just recently I bought this again in case I needed help sleeping (I sometimes have insomnia). I drank half a can and about an hour later (around 2:30pm) I was laying in bed taking a nap. I actually fell asleep on my back, which I NEVER do; always on my side or stomach.

Personally, I dont think it should be a "Bob Marley" product, as Mike Tyson would be more suitable - since it will knock you out cold.

Summary: bob marley really does help me sleep!
Text: 12 Pack of Marley's Mellow Mood - Black Tea Peach Raspberry Passion FruitI bought this on a whim, in a particularly bad walmart visit. I was really surprised that after a few sips I was really not so bothered as i thought. When I got home, I was reading the bottle, saw that it was quite natural ingredients, so since I never sleep for than 3-4 hrs. I bought a case at amazon. Have used it off and on all month especially when I was upset and not sleeping, the calming affect helps me get back to sleep. sandy in Central NY

Summary: Better than a sleeping pill until you become tolerant
Text:
This really knocks you out and gives you great sleep without feeling any hangover. It's amazing. (It's also quite tasty, kinda like Snapple only if you drink too much you turn into Rip Van Winkle.) A family member recommended it and I'm glad I tried it. I wish it wasn't so expensive and more available though. Often, Amazon is out of stock and nowhere else on their website is listed as a seller.

Update: I've noticed that since I started drinking this every once in a while when I have sleep issues, even if months have lapsed at a time, I've become more tolerant to the effects of the drink. (I found this, also, when I took Valerian pills directly. Valerian root is one of the ingredients.) So one bottle or two doesn't really put me to sleep anymore. This might just be me but I'd suggest not using it too often to avoid becoming tolerant. Just use it when you really need it...which I do but I tend to become tolerant to things very quickly. I wouldn't mind if the cost wasn't so exorbitant. Drinking two bottles a night can become pretty pricey if I'm having a week of insomnia. The thing is despite the price this does really beat the side effects of a lot of the sleep aids out there and trust me, I've tried A LOT of them. This is great for once in a while when your sleep schedule gets out of whack.

Also, I discovered that Walmart sells the drink for $20! And it ships free if you purchase more than $45 so it's worth going over to Walmart to get 3 cases at a time.

I got this cuz i like trying new drinks and im glad i read the label before drinking the whole bottle (it being 1pm)
I am so happy i found something that is "natural" that allows me to fall asleep. i suffer from insomnia and i had half a bottle and i just dozed off and slept though the night. such a great feeling. I went to the store the next day and bought a bunch of them.the Green tea isnt that great . but im not a fan of green tea. you should try it if you have trouble falling asleep!!

I've ordered this food before, and it's one of my dog's favorites.
This last shipment, however, contained many dented cans, which does not instill confidence.
I'd say about 20% were dented, though so far all the food has been fine. This is an observation about quality control more than it is a complaint, and I'll likely order again.
This was a terrific bargain.  This is also my dog Jax's favorite dog food and the purchase price was half what I usually spend.

Summary: Good to ship to elderly relatives
Text:
I live in California and have an elderly Aunt in Mississippi. She does not drive and has to depend on others for trips to the grocery store. The prices for things like Oatmeal may not always be competitive with places like Walmart or Costco, but ordering grocery items through amazon.com is a great way for me to help out my Aunt. I just talked to her on the phone while she dictated her shopping list.

Thank you for this service, amazon.com!

Summary: great way to start the day!
Text: This is a good way to start the day and this box will keep you going for almost two months.  Just add hot water and you're set.  It's quick and easy to prepare and very filling.  Plus, the variety pack will keep things interesting.

I purcahsed this oatmeal variety pack assuming I would receive the various flavors listed in the picture such as banana bread and cinnamon roll.

Nope.

I get a box with just 4 flavors including 13 packets of original. Who in God's names wants original quater oatmeal via packet? If you are going to deliver pain like that, then ad and description should state so accordingly.

Will not be making this mistake again.

Summary: May be able to find cheaper but a great deal non the less
Text: I needed some more oatmeal for breakfast and this hit the spot. I myself need more than just one packet and will typically use a plain and another flavor to use up the plain oatmeal. I don't know anyone that wants to eat plain oatmeal but that is my solution for the packs rather than throwing them away. Several people complain of the price but not having to deal with going to the store for it and the taxes of it more than makes up for any differences.

What is pictured and what you recieve is not the same!  The picture when I ordered had 6 or 7 different flavors pictured, one being banana, which is the main reason I ordered and I recieved only original flavors.  I will not recommend this seller and will never order from them again!

It's cheap. For about 18 bucks, you get 52 packets of oatmeals.
I usually take three packets of these each morning.

I like the large variety of oatmeal but less that a week after purchasing this on Amazon (with Amazon Prime) for $18.59 on March 20th, I went to Costco and found the same exact product for $9.39. Save your money and buy it somewhere else.

This is a quick breakfast and a great value.
I usually add a banana or other seasonal fruit along with milk or water

Amazing price compared to the grocery store and a great multi-pack mix. I like adding raisins and dried cranberries to mine, makes a great healthy breakfast. No surprises in this one, we all know what Quaker Oats are.

Summary: Too Expensive and not what I expected.
Text: The box I got is same as I can purchase from Costco but more than double the price, it's crazy.  I gave this a try cause I though this is different variety pack, No, it's just like you can get from Costco but more than double the price. save yourself some money.  This product needs detail information on what's inside.

Those little packets are wonderful for a quick low calorie weekday breakfast. My favorites are the cinnamon&spice, raisin&spice, and the apple. They are so easy to make and I usually have them after my exercise. With the exception of the warehouse stores (Sam's, Costco) it is extremely rare to see the 52 packet boxes.

When I ordered this product there were many more flavors listed such as "cinnamon roll" & "banana bread"....so this is why I ordered.  When it came in the mail it only had 4 flavors.  Cinnamon & Spice, Apples/Cinnamon, Maple Brown Sugar, & original.  I won't be purchasing this again on Amazon.

False advertisement here. The variety I received is not what I ordered. If you are out of a particular variety don't send a replacement unless you have contacted the customer for approval. I don't think I would order a bulk variety again. I'll order the individual flavors instead.

The Quaker Instant Oatmeal Variety Pack, 52 Packets offers four different flavors of oatmeal to kick start your day. My box contained 18 packs of Maple & Brown Sugar, 15 packs of Apple Cinnamon, 14 packs of Cinnamon Spice and 5 packs of Original. Overall this is a good selection of a product that I enjoy on almost a daily basis. The flavored oatmeal might be a little sweet for some people, so be careful using this product if you have Diabetes.

Please rate this review if you found it helpful.
This 52 pack of Quaker Assorted Oatmeal was ordered for a church food pantry. The product arrived quickly and in good condition. This is a great value and the church was happy.

Not much to say here - it's Quaker oatmeal, just in a bigger box than you'd get at the grocery store. My only problem is that there's plain in the box, but that's clearly visible, and I knew it when I bought it. I just wish they offered a big box without plain flavor.

Summary: It is under $10 at BJs and Costco
Text: Good product, but this price is beyond stupid.  It wouldn't cost this much if you bought 6 boxes of the 10 pack at walmart.
Tasty oatmeal start for the day. Cooked in the microwave while you get ready for work.

I got a 5lb bag of rolled oats from the farmer's market in Detroit.  Little did I know how hard it was to properly flavor blan oatmeal without adding 2lbs of sugar.  This solved my problem and makes my morning breakfast that much faster - boil, add, stir.  But why did they add like 6 packets of the plain stuff?  The cat won't even eat it.

I was shopping around for this same box of oatmeal and come to find out just before I was going to Hit buy that our neighborhood costco has the same box for only 9.99 so that makes this box here a rip off double the price.

I bought these after recently being diagnosed as type 2 diabetic.  Probably not the right thing I have found out. They are handy for a quick breakfast.  The taste is not all that great although the texture is much improved over the older product.  Have offered them to other people, but they are not really enthused over the prospect of eating what one called 'wallpaper paste'.  I'm going back to coffee and toast.

Summary: The Right Food to Wear, and a Tasty Way to Wear It
Text:
The stress of a tough year is starting to get to me. I've been puckered up so tight for so long, I'm afraid my puckerer may have frozen that way.

So I've been searching for inner peace -- and outer unpuckering -- in personal relaxation products. But expensive gadgets and doodads would just angry my blood up further, so I'm seeking Samadhi on a shoestring budget.

When my wife goes to a spa to relax, she always gets some kind of oatmeal facial scrub treatment. I don't know much about pampering, but I'm intimately familiar with a wide variety of hot breakfast cereals. If oatmeal on the face is relaxing, then I'd sure give it a try.

I heated several packets of the oatmeal in the microwave, per the cooking instructions, added a little milk and layered it onto my face. I'm not sure what's supposed to happen next in a 'professional' treatment, but in my bathroom, a lot of it just glooped off into the sink. The rest felt... well, like oatmeal on my face. Sticky. Warm. Lumpy, in a way that was less 'relaxing' and more 'get it off my face-y'.

The oatmeal did smell nice, and made me sort of hungry, but I don't think I relieved any stress by putting it on my face instead of IN my face. Maybe next time I'll try wearing it with eggs over easy, or a rasher of bacon. Bacon makes *everything* peaceful.

I bake a lot of bread and cake. This Xanthan Gum is a very fine powder product that emulsifies cakes without changing its color and taste. After using this Xanthan Gum in my bread and sponge cake, the pastries remain moist and fluffy longer.
This is a very good product and the cheapest price for a pound that I've seen.  I will be getting from them every time I need some.

Summary: Add body at little calorie cost
Text: I see this ingredient on product labels everywhere so I thought I'd check it out. I always liked thick shakes growing up so I thought it might be a way to make a sensible shake or smoothie with the body of a more indulgent drink. Guess what  -  it's amazing! It does the job to the nth degree. With the addition of about half a teaspoon you can make a fat free shake that almost refuses to pour out of the blender. I wouldn't reccommend any more than half a teaspoon to start because you can always add more liquid. I did that and wound up with a full blender full of drink and it was still almost too thick to pour. It's also very popular in salad dressings because it adds body and cling. Home made ice cream is another natural. Try it and discover your own uses.

Summary: A little goes a long way
Text: A must for low carb foodies!  I've used it in baking, making low carb ice cream (which gives the ice cream a real "mouth" feel) and thickening sauces without the use of flour or corn starch.  Amazon has the best price on it, too.

I bought this because I was looking for a lower cost alternative to the $12 small bags of Red Mill Xantham gum I had been using to make gluten free bread. I was trying to lower the total cost per loaf, otherwise I might as well buy the loaves in the frozed section which are pretty good. I had already figured out a means to cheaply combine my own flour ingredients so I wouldn't need to purchase the expensive Red Mill gluten free flour. Next, I located on Amazon a great bulk deal on bakers yeast that also added to cost reduction (and was superior in result too.) After buying this Xanthan gum, I further reduced the price per loaf significantly. I have found this product works well and have not noticed any difference in quality of my results with my bread. So, I am very happy to have found this alternative at a more reasonable price. I also like the zip lock bag it comes in which is much more handy for baking and easy handling than the Red Mill bag.

Summary: I use this as a thickener in y lotions and creams
Text: Works like a dream.  This and Guar Gum are the only thickeners I use. This gives my lotions a nice, spreadable quality that makes my lotions feel moist with out being wet or greasy.  Be careful, if you use too much it will clump and leave a slimy feel.  Excellent product.  "Xanthan Gum! WOW!"  Anyone get that reference? :)~

Summary: An excellent product for an excellent price.
Text: I was a bit apprehensive about straying from the familiar Bob's Red Mill brand of gums, but I'm perfectly happy with this product. There's no discernible difference between this and the much-more-expensive BRM brand, so if you know you'll be using xanthan gum often, this is what you'll want to buy. I use some every day and have barely made a dent in my supply!

I do a lot of gluten free baking and this is such a great deal.  Fresh, effective,and saves us money.  I've purchased this xanthan gum three different times now and the quality and price cannot be beat.
This came well packaged and I found that this gives my yeast breads a longer shelf-life and far moister end product. If you love gooshy white bread, this is THE trick to making it super moist!

Summary: great food additive with other uses
Text: This is a great deal for Xanthan gum. I used some of this as a thickening agent during cooking with great results. The re-sealable bag keeps the product good for quite a while (possibly years if you refridgerate it) and I found no observable difference between this brand and other more expensive ones. A little xanthan gum goes a long way and this 1LB bag should last you quite a while.

Summary: a little goes a long way
Text: Just restocked after being out for a long time.  I'd forgotten that you need so much less than cornstarch if you are substituting.  Maybe 1/4 as much?  Clumps less than cornstarch as well.
I use Xanthan Gum for my home made lotions, creams and serums to name a few and it works perfectly! You need just a little and that will go a LONG WAY! This will last me forever!

I grind my own grain and make all of our bread.  I have LITTLE kids and traditional home made bread is pretty coarse and difficult for them to chew, so I tweeked my recipe and added this to my dough to make a lighter textured bread.  This is pretty pricey in the stores here so finding it on Amazon has been a great budget saver.  The quality is great and the packaging convient for storage.

I used this in my Gluten Free baking and it works great!  For St. Patty's day I made my niece Gluten Free Irish Soda Bread using Gluten Free A P Flour, adding 2 teaspoons per cup of flour used and it came out tasting just like the regular bread.  Like I said, it works great, thank you for such a wonderful product, I will be doing a lot more Gluten Free baking.

We have to do a bunch of gluten free baking for my family.  This is the second time I have purchased this exact product.  I was disappointed to see that the cost went up 5$ since last year, but it's still about 7-8$ then purchasing at local retail shops.  This lasted us about 1 year using it for our baked goods.
A little goes a long way. Think baby steps when using, if you aren't using a recipe. I made fruit smoothies, with or without ice.

Ordering through Amazon is the easiest, safest way to order online. I received my order quickly and have never had a problem with an order being shipped incomplete. I order gluten-free products online because the deals are much better than anything found in the local grocery stores. Xanthan gum is costly enough, but you can buy it for less online. The product was fresh, sealed well and performed as expected.
Makes my gluten free breads and desserts the absolute best! My bread seems to be nice and tender--not gummy and gluey. Thanks Essential Depot for a great product.
I looked around for some a decent price on this stuff. This was the best I could find. It arrived quickly and was just as expected.

I was reluctant to purchase Xanthan Gum, thinking it was too expensive, and frankly, it was a foreign ingredient that I had never used before.  To my absolute delight, I found Xanthan Gum to be an indispensible ingredient in gluten free baking!  It is easy to use, and will last a long time in your pantry.  As any Celiac's patient (or person with gluten sensitivity) will tell you, it's wonderful to bake a Gluten free birthday cake from scratch, with the confidence that everyone will want to eat it!

Summary: exactly what I wanted - great value
Text: This is a great product at a great price.  It arrived on time and was packaged well.  I will purchase more when I need it.
Since you are looking into purchasing xanthan gum I assume you know what it does. It acts like it should, and the resealable pouch is very nice.
I have just started using Xanthan Gum in my protein smoothies! A little goes a long way, but the texture of my shakes are now so think and creamy.

Summary: Yes yes! Lovely texture and high quality
Text:
I bought this along with Sunbeam 2591 350-Watt MixMaster, Black to make some bread and cakes.

I wasn't too impressed with the mixer but this Xanthan Gum is incredible stuff for the price.

It thickens up nicely and gives a great texture.

I will be coming back for more.
I have used this product all year without any problems (For gluten free baking).  Works great and best price I've found.

This product will cause SEVERE GI distress; even when used in very small amounts.  The gas pains and resulting diarrhea is not worth what it adds to the food product.  I bought it to make home made ice cream smoother.....  forget it!  I'd rather eat ice crystals than go through what my husband and I went through with just 1 tsp. in a quart of mix.  I looked it up on line and this is one of the MAIN side effects and says someone "may" tolerate after using for 30 days!  Why would one want to?  Even though the label says it is "food grade", the food service that used this product would soon be out of business.
Love this and I use in a differnt way my husband can't swallow driniks well and this is a good thicken for that and so much cheater

Summary: a new variation on curry powder
Text: ....Use it when you want something a little less tumeric-bright. One stop spicing if you're making a tanjine too. All the moroccan spices I ordered were surprisingly different from each other. So feel free to experiment.

I purchased a chi poo last week and this is what they had him on. The first bag 6 6lb was $9.99
I purchased another bag while he was being groomed 4 days later this store is 13 miles away so I figured it would be a good idea to grab another bag. Granted nothing in this store is priced for the consumer.Imagine my surprise when I checked my receipt to find I was charged $17.99 plus TAX for the same item i purchased 4 days prior at the same pet store for almost $8.00 LESS. There are only three places I can purchase this. At the pet store or online and the costs are outrageous to say the least. I have found other brands of holistic food at Pet Smart about the same Price. You're paying for the name. Same with IAMS and all the rest. Just how much better is this stuff ? I'm not sure. I know this dog evacuates a lot within minutes after eating it !

I shop on Amazon all the time and I was stunned to see this listed at $89.00 for 6 lbs bag marked down to $13 but then they soak ya for shipping which is bringing the total up to $20 for a 6 lb bag. I've seen 25 lb bags for that price. Glad I checked. Think it's time for a food change for this pup !

I first bought this cereal at the HEB grocery store and it's priced between $4 and $5 for 1 box. It taste pretty good. Amazon currently sells it for about $3.95 a box, if you opt for subscribe & save. It's crunchy and takes longer to sog, which is what I like. I don't like Nature's Path Flax Plus Multibran Cereal or Heritage Flakes (not sure which one I tried). It gets soggy too quickly.

And if you're curious about the expiration date, all 6 boxes (arrived 2 days ago) are dated for December 2012.

I never smoked,and have all my taste buds intact. This cereal is less sweet then corn flakes or wheaties by a long shot. They really have a multi grain flavor. One thing to note on these boxes,the serving size is small and there are not very many servings per. I suggest buying the bags if you like to eat ,"A real bowl" not a cup of cereal. It's far more cost effective. I'd give this cereal five stars if all the ingredients came from North America. The cane juice and rice bran flour are from South America.

Nature's Path organic multigrain oatbran flake cereal is a great tasting product and it's very nutritious and friendly to the diet (i.e., very low fat, low sodium, good protein, high fiber content (at least 5 grams by my standard), and low sugar). I've been consuming it for a long time.
Great cereal, always seen in my cupboard. Amazon pricing most fair keeps me coming back.

Summary: I used to like it but they made it too sweet now
Text: This used to be my favorite cereal. It had fiber, good taste and texture but in the past year or two they started making it sweeter and sweeter. I don't like sweetened cereal. At least with an unsweetened cereal I can choose to make it sweeter myself. But if it is too sweet out of the box there is no choice to make it less sweet. I contacted the company and told them I didn't like how sweet they had made it now. They denied that they had changed anything. They lost me as a customer after that. I was buying 6 boxes a month for almost 2 years straight. I stopped. I waited a few months and decided to try again to see if they had changed their recipe back the way it used to be. I just opened a new box and it is still sickening sweet for my tastes. Goodbye Nature's Path. If I wanted super sweetened sugar cereal that is what I would have bought! Anybody want free 6 boxes? You can have it!!! Yuck!

ProfileName: J. H. Minde "Everything I need is right here"
Text:
Do you like ginger? Are you aware of it's health-giving qualities? Ginger has been shown to settle the digestion, to act as an anti-inflammatory, and may even shrink tumors and inhibit cancer cells. I've seen this specific product recommended in various articles on Naturopathic health. It TASTES healthy. It tastes great, too.

Ginger Beer (as opposed to Ginger Ale) is loaded with ginger. And it's rarely more loaded with ginger than here in REED'S EXTRA GINGER BREW---At 26 grams per bottle, you can practically SEE the ginger in it. It has a lot of ginger "bite."

Unlike the soft drink megacorporations which produce a tasteless and overly fizzy sugar water they label as "Ginger Ale", Reed's microbrews it's soft drinks in a process similar to that used by a beer microbrewery. There is no alcohol in REED'S EXTRA GINGER BREW. 25% of REED's EXTRA is fruit juice, part of which contributes to the sugar content, which is comparable to other sodas. REED'S should be a treat, not a substitute for water.

REED'S GINGER BREW comes in three varieties, ORIGINAL, PREMIUM, and EXTRA. The amount of ginger increases with each variety (It's a little odd that PREMIUM has less ginger than EXTRA). The labels are similar so check carefully to decide which variety you want.

Summary: Oh, My! A Fine Soft Drink!
Text:
I've had "ginger ale" as a soft drink off and on throughout my life, both the regular and the diet varieties. It was okay. Then I spotted Reed's Extra Ginger Brew (all natural Jamaican Ginger Beer) in my local Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market. What is this, I wondered? Well, looked it over and decided I just had to try it. Oh, my! It was good! Really good! It was so superior to the "ginger ales" I've had that there was just no comparison. And this drink tasted like real ginger and it was good and strong! Boy, this is a fine soft drink. A bottle has just about the same calories as regular soda and I note 37 grams of sugar. I'm going to have to watch it. This stuff goes down so easy!

Gary Peterson

Summary: It's good, but not the best
Text: I like this. Sometimes I even love it, like - when it's a furnace outside and the ginger beer is ice cold. But it's not the best I've had. If you want a very gingery beer, try The Ginger People. They infuse their beer with real pieces of ginger - ginger that you can see. Fever-Tree offers a nice, refreshing ginger beer as well.

Summary: Can't get enough of this ginger beer!
