I bought this as a gift for my rich bitchy grandma. And she loved it. She said the cheese and crackers were great the thing was to damn cute I wished i would have gotten myself one. I bought a bunch of hickory farms stuff for my other family this was the only thing that everyone thanked me on. It's good for one or two people.
My wife and I has been drinking folger half and half for some time now. We enjoy the great taste. I shop between amazon and walmart for out coffee.

This is a great tasting product that also came in a very appreciated packagin. I do thank you guys. I will order more when I am running out. No biggie. You all hae a good day. Later.

G.
It's almost doubled since I last ordered it last month. The coffee is great, always our favorite. But I can get it locally for less than $10.00 a can, on sale for $5.99. Doesnt' seem right.
This is a delicious sauce that my entire family loves.  We can't get enough of it.
This is a delicious product.I have made roasted barley tea from scratch.This is much easier and same delicious taste.I will buy this product again.Nice packaging and large quantity.

I absolutely adore this tea, especially in the summer.  It is very refreshing and caffine free.  This is a nice large package to get you through the season since 1 bag makes about a gallon of ice tea.  The service and shipping was fast...but I didn't get a free pack of Meiji Mini Candy with my order of 2 bags.

I love mugicha and am disappointed that it's so hard to find.  It's great for our kids too -- a healthful alternative to sugary drinks.  My  former Japanese teacher said children and pregnant women in Japan drink it all the time.

Summary: boricha in Korea, Mugicha in Japan, any way you spell it, is refreshing
Text:
The idea of boiling grain to make a tea never occurred to me. Surprisingly in Seoul, many restaurants serve barley tea, called bori-cha as their standard free beverage. Most of my Korean colleagues love it. It is a kind of cultural icon. Growing up with Honey nut Cheerios, I assumed that barley needs honey, so I added honey to my barley tea and it is to die for. My Korean colleagues consider this sacrilege, but I still recommend it.

Barley tea is also popular in Japan and Ecuador. Apparently, we are behind in the discovery of this wonderful tea.

The taste of barley tea is a bit like regular tea, say Lipton, but softer. Most importantly for me, this tea is healthy and natural. I don't drink coffee, black or green tea for health and personal reasons. Tea made from barley is healthy, refreshing and enjoyable. You must try some.
This tea was a disappointment. The tea had a weak barley flavor no matter how many tea bags were used. I do not believe this tea was very fresh. I will try another variety.

I spent last summer in Japan, and recently found myself missing the refreshing taste of barley tea. The tea tastes exactly as I remembered. I dropped a single bag in a liter of water and left it in the fridge for two hours, and there was my tea.

The smell of the tea bags pre-tea is a bit offputting, but it's well worth putting up with for the tea.

Also, the bags are not for individual cups, but for pots or pitchers. This is what I wanted, but make sure you aren't expecting smaller tea-bags made for individual cups.

Also, good deal for the price in my opinion.

Mugicha is so delicious, especially when ice cold.  It really quenches thirst and has a nice, slightly astringent flavor.  It was the first thing I consumed when I first went to Asia, specifically Korea.  I drank it a lot in Japan too.  The Japanese drink it mostly in the summer but I like it year round.  Enjoy a glass today.  Oh, and it is so simple to make, just put a bag in a big jug and add cold water and put in the fridge, it is ready in 2 hours.  So easy!

First, this product is overpriced on Amazon... you can easily get this much cheaper at an oriental grocery store in most areas.

Second, I found this tea to be good but it was just ok. I prefer buying roasted barley seeds from an oriental grocery store and making the tea that way. I wanted to try the tea bags for their convenience as the aforementioned method is not as convenient. However, the taste difference between making it the real way and using convenient tea bags is notable enough that I would not use this particular brand of tea bags (note: other vendors sell the tea bags will the barley seeds but too expensive).

Conclusion:
1. For convenience, it is a great product. However, for great barley tea, try doing it the real way with roasted barley seeds... the seeds are cheap (more characteristic of the Korean way)!
2. Buy from an oriental store if one is available in your area to save money - not Amazon!
3. Anyway you cut it, barley tea is a great tea!

I really enjoy the natural decaf property of barley tea. I normally use whole barley at home but needed bags for the office. I had brought some back from China on my last trip that I could not find in the US, so I tried this brand. These large bags are actually for a teapot, not a cup as I expected. As mentioned, the flavor was not full-bodied and so I will keep searching.

I first began using the roasted barley to make a beverage almost thirty years ago while learning Hapkido. It is good for the heart, stabilizes the pancreas, and works as a fat emulsifier. It goes well with roasted corn to make an even more healthful drink. I would suggest buying it from a local Korean, Chinese or Japanese market. I just got 4  bags of roasted corn and the roasted barley for less than $9. Then you can either brew it whole on the stove, or grind it and brew it in a French Press. Both ways work well. Adding sugar or honey diminishes some of the health benefits. In spring and summer I have it at room temperature. If it is cold outside I drink it warm. Either way is great. Try 4 tablespoons to a quart of water.

I had a craving for this while I was pregnant, and ate it almost every day. Th flavor is excellent, and true to the directions, it only takes 12 minutes to make. Use a nonstick pan, and keep it on a full boil just like it says. Worth every penny! You won't be dissapointed!

The label says that you can make this risotto in 12 minutes. It took me about 35, and there was still a bit more liquid than I would like; I finally decided to just let it sit on the cooling burner to absorb the last bit of liquid.

The flavor, however, is excellent. Cheesy, but not overpoweringly so. I'd definitely order it again.
I love this product, and everyone must too, because the prices are going up. I now use it sparingly. More for a treat. That is what I ask for Christmas every year. I hope I get it this yr. 8)
If you want to pay a lot for sugar, then buy this box of sugar. No Kiwi was hurt in the production of this so called Kiwi Smoothie, because it does have any Kiwi in it.
I LOVE THIS CHUNKY VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP BECAUSE IT IS GREAT TASTE. I LIKE THIS SOUP. I ENJOY EAT IT.

I would say it's a good sugar, with a nice vanilla smell. However, I have doubts about the freshness of this product, because the label was blotted. The sugar was not humid, though. But again, the label words being fuzzy made me think they have been keeping the sugar in the deposit for quite a long time.

Summary: wouldn't buy again, did not taste fresh
Text: The title says it all. The aftertaste tastes stale and not so vanilla-y.  There was a big sugar clump in the jar which made me think moisture got in there at some point.

My 3 dogs love this food. I mix it with a small amount of dry dog food that is also very healthy (no grains). All three push their bowls around the kitchen floor licking up every small bit they have left and then lick the other dogs bowls just to make sure they haven't missed anything. A very healthy food and if it looks that good to you, you could eat some too. It's made in a facility that also makes "human" food so it wouldn't hurt you if you were very hungry and had nothing else to eat.

ProfileName: Writer of Books - Mage - Mom to Two "Writer, ...
Summary: The perfect Hoisin sauce! Great in stir fry for sure!
Text:
I just used my new wok to make a stir fry, and took a gamble on this Hoisin. I usually use one from an Asian foods store. WOW, What have I been missing all this time!!?! Dynasty brand is so much better, deeper, and well...less weird than the type I was using. I didn't even know what I was using was that bad, I enjoyed it until I tried Dynasty. Now I'll never go back.

It has that earthy, rich flavor that you can never quite identify when you go to a Chinese restaurant. I used to think I just needed to add more soy sauce to make my stir fry or beef and broccoli taste like it does when I get takeout. No. It's the hoisin!! You don't need much, but this will bring out that depth and richness you want in a sauce, thick or thin, to really taste wonderful.

Personally, I used a bag of frozen stir-fry veggies (I know, life is short, frozen is okay sometimes!) and a handful of shrimp and a block of tofu cut up. I added about 1/3 c soy sauce (kikkoman, of course!!) and a dash, probably a 1/4 teaspoon or so of Dynasty Hoisin, mixed well and DANG! That was so good!!! If you like a lot of sauce you could totally double or triple it, adding hoisin to taste. I also added about 1/8th teaspoon oyster sauce, another one of those "Why is this beef and broccoli so good??" items, but you could leave that out. Also, you could add cashews and sub chicken for shrimp and make cashew chicken! Yum! Enjoy!

Summary: We need to get an MRI brain on the people who rated this 5stars!  STAT!
Text: Ok.  I've been making a lot of Vietnamese spring rolls at home with peanut sauce; they're surprisingly really easy, but I need a lot of Hoisin to make the peanut sauce.  Ran out of real Hoisin Sauce, and because I didn't have the time to go to the local Asian market, I took a chance with Dynasty (got it at Wal-mart).  The best thing I can say about the Dynasty Hoisin Sauce is that it's a small bottle, so I didn't feel too bad throwing it in the trash.  IT IS REALLY BAD!  There's no way anyone who likes to eat yummy food could possibly rate this sauce over 1 star.  I would give it negative stars if I could because I find it offensive to eat food that tastes so wrong.  I'm completely baffled by the 5 star reviews.  TIA?  Stroke?  Alzheimer's?  Tumor?  There's got to be a reason beyond just not knowing any better.  In my humble opinion, Koon Chun hoisin is the gold standard.

Summary: Good product at a good price
Text: Hard to find Hoisin Sauce at my local supermarkets here in this small town. This is a good product at a good price. Hard to believe that Amazon can sell and ship these for just over $10...but they did!  Packaged really well.  Use this for creating that authentic Chinese BBQ food taste for ribs and pork.
The souce is ok.It smells good but it is quite spicy.I am not sure if Hoisin sauce is hot to begin with but I soo didnt expect it

Frankly, I could eat the whole box myself. These are a winner. Not as sweet as human cookies and full of wonderful flavor, tender crunchy. I approve!

ProfileName: Kathleen Leatherbury "Love and God Bless, Kathy"
Text: Every morning she has to have one. If I gave her one all day, I'd be buying these every week. She plays with it. It's so cute. I throw it down the hall, she goes running after it, then jumps all around it. I used to chase her like to try and get it from her, but she got too impatient for that. Don't get me wrong, these pistachios are fantastic.  Though, it's something that I've never thought of... but these nuts are not salted.  Antep pistachios are great, but when you take away the salt, they're just not as addictive.  I'm still going to eat them, I just won't horde them all to myself like I used to. I purchased these pistachios as a present for my husband.  he loves Turkish pistachios and we can't get them here in rural Maine. These nuts are fresh and exactly what he wanted. The price per pound works out the best I could find.

I like this cereal over all the other ones out there, so I gave it 5 stars. You pick up the box and can just tell it has more substance to it. A lot of cereals show plenty of fruit and nuts on the picture on the outside of the box, but then the actual cereal has very litte. This Quaker cereal is different and I hope they don't cheapen it over time like the others are doing.
But $21 for a 56 ounce box???? Are they out of their mind??!! One 28 oz box cost $4.50 in the grocery store, so 56 oz would cost $9. Where do they get off charging $12 more is a mystery to me. Unless I'm reading this incorrectly, and they are selling several 56 oz boxes for $21.

UPDATE 9/1/2012: I see they have reduced the price from $21 to $11.24. But it's still not $9 like it would be at the store, and what would shipping add to it?
excellent salame - it is a luxury product that will make you throw rocks at ordinary dry salami.  I will order it for my next special occaision.

This salami is not what I am used to when I buy Genoa salami.  Too much fat, great lumps of fat in the meat which I took out one at a time before eating what was left.  Very greasy.  Threw it all away in disgust.  Would not recommend to my friends.

Summary: A Great Product if the price is righ
Text:
Finn Crisp Multigrain are very tasty very thin "crackers" each 1 5/8 x 4 3/4. Finn Crisp are wonderful with melted cheese (about 20 seconds in a microwave). They can be used anyway you'd use crackers, with the benefit that they are less fragile, less likely to spontaneous disintegrate with the first bite---so Finn Crisp are actually better than crackers for dips and spreads and such. In fact, a very tasty, very healthy snack (if you aren't counting every calorie) is simply a thin layer of mayo on a Finn Crisp.

I suppose Finn Crisp are healthy, a good source of fiber, with minimal processing, no preservatives, and such. However, Finn Crisp are simply my favorite crackers.

OTHER VARIETIES
Multigrain Finn Crisp have a mild neutral flavor, excellent with very delicate cheese. Finn Crips original has a slightly sour flavor, like (unseeded) rye, pumpernickle or sour dough bread. Finn Crisp Original, Delicately Thin Rye Crispbread, 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 9) If you like the flavor of seeded rye bread (i.e., with caraway seeds) try the Caraway version (my favorate). Finn Crisp Caraway Thin Rye Crispbread with Caraway, 6.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 9)

PRICE
$26 for a pack of 9 (or $21 if you sign up for a periodic shipment subscription) direct from Amazon is a fair price. However, when Amazon is out-of-stock, I've seen the price as high as $42, which is excessive.

Recommendation: After major grocery shopping expeditions, sit down at your computer with your reciept, and check if you can buy any of the non-perishables through Amazon. When you find items (even if more expensive than you just paid), put the item on your Amazon wish list, and add a note to the wish list of the price you just paid. Check your wish list frequently, and when you see an item you need at a bargain price, buy it.

After having gastric bypass, I find that I really miss the "crunch" of crackers. After looking for a good whole grain cracker with low or no sugar, and low in carbs, I stumbled across this cracker and decided to try it. I AM SOLD!! This cracker is just what the right cracker. Its made of all healthy ingredients, all good grains. Yes it has carbs, but they are healthy carbs and only 10 grams for 2 crackers, which are good size cracker. I will eat 2 or 3 crackers with cheese or tuna, or sometimes peanut butter (for the protein) and I am full.

I took the package to my doctor, and he said it was a good healthy cracker. Its great for anyone with diabetes too!!I now order them by the case from amazon. I am glad to find this cracker and its now the only one I will eat.

I always loved the Finn Crisp Rye w/o Caraway Seeds, but I had to order the Multigrain b/c they were out of the rye ones. Now I've got some of the rye again and I realize--I love the Multigrain! Maybe they changed the recipe for the rye ones--they're almost like sawdust when you chew them. The Multigrain ones are so yummy--you can just grab a couple and munch on them for a snack. They have a very slightly sweet taste, like whole grain products often do, but they go well with everything. My favorite thing to top them with is plain cream cheese with salt and pepper. If you like healthy foods and want an easy way to be good to your diet, buy these!
A healthy snack option.Such as great taste!You should definitely have the courage to try it.I'm eating one while writing this...

I have known and enjoyed Finn Cisp for almost three decades, because I was able to buy it in Germany. I now live in AZ and was not able to buy it here.
I was so glad to learn that I could order through Amazon.com. I love the product because of its taste and it's low calory and fat content. My whole family and many of our friends love it too. I now order it through Amazon's subscription thereby taking advantage of lower prices and free shipping.Finn Crisp Multigrain Thin Crisp, 6.2 Oz Boxes (Pack of 9)

The wholegrain rye with caraway taste great. These were served at the Finn Embassy in D.C. at recent open house and they are great eaten plain or with a bit of topping. Also try with quark, sardines or salmon.

I've been sipping cups of it and just can't get enough of it. It is very flavorful, easy to dissolve, and has a pure, natural taste. It is fantastic - I highly recommend it!

Every kitchen needs some Marigold Bouillon Powder.  I chose the reduced-salt product and I was a bit skeptical that I would be able to use 6 containers, but that's how they were packaged.  Now that I've tried it, there's no question I'll use them all and be reordering very soon.

Summary: Please carry the Low Sodium Version
Text: This bouillon is great and VHTF. I love the low sodium version. Please add it to your inventory. Thank  you.

Summary: Liked the bouilon, did not like the sell-by date
Text:
The boullion has a great flavor, albeit salty. It is saltier than other vegetable boullions that I have used (Repunzel is my favorite).

I was very disappointed that the sell-by date on my six-pack is April 2012 (purchased January 2012). I suspect that this product has been sittting on the shelf for many months unless it has an end-date that is only a few months from the manufacture date.

While I understand that I will still be able to use the boullion after April, as reviewers of other products have noted sometimes Amazon's food items are not fresh. Sigh - one of the perils of purchasing perishible items on-line.

I subtracted one star for excessive saltiness and one for the closeness to the sell-by date.

Summary: i really wanted to like it
