Many people, including myself grew up on this soup. It was one of the few vegetables I looked forward to as a kid. This is my favorite vegetable soup, and I pretty much judge all others against it. Unfortunately, it has become increasingly difficult to find this product in my area. In fact, I can't find it at all. It was refreshing to stumble across it here on Amazon. I had not previously purchased more than one bag at a time when I wanted it. But after ordering it in bulk, I found a few other uses for it.

Normal Use- This soup is great just by itself. Add water and you are good to go. But it is best if you add your own touch to it. I suppose each family has their own way of using it. I like to add stew meat (as per the instructions), and also a little extra carrot, celery, potatoes that I have on hand. You could pretty much add any vegetable, or even some canned tomato product to make it just how you like it. It's an awesome launch pad for perfect vegetable beef soup.

Camping- It is a great camping food to take along. Take along some frozen stew meat, a carrot, a potato, etc. Brown the meat in a dutch oven over some coals, throw in the sliced vegetables and let it simmer for an hour. Your friends will be amazed wondering how you made such a great soup without a bunch of vegetables, and spices. It's super easy and fills you up with some tasty warm nutritious food on chilly nights.

Prepping/Food Storage- This is a shelf stable food that lasts a very long time just sitting in the pantry. It is also easy to use by just adding water. Perfect for emergencies, or times when you may be unable to get to the store. If you can simmer water, you can have a satisfying meal for the whole family with this stuff.

Potlucks- I hate those times when at the last minute I remember I have a potluck to do at work the following day. No problem. Get the large crockpot out of the cupboard. Cook it however you like it that night, then store in the fridge. Throw it in the crock pot the next day an hour or so before the time. Just add some paper bowls, bag of oyster shaped crackers, and plastic spoons and you'll be bringing home an empty crockpot.

This really is a very versatile great tasting soup. Perfect item to have on hand!!!

Have used the Mrs Grass soup mix for several years, preferring it over other dry mix soup bases because it does not contain rice, which most others seem to include.  We slow cook the soup, adding stew meat and other fresh vegetables to enhance the flavor and nutrional value.  It is very easy to customize the ingredients to suite your own personal preferences.  Left overs are easily refridgerated and can be used by simply reheating.

I have used both the Beef and chicken soup mixes from Mrs Grass for years to make a nutritious home made soup. When Walmart stopped carrying it for sale I looked on the 'net to see where I could get it. Amazon has been great to deal with on getting it in bulk packages of 8.

My way of making it involves adding 12 cups water, fresh garlic, onions, sliced carrots, celery and beef from either leftover roast/steak or inexpensive beef steak browned (leftover chicken in the chicken soup mix). I also add one can of diced tomatoes with a couple of beef bouillon cubes. In order to have the best taste it needs to simmer on the stove for at least 3 hours.

This will make enough to feed a lot of people or by freezing the remains, Dinner for 1 for many nights (3 for me, I am a big eater). Very economical

We love this soup, but it is hard to find in stores. When I saw this item on Amazon for the good price, plus free shipping , just had to get it. We eat a lot of it in the cold months. We cook groundbeef, then add everything in the pouch, and it is wonderful and tasty.

Summary: Exceptional Soup Mix NOT Available Elsewhere
Text: Can't find this great soup mix anywhere in the Nashville area at any store. So glad Amazon has it and I will buy it again! Highly recommended! A wonderful mix you just add meat to if that is your desire.
The flavor of the soup starter is great and tha seasonings and bits of vegetables are a wonderful addition to the dish. My family including 3 teenage grandsons love " my soup".

This soup mix has been sold in stores for many years. When I recently went to the store to buy more, I found it was no longer available. In checking online, I found the soup mix on Amazon. The mix is great - add stew meat, any vegetables, mushrooms, diced tomatoes - whatever you want to add. For two people you get 6 1/2 good tasting meals out of one package. We freeze the leftovers in individual containers. Very economical and good tasting!

We have been using this product for years.Not only can you make soups with it ,but you can use it as stew starter,dip seasoning or just use as a shake on seasoning. Mrs. Grass also has a fine assortment of other great mixes.

My local grocers stopped carrying all soup mixes with dehydrated veggies. I like dehydrated veggies. I prefer the Bear Creek soup mix but noticed that Mrs. Grass, which I like also, was much cheaper. It arrived promptly in a really big box. I have eaten all of them. I will probably order again.
This is a great tasting product. Cannot find it in major supermarkets anymore. Happy to find it online. Highly recommend it.
Loved this product,but sorry to say it can only be bought on line. I use it as a base and add some veggies and beef. It makes a harty meal.

I love these soup mixes. They're not as good as homemade, of course, but they're still very good. I usually add a variety of things to mine like additional veggies, etc.

I highly recommend these for a quick and hearty supper solution!

Summary: Hearty and Good "Mrs. Grass's Homestyle Beef Vegetable Soup Mix"
Text: For anyone who loves home made vegetable beef soup this is a must for flavoring.  YOU add the potatoes, celery, peas, corn, onions, and all the  wholesome vegetables you prefer along with  very lean stewing beef. Add some tomato sauce to the water and then add the amazing flavor of Mrs. Grass's homestyle beef vegetable soup mix and you had have a gourmet soup that was easy to prepare and wonderful to eat.  The aroma will fill your home with memories of times past.  You will experience a great feeling of  home and family as it simmers in the pan. This is not an "exotic" mix, but rather a down home flavor that your whole family will enjoy.

Easy to make and a filling soup. It is hard to find in any stores in my area so am very happy Amazon has the mix for sale. I can eat the soup even though I am on Weight Watchers! If you want, you can add extra noodles and carrots when extra company arrives! Short time to cook. Love the soup!

I was so thrilled to find this soup at a decent price. I look in every grocery and department store I go in but haven't been able to find it for a couple of years. I'm not sure why it is so hard to find because according to the reviews it is a much-loved product. Initially Amazon said it would take 8-10 weeks to ship but as soon as the order was placed they bumped that up & I received it in about a week. We are so happy to have our soup in the house for the winter!

I love this soup; it's perfect with warm bread and a salad for a cozy meal on blustery days.  I usually brown beef and add tomatoes and leftover vegetables to the mix and just let it simmer in my crock pot....easy and delicious.
I can't find this in stores around Los Angeles, so I seeked the help of Amazon. Huge success... Totally awesome.
wish this product wasn't so hard to find.  makes the best soups ever.  always taste homemade....
This is one of our favorite soup mix, but unfortunately it's becoming very hard to find in the grocery stores. Great price, fast dilivery.
Love this stuff.  Been using it for many years.  Only soup mix that tastes good in my book.
easy to make and has a great taste.  I have used this for over 2 years.

The product is great!!!!!!!My kids are all grown and have families of their own. I shared it with them and they all loved it too.Purchased it directly from Amazon because it's hard to find in the store.

I'm not ashamed to admit that I love soup mixes. I know that making home made soup is easy, and even fun if you have the time. But nothing beats a mix that can be dumped into a pot with some browned beef, or any other optional ingredient you favor, and have it be ready and delicious in 20 minutes or less. Mrs. Grass is a very good mix compared to a lot of the ones more easily available in the stores. It taste a little more like home made to me. And believe me I haves tried all of them available in the stores. The only reason I refer to it as second best if because I also buy the Bear Creek veggie beef soup mix also available on Amazon, (link enclosed). I have to give the nod here to Bear Creek for just being a little spicier, and in my opinion having just a tad better beef broth. I still highly recommend Mrs. Grass for it is much better than the store bought mixes, and besides, you may like your soup a little on the lighter side. Still very tasty, and very worth it... Recommended. Bear Creek Country Kitchens Vegetable Beef Soup Mix, 9-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)

i have been using this beef soup mix for years. absolutely delicious. best out there and becoming increasingly harder to find. i bought 8 so i will not be driving alllll over town looking for it. grab it...so easy to make and i always add barley,corn and jalapeno's to it. YUMMY!!! please never discontinue!!!!

Thoughts of great soup on cold days went out the window when we could no longer find this product in our stores.  We tried others, and nothing compared.  As always, Amazon comes through and we are happy campers again.
I buy this soup in grocery stores for $2.99 per package. Here the cost is $4.24 per package.

Summary: Interesting Variation From My Ordinary Chili Sauce.
Text:
I spotted this Mae Ploy sweet Chili Sauce (12-ounce bottle) in the international section of a local grocery store. It's imported from Thailand. I use regular chili sauce in a variety of ways and I love to try variants such as this. Into the shopping cart it went. Well, my, oh my, this stuf is excellent. It's both sweet and somewhat hot and has a nice variety of spicy flavors dominated by pickled red chili. So far, I've used it on eggs and small frozen dinners. Excellent. I can hardly wait to try it out on meats. This is, indeed, a very interesting variation from my ordinary chili sauce!

Gary Peterson

The CHARLES BAR is absolutely the most delicious, creamy, gourmet Belgian Chocolate I have ever tasted! It is a Truffle consistency and melts in your mouth. I don't know which I like more the dark or milk!! You won't believe it is sugar and gluten free as there is no aftertaste or anything artificial about the chocolate. Like Charles says on his commercial.."It doesn't get any better than this" and it's true!! Grab one and see for yourself.
Seriously?!!!! Have you read the product features? It Says "Place in large critter keeper for frogs to burrow." What the hell???!! Does anybody preview/edit this stuff? I volunteer.

I make my own coffee flavoring syrup to save money, however the most expensive part is the extract. This is easily one of the best values I've found for bulk almond extract. The seller is reliable and ships very fast and I will most likely purchase more in the future.

Because of my Danish background,I use a lot of almond products.  I am unable to buy my usual store brand in my new little town, so I got online and started to read reviews.  My almond extract arrived and was put into a taste test in our almond brownies that very day.  We took these to a middle school picnic and SEVERAL people asked what that incredible flavor was in the brownies!  The extract is wonderful.  There is no bitterness at all.  The flavor is true, rich and strong.  The cost is so reasonable and it was well padded in the package.  This will be my extract from now on.  Try it, you will LOVE it!

This is exactly what I needed.  I use a lot of almond flavoring, & this bottle-size is great for me.  It is real almond extract and not imitation, which is something that I didn't care about before.  After using this extract, I probably can't use imitation flavoring anymore. This extract gives the perfect Almond taste and that little bite that I like to taste in my recipes.  I will be ordering this as long as it is available.

Read a lot of reviews complaining about the taste and odor of the product. I have to say....  The product we received looked and smelled like Almond extract. My wife used in her poppy seed bread and it was excellent!
I use Almond extract alot aroung the holidays...tired of buying those little bottles for almost $3 each....very happy with purchase.  Great price

Summary: almond extract not in a brown bottle
Text: This product is not what is seems.  I thought it would come in a brown bottle but it came it a plastic clear container.  I would not have purchasedit.  The product is just o.k..

I got these to put in the girls' favor bags at my daughter's 3rd birthday party and they were a big hit!  The package that we received had a nice variety with at least one of each princess.  There were more Cinderellas than any other princess.  These are well priced versus what you would pay for them individually at a grocery store.

I bought these to give out as party favors at a bridal shower--my sister got engaged at Disneyland, and they're going on a Disney cruise for their honeymoon, so it seemed like a nice touch.

The guests loved them!

My pack included: 2 Ariel, 2 Cinderella, 2 Belle, 3 Aurora, 1 Frog Princess, 2 Rapunzel. So, obviously it's just a random assortment.

They make great favors because they're already individually wrapped. Also, they do come with the little display like shown in the picture here on Amazon. When my guests were leaving, I just put them out in their display box for them to pick up on their way out, and I used labels to put a sticker for the event on the packages.

If you want Pez dispensers that are Disney princesses, this is a great option.

I bought these for my daughter's birthday.  She was excited at first but her favorite princess is Sleeping Beauty and there were not any in the entire box.  Seriously?  They can't ensure that there is at least 1 of each princess?

I had my doubts but this is a delicious product best used at a party for appetizers or with a garlic parmesan butter sauce over pasta. Cooks quickly[do your homework] and can does not contain shells for presentation but no big deal. Remember there are 5 dozen good sized snails so invite a crowd!

Summary: I'm Glad They Added "IMITATION" to the Title
Text: I'm glad that they added "IMITATION" to the title of this product because when I purchased it it just indicated that the product was Lemon Extract, but that is not what I received (Also, the receipt that I printed when I ordered shows the title as Lemon Extract, 16 oz).  I received IMITATION Lemon Extract.  The two are not the same.  After I received it, I checked the description and it indicated that it was imitation, but the title was also changed by the time I checked.  Other than that little issue, it was shipped on time and packed well.

I decided to try this coffee and went with subscribe and save to get a discount. I figured I could always cancel if I didn't like it. Well I love it. My only problem is that I run out of it before the next month's supply gets in. It's bold and strong, so if you like that in your coffee flavor, this is for you. Reminds me a bit of a starbucks type of coffee. I Loved It.

Summary: Great cup at a better cost
Text: I don't get the negative reviews I see here. I've been drinking Newman's Special Blend, but decided to give these a try. I think the flavor is every bit as good if not better, I love it! Very smooth. And I don't usually care for French Blend coffees, they are usually too "dark" for my taste. And the price is great...I found them at Costco...a box of 80 for $25.99. And even though there's still plastic to be disposed of, there's not near as much.

Summary: Purchased from Amazon - Good Flavor, great price
Text: I read the reviews and thought to give these a try. They arrived in a timely manner (prime membership). The coffee has a great taste. I use a large mug and make 2 regular cups of coffee out of one pod, add my sweetner, and am a happy camper. This may weaken the flavor a bit but I need alot of coffee in the morning and this hits the spot. Try it - the price is a great deal better than buying 18 pods for $12 - 17 a pop.

I like the flavor of this brand. It has taken me a while to find something I really like. Some of the Keurig options are too acidic for my taste. (But taste is subjective, isn't it?) Reviewers have complained because the cups aren't surrounded completely by plastic; they use a filter-like material instead. I suspect that the traditional filter aspect may make them better. I gave this four stars. To get five stars it would have to be the amazing. I have not yet found a Keurig brand (or lately even a traditional coffee bean) that rates in the Amazing category.

Here's a product that had the potential to be excellent but isn't. Since it's not a "K-Cup", they're not paying the licensing fees, so it should be cheaper. Yet it's about the same price as many brands of K-Cups. What makes it worse is that these aren't even "extra bold" portions, the ones with extra coffee in the cup, which again you can get for about the same price as these.

On the positive side, there's less material here, so less waste generated. I've bought this brand of coffee in bean form for years, the "not a K-Cup" version does deliver the familiar tastes. A small cup of the same taste.

I was not expecting the way these K-cups were made.  The plastic collar on top with the exposed coffee filled filter hanging below is ingenius and I can see where it saves on throwing extra plastic in the landfills.  But, I have to agree with other reviewers that in order to keep each cup fresh, you will have to empth the bag into a ziplck bag or a plastic container with a sealed, locking lid.  That is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.  The coffee is excellant and very comparable to the other brands and it is cheaper if you use the subscribe and save.

I have been using the SF Bay French Roast for about 6 months, and have it on automatic delivery.  I like the flavor of the coffee and am pleased with the keureg packet as it is not all plastic. All together a great deal for the price.

I have been using this brand, in my six year-old Keurig, for about a year now.

I like the flavor, not quite as rich as I like, but for the price, it's fine.

There is a bit more sediment at the bottom of the cup, but for the price, it works for me.

The main difference I see between these "pod-like" k-cups and the k-cups is a lot more drips after the coffee is brewed. I just wipe under the cup holder and the drip tray a bit more often.

I do get these, the 80 count, at Costco for $24.79 a box, coming to 31 cents per cup (compared to Amazon purchase at $33 for 41cents/cup or Amazon subscribe at $33.35, for 39 cents per cup). But if those prices change I would not hesitate to switch to Amazon for my source.

San Francisco Bay Coffee is an especially good French Roast! It has more body and flavor than the French Roast I usually get from Keurig. If it were more reasonably priced, I would most likely change my brands.
Nice strong brew to get your morning jump started!  I do not display the cups since the filter shows, but that is not a problem for me.  Hopefully, it is less waste for the enviroment.
Makes a good cup of coffee.  Robust flavor.  This is my second order which I receive on auto delivery. San Francisco Bay coffee is a good purchase.

Summary: Delicious savings for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
Text: I love my Keurig K-Cup Brewer, but not so much the cost of the K-Cups!  The San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers is the delicious solution!  Initially, I tried the 36 count box French Roast from Amazon to see if I liked the coffee.  I already knew I liked the price which was almost half the cost of the Keurig K-Cups at your local grocery or department store, but I also loved the full-bodied, eye-opening flavor of the coffee!  Then I noticed the 80 count box which is about a third the cost of store-bought K-Cups and thought I was in Heaven! Of course I ordered it, because I just can't pass up a bargain this amazing! This product is definitely a five-star keeper, and I will continue to order it from Amazon!
I don't drink coffee but I got it for my Husband.  He said it is pretty good.  We just got the Hazelnut in which he likes much better.  I love the price!
Good flavor but it is a little weak!!!! if it was made stronger the flavor would come in!!!! All in all Good enough for the price

Summary: Excellent Taste and More Robust Brewing with These Type of Pods
Text:
A friend of mine in the office gave me a pod of this coffee and I really liked it, hence my purchase of this 36 pack. This coffee is not as strong to me as this company's Fog Chaser brand, and is good-tasting that not only tastes great but has a nice aroma.

The pods are a little different than your traditional plastic K-cup portion as, instead of any plastic around the sides or bottom you have basically a mesh coffee filter holding the coffee grounds. This appears to make a more complete brew, and allows more of the flavor to come into the actual coffee. You will see a dirty residue at the bottom of your cup due to this filtration system vs. a "clean" look from a normal K-cup pod. This seems to make sense as the normal K-cup pod has all of the brewed coffee escaping through the pinprick hole vs. the full brewing experience of these pods.

As the pods are in this filtration medium the coffee is not air-tight sealed after you open the package of pods. I have put the unused ones in a sealed Ziploc bag to keep them fresh.

Several folks in my office have also ordered their own so it's not just me who likes this stuff. I believe between this and the Fog Chaser brand I have found a new favorite coffee company!

I had used SF Bay coffee(French roast) in the past but didn't know it was available for my Keurig one cup brewer. I absolutely love this coffee and have placed an order for more French Roast as well as Fog Chaser. Nice bold coffee flavor with no bitterness.
This coffee is great at a great price. This new style K-cup give you stronger more full flavor coffee at a price that can't be beat

We enjoy the French Roast flavor from this maker mainly for the aroma and rich taste. Great for a morning cup. Initially we were worried about drip risks due to the pod's design, but never had a problem. Having the paper filter exposed might be the cause for the richer taste, and some minimal sediment does get past the filter. Not enough to be troublesome. This coffee has been the best value k-cups thus far, and with the Green Coffee patent expired, hopefully we will see prices go down even more, which will lead to more consumption!

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig  K-cup Brewers, French Roast, 36 count
Text: I received this order already on time. I was late in writing my review. I alresdy drank this coffee. I love the flavor of the coffee and I like getting a fresh cup of coffee all the time.

Of all the flavors and kinds of coffee, this one is my son's favorite. I enjoy it, too. It tastes like a good home brewed coffee, fresh everytime.San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Fog Chaser, 36-Count

Summary: Don't let the difference keep you from purchasing.
Text:
With the high cost of K-cups I've tried several different alternatives. I have the My K cup and the Eco-cup and they both work ok but just not great. The 3 adults in our home all love coffee and drink lots of it so the cost was getting to be a problem.
I've compared K cup prices everywhere, online and brick and mortar stores. I usually purchase from Amazon.
Was checking out what was available and ran across these. I love the Millstone Fog Lifter coffee so I was interested but read the review and found that they were made differently. I hesitated but decided to try the 36 ct box. I figured if I didn't like them somebody else might. Was still skeptical and thought it might not work in my Keurig.
Works perfectly! The Fog Chaser is delicious. I like bold coffee and this is good strong but not bitter coffee. I highly recommend it and others love it too. We have a Keurig at work and I took one of the bags and shared. Everybody loved it. Also, though I'm not usually into "being green" particularly I feel that there is less plastic to end up in the landfills.

Summary: Very good and Tasty Gourmet Coffee * Love Presentation ! !
Text: First time I purchase this Brand, San Francisco Bay Coffee (Decaf French Roast). I bought it thinking they were the original K-cups, and I was so surprised when I opened up the box and saw the presentation, I thought I bought some kind of tea cups by mistake instead of Coffee cups, or it was coffee made for another type of coffee pots, but noooo, they were ecologic and new presentation which I love, and I am very happy with this brand now, I sure will be buying again, very very tasty coffee and nice and friendly presentation, ecologic, excellent Gourmet taste, very happy with it, I love it..!!!!

Another great coffee from San Francisco Bay. This roast,like their Fog Chaser, are great first morning cup of coffee.  I then switch to their decaf French Roast for the rest of the day. I have used all three of these roasts as a bases for mochas and Irish coffee.  They maintain their flavor very well. Recommend to any coffee lover. Their unique K-cup design uses less plastic which is nice for the environment.

Summary: Great coffee in a great container
Text: After reading the reviews we werent quite sure what to expect, but we are delighted. The packaging is much better environmentally and the key is that we dont have to compromise on taste or convenience. And by the way its a lot cheaper. The coffee is robust, strong and dark, like it should be ( I haven't tried the other flavors) and it has a great aroma. Of the four people who tried it in our office this morning three are buying it for home and the fourth is concerned only because it is too strong for his family's taste. The packaging is different but works as well as the regular k-cups. I am definitely buying this in the future
This coffee is rich and smooth.  I especially love the price and the subscribe and save is wonderful. it automatically ships every 2 months to me
I enjoyed the coffee and will continue ordering it in 6 month time frame.  It had a nice bold flavor and a rich aroma.

Excellent product for the money.  Based on the going price for the K cup line, I was very skeptical.  However, I thought I would give it a try and I could always cancel my order.  I ordered the French Roast because I like a good strong, robust cup of coffee.  I am now on automatic delivery and receive an order once a month.  Couldn't be easier.
We first tried this coffee and had some doubts. These were quickly vanquished as the coffee is delicious in taste and very reasonably priced through Amazon. Starbuck's.....look out!
I have used this coffee for about one year, it has excellent taste, on the bold side and the price is right.Also very conveinent to have it delivered to your door every month.

Summary: Not a Bad Cup of Coffee
Text: I was looking for a cheaper alternative to the high priced K-Cups so I decided to try San Francsisco Bay French Roast coffee. First, the price is right. I read all the reviews of this brand so I knew what to expect regarding appearance and storage. I must say, it really is not a bad cup of coffee. I usually drink Newman's own K-cups and, in my opinion, Newman's Own is a better cup of coffee. However, if you are looking for a cheaper alternative, I would give San Francisco Bay French Roast a try. Try a smaller box to try it out first.

If you like strong robust coffee, then look no further!

The only problem is that you might want to get an airtight container to put these in. Once you open the package that contains 10 or so they fill a room with their coffee blend smell. Not a bad thing, but it's potent.

The Coffee is awesome though!

So now I feel so warm and fuzzy on the inside since there is less plastic being used. However, once you break open the inner plastic packaging that holds the kcups, you now have to store them in a jar so they stay fresh.

Deep, dark, rich flavor. I appreciate the reduced packaging which is environmentally friendly, and as a side benefit takes up less space.  What I really like about these, besides the great flavor (best tasting K-cups I've found so far) is that there is just the filter on the bottom. I've always had some un-addressed concerns about the composition of the plastic that other k-cups are made of, and what may be leaching into my beverage from the hot water passing over the coffee.  Look for these at costco where a 80 pack is 25$ (look around, not all stores carry them), but even on amazon it's a good deal with shipping included.
excellent price and very earth friendly. Would recommend this product to everyone nice price to. Flavor was french roast and it tasted like other french roast that I have enjoyed in the past.
Delish! strong tasty cup of joe for an exellent price.I used to buy this same coffee all the time at costco, so i knew it was good.

Summary: Great bold flavor coffee for keurig machines.
Text: This is now the only coffee I order for my Keurig.  The quality is much better than i initially expected and the price is great.  At first when i saw the k-kup it was different so i expected it not to work but after the first coffee I was hooked.  This tastes to me like a starbucks flavor with the full body boldness.  I would definitely recommend especially for with the subscription discount.
I bought the french roast first. It was good so I ordered the breakfast blend for when I wanted a milder cup of coffee. Both are very good and work perfectly in my Keurig.

Summary: Good Flavor with the Fragrance too
Text: Rich and smoky. This is a good French Roast. The packaging allows you the fragrance of the ground coffee, which you don't get with standard K-cups. A box of 36 comprises three sealed plastic bags of twelve cups each. They are not resealable, so after I open a bag, I put it into a plastic storage container to preserve freshness. San Francisco Bay Coffee's K-cups will remind you of what it used to be like to open a coffee can. If you miss the rich coffee smell, but you don't use a basket accessory or one of the reusable K-cup accessories to hold your choice of loose ground coffee, consider giving this a try.
From the first cup the aroma won me over. Rich, full bodied French Roast Coffee. Like not having the plastic cups. Just seal the "pods" in a bad and good to go.Will probably purchase again.

The subscribe & save service is good, the product was delivered as required and actually did save me money! The coffee is great and has a good full bodied taste, delicious and keeps me wide awake while working.
Received product very quickly.  The k-cups taste fresh and robust compared to other Keurig cartridges. I will definitely be ordering for my office again!

This is by far..the BEST FRENCH ROAST I have ever had! Aside from that...you can't beat the packaging and the price! Talk about eco friendly. I'm all for it. I will be a forever customer as long as they keep things the same. I recommend the Subscribe & Save program.
I will start with the complaint.  This little things kinda do stick to the brewer when you open it after the brewing is over. Not a big deal though.  They brew perfectly and the coffee is wonderful.

The San Francisco Bay french roast K-cups are an excellent choice for anyone that likes a full bodied bold coffee taste. These have a different design that any I have seen, having the filter covering the entire "bottom" of the K-cup. The 80 count box is full of smaller packages with a vacuum seal...keeps the coffee fresher. The price is more than reasonable for the quality.

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee - French Roast
Text: This coffee is very smooth and I love the taste!  It was my first time purchasing and was hesitant about purchasing such a large amount since I had never personally tasted the coffee but I was very happy with the taste and will be ordering more!
This coffee is my favorite now.  I like dark bolder coffee that stands up to my cream and sugar and this is my new favorite!
This is a bold coffee with a smooth taste. For the money it is the beet tasting c.offee I have found in the market .place. I love the easy storable sturdy box.
Some of the best coffee I've had. Great if you like full-bodied and rich coffee.  No bitterness and makes a good cup of coffee everytime.
This was my first product by San Francisco Bay, but won't be the last.  It works perfectly in the Keurig and the coffee is very good.  I'll continue to buy K-cups from this company.

When I noticed the packaging for this coffee, I was reluctant to order it. Because the price was so reasonable I decided to give it a try. Surprisingly, it was at least as good as some of the coffee in typical packaging, and was much better than others. Immediately, I revised our "Subscribe And Save" to receive this instead of what we'd used previously. I've made converts of my sister and my mother, both of whom use this now instead of there former brands. Everyone who tastes it loves it.

I failed to mention that we've been using the San Francisco Bay "frustration free packaging" coffee for about six months -- both French Roast and Fog Lifter. Besides the coffee being delicious, we have had absolutely no problems with our Keurig machine becoming clogged or finicky. Prior to that, for two years, we held our breath each morning wondering if we'd have to resort to the paraphernalia of paper clips, needles, etc,. in an attempt to make a cup of coffee. We'd even returned two brewers due to the problem. Now... a perfect brew every time.
Like the packaging instead of the plastic k-cups! I believe it brews so much smoother! The price is attractive also.

Summary: Very acceptable - my every day coffee.
Text: For my personal taste, this coffee could be a little bit stronger.  However, it has a nice rich flavor and it starts my day everyday.  The unusual K-cup keeps all of the grounds out of my cup because there is no hole poked in the bottom of the K-cup.  The price is also very nice.  I think some of the other brands are slowly pricing themselves out of the market.
For the price is coffee is pretty good, I like a strong cup and it does a good job. I have been using it for about 6 months now and have it on auto ship. Give it a try.

I really do like their coffee products and the prices cannot be beaten.  Yes, as the reviews state to keep them fresh requires a zip lock or container but for the cost savings that isn't a problem at all for me.  This is I believe, my third order of the SF Bay coffees.

Summary: Great Coffee, Great Packaging - Perfect for the Office
Text: Love these streamlined low-plastic K Cups. My biggest beef with the Keurig system is the amount of non-recyclable plastic involved in the single use cups. If this was for home use I would consider the reusable filter system, but as this is for an office environment, I need a tidier solution than wet coffee grounds everywhere. The mesh body works great - great coffee flavor.
My husband and son love this coffee.  Great value....and the free shipping really helps too....Have used other San Fransico products and they are all awesome...

Summary: One of the best K style French Roast Coffee brands available!
Text:
If you have never tried San Francisco Bay Coffee French Roast, Your in for a treat. This is a relatively inexpensive coffee, but has all the traits of expensive Gourmet brands.
Very Rich and full bodied, without the bitterness you normally expect find from a French Roast. A full flavored experience.

San Fransisco Bay Coffee comes in their unique style K cup comparable one cup pack's servers.

A must try brand for any real coffee connoisseur.

Summary: Bitter no matter what size cup you brew...
Text:
I shouldn't label myself a coffee connoisseur, but I know bitter when I taste it. I have been testing different coffees in my new Keurig and can honestly say that this coffee is the worst of them all, thus far. No matter what size cup I brew or how much creamer and sugar I add (I normally do not use cream/sugar) the stuff in the cup goes down the drain. What a waste of money. Don't do it... If you can find a small test trial go for it, but don't invest on the 80 k-cup box because you are throwing your money away! Bleh!

If you are worried about recycling, use the plastic k-cups to start seedlings in and punch a couple more holes in the bottom so the roots can absorb water. San Fran French Roast is garbage.

But it is very good value for money.  Taste is fine and strength is fine.  The cups work well too but I can't convince myself that they use less plastic given the plastic bag they come in.  I do recommend these quite highly however.

Summary: San Francisco Bay coffee for Keurig.
Text: I bought this coffee after reading the reviews. I have been a black coffee drinker my whole life, but did not like this coffee. I did not have a problem with the pod.  I thought the coffee was terrible and will probably try to give it away.

Summary: Like coffee but storage is an issue
Text: This coffee is good and it certainly is worth the price, HOWEVER, there is one downfall.  While it doesn't waste plastic, if you just store your coffee k cups in a basket or an open container, it allows air to enter and thus the flavor will escape.  It's the only thing that will keep me from purchasing in the future.

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee costs less, tastes richer
Text: We've been buying San Francisco Bay Coffee French Roast in whole bean packages at a warehouse store for years, mostly because it was less expensive than the better known brands. To our surprise, we like its bold flavor better than the other brands. I always thought higher prices meant better tasting coffee. Not true! When we bought a Keurig coffee machine last January, I was resigned to trading a taste I prefer and an outstanding value, for the single cup convenience of the K-cups, which meant buying the more expensive brands of coffee in K-cups. Fortunately, the SFB Coffee people have made a single serving cup which fits in Keurig machines. It has the same flat, round top as K-cups, but the cup portion is a mesh filter cup, not made of plastic as with a K-cup. The SFBC cups work just as well in your Keurig machine and with less waste. I take a 16-oz. travel mug to work each morning, and I find the flavor to be consistent whether I make 8 ounces or 16 ounces. My sister-in-law's husband calls himself a coffee snob. He tried the SFBC French Roast for the first time today and was blown away by its rich flavor. He's now a believer and has ordered his first case.
Ill be buying these cups again and again. This is a good bold french roast with a packaging that appears more eco-friendly.

I will continue to buy these; excellent price of around 38 cents a cup if you use Subscribe and Save and the pods are eco-friendly

But most of all the flavor is great, as I like my coffee strong, the French Roast is just right - deep and bold.

This is a very good tasting coffee and I like the new packaging because it brings the price down but not the taste.
One great coffee.

The price of the pods was very inviting compared to the Timothy's brand. I purchased the French Roast Decaf for my wife and the regular French Roast for myself. We both drink our coffee black and found it favorful and not at all bitter. I highly recommend San Francisco Bay French Roast.

Summary: My New Favorite... Next order will be the 80 count! :)
Text: 5 Stars on flavor. I was concerned about the design of this 'Kcup' but its sturdy. The only thing that would make this coffee better would be if the packaging was resealable. Its annoying that I have to put them in their own zip lock once the plastic bag is cut.
Great coffee at a great price!!  We were skeptical at first because it was inexpensive but this did not disappoint!  A bold flavored choice.
The coffee is excellent! Having it delivered makes it convienent and the 80 count lasts long enough for two of us for  a month. Willl definitely keep this coming!

When reading the other reviews, I was hesitant to get it, but I am glad I did!  The smell from opening one of the mini bags in the box was amazing, definitely proving it to be a "French Roast."  The taste isn't as strong as other French Roast coffees, but that's fine with me.  This brews up perfectly in my Keurig, and tastes amazing!  I definitely would recommend it, especially if you don't like the stronger French Roast blends.

I was pleased with this brand of K-cup coffee.  Instead of coming in a small plastic (not very green!) container it comes in a mesh-like pouch making the coffee flow through it easier.  i have a hundred dollar Keurig machine and it stopped making coffee from the plastic containers.  Coffee everywhere.  i was ready to throw it out in disgust until i tried this new model of single brewing cup.  The taste is bold, although I prefer bolder, but it is fresh, dependable and works everytime.

Summary: best coffee for the Keurig brewers
Text: I had given up on the Keurig after trying several different coffees as it always lacked in strength and flavor.  I had tried many varieties of the various branded versions of Green Mountain Coffee, aka all K-cups are packaged by Green Mountain.  I finally retired the brewer after the last bad cup having a distinct plastic taste, to a shelf in the basement. Then walking through Costco came across these pods, and different is better!  They seem to have more coffee grounds resulting in stronger coffee, are less expensive, and your beverage is not brewed through a plastic cup.  By far the best coffee for the Keurig and I am looking forward to trying some of the different roasts and blends and really glad to see they are available through Amazon Prime, as Costco is often there one minute gone the next trip.
I was a little skeptical at first before receiving these but they turned out to be great! The smell and flavor is wonderful. I would definitely recommend these to anyone.
I love this coffee and will continue to purchase it over and over again.  It takes great with a bold taste and for the price, you can't beat it.

Summary: Great Coffee at a great value
Text: I am a coffee fanatic.  This coffee is delicious!  As good if not better than other brands, and the price is reasonable.

We bought a Keurig a few months back and once we were through the packs that came with the machine (Costco combo pack), we chose these because they make great coffee and fill up the trash can much slower. We usually have 2-4 cups a day and the cost can really add up, but these are great at less than $0.50 a cup!

We love our Keurig machine but found the kcups to be expensive. This brand of coffee offers a strong, bold cup of coffee and at a lower price point that most of the others.

We have the box of 80 delivered every month, very convenient.

Delicious rich French Roasted coffee in 8-kcup vacuum-sealed bags. The kcup is mesh rather than plastic so the water is not funneled through a small hole but throughout the coffee, making for a much more robust taste. The price is reasonable, too. If you're a Caribou fan, you'll love this coffee -- and it's cheaper!
Taste will be different for everyone, for me this is as good as Starbucks French Roast and better tasting than Black Tiger and the price can't be beat.

We have been using another brand of French Roast and I thought to try this one. I like the coffee to be rich and full flavored that is why I like French Roast. This one really fills the bill. By the by I drink it black so I get the taste of the coffee not some milky mess. I will buy this one in the future.

The format of the coffee is also interesting. Not your usualy K cup. I have not had any problems with the packaging. Seems to work just fine.

To end this where it should be the coffee is great tasting.

Can't really call these kcups because they aren't like conventional kcups. but they work just fine in my keurig. The coffee is excellent, and at .41 cents a cup (with subscribe and save)  very economical. love them!

We Bought this product at a local warehouse store in the 80 count box strictly because of the price. We had never seen or heard of them before, so were a bit skeptical, but had no opinion, good or bad. I read reviews after the purchase, because I liked it so much, I came to Amazon because I wanted to see if I could order it online and save us a trip, and I got a real chuckle out of some of the reviews. I'm not sure of why the product got such bad reviews from some people. Yes, it is a strong coffee,and maybe too strong for some people, even our son said it was "stout", but we first brewed it on the smaller settings. Now we brew on the largest setting, and have had no problems with it. Also, because of the design, we put the cups in an airtight container to help keep them fresh, so don't store them outside in one of the many K-cup holders that are popular. In the end, I guess it really is true that if you try to please everyone, you end up pleasing no one, and I'm sure there are those in the internet world who could make a career out of complaining, but I would recommend the product to anyone, with the caviat that it is a bit on the strong side, and to be aware that taste is truly subjective, but I think overall, It's a good product and the price is great.

OMG this is such great coffee.  Unlike the other K-cups (which are good), these cups make the coffee take exactly as you would get if you went to a coffee shop like Starbucks.  I just finished my last K-cup and will definitely order them again.
It's great to wake up to a cup of coffee that will give one a great lift at a reasonable price.

The coffee is not quite as strong as I had hoped, but it is pretty good. Sometimes the pod gets stuck in the puncture pin and is hard to get off, but I knew that they might not be 100% compatible. Overall I am well satisfied given how much cheaper per cup these are.

Price is nice!! We started using Amazon to get better deals and try new flavors.  I was a little skeptical to try this one as the packaging was so different then all the others, and the price was so good.  So glad we tried it!!!  We like the flavor (we prefers bold) and the rich taste and smell.  The only thing we didn't like was it shipped UPS and we had to sign for it.  Took 3 extra days to meet up with UPS and sign. Like previous reviews make sure you put them in a ziplock bag.  We will be buying this on a regular basis!

Summary: Great Price, but a little bitter.
Text: This coffee is a great buy, for the price. It is a little bitter. It's strong too. Great for when you are really tired.

Summary: They work with less waste and they taste great!
Text: I thought these might come apart in my k-cup coffee machine, but they held up perfectly and the coffee itself is really good. Plus, with less packaging, I don't have to feel quite as guilty about using the single serving size.
I've tried a lot of different Keurig K cup and pod brands. This coffee is the best. And, I love the new style K kup. It's more effecient and more ECO friendly.

I hesitated buying these quasi K-cups fearing they would not have good flavor, not fit right or spew grounds into my cup.  All those concerns were unfounded!  I have tried just about every dark roast coffee put into a K-cup and this is the best and at half the price...that is called value.  I have purchased hundreds of items on Amazon and this is the first one I felt compelled to review because I assume others have the same "it is too go to be true" feeling that I had.  Now I am going to use the subscribe and save feature and save a little more.

We liked these so much we did the "Subscribe and Save" option. They are a bit bolder than the average K-cup. Good taste, balanced flavors. Every once in a while, because they are not the traditional plastic K-cup, but rather with a mesh type of thing holding the coffee, they got stuck in the brewer. This was only a minor inconvenience and not a big deal at all.

This coffee is my all-time favorite, beating Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts.  The flavor is rich and bold.  The pod design is eco-friendly, the price CAN'T BE BEAT.  I will continue to order this item.  It is the best coffee I've ever had!
Great coffee and I love the way the coffee is packaged in less plastic. Much more environmentally friendly and I can use the filters to start seedlings for my garden.
From the time it starts brewing it is waking me up. Fresh coffee aroma and sharp tasting great start to the day.

Summary: Good coffee at a great price
Text:
This is a good deal for a good cup of coffee. My wife and I enjoy both the French Roast as well as the Fog Chaser K-cups. At just about $0.41 per cup (subscribe&save price), I haven't been able to find a better deal anywhere else. But don't think these are just cheap coffees, I'd put these two San Francisco Bay coffees in my list of favorites for sure. There may be better coffees available depending on your taste, but you're going to pay more for them, guaranteed.

The SF Bay cups are a bit different than your typical k-cup and actually I would consider them a bit more environment friendly. While the top of the k-cup remains similar to other K-cups, with a puncture foil top and plastic ring, there is no plastic shell or 'cup' around the base and filter. Instead, the filter is exposed. For this reason, the coffee is exposed to air when you first open the bag. Fortunately, the 36 cups come wrapped in 3 separate 12-packs. Once we open a pack, we transfer the cups to a ziploc to keep them fresh...no biggee, and still worth the savings.

Buying this versus another brand on Amazon or at Sam's club saves us about $20 a month since we drink about 4 cups a day. So our day to day coffee remains this and Fog Chaser, and on occasion, we'll splurge for something a bit different.
Awesome, San Francisco Bay French roast is the best.....without the bitter bite, dark  smooth......smells and tastes GREAT......we love it.....we will be buying more!

Quality taste at a great price -(especially with subscribe and save). Took a chance on something new and that looked a little different and I'm glad I did.  After I open a pouch of K-Cups, I put them in a zip-lock bag.  My cup of coffee is fresh and delicious.  Try it.  You'll like it.

Summary: Good almost-K-cup concept, don't like this flavor
Text:
**See update below**
First, I want to say that in general I very much like the San Francisco Bay "One Cup" coffee products - their Fog Chaser and Rain Forest blends are two of my favorite K-cups. As has been mentioned in many other reviews, they don't look like "normal" K-cups, but they work in Keurig brewers. Never had any problems with the brand or the innovative cup design.
I also like Amazon's Frustration Free packaging option - between that and the reduced plastic in the cup itself, this is a good less-waste alternative, and the price is great.

However - I really don't care for this particular French Roast variety. I'm not especially picky about coffee - I like a variety of brands, roast styles, and flavors. Specifically, I tend to prefer "Dark" and "Extra-bold" K-cups. But this particular French Roast just doesn't work for me. Some of the cups have been worse than others, but I find the coffee to be especially bitter, with a very distasteful burned flavor. With most coffee, I can enjoy it black, but I usually add just a little bit of cream and sugar. For this variety, I have to add an extra slug of cream, which balance out the bitterness just enough to be "OK". With this amendment, they're not quite bad enough to throw away, but I definitely won't be purchasing more.

To summarize: SF Bay K-cups are great - if you stick to the non-French Roast varieties.

**Update: After receiving the prompt comment on this review from SFBay's customer service, I gave them a call. I immediately talked to a real person at the company (not some random call center), who was very helpful and communicated clearly. This helpful rep was primarily focused on making me happy with their coffee, and to that end, he sent me three replacement bags of different varieties (which I knew I liked) at no cost. I've tried those and, as usual, they're excellent. He was also concerned that there might be something wrong with the batch or roast that I had received, and provided me with a pre-paid label to return the old coffee so they could test it.
So I'm still not sure whether I got a bad batch, or whether I just don't like this flavor. Hence my 4/5 stars. But either way, with customer service of this caliber, it's DEFINITELY worth trying the coffee! Highly recommended. My review was therefore changed from 2 stars to 4.

My local Costco has them for $25.99.  Also, my local tax is 8% here in CA.  That brings the total to $28.07 which is actually more expensive than the subscribe and save price here and I don't have to go borderline insane with cart rage at Costco.  But I understand that I may have a unique situation not having to pay taxes on Amazon purchases but on local purchases I do.  Some may have no sales tax or may have to pay tax on Amazon purchases.  With the S&S this is way better than the other option (IMO). With that being said, it is an excellent bold coffee at a good price.  There is a little bit of residue at the bottom of the coffee cup when I am done but nothing major.  With some of the "make your own cups", I ended up with a gritty and terrible last drink which deterred me from wanting to use those things.  I even bought a burr grinder in the hope that with a coarser grind I wouldn't get that but it still had a terrible last swig.  With these, I don't dread that last drink and only notice a little residue on the bottom of my dried cup.  These are now my "go to" for the Keurig.

I am not a coffee critic, but this is some dang good coffee.  Although I did not get it for the $28.00 others refernce, I did pay $33.00 and feel that is a good buy, at least $12.00 less than Sam's Club for what I feel is better coffee.  I like the little pods, will composts them when I decide to compost.

I just received these 'k-cups' a few days ago. I ordered them on subscribe and save because of the value. I failed to read all reviews, just a few to make sure they were good. When I opened the package, I thought I was sent a wrong item...until I realized these are k-cups, but not the usual looking ones. They are foil sealed with a plastic ring around the top, and the rest of it is a filter. When placed in the brewer, just a hole gets punched on the top, not bottom. Something new perhaps? I tried a cup and I admit, it was very good coffee, full flavor. I will purchase these again and do recommend them. These do arrive in a shipping box, but the k-cups are sealed in plastic bags.

With the recent price hikes for K-Cups, I was starting to question the value of using my Keurig anymore. I saw the San Francisco Bay Coffee OneCups on Amazon and was intrigued by the price and the unusual design. I have been pleasantly surprised by the quality of the coffee. The only downside I have experienced so far is that the pods do need to be stored in a zip-lock baggie since they are not airtight.

Summary: Not bad, but decidedly unlike any other K-Cup product
Text:
Full disclosure - I worked briefly for the people who make this product back in the late '70s. Since I had a personal connection to the product, I really wanted to like it. And it's not bad - it's OK, but it's just a bit odd.

First off, the packaging. These aren't your father's K-Cup, where it's an actual cup. These have a top like the traditional cup (so they'll fit in the brewer) but the bottom is completely different. It's almost more like a filter than a cup, and kinda rounded rather than cup-shaped. They come in sealed plastic bags of twelve, so you need to keep them in a ziplock bag or some kind of airtight container once you open the bag, unless you're planning on using them all right away.

Second, the flavor. It's OK, not bad at all, but it just tastes a little off for some reason. A hint of odd flavor. Also, it seems to lack body, for want of a better term. It doesn't have that rich, full, satisfying flavor I expect from a good cup of French Roast.

Lastly, it seems to leave more sediment in the bottom of the cup than traditional K-Cups - not sure if that's a by-product of the design or what.

Bottom line - it's not like I'm going to throw them away. I'll keep them and drink them, but I probably won't buy them again. I much prefer the flavor of just about any regular K-Cup to these, even non-premium brands like Folger's.

UPDATE: After drinking my way through the whole case and comparing them with other K-Cup products, I have a bit more appreciation for these and might consider buying them again, particularly given the excellent price of around 38 cents a cup if you use Subscribe and Save. One other point I neglected to mention in my original review is that these seem to produce more "crema" - the brownish foam that appears on top of a good cup of coffee - than most K-Cup products. Keep an eye out for my reviews of the Rainforest Blend (which I found somewhat weak and flavorless) and Fog Chaser (which just arrived and I've yet to sample) varieties coming soon.

I've been a San Francisco Bay coffee fan for years, and was delighted to learn of their one-cups.  The flavor is great and the pods are eco-friendly.  I like my coffee strong and have found the French Roast to be just right.  Don't know what a reviewer meant by "weak and watery."  Not so!  I like the price too.

Summary: Happy with San Francisco Bay OneCup French Roast
Text: I am so happy with this new economical and more environmentally friendly coffee.  The flavor and aroma are just what I expect from a French Roast -- deep and bold. I keep the pods in a ziplock bag in the refrigerator. My husband and I each drink at least two cups every morning, so we go through a box pretty quickly with no concerns about the coffee pods staying fresh.  The used coffee is much easier to remove from the pods for composting, too.  Fine quality, great price!
A truly tasty French roast and I love the the packaging--feels more like brewing coffee, allows savory aroma to waft.  Packs a caffeine punch yet delicious flavor. Will buy again.

Summary: Ahhhhh,  the aroma  of  fresh coffee again -
Text:
I was so excited to try these in spite of all the negative reviews that tried to scare me away - maybe some folks were confused by the title however please note **these are not K Cups - they are One cup made to work with our beloved Keurig K-Cup Brewers.
Thank goodness - for any of you who have had to deal with that puff of air sending the K Cups coffee grounds up inside the Kuerig needle which after only one use can clog the needle. I thought I was going crazy going through the process of returning my Kuerig which was still full of water back to either Amazon or in my case Costco - because I thought it was just a lemon - yeah, did that 4 times -
The beauty of these little One Cup filters is that they are not vacuum sealed -
I keep mine in a large glass, clamp lidded jar.....The freshness is a divine improvement - and less waste in the landfill ...every little bit helps... So far, no bitter taste and I am loving these...

Summary: Not a full dark roast...but very good
Text:
I have tried each of these New K-cup like items from San Francisco Bay. This one is darker than the Rainforest blend but not as dark as the Fog Chaser (my personal favorite).

Great coffee...great alternative!

I've been drinking this brand of coffee for many years. I was delighted to see them come out in a Keurig compatible form. Because they're not really "K-Cups" they don't have to pay the licensing fee, so they can sell for a lower price.

The One Cup pods deliver the exact same taste as the beans, a good rich French Roast.

Because these are pods and not sealed cups, they should be stored in an airtight container or they will go stale very rapidly. The box is subdivided into smaller sealed bags, each bag holds a few days worth of cups for the two of us at my house.

ProfileName: Miss Betsey Trotwood "Only bad witches are ugly"
Summary: Why I Like These Better Than 90% of K-Cups
Text:
I like strong coffee. I should get that out of the way first, because I know not everyone appreciates deep, dark coffees. Aside from Dark Magic and Mahogany, this is better than almost every k-cup I have tasted.

I may be in the minority here, but I actually prefer the filter-like bottom of these pods over the k-cup for four reasons:

1. I've noticed no difference in freshness compared to the Nitrogen-filled, sealed k-cup.

2. I don't have to waste filtered water and keep a paper clip handy to unclog the coffee grounds that get stuck in the needle of the Keurig because of pressure and temperature differences between where the k-cup was sealed and where it gets punctured.

3. When brewing with these One Cups, the kitchen smells of freshly brewed coffee, an aroma I had missed when using k-cups.

4. (And I realize not everyone will feel this way) - warning, nothing but complaining ahead:

I had begun resenting being beholden to Keurig. I dutifully sent them money each month for k-cups and each month they found new ways to make me regret it. (Not shipping the k-cups out at all, allowing my package to sit in their warehouse for a week while they assured me it was on its way, consistently being out of stock of the k-cups I wanted and most of all, whenever I called or wrote to point out a problem, issuing a coupon code for free k-cups but then repeating the problem the following month. Their customer service dept is structured in a way that they repeat problems and never resolve anything.)

great cup of coffee. i MUST have these or else :) i am very fussy about my coffee. these are in a sealed bag, when opened a burst of fresh coffee hits you...which i never had with k cups. they are a whole new way of enjoying your keurig coffee makers. i sooooooooo highly recommend san francisco bay coffee ..especially french roast
These K Cups provided strong coffee without sediment in the bottom of the cup. I think the taste was deeper then the usual K cups and I felt better about not having the plastic on the bottom.

I was a little hesitant about ordering these after reading multiple reviews that talked about the foil breaking and spilling the grounds everywhere.  But I'm glad I went ahead and made the purchase.  The coffee tastes great and after getting almost completely through the first bag (12 "pods" in each amazon frustration-free package) I have been very happy.  No spillage and a great, strong and flavorful cup of coffee.

For the past year, I have had a monthly shipment of the Diedrich French Roast sent to my house.  When they discontinued the subscribe and save for that product I was very disappointed and had to find a new french roast.  After reading the reviews I decided to give the San Francisco Bay a try.  I was a bit skeptical about the package and I am very picky about taste, however, I just brewed my first cup and I love it!  It has a really rich flavor that seems to have more of the natural oils that you would find in a french press.  Sounds crazy, but it seems to be true!  The aroma is wonderful as well.  I haven't gotten to the end of my first cup quite yet so I don't know if there is more sediment, but hey, I like french press so a little sediment won't kill me.  I plan to make this coffee my new subscribe and save.

I love the beans, but this design of the cup is not good-- the cups are not sealed all the way and after the first few cups, the coffee starts to get stale unless you vacuum seal the k-cups.  I would say hold off on purchasing these unless you go through them quickly or can find a way to store them.
Product is as advertised - a full-body strong coffee.  The difference between this and other k-cup coffee is it leaves a sediment in the cup.  This is not detrimental to the taste.
Great coffee and a great price; much less 'offensive' packaging than a normal K-cup; works just like a normal K-cup; no problems.

So nice to get a cup of coffee on my Keurig B60 that isn't watered down like what I get with my K-cups, especially on the large setting. I love the fact that they cost less than K-cups and are more environmentally friendly. My coffee came in 3 sealed packs of 12. I brewed one cup and put the remaining 11 in a quart-sized ziploc bag. Only complaint--not enough flavors. I would like to see flavor variety packs, and other flavors like my favorite... pumpkin.

I thought that the flavor was good - it tasted more like a real cup of coffee - like one that was brewed traditionally. But this French roast was just too strong to me. Almost a little bitter.

I prefer the San Francisco Bay cup style over the plastic K-cup. And I will be trying a lighter roast.
The coffee is great. The Kcups are not even cups, just a pouch of coffee with a lid.  But it works great in the brewer!  After I am done I even rip open the pouch and compost the coffee grounds.

These coffee pods work great in the Keurig Brewer, and if you like the flavors available these are a good value, but at our local warehouse club (BJ's New England) we got a box of 80 for around $28.00. This is way less than here at Amazon. I hope they create more flavors. As for the "off taste" other reviewers are complaining about this coffee is a branch of Peets Coffee. They roast a lot differently than Green Mountain Coffee, the people who bring you the Keurig brewers. I find the coffee to be robust and a lot less bitter than Starbucks, but more bitter than, say, a Dunkin Donuts coffee.

I would buy these again and again, but as I said, our local warehouse store had them for even less. Shop around!

I like strong coffee...I LOVE strong coffee and drink it black. This coffee is not really strong but it is quite bitter and has an odd taste to it. Reminds me of 8 o clock French Roast which I also do not like. If you like 8 o clock French Roast you will likely like this one. I like San Franciscos Fog Chaser much better and make it on the stongest setting of my brewer.
This coffee is full-bodied and delicious!  The design is wonderfully economical and green.  Save some money while saving the earth! I can't wait to get more!

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee for Keurig Brewer
Text: San Francisco Bay Coffee OneCup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, French Roast, 12-Count (Pack of 3)That is 36 K-Cups. I was worried when they looked different than the other cups. They work and taste great Great deal!

Because these K-cups are made a little differently, I was skeptical of just how the coffee would taste.  I ordered both the French Roast and Fog Chaser and if you like your coffee to have a robust flavor, you will like both of these.  I have now ordered the larger 80 count boxes of each.

Summary: Much richer flavor than normal k-cups
Text: Since I bought my Keurig I felt the coffee wasn't as rich as coffee you slow brew. I bought Starbucks, Caribou and many other brands. It wasn't that I dislike the coffee but I did not get the same satiisfaction.  The first cup of the French Roast I really felt it had such a good flavor.  I'm hoping they start selling more flavors.

Love the pod design. Going to try the French Roast next.
I am a coffe snob and I admit it! This is great coffee!
Wonderful coffee at a great price!!! I haven't tried other beans, but the French roast is delicious. Happy to have auto ship too - keeps my keruig busy and my taste buds happy!

This is the BEST French Roast coffee from all of the different K-Cups that I have tried!
You must try these!

I'm somewhat of a dark coffee snob and have tried MANY dark roast pods.  These are both dark and flavorful and work great in a Keurig.  I usually like to slightly sweeten dark roast coffee, but this really doesn't need any sweetner.  Not at all bitter but still robust even on larger volumn setting.  Order by subscription and it's less than $15 for 36 pods which come vacuum packed in bags of 12 each.
As others have written - a K-Cup knock off with nice full flavor - 10oz. setting is good for me - great value - nice bold flavor - best option I have tried so far.

If you like it dark and strong you'll love this coffee San Francisco Bay Coffee OneCup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, French Roast, 12-Count (Pack of 3)! It is my favorite Keurig coffee. I make it on the large cup setting and it makes a perfect cup. For some reason it seems stronger and more flavorful to me than the "Fog Chaser" of the same brand. I will definitely be buying more. Keep in a zip lock baggie after you open it. The 'tea bag' bottoms seem to make a better brew.

Summary: I used to live in SF and this isn,t Bold but ok+++
Text: I usually drink this in the af'noon and find it perfect mild bold drink using 1/2 the amount of water required. the aroma is wonderful and the brew flavors expand as you mull the first few sip around in your mouth..the wife also finds it her 2nd choice as Nantucket grabs her attentions 1st. This is not a Kpod but has a mesh bottom..thus I found it tended to lose floavor if not sealed in plastic bag...just an heads up for new customers.

Summary: Wonderful full bodied flavor no bitterness.
Text: Our favorite coffee is Donut Shop by Coffee People and we were curious with this new type of Kcup. Although not the same as Donut Shop this coffee has a wonderful flavor. If you like a strong full bodied flavor use the middle setting otherwise the 10 ounce setting will still give you a very full bodied coffee without being watered down. All in all we will definitely be ordering this again. The best at .44 cents a cup this is a great value.

I tried this coffee because of the price being less than most k-cups here on Amazon. It's very strong coffee using the largest setting on our B-60 (I think it's 9.25 oz.). Taste is not full-bodied but rather ashy tasting and flat; it smells and tastes like cigarettes and coffee.
Also, I have to hold the machine closed while it's brewing. The strange non-k-cup pod will not allow the machine to close properly. The pods need to be stored in a ziploc or other airtight container. I'd have appreciated knowing they were not standard k-cups in advance.
I won't re-order despite the savings.

I purchased this product because the pods looked like they were made in a more earth friendly way. There's no hard plastic cup involved. We break down our cups after use. We compost the coffee and recycle the foil tops. The plastic cups end up in the garbage.
This product arrives in several heavy plastic bags for freshness. The filter pods are synthetic so they can't be composted and the tops seem to be made of plastic, not foil. The only thing I can keep out of the garbage is the coffee itself.
The coffee tastes good.

Summary: San Francisco Bay k cups coffee
Text: I love this coffee. I am on S&S and have already ordered it sooner than I have it ordered. I have heard that it is bitter. To me it is not bitter. Maybe it is because I use cream and stevia in it. Don't know but I look forward to drinking and enjoying my second cup.

This French Roast is by far my favorite. I like a strong tasting coffee. I also like the new packaging but I am glad that I didn't buy a Keurig K-Cup holder. The way this coffee is packaged you will have to put it in a covered container. This type of K-Cup recycles better too.

I sort of like the built-in filter bag instead of the usual plastic container, and the plastic bag.  The taste, for me, is a little more bitter and less pleasant than the other French Roast coffees offered through Amazon.
San Francisco Bay French Roast coffee has a great taste--full-bodied with no bitter aftertaste.  The K-cups appear to be more environmentally friendly than other K cups.
Great value and great taste!  Nice fresh coffee aroma when you open the bag.  You will get the best price when you sign up for a monthly shipment.
San Francisco Bay French Roast coffee for keurig is one of the best k-cup coffee I have tried.  I recommend it to anyone who prefers the strong flavor of french roast coffee.

I was surprised when I saw the "kups", but I had nothing to be concerned about.  The little bags of coffee are very sturdy and the coffee is very good.  In fact the coffee is stronger than the other kups,  I much prefer these bags.  And monthly delivery is perfect.

Summary: Compared to other dark or bold brews...
Text:
Like many others, the price point of this coffee got my attention but what's the point of cheaper coffee that's all but undrinkable... Grove Square, anyone?

So before ordering on price alone I wanted to see other reviewers contrast and compare this blend to other k-cups such as Timothy's Midnight Magic, Emeril's Extra Bold or Jet Fuel. After all, given the wide disparity of opinion about which k-cup blend is bold, strong or rich in flavor, at least finding common ground with others who enjoy the aforementioned brands you can estimate the appeal of the flavor to your own palate.

At the time I placed my order I didn't find any clear indicators from other reviewers along these lines, hence for what it's worth, as one who enjoys the previously mentioned k-cups, I can say that overall San Francisco Bay French Roast measures up pretty darn well to the more expensive brands.

Now if cost were not a factor I'm not certain this would be my first choice as this blend has a somewhat smoky after taste and I prefer a more fruity or sweet flavor. But hey, this is French Roast and as such the taste seems well suited.
Nevertheless, no regrets...it's a nice bold brew (with an appealing price) that I look forward each morning.
Ok so you know the pack is smaller... but dont get too dissapointed it is a strong cup of coffee  will make you go for a while befor you will want anther 1 i am a fan.

I was happy to see these new K-Cup designs because they're at a much better price point than the original K-Cups.  I tried the San Francisco Bay Coffee's French Roast because I like a really dark and flavorful cup of coffee.  Since I also almost always use the large cup setting when I brew my coffee, I want a coffee that gives as much flavor as possible.  I was not disappointed!  The French Roast has a very bold flavor while not being acidic or bitter.  I'll definitely be ordering more!

This is a heads up for those who like strong, fresh, French Roast coffee... It will not be found with these K-Cups.

Freshness. The coffee in each individual K-Cup is not sealed from air. While other brands have a plastic cup and a sealed top, the base on these Cups is the coffee filter. Secondly, all of the K-Cups are packaged together in a single plastic bag. Once that bag is opened, the unused K-Cups become exposed to air. I placed my remaining K-Cups in an sealed container.

Coffee Quality. The taste is good but the strength is less than Starbucks French Roast. While the packaging indicates a very deep roast, I did not experience that strength. If a mild French Roast brew is desired, then this coffee should work fine.

I was suprised at the coffee that I ordered had these neat little cups.  What I like most is that they are reusable.  I just tear off the top, then fill with my coffee and put a little piece of foil and cover the top, it works perfect.  I can only drink half and half coffee and my husband drinks regular so he uses the original coffee then I reuse the cups.  He really likes the coffee too.
I love the fact that it does not come in a plastic k-cup style. Eco friendly, and the taste is one of the best. I will be reordering soon!

I like strong, flavorful, coffee and missed the Coffee People Organic. After reading all the reviews I ordered the French Roast. With all the warnings about packaging and looks I expected the worse. When it arrived I was surprised that it was packaged well and easy to use as any k-cup. The packaging of the pod seems more earth friendly. Most importantly, this is now my favorite brand. It tastes like a good cup of coffee should.
Different look but works just fine in my maker.  I love the French Roast flavor.  I will definitely buy again.

From a value/taste standpoint,  this coffee is great. I saw it at Costco (80 k-cups for $25.99) and chose it over the Paul Newman and Starbucks brands that were 10 bucks more for 56 k-cups.  They do look different than the regular k-cups but may be more earth-friendly because the lower part is not plastic. To me, the coffee is robust and the aroma totally fills the house.  So glad I chose this over the higher priced brands.

I love, love this coffee. The packaging as well! The flavor is unique strong and good!

No more to say it is great.

This has been our favorite coffee for a couple of years now.  Used to buy the 3lb. bags at Costco and was so happy to find it in kcups for our Keurig brewer.  I also love that you have eliminated the plastic "cup" portion itself, eliminating more unrecycleable plastic to go to the landfills!
Just tried this coffee a few days ago and love it!  I like my coffee strong (will enjoy a dopio every now and then).  This coffee is strong and smooth.  I can't ask for more.

Like many Keurig users, I have been frustrated by the lack of choices in K-cup vendors. That is, while there are many types of coffees available, only Green Mountain can make the K-cup because of their patent. Pricing has been held fairly high and steady. It would be nice to have a choice and better pricing.

The SF Bay coffee appears to be a good alternative. I have used it for 2 weeks and it seems to be compatible with the Keurig machine. The coffee taste is good. I prefer a stronger taste and am ok with it a bit more bitter. As a frame of reference, I find the average 7 oz cup too weak and use the 3 or 5oz setting.

As others have noted, the coffee comes in small bags of 8 "pods" each. You have to put the open bag in a ziploc bag for storage because the coffee in the pods is exposed in the filter.

I really like the price of the SF Bay coffee. It is good value and feel like I have a choice.

I am not a SF Bay employee or shareholder. I just want reasonable pricing and choice.

Great coffee at a better price. I like this much better than Starbucks kcup french roast.  This is smoother with less bitterness than Starbucks.  I am sold. This is now my 2nd order. I love the design of the kcups better. There is so much less plastic which results in a better taste. They have a top and the remainder is paper filter. Just pop them in like regular kcups. Better for the environment while cutting down on the harmful effects of plastic absorbtion in your body.

We picked these up at our warehouse club store... They are under forty cents per cup. Delicious, dark roast. I love the fact that each k-cup has an exposed filter rather than the plastic cups. We will be sticking to these!

I bought this at a local HEB in Texas for $6.99 and was skeptical but alas! this is great in my Platinum Keurig. I had decided not to use k cups anymore because the price is over the top but these will keep me going until Keurig prices come down!
