More than two years ago I switched to the oh-so-convenient K-Cups, despite reservations about brewing coffee in little plastic cups. (1)Very hot water steeps in Plastic cups. (2)Lots of little plastic cups go into landfills or incinerators. Now, finally, there's a product with all the convenience of the K-cup brewers, but none of the drawbacks! Why didn't someone think of this sooner?

I really like this coffee. It's bold, yet smooth as well. I especially appreciate the simpler packaging with much less plastic waste. Additionally, I don't think the coffee grounds touch plastic at all, just the foil top and filter. They work impeccably in my Keurig.

Summary: Less waste, great taste, go for it!
Text: Our family really likes this brand of coffee.  The package the coffee by the dozen in plastic bags to ensure freshness and the taste is a mild to medium flavor.  The subscribe and save is a great way to save money (around fourteen dollars for thirty six cups) and ensure you're never without coffee.  Although it's still wasteful, each cup has less plastic than the regular k-cup coffees out there.  I actually like that you can see the coffee and the little filter pouch it sits in.  We recently found out that costco is selling this brand of coffee (french roast - which is much more bold) for a more economical price (eighty cups for around thirty six cents a piece).  We will continue to purchase and suggest you try it out at least once.
I like a bolder coffee than my husband does and this one is good enough for me. It leaves a pleasant after-flavor. I am impressed also with the design of the cups. I'd certainly order it again.
It was much too "sharp/harsh" for me.  Had to add cinnamon and half-and-half just to get it down.  Really sorry I purchased two boxes of it!

Summary: Only decent coffee. Poorly filtered and goes stale
Text:
I purchased this because another reviewer likened it to Coffee People's Jet Fuel. Unfortunately it is not even close.
The first cup seemed fine. The flavor immediately after brewing is good, but as soon as it cools down some it turns harsh fast.
The open-filter is a poor design. It can and absolutely will go stale. I compared the scent of the final coffee pouch(cup?) from a previously opened bag to a newly opened, and the scent is completely different. Think old coffee can vs. freshly opened.
The other gripe on the filter is the poor filtration. There is always sediment at the bottom of the cup.

About me: I am very picky about my coffee. I drink it straight black and brew at 8oz with double filtered water in a Cuisinart Keurig coffee maker. I don't reuse k-cups!
My favorite coffees are Coffee People's Black Tiger and Jet Fuel, Caribou's Mahogany and Van Houtte's Eclipse.

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Fog Chaser,
Text: Both my wife and I like this coffee.  one brew per cup for her is how she likes.  I brew a cup 1-1/2 times to get the flavor I like.  Very good price.  If there is a down side it would be the container is not your typical k-kup, rather a round filter at the bottom holding the coffee.  It works fine in the Keurig and we keep ours unused in an air tight container to keep fresh

The San Francisco Bay coffee was delivered to my home very quickly and I found the product to be professionally wrapped in several small packages offering fresh coffee over the entire period of use; Amazon puts a lot of thought into what they sell and how they sell it.

While I found the product different and a bit stronger in the beginning I think I will tray another brand not quite as strong next time.

Love this coffee - when it first arrived I thought I had ordered the wrong thing as the "pods" are quite different from regular K-cups, but they work perfectly and I think the coffee tastes much better than the coffee in the plastic pods.  The Fog Chaser is a nice, not-too-strong, coffee, perfect for that first wake up cup in the morning.

Summary: Best value for quality k-cup coffee!
Text: From the moment I cut open the sealed bag containing the coffee pods, I could appreciate the quality of this coffee, as the wonderful aroma enveloped my senses.  The coffee taste only bolstered my appreciation, as the flavor was rich and delicious.  Highly recommended!  (Note: I have no connection with this company... just a happy customer)

Summary: Great bold flavor and great value
Text: Love these k-cups, bold flavor similar to Jet Fuel or Big Easy with less of a French roast flavor.  I can actually get a 12 Oz. cup and still have good flavor.
wonderful full bodied coffee and a great price; much less 'offensive' packaging than a normal K-cup; works just like a normal K-cup; no problems.

Summary: This is the best one yet!
Text:
"Fog Chaser"...a great description! Extremely fresh. The taste is surprisingly deep and rich for a medium roast, or "Full City." I usually drink a darker roast just to get the extra bit of flavor, but this one is even better than San Francisco Bay's French Roast. The only other coffees that come close are Brooklyn Bean Roastery "Fuhgeddaboudit" and "Cyclone," two of my other favorites, along with Green Mountain Revv.

Keep in mind that these are "pods" rather than actual k-cups, so after you open the bag, you will need to seal the unused capsules in a zip bag, preferably in the refrigerator (not the freezer). Doing this, I've never had the coffee go stale. If you like deep, flavorful coffee, I recommend you give this one a try.

The design of these pods are so much better than the Kcups. Give a full bodied rich cup of delicious coffee.
Wish there were more flavor options in this packaging. Fantastic!!

Good option for K-Cup coffee makers.  The filter pod fits right into the machine and brews a great cup of coffee with less plastic waste.  The packaging allows a pretty good price point, but for a stronger better tasting coffee  (you know the one named after the actor) I will stay with club stores 80 pack for $39, keeping the coffee price just below that 50c mark.
The taste was ok, but every cup ended up having sediment at the bottom of the cup.  I will not be buying this brand again.  So far, Brooklyn Bean Cyclone and Coffee People Jet Fuel are my favorites.

No sediment, just great tasting (and smelling) coffee.  Tired of Emeril's constant price changes and packaging changes.  This is as hearty as Emeril and as smooth with less waste to Mother Earth and much less money.  Very impressed, been using Keurig for over 5 years and this coffee is great.

I am not big on posting reviews but this coffee is awesome!  The aroma when you open the bag, the smell while it is brewing, I just cant say enough good about this coffee!!  Yes is it not the same K-Cup we are used to seeing - so what!!!  It works great and I will just store them in a canister - it is worth it for a good strong cup of coffee.  Something, in my opinion, that has been missing from K-cup selections.  Hope this review helps!!

I like the concept of eco-friendly packaging. It fit and brewed in my Keurig just as a regular K-cup does. The coffee was smooth and aromatic but a bit too smoky for my taste. Maybe I will try a different blend.

After living in Europe for 6 years, I have become very picky about coffee. I am not a "coffee snob"...I can't tell what aroma a coffee may or may not have; I can just taste the difference between good and bad coffee. Don't be fooled by the price of this coffee or the different looking k-cup; this coffee is top-notch. If you like good coffee, this is worth a try.

****EDIT****

I thought about writing a long rant, about how the negative reviewers of this coffee, don't know what good coffee taste like, but I thought twice. They just like a different taste to their coffee. So instead, if you like Folgers, Maxwell House, Green Mountain, The Coffee People, etc., you will probably not like this coffee. The people who will like this, should know who they are, by my previous comment. I did find a couple of varieties of coffee from the same manufacture I did somewhat enjoy; Coffee People - Black Tiger, Green Mountain - Black Magic and Sumatran Reserve, although I did not like it enough, to purchase them again.

Here is a list of coffee I really enjoy and come in K-Cups.
Caribou Mahogany, Starbucks Sumatra and Pikes Place.
Thses cooffee pods are extra nice because there is much less plastic and work just as well.  The flovor is nice and bold without being bitter.  I have re-ordered and will continue to do so.

Very smooth with no aftertaste, slightly bold. I use a medium size setting, I think 7 1/4 oz. on my maker. It seems necessary to store them in an airtight container after opening, to keep fresh. One of my current favorites.

I stumbled upon this coffee while browsing Amazon and was instantly interested because of the price and when I looked further I saw that it had much less plastic.  I decided to try it.  It is sooo  good.  I can see this being my new favorite coffee.  I will have to see how it stores.  I do like that there are 3- 12 packs so I only have to open 12 pods at once.  I'll store them in tupperware or something but I can't imagine it will be much of a problem.  It really really is a wonderful, strong, flavorful cup of coffee.  Thank you SF Bay Coffee.

Great coffe! Ordered the French roast to see if it is as good. The pod design is very good.
Enjoy!

This is one that truly seems to depend on your taste in coffee.  I served it to five people at the office because I personally love it.  Two of them said they couldn't finish the cup, while the other three thought it was the best they've had. I personally like the more traditional taste of brewed coffee that this product produces.  The plastic k-cups always seemed to have an awkward taste to them, almost as if I wasn't really drinking coffee.  I do get a small amount of sediment in the bottom of the cup, but also don't mind that.  Since it does turn the inside of my white cup pretty black, I suppose I should also start thinking about what it's doing to my teeth and my insides, but the flavor seems to make it all worthwhile anyhow.  At the office it was clearly a love it or hate it type reaction - this from four people who usually choose a bold coffee and one who always drinks light (but happened to love this).

After buying the SFB French Roast K-Cups, I thought I would give the Fog Chaser a chance. Wow! What a good and strong cup of coffee. Stronger than the French Roast. I will keep buying these!

Just an update: Recently I found k-cups on sale and bought a box of what used to be my favorite. After brewing the coffee and drinking it, I realized, I did not like it! The SF Fog Chaser is superior to the k-cups offered. Will not go back to the regular k-cups again.
makes a good cup of coffee at a reasonable cost. not a true k-cup but works well in a keurig.

I stumbled across this coffee, and I'm so glad I did !!!  Just received it today, was curious so I made a cup.  Great flavor, a bit bold, but very smooth.  I think my husband will love it tomorrow morning.  Signed up for the auto shipments, which takes the price a bit lower and I don't have to place an order every month.  Great product and love the auto ship !!!!

Summary: San Francisco Bay Coffee OneCup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers
Text: I was a bit skeptical when I saw to alternative to the original K-Cup,  I tried the Fog Chaser and have to say it is a great product.  Good balanced flavor and strong too.  I usually buy coffee by the case at Costco but this is a superior option.  Less plastic also makes them more ecologically friendly and potentially recyclable.  Two Thumbs Up!

I am so glad I read the reviews on this coffee product.  The cups fit the Keurig very well and make a tasty cup of coffee!  I like the fact that there is no plastic base to it (less plastic in the trash).  I will buy it again and again.  My favorite coffee thus far.  I have subscribed to this so it will be shipped automatically every month.

Summary: Nice taste, but can buy it for less elsewhere.
Text: Fog Chaser is a pleasant tasting cup of coffee. I like the more environmentally friendly cup/pod design, but since it comes twelve in a plastic bag, I don't know if it is a net eco-plus. I also can buy it at Wegman's for much less than from Amazon.

This is an intense, rich, flavorful coffee. While I like a robust flavor, this one seems quite acidic. It does "chase fog", for sure! I think it has a real caffeine kick to it. The cups are intersting in that they have a wider brim so they fit right into the Keurig without touching the bottom poker. I brewed a 12oz. cup and a 16oz. cup. The 16 was more to my liking, but the acidity of the coffee made it difficult to finish either cup. Just a little too strong for my liking. Interesting packaging. We drink several cups a day, so I don't believe it would get stale. And they do fit right in the carousel.

This is a great full bodied coffee. I have tasted different brands and have a few I would call favorites, this is one. The design of the K-Cup without the plastic cup at the bottom is very different but you don't even miss it. You will love the taste of this coffee.
I haven't tried the other flavors San Francisco Bay puts out but I'm tempted.
good coffee not to strong not to weak enjoyed very much will continue to order this brand of coffee in the future. Thanks so much

Summary: Robust Alternative for Discontinued San Lorenzo Dark
Text: Another manufacturer recently discontinued my favorite k-cup and I have been searching for a replacement - Fog Chaser is my choice - robust and flavorful, it is best consumed black - it certain chases the fog of sleep and and helps to get my days started.

Hands down, this coffee is the best K-cup compatible product available..  Filter system is superior to K-Cup, much of the natural coffee oils actually make it into your cup.....  HIGHLY RECOMMEND - subscribe and save a +

Bravo for the new Eco Friendly Pod.  I actually forgot what fresh, real coffee tastes like.  At first I was taking back but the strong, robust flavor.  Then after a few sniffs and sips I felt rejuvenated.  For the first time since I got my Keurig I realized that I missed fresh brewed coffee.  The taste is so fresh, so lively, so good.  The price is also an added bonus.  This Crazy Coffee Mom is really hooked.

Summary: Don't let the different form factor scare you off - they'll work in your Keurig
Text:
These work just fine in any Keurig-style coffee maker - if it uses K-Cups, it can use these. If anything, these are probably a bit more environmentally-friendly than standard K-Cups simply by virtue of containing far less plastic.

The only problem is, they just don't taste that good. The coffee itself leaves something to be desired, surprising considering the history of the company that makes these. (full disclosure: I worked briefly for these folks back in the late '70s. Since I have a personal connection to the products, I really wanted to like them) I liked this better than the Rainforest Blend (which I found weak and watery) but not as much as the French Roast. (which I didn't really care for that much when I first tasted it, but found it grew on me as I worked my way through the case and compared it with other K-Cups)

Keep in mind that this review is based on a single cup, and I didn't really like the French Roast when I first tasted it either, so you might want to take this with a grain of salt until I've had a few more opportunities to sample the product and compare it to other varieties. I'll update if my opinion changes with time, but on first try, I doubt I'd buy this again. It's better than the Rainforest Blend, but I'd be more likely to buy the French Roast than this.

Like other One Cup varieties, these leave a bit more sediment in the bottom of the cup and produce more "crema" - the brownish foam floating on top of a good cup of coffee - than most traditional K-Cups. The Fog Chaser seems to produce less than either the French Roast or the Rainforest Blend, for what it's worth. I found the flavor just a little on the thin and bitter side.
It fits fine in my Kreuig.  My low rating is for taste. It was ok, not terrible... but not something I am excited to have in the mornings.  Put some flavored creamer in it and all's good.

Summary: Coffee as good as green mountain!
Text: Just recieved this coffe for the first time. San Francisco Bay "Fog Chaser", I like a bold coffee and this one delivers...great balance flavor and this cup design works great! With so much less waste and the price is outstanding! Thanks San Francisco Coffee Co.

Summary: Best Keurig cup of coffee I've had!!
Text: These "cups" have a little filter at the bottom instead if a plastic cup which allows for less waste in the trash can, yeah!! I always felt kind of guilty putting so many plastic cups in the garbage. Now to the coffee it is absolutely the best I have had.  A 10oz cup is possible without tasting too watery, especially with the French roast.  Every one of the Rogers family cups are great.  The fog chaser is a little smoother than the french roast but nice and dark.  The french roast is great also not quite as bitter as the usual french roast even the decaf is great.  This coffee rivals fresh brewed easily and is less expensive which is a bonus for those of us who want the freedom of K cups but don't like the price.  I will buy this brand from now on, I am a loyal customer of this Old San Francisco Bay Coffee.  Rogers family thanks for bringing real coffee to Keurig.

Summary: Yay, less plastic! Boo, weak coffee!
Text: These smell FANTASTIC! Too bad the coffee is weak. When the machine brews, the last 70% of the stream is hot water. (Every other K-Cup brews fine.)

OK, I know there are over 200 reviews, but I just had to add my two cents. THis is by far THE BEST approach to this one cup (kcup) system. Not dispensing with the pod system, which is slightly less toxic to the environment. Ok, so without a doubt a step in the right direction on the kcup systems; but the coffee....WOW..this stuff hits your nose when you open the bag and keeps hitting it each time I open the zip lock I put them into, after opening the original ( slight dig on the company for not making a resealable bag..come on man! Anyway, can't say enough about the coffee, I have tried just about every bold, dark, espresso, medium roast, you name it, and this one is my favorite so far.
I may have to buy some beans or grounds to use to make my own.

Thanks!

I really like the idea of the large filter on the bottom.  I hate when one of my K-cups would not work correctly and leak everywhere but this design prevents that. The coffee tastes great with no bitter after taste. I will be buying this again!
This particular coffee is a bit strong for my taste. It was worth a try and you certainly get good amount of coffee for the money.

Summary: Great coffee, less waste in packaging
Text: This coffee is a good selection if you like a dark, full-bodied brew to chase the fog, and dislike the waste inherent with the convenience of a Keurig K-cup brewer. Works great, less material waste and less packaging waste. I do think it is a good idea to keep them in a sealed container, but an old coffee can works great.

Summary: Not bad - Had better - I'd buy it again
Text:
The flavor of the the Fog Chaser is pretty good. Bold, yet not "too" strong.
The cup design seems to work/brew okay, just maybe allows for a small amount of "fines" to sneak into the coffee cup.
The price is attractive and makes it a "re-buy" if I'm running low on Coffee People Donut Shop...
These need to be kept in a air tight container. I use a zip baggie.

This is a great idea to reduce packaging and works great on the kuerig brewer.  The coffee was wonderful, and the price was much better than the regular k-cups. I would love to see them come in flavored coffee also.

When I ordered this coffee, I hoped the majority of the reviews were correct, and they were. I am really happy with Fog Chaser. I've bounced around through all the Keurig dark roasts and in my opinion, this is better than all of them. The aroma and taste far surpass any K-cup I've ever had. I store the coffee in an air-tight container, and have had no problems with freshness. They work perfectly in my B70 brewer, and I do wash the K-cup holder every couple of days or so because these have a real filter instead of plastic. The price is great, especially with Subscribe and Save - never going back to plastic K-Cups!
This is some great coffee. My wife likes it too. It has a good blend of flavors and isn't too bitter. I'll keep ordering it.
A perfect blend, and a good bargain.  The coffee "pod" cups fit perfectly in the Keurig.  I bought this coffee for my husband who is a fussy coffee drinker.  He loves it!

This was a new item for me, believe me I have tried them all. The new type of K-cup is great! It lets the coffee drain much better.  I am ordering more...Thanks San Francisco Bay Coffee for your new way of packaging.

Summary: Great way to make K cup coffee
Text: Great coffee flavor.  Great price!  Like this method.  Use coffee canister to store once open package.  I use the subscription for an even better price.
This was a new brand for our Keurig, so I did not know what to expect. I was surprised with no "k-cup" - but this works very well and seems "greener." Tastes great.

I like coffee but I don't have a palate that can differentiate between a coffee with subtle hints of vanilla, grass and one with "smokiness." I just know whether I like it or not. To me there's two kinds of coffee, the smooth kind and the kind that has a bite.

I feel like Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts have a bite to them, something that makes them different. This Fog Chaser coffee is like that. There's something about it that makes it different and I think it's really good!

The cups are not your normal K cup so I just got a metal tin and put them in there to keep them fresh.

If you do the subscribe and save on amazon, it makes these cups very affordable (for k cups).

Overall, very good coffee.
Bold taste, but the roast isn't too strong.  This is a nice, every-day cup.  Brews well in Keurig.  I also bought the Rainforest and French Roast (which I love).

Coffee has a very good taste, is not bitter and has a pleasant aroma. The only problem I have with it is it comes in a fiber womb, not plastic like most other K-Cups. And sometimes it allows the coffee sediment to leak through. It doesn't happen all the time, found to be about 20-25% of the time. Also you have to place cups in a zip lock baggie to keep fresh, after you open Mfg's.bag. If it weren't for this I would have given it 5 Stars.

Summary: Not Quite a K-Cup, but awesome coffee!
Text: First of all, the coffee is quite rich, and definitely appropriately labeled Fog Chaser!  Non bitter, smooth bold medium-dark roast.  It is one of my personal favorites.  But the purchaser should be aware of how this coffee is packaged. It works great in the Keurig machines but the packaging is not a true K-cup.  A K-cup, as designed (and probably patented), is a small plastic cup sealed with a foil lid, under which is a coffee filter pouch of a single serving of coffee.  The packaging on this does not have the plastic cup encasing the foil lid and filter paper pouch of coffee.  I suspect the manufacturer is saving in paying licensing fees from using the K-Cup design by excluding the cup.  But you have to use different storage containers for these packages, as using the usual racks and other means of storing K-Cups will allow air to get to the coffee and cause it to go stale unless stored in an air-tight container or plastic bag.  Also, this packaging may not work in Keurig brewers that automatically dispose of the spent K-Cups.  Another slight inconvenience is that the brewed package leaves a wet coffee filter sack of coffee grounds, whereas with a genuine K-Cup, the spent package only has one small hole in the bottom of the plastic cup, the rest of the package is dry upon disposal handling.

The moment I opened the bag I knew this was going to be good. The Aroma was FANTASTIC.
I have this in my office at work and several other people have had a "wow" reaction to the aroma.

Summary: Fantastic Product and a BIG Surprise
Text:
I am very surprised that the biggest secret about San Francisco Bay single service coffee , which works perfectly in famous brand K-Cup makers, has not been revealed in any of the previous comments. Or at least I did not find the secret yet revealed. I love Amazon.com and am a high volume customer but folks, you can get this product at COSTCO at a significant savings. An 80 count box at COSTCO is just around $30; unit cost is about 34 cents. Do not hesitate because of the 80 count box. The contents are packed 8 units to a heavy duty sealed nitrogen filled bag that will hold for over a year. You will find the 'good until' date clearly printed on each bag. When you cut open the bag (you will need scissors) the phenomenal fragrance of freshly ground French Roast coffee comes right at you. If you like that rich smell of fresh ground, this will be almost as good as when you drink it after brewing.

So is this a good coffee? I am an old restaurant guy and I always prefer my coffee rich, dark and not bitter. I tried virtually all the K-cup samplers available so I could do a comparison of the DARKS, BOLDS and FRENCH ROASTS I could find. Other than a few Sumatra brews, this SF BAY product stood out at the top of the list. That even includes the really expensive stuff that is good but not good enough to be price competitive or flavor superior. If you do not at least try this coffee in your K-Cup brewer, you are missing a unique opportunity for quality and value. If you shop at COSTCO, you need to look for it and get the best competitive single serve French Roast around town. You will also find that San Francisco Bay bulk coffees have been sold at COSTCO for a very long time.

Now, about that little filter material container in place of the plastic cup you are used to seeing. Well, the Rodgers Family who produce all the San Francisco Bay Coffees (and other labels), are independent and want us all to get their premium coffees without having to pay the Royalties to use the "K-Cup" brand name...and they do not want to infringe on copyright designs, so they were inspired to have this design created. The entire container portion of the unit is indeed a filter and allows for the best extraction methodology.

You must be asking yourself if I am a "shill" for this company and the answer is an emphatic NO. I am just a life long student of consumer economics and I really like to give credit when and where it is earned. The Rodgers family business is located in Lincoln, California in the vicinity of where I live - and I also like to support my local business.

You may forget all about what I have said here, but you will always remember San Francisco Bay French Roast once you have tasted it.

Like others here I am always on the lookout for a K-Cup bargain. With such an attractive price I finally decided to give San Francisco Bay's Fog Chaser a chance. I was a little worried about the unique design of these cups. However, after receiving them and brewing a couple of cups of coffee I can say that there was no need to worry. I would describe this coffee as Medium roast, maybe leaning towards dark. It has a nice distinctive flavor, and the Amazon Frustration Free packaging really is frustration free. We store our open cups in a sealed container to help maintain freshness. All in all a good cup of coffee, and as long as the price remains competitive I will be a repeat customer.

Summary: New K-Cup brewers are great, especially the lower price.
Text:
I'm thrilled that we can now purchase less expensive K-cups.
Keurig was definitely getting too expensive for me.
I tried the Fog Chaser, it was good, clean-tasting coffee but not as strong
as I thought it should be. And the free shipping from Amazon makes it
more appealable. Will be purchasing again.

What a surprise when I got home from the grocery store and opened this package to find cups that really look nothing like the ones you are used to. I was a little worried when I saw that instead of all plastic, this actually is made out of very little plastic and the coffee is actually held in material just like regular coffee filters. I love that they are not as destructive to the environment as the others. The company really believes in freshness since they put these little pod/pouches in a sealed pouch and then stick them in the cardboard.

Now mind you I am truly wedded to my Green Mountain Dark Magic, but I decided to try this because of the price. And I'm not one bit sorry I did, I feel a tad guilty for semi-abandoning my Green Mountain! This Fogchaser blend makes a good strong cup of coffee without giving me the feeling that the lining of my stomach is going to burn out.

I'm thrilled to see that I now have an alternative to Green Mountain and I can even save money since it is at least 3 dollars cheaper (at least in my grocery store) a package.

Decided to give this a try since k-cup (all coffee?) prices have been going up. Brewed with the large mug (not tumbler) size on my Keurig B70. It isn't as dark as Peet's from my ekobrew adapter, but that might be because Peet's does a darker roast. Stronger than Green Mtn Colombian. Maybe about the same as Dark Magic.

Coworkers agreed that we'll probably buy more since we don't have to do any coupons from other vendors to get good coffee at this price.

Summary: A step in the right perfection
Text:
5:45 a.m. The alarm just went off. You want to be on the road before 7. You find the kitchen, get out the kettle and start the water boiling. Get out the Boodum, fill it up. Wait. Water boils. Pour it in the press. Wait. Wait more. Can't wait any longer. Push plunger, drink, coffee is weak, pillow starts calling your name, you lose the will to shower, next thing you know, it's 8:15 and you're praying for the grid to melt down.

OR, you get up at 5:45 a.m., drop a K-Cup in your Keurig, push a button and your cup runneth over (especially if you accidentally pushed the button with the picture of the mug on it). And if it's San Francisco Bay Fog Cutter, you also get a deliciously rich, full-bodied, fragrant brew that is acid free and gentle on an early morning tummy. Best of all, you can drink your Fog Cutter while waiting for the stuff in the Boodum Coffee Press to be ready. Now you can face the shower, the hair dryer, the curling iron and the eyelash curler without fear.

I prefer the Boodum to the Keurig, but when you need coffee now, this blend can't be beat. It's the best of all the K-Cup offerings that I've tried, and I've tried everything from Donut Shop to Newman's Own and most points in between. It is my early morning wake up favorite.

I was very amused, not to say impressed, by one reviewers comments about the packaging He notes that there is a drawing of a K-Cup type machine on the front of the box and a list of various K-Cup brewers that will accommodate this version of the K-Cup. He points out that the San Francisco Bay Coffee supports many environmental projects, as noted on the top of the box, which also shows photos of these worthy projects. The Rodgers Family, who own the company, are shown in a family photo on one side flap, along with an essay on the company's values. The other flap has a description of the actual coffee. This guy is a whiz in the a.m. I'm happy if I find the sink on the first try.

Anyway, this is the best pre-coffee coffee I've ever had. And it's an excellent main course coffee too.

Enjoy.

Summary: If you like it strong, this one's for you!
Text: This variety is strong and bold!  The price is reasonable as it is.  But, if you want to stretch your K-cup value even more, you can make 2 cups from one K-cup.  I brew a medium and a small cup into my large coffee cup.  And, it's still a strong cup of coffee!  I like this so much that I signed up for subscribe and save!

I generally like the stronger coffees. A lot of the k-cups have been very weak and flavorless. I have nearly finished my first order of the Fog Chaser and it is one of the better coffees I've had for the Keurig. The k-cups are little different than the traditional plastic cups, but who cares? And I can't figure out what "smell" other reviewers are talking about. When you open a bag, it smells like ground COFFEE. Uh, that is not a bad thing. It is because the cups are made of a breathable filter pouch. What does a box of regular K-cups smell like? Plastic cups?
Each twelve comes in its own sealed plastic bag so I am not worried about them going stale unless it takes you a couple months to drink 12 cups. And the price is much lower than most of the of the other brands. I can't see spending 1 1/2 to 2 times as much for coffee that is either not as good or at best just as good. I singed up for the subscribe and save to get it delivered regularly so I dont run out. I just hope others find it as great tasting as I do so amazon keeps carrying it!

I wish I didn't feel like I have to give this product a low rating, but I wouldn't buy it again without some changes. It's really delicious coffee -- bold and flavorful, without the mouth-puckering acidity of some of the coffee I've tried. The flavor changes as it cools, too. Most delightful.

However. The first time I used one it really made a mess. I had to clean coffee grounds out of the brewing doohickey on the Keurig (which I hate doing because it's tedious), and there was quite a bit of sediment in my cup, too. It's exactly the same thing that happens with my reusable k-cup. I was trying to find an alternative to that, and to contributing so many of those little plastic planet-polluter K-cups to the landfill. (We drink a lot of coffee.)

If the company could find a way to keep that from happening -- a coarser grind, maybe? -- I'd for sure try this again. I can use the remaining pods, though. They'll be handy for traveling with. I tried opening one and brewing the coffee in my Aeropress and they're just right for that.

And then, later on...
I had to come back and update this review. We ran out of Kcups, and I dug these out of the cupboard in desperation. My husband likes them so much that I'm ordering more, messy or not. BTW, he said he considers the sediment minimal, and not much of an issue at all.

After having the conventional plastic packaged k cup brand coffees this was a very eco-friendly and satisfying alternative.  I have tried each of the Rogers family flavors and find them all aromatic and good tasting.  Only one downfall, as they cannot be stored in my countertop carousel.  This flavorful coffee is well worth the inconvenience of having to store the unused cups in an air tight container.  Who would think that such an economical coffee could taste so good.

After reading the reviews that indicated a non-traditional k-cup packaging, I was a little leery-- but the packaging works well in my coffee maker and leaves no residue in the cup. The coffee is delicious-- I tend to prefer strong blends and this is satisfying. Good product, good price.

Summary: The best K cup coffee so far
Text: I have owned a Keurig for about 2 years now and this is by far the tastiest cup of coffee I've had and I've tried LOTS. I love the little paper filter as opposed to the full plastic jacket of most K-cups. It's a keeper!

These brilliant K-cups have about 10-20% of the plastic of a normal K-cup.  A persistent criticism of K-Cups in the press is the amount of plastic that winds up in the landfill.  We all know (and love) the ease of popping in a cup, pressing the brew button, and tossing the cup afterwards.  So easy!  However I've always felt guilty about the waste, as normally I compost coffee grounds and of course there is no plastic associated with a paper coffee filter.  You can buy refillable K-cups but none of them fit my B30 apparently and anyway the convenience factor diminishes greatly.  These work in my B30 perfectly.  It's hard for me to judge the taste - I add milk and sugar - but the bouquet is pleasing.

Summary: You really can have it all
Text:
Function: these cupless k-cups work perfectly in our Keurig B130 (the business version of the small personal brewer).

Less waste: I was terribly disappointed when I discovered that the plastic k-cups aren't recyclable. These are a terrific low-guilt, more responsible alternative.

Less storage space: they take up much less room to store. I buy my k-cups in quantity to save money, but then I had to dedicate a large cabinet to storing them! Not so with these, partially because they're less bulky and partially because...

Great Price: these k-cups are much less expensive than other brands, especially at the Subscribe & Save price. At this price, I can buy less at a time and still pay way less per cup than I could finagle with coupons & sales & bargain-shopping the major brands.

Taste: Ok, obviously this is the most important factor...and so as soon as they arrived I threw one in and...hurray, they're tasty! Fog Chaser is a slightly less strong taste than I usually drink, but I find it pleasant & smooth & complex in flavor. It tastes like it smells, which is very nice.

Conclusion: I'm keeping my subscription. How can you beat cheap, tasty, less bulky, and less waste? You really can have it all.

Update a month later: this roast has really grown on me!
This coffee has a wonderful flavor.  It is very aromatic.  I love this coffee and the price!  I love my Keurig, but k cups are spendy.  This product is perfect.

Wow! When I first tried this coffee my response was "That's way too strong"! And yet, after getting into the 2nd cup, I found that I am starting to enjoy real coffee again. Definitely the big favorite in our house, and highly recommended. Also, a little less plastic in the landfill, so that's a plus.

Summary: Great Coffee -- some of cups flawed
Text:
Yes, these cups have to be kept in a bag or jar to keep their freshness. However, there are only 12 cups per bag, so I didn't find any flavor loss when I clipped the bag closed. I used 12 in about 15-18 days.

I loved the flavor: a nice, rich cup when set on medium setting on my Keurig (which is what I always use except for some weak flavored blends). They fit perfectly in my B70 Keurig -- and I love saving on extra packaging.

But I had a problem I don't see anyone else mentioning: Of the 36 cups total, 3 were duds. The water flowed them, but only light brown water came out. Three out of 36 is too high a failure rate for me. With regular k-cups (of which I've used at least 1200 in 5 years), I've only had maybe 5 duds.

Therefore I rate this as 3-stars for now (not less as I don't see anyone else having had this problem). I might try this or another flavor again at some point because the coffee is good and the price is right. Then we'll see...

I purchased the Fogchaser Kcups and really enjoyed the strong earthy taste. The coffee tastes like "organic" grown beans. I stopped buying Kcups because I just wasn't getting the caffeine kick that I demand from my coffee. San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser coffee is the only Kcup coffee I have ever purchased that actually tastes like strong black coffee as opposed to the usual Kcup brew of hot colored water.

I will definitely keep my "Subscribe and Save" order for SFB Fog Chaser coffee.
Coffee is excellent.  The K-Cup is different in that a filter is at the bottom and really provides a great taste.  Set up a subscription and you can not beat the quality and price!

I have been having trouble with my small Keurig with the regular kcups.  (this is the smallest Mr Coffee made by Keurig and is brand new), but it would only brew half a cup and sometimes the pressure would rupture the seal on the k cup and grounds would overflow...I bought the San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser and not only is the taste awesome...but my keurig loves them...I think the filter bottom vs, the plastic cup allows the water to flow thru better and I get a full cup every time and no more mess!  I was going to return the Keurig and try something different...Not now!  Mr. Coffee Single Serve Powered by Keurig Brewing Technology

Summary: By far the best cup of coffee ever!!!
Text: I received a Keurig machine as a gift for my birthday and had been using the regular run of the mill products that were available.  Then low and behold I found the San Francisco Bay brand of one cup brewing pods and you could not pay to stop using them!  By far the best cup of coffee ever, every single time!

Life is hectic and it's the small things that matter.  A fresh start to each day with a cup of great coffee!  The personalized product of the one cup San Francisco Bay is AMAZING!  The depth, aroma, flavor, color are far superior to others on the market.  Great quality, great price, great cup of coffee-

Summary: Good coffee with one BIG flaw!
Text: I really liked this coffee, but it will not be on my list of coffees to buy again because of the one major flaw.  It comes in a sealed bag and when you open it, the aroma is tantalizing.  Too bad it is so short lived.  Unless you are going to drink 12 cups of coffee, or have a bigger family who will in one day, that is the last fresh cup you will get.  There is no bottom to this K-cup except what would be around a pod of coffee so the air destroys it quickly.  After I took out the few we would need for breakfast, I sealed the unused "k-cups" in a plastic bag, but for the next couple mornings when I got some out, the aroma had faded more and more.  I love the way the original K-cups stay fresh until you use them, and these are not like that.  I also didn't like how I couldn't put them in my carousel of other K-cups.  Kind of a pain to have them sealed in the cupboard until I wanted them.  Don't get me wrong, the coffee was excellent when we first opened the package, but the quality diminished quickly.  If you are one of those people who drinks the same kind of coffee every morning and have several people drinking it, this may work for you.  I like to have variety in the morning whether it be Jet Fuel or Italian roast according to how I feel that day so these won't be purchased by me again.

Summary: This is supposed to be French Roast????
Text:
I went into this purchase with an open mind. I liked the price and thought about how nice it would be to finally get a serious French Roast for my Keurig. Unfortunately this one did not measure up in the strength of flavor dept. I may try some of their other coffees though because I liked everything else about them very much. I just need my French Roast to have more punch than this one.

***** price
***** fast shipping
** French Roast flavor

Sorry guys but I'll stick with Midnight Magic and Jet Fuel for now.

Please some show me a reasonably priced French Roast K cup that actually tastes like a French Roast.

Summary: Great coffee. Great price. Get a ziploc & enjoy
Text:
I like strong coffee and this coffee taste very good even when brewed on the big/travel mug setting. It's flavorful, not burnt tasting, and has a good kick. And to me represents a standout value in the world of Keurig choices. Do the math, especially with Subscribe and Save. I know some folks complain about them losing freshness... I just transfer them to a ziplock bag upon opening the package. Not a big deal and I don't sense I've lost freshness.

I'd dock them half a star for the bag-to-bag transfer (here's an idea: package them with a zipper, like cold cuts!) but it still rounds up to 5 stars. :-)

I have purchased these k-cup/pods a couple of times.  They brew a nice strong cup of coffee.  Bold flavor without bitterness.  These pods work great in my Keurig.  They brew a great clean cup of coffee.  I haven't had a problem with freshness because I go through a twelve pack in a few days.  If you want a flavorful and bold cup of coffee give Fog Chaser a try.

I at first thought I ordered the wrong product, and had to go back and check. This defeats much of the purpose of a K-Cup, having a sealed package with nitrogen gas to keep it fresh until ready to use. When I opened the bag, it was a great smell, as all the aroma escaped into the atmosphere!
Know how do you keep the rest fresh? Opening and closing a zip lock isn't going to cut it, as air gets in each time.
Also, without the cup, I don't think the coffee gets a chance to 'seep' long enough, as it seems a bit weak for something called Fog Cutter.
Think I'll avoid this one in the future.

I found this coffee to be a bit too mild and flavorless for my taste. It reminded me a lot of the coffee I sometimes have to have when the family all wants to stop at Mcdonalds for breakfast. I also found that the coffee pods/K-cup quickly lost its freshness after two days. I had it inside an air tight container but soon after a couple of days the freshness was gone and the aroma of the coffee smelled like the can of Folgers that my mother-in-law has on her shelf. They also make a french roast which I thought was OK. But again, a bit weak for a french roast coffee. The french roast coffee, as was with the fog chaser,after a couple of days, soon lost its flavor and the aroma became "Folgers coffee" like. I guess the packaging makes a difference. In conclusion, I do not think I will be purchasing this again.

I picked this up at a Fresh & Easy.  While I like the idea of more choices than the officially licensed K-Cups, this is just not a good coffee.  It tastes bitter and bland.  Not recommended.  Try Millstone's Fogchaser K-Cups instead.

Summary: San Francisco Bay K-Cups for Keurig Brewers
Text: Outstanding Cup of Coffee!  I have tried at least 20-25 different K-Cups for the Keurig Brewer.I highly recommend this one!  The aroma of the coffee in the K-Cup was fresh and smelled like the beans had just been ground. The flavor was not bitter or too strong.  I am impressed and now a fan of the San Francisco Bay Coffee makers. I also tried the French Roast and loved it as well. I appreciate other AMAZON users posting their reviews or I would never have tried it.
Excellent coffee and one of the best Keurig cup bargains there is I will buy more of this product and no plastic bottoms

ProfileName: LT "Signed : LT in Beautiful South Florida"
Text:
Loving the Greenmountain Nantucket K-cup . I like a variety of coffee. Love trying new
but Regular types of coffees. I found this to be a nice cup of coffee. Not Acidic at all.
Some people are Starbuck lovers , some poeple are Dunkin Donut coffee Lovers. Im
a Dunkin Donut coffee lover. This coffee was enjoyable to both me and my husband. Would
defintely order again. We love that it has less plastic on the actually pod/k-cup to save
the earth. The downside is that it doesnt fit in our k-cup stand. I actually store
them in a ziplock to keep there freshness. Would be nice if the company when they sold
it had it in a ziploc bag atleast as we had to transfer it to one ours. Other then that.
Great Taste,

I am so happy that I found this coffee. I have been using a Keurig for years now, and tried many of the single use cups on the market. I have even used the cups that you fill with your own coffee, but nothing compares to this San Francisco Bay coffee! And can you beat the price? Love the coffee, love the price and love the convenience of the 80 count box.
This coffee is at least as good as any of the actual Keurig K-cups at a much lower price. I will definitely order it again!
Excellent packaging, aroma, taste and delivery.  A little too bold for my husband's taste (he likes a lighter coffee), so I am not going to hesitate to try the breakfast blend next time.

I actually stopped using my Keurig coffee machine for several months before finding these tasty SF Bay fog chasers.  Now I'm using my k-machine nearly every day again and loving it.  The best part of these k-cups is they're not made entirely out of plastic like all the rest.  I do think that the "all plastic" k-cups affect the overall taste of the coffee.  The fog chasers have a "filter paper" bottom that contributes to a much more authentic brewed coffee taste.  Great deal and a great cup of coffee!!!
This coffee is something all should rave about at the price compared to other you must pay more for a commerical resaurants.

I am a big fan of bolder coffee's and have struggled to find coffee pods that live up to the bold flavor, until now! I am such a fan of the Fog Chaser blend, that I have it on auto ship & save from Amazon!  One taste and you will see!
Much smaller, less plastic than original k-cup style, good flavor and for the value pricing when you use repeated mailing option. Would recommend the bold version.

Yep - I'm totally sold!  And it's about time too :)  I love a strong / bold flavor that's not too bitter.  My favorite brands were Black Tiger by Coffee People and Extra Bold by Paul Newman.  However, the price of K-Cups keeps going up and up! So I saw these and decided to give it a try. I'm a big fan of Amazon's "Subscribe & Save" program b/c it's so flexible where I can choose my delivery from anywhere from once every 1 months, all the way to every 6 months.  So I generally signe-up for the S&S for many things starting off a delivery every 6 months just to see if I like it.  Unfortunately for me I end-up liking many of my S&S items and bumping the delivery to every 2 months! But the price for this at .41 cents is unbeatable.  And the flavor is right up there with my Black Tiger & Extra Bold.  So this is it - I've found my new coffee, at a great price, with less plastic.  A win-win all the way around!

I love my Keurig, but the cost of the cups had me looking for a better deal, and I was getting tired of adding to the plastic in the world with every cup of coffee.  I tried peeling the tops and bought the new lids to iron on (too messy and time consuming) and I do have the refillable cups you can use repeatedly, but those are messy, too.  I always thought the goal of a Keurig was a quick single cup of good coffee without the mess or fuss of a regular coffee maker. During a recent browsing day on Amazon, I ordered this product.  Surprisingly, the missing bottom to the cup is not an issue!  Spouse and I love the coffee, it is rich (read strong) enough for him, and tasty for me (I add a little hot water to mine.)  If you want to recycle the grounds, they are much easier to get to since you only have to tear open the paper basket on the bottom.  The cups come in sealed bags of 10 cups at a time to preserve freshness, so buying 80 is no problem.  This purchase was cheaper than my local Costco, too.  I also bought the decaf, and it is great as well.  Definitely a recommend!

This product is exactly what I have been looking for - a reasonably-priced per-serving K-cup! San Francisco Bay has successfully found a solution to the royalty/licensing issue that has kept K-cup prices in the $0.60-0.80 per-serving range.

My requirements for coffee are best described by Louis L'Amour - "hot as hell and black as sin." Surprisingly, the quality of this coffee tops any Starbuck's I have ever tasted. In fact, having tasted nearly every coffee offered by Gevalia (of which I am a subscriber, and have been for years), I can say San Francisco Bay Coffee rivals even some of the seasonal/limited edition coffees from Gevalia.

For anyone snobbish enough to bad-mouth the quality of this coffee, if one is really such a connoisseur of coffee, one should also know enough to keep the bag tightly closed and preferably in the freezer.

I wish this family-owned company the best of luck, kudos on meeting a market need in such a delicious way, and PLEASE offer subscriptions in 2- or 3-week intervals! 36ct. will not last me a full month!

Protip: Store in an emtpy resealable plastic coffee container in the freezer.

EDIT: Looks to me as though someone was dissatisfied with the coffee (for some reason...maybe poor taste) and reinforced their lack of taste by systematically voting every 5-star rating as Unhelpful. Classy.

I have found this to be an excellennt value for the money.Purchasing this excellent full bodied coffee in bulk is a great way to save money over the full retail costs in the grocery store. I like the fact that the mesh K-cups are easy to refill and reuse when if you order the k-cup disposable lids.
I was going to go back to a traditional coffee maker until I found these pods.  They are the strong and I enjoy the flavor of the coffee.

I just received my order for the San Francisco Bay K-cups "Fog Chaser" I am drinking it as I am writing , it is the BEST....If you like a nice robust coffee with yet a smooth flavor, then this is it. I have tried the actual K-Cup variety and NONE of any of their flavors came even close to this strong, yet , smooth great taste. I will def. be re-ordering this in my future. For the price and the amount you get , $17.49 FOR 36 COUNT whatttttaaaaa deal !!! They are also a lil different then the original K-cups, the have a filter type bottom but fit and brew just fine. I have not tried the Lavazza Gran Crema Expresso or the Dark Hot Chocolate, which was also part of my order, yet... San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Fog Chaser, 36-Count
This is a good strong coffee. The modified k-cup pack works well in my Keurig brewer and I suppose is less wasteful. You can't beat the price especially with subscribe and save!

Summary: Great cuppa Joe with less plastic at a lower price
Text: Really love this newly designed cup for my Keurig. Coffee is delicious and aromatic. Less plastic waste is produced and the price is much lower than the traditional k-cups.

I really didn't know what to expect when I ordered this, but the reviews were mostly good so I tried it. I occasionally like a cup of Tully's Kona (outrageously priced right now) or Folgers Black Silk, but I have made the San Francisco Fog Chaser my regular morning cup. The 36-pod order comes in three air-tight bags of 12 each.  I open them as I use them, putting the pods in a jar to maintain freshness.  Going to order more soon!

Summary: One of the best coffee variety for Keurig!
Text: Having tried 20 or more different k-cup varieties from Amazon over the past 2 years, I must say that this is probably one of the best (if not THE best) k-cup variety I have purchased.  I was skeptical at first because the pictures showed a lack of complete shell for the coffee, and I wasn't sure how the pressure brewing would work.  But I must say that this coffee has more aroma, strength and flavor than most Keurig brewed coffees.  It comes in small bags, containing 12 each.  I usually transfer them to a freezer bag right away once I open each bag.  This helps keep the flavor a little more.  I like it so much that I started my first coffee subscription from Amazon for this product!  If you love coffee, you MUST give this a try, at least once.

I used to like to try different coffees but after wasting (a lot) of money buying kinds that were a disappointment, I've finally found one to stick with. San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser is my favorite Great coffee - deep, rich, full bodied but not bitter. I especially appreciate the minimal plastic used in the cup. Cups don't fit 100% in my Keurig storage turntable but they do fit. They just fall out a bit more easily.

I was skeptical about this coffee packaging but read the reviews and took the plunge. I was SOOOOO amazed at this coffee. First of all, it is a wonderful, decent strength coffee with no bitterness. Secondly, the packaging is much better for the environment. Thirdly, the value is outstanding!! Just be prepared for a small amount of residue at the end of the cup, a minor thing for such a great coffee!!!

I read the other reviews and decided to give this brand and style of Keurig cup a try. I, like many, am now a believer. The coffee is excellent and I agree with others who say the taste is enhanced by eliminating the plastic cups other brands use. My wife who is not a "coffee drinker" (per se) even prefers these. Also, the price is relatively reasonable.

We took a chance after reading the good reviews for this coffee.  We love it.  I find the way they package it to be great for the environment as there is almost no waste.  We keep it sealed in zip lock bags to retain freshness.  We will order it again.

I consider myself a bit of a coffee snob. Living alone I love K-cups ability to brew a single cup instead of wasting a whole pot. I have tried dozens of different K-cups and all of them made a decent cup of coffee but when I really wanted something good I had to use the french press. These K-cups are by far the best. I love opening up a bag of them and smelling that sweet smell of coffee, something you just don't get with the plastic ones. The taste of these is bolder and stronger than even the most potent plastic version. Lastly these will biodegrade a lot quicker than the plastic ones making them better for the environment.

One last quick tip: Put them in a ziplock to retain that fresh ground coffee smell and taste.

Found this coffee at Costco, 80 count for $25.95, purchased 1 box, should have bought more!!! Went back today to buy more and they have discontinued it ! My whole Italian Family loves this Fog Chaser Coffee, we have been using other flavors, mostly Paul Newman's, but we like this much better, It is Rich, but not strong, it has a wonderful taste that appeals to us. I will be ordering the 80 count from Amazon, I am so happy to find it available.

I read some reviews stating this coffee was stale and didn't taste good, so I was skeptical, but the price was low enough for me to try at least once.  I'm glad I did!  I would pay $25 for the same amount of K-cups at the store, and this gets delivered to my door for $14!  Not only does this product waste less plastic because of the design, but it also tastes good.  Now, I use a lot of flavored creamer in my coffee, so I may not be the best judge, but my husband, who likes his coffee strong and black, also drinks this coffee daily.  He agrees that it is good, and a bargain too!  This product comes in three individual, sealed bags, each with 12 cups, so I think this helps keep it fresh.  It is definitely worth a try, and they do sell these in stores if you want to buy a smaller package.

This coffee is so much better than the K-cups you get in the grocery store. And I love the K-cup design. I'm
on auto-ship so I don't run out.

Summary: Fits in my Keurig and tastes great!
Text: I really enjoy this coffee! I was skeptical about the packaging, thinking it wouldn't fit correctly in my Keurig, but it did! And for the price, AWESOME! I have used the refillable Kcups, the ones where you can get lids and "refill" other cups, but hate it! (I guess I am too lazy to keep refilling and cleaning my kcup) This coffee tastes good too, not the best I have had, but good! I still get most of my Kcups from Kohls when I get a 30% off, I stock up-I love the variety packs there! But I will definitely keep getting these!

this is a very enjoyable 'cup'. the packaging is not a normal plastic,but a mesh of a sort.it did not pose any problem for my machine. the only thing i worry about,perhaps needlessly, will the 'mesh cause a decrease in shelf life.it comes in a airti ght clear plastic package but i break the package and add the kcups to my other kcups on 50 unit display unit. anyway the coffee is nice. im not a expert but i would say its a medium,so it required 2 mugs for my normal bowl movement.im retired so it does not pose a problem.but you younger whipper-snappers may want to keep that in mind. i always kept a small bucket in my car for that reason when i was young,just saying. and no,thats not gross,whats gross is not to have a bucket,cant make it to a rest room,or when u get to one,its in use. be perpared,anyway happyness and peace to u,ur family,and friends,bye-bye.

I had not heard of this brand before, and happened upon it in my local grocery store.  The lower price for a box of 12 cups made me take notice, so I thought I'd try it.  Instant coffee gratification :-)  This is a strong cup of coffee, but it's not overwhelming - at least to my taste.  I prefer some kick and this has got it.  I love the environmentally friendly pod as well.  Definitely will be subscribing and saving!

they are not contained in the keurig plastic cup so once you open the package, you'll want to put them in an airtight storage but i was really impressed with the smooth flavor and good taste. these were a little cheaper than most of the keurig kcups i've found so i was not sure what to expect but these are deff up there on my favorites list.
My daughter introduced me to the San Francisco Bay coffees.  I love them.  This is my favorite of the ones that I have tried.  Fog Chaser!!  The best coffee ever!

I really like this coffee, this was my second order so far. I haven't had a bitter after taste like I have experienced with some other higher priced K-cup brands. I will order again , the price is great & I like the pods better than the original K-cups because the lid is the only plastic in the pod.

Great strong coffee perfect for the morning.  Like the minimal plastic use on the k-cup itself - instead of a plastic bottom it has a paper filter that works fine.  Comes in three bags of 12 cups each, once a bag is opened I just store them in a tupperware until I use them.
I am very pleased with the quality of these coffee k-cups, it makes a great cup of coffee and leaves less of a container going into the landfills.

Summary: Great coffee at a great price!
Text: I was disappointed that Timothy's Midnight Magic was no longer available as a Subscribe and Save item. I looked around for a replacement that has a bold flavor and was economical. After reading several reviews I ordered a case of Fog Chaser. This coffee is great. Really great. I also picked up a case of Starbucks Cafe Verona and I prefer the Fog Chaser. It has a wonderful aroma and a bold but not harsh flavor that I really enjoy. The slight inconvenience of having to keep it in a air tight bag to keep it fresh is mitigated by the excellent flavor and price. It's a good trade-off. I have a case coming every month and I may run out sooner.

Great bold taste and aroma. I would recommend to coffee drinkers who enjoy a strong cup of coffee Tha pods are "greener" in packaging. Good job San Francisco bay Co.
Fairly priced.
SanFrancisco Bay coffee is GREAT love this stuff.  Flavor is very good flavor dark but not bitter will buy again

The price of this coffee and the fact that it could be a little "earth friendly" convinced me to at least try it. The coffee came packaged as described, so "hat's off" to the seller. But that first cup just didn't do it for me. It's lacking that rich dark coffee taste and the pods leave a residue at the bottom of the cup, so that last gulp just doen't happen. I'd rather fill the little coffee baskets, use a mini-coffee liner and fill it with my favorite coffees than buy this product again. But again, this is a $reasonable$ price for Keurig compatible cofee.

I was hoping this would be as good as many people said, but it falls way short!  The price was great, but the taste wasn't.  It tastes like cheap regular coffeepot coffee!  And it was too weak as compared to many stronger Keurig coffees.  I will stick with my trusted Dark Magic.  I can make a 12oz. cup and have it taste like coffee.  This brand I had to reduce it to 6oz. to get something I could drink. That's not cheaper nor more convenient when I have to make two cups in the morning.
Very good coffee, but must keep bag sealed at all times.  It will pick up other flavors.  Other than that it is great!  AND takes up less room than a kcup.

Summary: review of unique cup design-not the coffee inside it
Text:
This is a first impressions review of the unique cup SF Bay uses in place of the traditional sealed K-cup design after using 12 cups.

The cups work fine. They may take a few more seconds to brew (I haven't timed it) because the filter bag inflates with the hot water before the coffee comes out. This makes me think that the mesh bag is actually sealed somehow and that seal is broken with the pressure of the hot water as it's injected into the cup. A strong smell test indicates that there is some sort of seal there because there is not a strong coffee smell coming from the dry cups.

If there is some sort of seal these cups should stay fresh longer than they would if the coffee was completely exposed to air. I am still storing these cups in the sealed 12 pack bags they came in and would recommend storing them in a sealed container if you don't go through them quickly. The need to store them sealed takes some convenience out of the K-cup system but the lower price of these cups should offset that.

As for the coffee itself, it was good, strong, and tasted more like a fresh cup of coffee than any other k-cups I've tried. It could be the coffee or could be the cup itself. I plan to order a few different flavors in this cup style to find out.

I was looking for affordable k-cups online, and came across the San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser - YUM! is all I can say.  It's rich bold coffee with strong flavor, and an environmental friendly packaging at an excellent price.  Highly recommend it if you're thinking about it.
Brews a very good cup of wake up coffee, but wish they had packaged it in a zipper pouch to keep it fresh.

I opened my Fog Chaser coffee and immediately thought I had ordered the wrong thing because it looked different from my k cups. I read the reviews and found out I was just confused by the different packaging. I brewed a cup and it was a very good cup of coffee. It worked perfectly in my Keurig maker. My story has a happy ending.
Fog Chaser lives up to it's name!!  One cup and I'm good to go.  I love the style of the cup as well... less plastic!

Good and bad for without a bottom k-cup plastic. Good is that like one user say, no hot water going through another plastic. Bad, is that you need to keep the coffee in a sealed bag once you opened the factory sealed bag. I wish it comes with a resealable bag for this. They already save money by not using the plastic bottom half of the k-cup.
The coffee do taste good though.

Summary: This is my absolute favorite coffee!
Text: Fog Chaser is the tastiest full bodied coffee I have had from my Kerig maker. I love this coffee! My husband calls it my "Foggy day" coffee. It truly chases the fog away!

This coffee is very rich and fresh .  The only downside of this product is that when you brew it you should have a wide brimmed cup under it, because it comes out of the pot, in an uneven stream and goes all over.  Other wise its delicious.

Summary: Better tasting than any of the K-Cups to date!
Text: This is really a great cup of coffee. It has a deep complex taste and is not at all bitter. It is a good balanced strong tasting brew if made at the 8oz recommended level. While not a K-cup per se, it is just as well thought out with it's open mesh design. It is basically the inside of the K-Cup without the plastic bottom.  The person that gave it 2 stars because he/she says the 1st cup may be good but the rest will go stale, is just plain stupid. I guess he/she has never heard of a plastic bag or container. Once you open the package just stick them in an airtight container or plastic bag...oooh that's difficult! I wonder when he wrote that review if he had something more than just coffee in his cup??

We wanted to try something different and this coffee didn't disappoint!  We prefer bold flavored coffee which this is.  I was concerned that the pods might not fit my basic model Keurig but they fit perfect.  Less waste with these K-Cups because they have a filter type bottom instead of the plastic cup.  We will definatately order these again!
The coffee tastes good and the packaging is less wasteful. The price is very nice also. Thanks for providing an alternative to the standard K cup.

Before I purchased this coffee, I read the other reviews. All rated this coffee extremely well, with a few concerns stating it did fit their coffee maker. Not knowing if that would be the case with me, I took a chance and was not dissapointed. It fit my machine with no problem, the smell of the coffee is exquisite and it lives up to the excellent reviews.  Everyone in my family that tried it, loves it.. Keep up the good work!

Summary: Flavor ok but they do not fit right
Text:
I ordered these because the price seemed good. I didn't care so much that they weren't the same as regular K-Cups as people said they fit. They do not. On our brewer, you have to hold the handle down because the cup doesn't fit all the way down into the holder. I like to do other things while I'm brewing the coffee knowing it will be ready when I'm ready to grab it. Not so with this one. You have to babysit the machine. We have a B-40.

I will not buy again. THEY DO NOT FIT!

No, these do not look like traditional K-cups, but worked perfectly in my machine. They have eliminated the plastic lower portion of the package which has created a more enviromentally friendly product, although many who like to display their pods will be disappointed because you have to stick them in a zip lok bag after opening (boo hoo). If you open a traditional K-cup it looks exactly the same. Anyway, the coffee is amazing!! Bold but not overwhelming. Perfect for starting the day!

Thanks for providing these Amazon!

Summary: A Great Cup & Storage is not a problem
Text: Have the rest of you coffee lovers nearly fainted over the sharply rising price of coffee? When Amazon sent me an email with a link to this coffee it was cheap enough that I thought I would give it a try. I use and love Newman's Own Organic-Caribou Blend and Sumatran Reserve on a daily basis. The price on those k-cups right now is $65 to $.70 per k-cup. I am always looking for a good bold k-cup that is less expensive. These look different than a k-cup and they need to be in an airtight container after you open them. You need a small container as you only open 12 at a time-the rest stay vacuum sealed. I can't understand the fuss about the packaging-it is a simple thing to put them in a Tupperware type container. The bottom line for me is that the subscription price for this coffer is about $.41 per serving as opposed to $.70 per serving-and the coffee is GREAT! I love the coffee and I now drink it daily. I have not given up the expensive blends that I love-but this one works for me for my 3rd and 4th cup of the day. Just give it a try-some of you will not like it-but some of you will find it to be an excellent and reasonably priced supplement to those very expensive k-cups that we all love.
I brew a double cup out of one kcup and it is still nice and strong. The cups are like a cup/pod hybrid, so I store them in a ziploc baggie. Love these, great price for great coffee!

Summary: Great price for a strong, delicious k-cup coffee!
Text:
I had to try this coffee in an attempt to find a lower price on k-cups. I love it! It's a good strong brew, with a nice smoky aroma. The 36-count comes as 3 plastic bags of 12 cups. After opening the 1st bag, I'm keeping the remainder in the bag, sealed with a clip. It's possible that these could have freshness issues if left out for several days/weeks. I don't think my supply will last long enough to go bad though. I like the idea of less plastic - I like to compost my coffee grounds in the summer and these have much easier access to dumping out the grounds. (I can just tear open the mesh bag.) They fit in the Keurig and brew just fine.

In fact, I usually buy the strongest coffee k-cups so I can "double-brew" mine into a bigger mug. True coffee aficionados may not prefer this. It may be too strong if you like lighter roasts or flavored coffees.

Tastes great, cheaper and more environmentally friendly than other k-cups!

I wanted to try this in my K-cup brewer because of the positive reviews and the lower price; however, I did not like the flavor of the fog chaser coffee.  I've since tried the rainforest blend, which is better, but still not as good as the Donut House k-cups from Coffee People,which I chose when the Kona blend was no longer available.  I'm debating whether to try the breakfast blend; too bad I have to purchase 36 of them just to try them, though.
this stuff is so oily, you probably could run your car on it. it takes 1\4 cup creamer to make it change from black to tan ick !!!!

I was enticed by the cool design - less trash is good. The price obviously was also very enticing.
When the coffee arrived, I carefully transferred the pods to a plastic ziploc bag.
So far, so good. I then proceeded to brew my first cup - all excited to have found something wonderful.
Well, the excitement ceased when the cup produced was pure black liquid with a flavor that was not pleasing to my palate - at all. Maybe if you like bitterness in a coffee without the pleasantness of a well-rounded rich coffee, then this is for you.
I found it not an experience to be repeated. I tried to like this coffee, but will go back to another brand. Sorry San Francisco Bay Coffee company - I really tried. The decaf French Roast was even less likable...

This coffee is very stale tasting and gives off no good aroma.  I thought I would be getting a strong coffee because of the name!  Instead it is very weak.  I can't return it so in the garbage it will go or maybe sell it at my next garage sale.
When I received my latest order, the bag said "36 count" but there are only 12 K-cups inside.  That makes this very very expensive coffee.
This coffee is horrible and unfortunately not eligible for return. It tastes like burnt wood shavings. Looks like its going into the compost pile.
This coffee was not even drinkable. It was so strong even adding double the water and extra cream and sugar didn't help. We like strong coffees, Starbucks original, but this was too much.

I regret to say that we were disappointed with the coffee pods. Immediately upon opening the package there was an obvious lack of wonderful coffee aroma, but rather a stale one. Although the title of the coffee itself was most appealing, we would not purchase again. Thanks for letting me remark.

\
I bought this for my husband.  I use an ecobrew with Starbucks!  He didn't like it and it is sitting in our cabinet as a backup in case we run out of doughnut shop!

Finally...a coffee for my new machine that I like.  Usually the coffee I have tried has been too bitter with a nasty after taste.  This Fog Chaser is just wonderful.  I can finally enjoy more than one cup of coffee in my day.  Any coffee will pretty much do first thing in the morning, but that awful after taste has no place in my afternoons.  Fog Chaser is flavorful but smooth. If you have had difficulty finding a good coffee for the new machines, do give this one a try.

Summary: Chasing the Fog and Forgetting the Bug!
Text:
I have been drinking coffee for over 40 plus years now. Folks, I have tried so many varieties from Instant to Drip to K cups, and the list goes on. Hopefully, the reader gets the picture...I love my coffee. Yet, I am not sure what this "stuff" is. Here is my experience...

First, I get the shipment. Open it up, and I must admit, I do like the nice box the coffee arrives in. I do appreciate the added note on the box from the Robinson Family along with their mission statement.

"Taste the Difference - Make a Difference - Community Aid Program" and there is more information on the side of the box which really sort of made me "feel good" about my purchase. The Robinson Family goes on to state "Offering the best value to you, our customer. Treating our employees, suppliers, and customers as if they were part of our family." I mean all this really made me feel good and I was glad I had purchased a product where a "family" supported others...

Yet, that is where it ended. I opened the box, cut open the plastic sealed containers this "cups" come in, and grabbed my first little strange looking but new looking "k cup". Please note, as others have said, these are completely different than an actual "k cup", but I thought unique and liked the design....

UNTIL...yes, UNTIL...I hate to write this, but the very first thing I noted on the side of this "bag cup" was something that looked like a bug!! It politely dropped in the palm of my hand, and since it was not "wiggling", I figured I could examine it very closely. I did....

YUCK! It was some sort of freaking small, slim BUG!! I thought maybe it was my ole' eyes, but had my son examine it and he confirmed my verdict....

Did I go ahead and try the coffee??? Well, again, I hate to admit this, but I figured the bug could not "kill" me, so yes...I went ahead and tried the other "cup" things (honestly, I don't know what to call these little cups"). My first reaction was just "disgust"...The flavor was weak and the cream and sugar simply diluted to the bottom of the cup. Nothing like the Rev K Cups or other K cups I had used...

So, I went to the computer to write a review...no, not today I thought...I wanted to be fair, because, again, I felt a part of the "Family" the manufacturer had written about on the box...and maybe the "bug" was still in my mind!

Thus, here I sit today several days later, and just finished another of these cups....and after using a few of the things...I just honestly cannot understand why all the high positives written by other reviewers? Honestly? I am trying to like these things due to the price and the "Family" caring thing...but, this coffee is simply too weak and does not taste like "coffee" to me. In comparison, it sort of reminds me of an off the wall instant coffee on the weak scale...

Folks, all of you who have written such positive reviews...trust me, I want to be open minded...I want to like this coffee. I tried smaller cups on my K cup machine, and it simply gets worse...

So, in conclusion, maybe I got a "bad box"? I mean should there have been a "bug" in it to begin with?? Even with that...get past the bug issue...where is the flavor? Why does the cream and sugar simply dissolve to the bottom of the cup leaving a bad looking residue as you get to the last sip? It dissolves "into the coffee" with other brands...

I love the price, and wish I could like this...is there another type other than the "Fog Chaser"??? Would like to stay with the Robinson Family, but not left in the "Fog" as this is sort of how I feel trying to drink this coffee ....."Fog Chaser"???? Well, I am definitely "chasing the Fog"...trying to understand how this is called "coffee"????

I will continue through this box the best I can, and "if" I find one of the cups different, then in all fairness, I will update this review to treat the "Robinson Family" fair...And yes, I guess maybe I am crazy to drink through all these things since the bug was on the first one, but I figure the hot water should kill any harmful bacteria...hope I am right?? But, again, I want to emphasize, it is not the "bug" that is causing my dislike of this "wattery, weak...very odd coffee".....

The Good:
+ Eco-friendly packaging
+ Less expensive per cup

The Bad:
+ Stale taste

While I was excited to see the innovative packaging of this new product, it just doesn't taste good. It tastes likes the coffee is stale, which makes sense considering that the coffee is exposed to air. I realize the packaging reduces the amount of "exposed air" but it doesn't matter - the taste speaks for itself.
