The coffee is not bad however the product is not a full K-cup. There is a K-cup top and a filter bottom. By not being a full K-cup it looses the benefit of being air tight and not as fresh as others.

As others have mentioned, these arent k-cups. Its a paper top with a filter bag full of coffee stuck to it, no plastic bottom. So the coffee will go stale far faster than a real k-cup and they dont fit properly in my k-cup rack.

You have to license the patented k-cup design and pay green mountain a couple of pennies per cup made in royalties, these guys seem to have tried to cut that corner. But I wont buy them again, I buy k-cups because I want a fresh cup of coffee not something thats been exposed to circulating air until I use it.

Im usually happy with all my purchases from Amazon, however this was my worst purchase ever. I went by other peoples reviews when I purchased this coffee. The coffee was rated good by everyone so I took my chances and ordered it. My boyfriend and I both tried it and it was not drinkable! The taste and the smell of it was terrible! I didn't even feel I could give them away to anyone because I didn't want to subject anyone else to the terrible taste of it, so I tossed them in the garbage. What a waste of money! I will stick with familiar brands like Green Mountain.

Received the package and tried one out immediately. I don't know what the expected shelf life is on a coffe kcup but I think this one expired a long time ago. The coffee had a harsh smell, like when you left the can open and the coffee went stale. The taste was bitter and did not meet my expectations. Cross it off my list!!!!
I'm all for eco-friendlier packaging, but this coffee goes bad the minute you open the package. Even the first pod out is a bit stale, and anyhow the flavor is terrible to begin with. Yuck!

This is NOT equal to doughnut shop coffee.
This is a STRONG coffee. Not to my likeing!!!!
I would NOT recommend it...

I made the mistake of buying 72 of these K-cups. The other reviews were good, so I thought I would like them. First of all, I enjoy strong coffee thats not bitter.  When I got these and opened up a pack, the odor was wierd, in a way thats kind of hard to describe, they smelled terrible, not like coffee at all. They are to be used in the Keurig machines but have a filter casing, not plastic like the regular K- cups, which is not a problem.  The coffee tasted terrible. The date was fresh, so it wasnt that the coffee was old. I will never again waste my money on this brand.  I cant understand why the company would put out a product like this and expect it to sell, I for one will never buy it again.  I drink alot of coffee, 4 cups at least daily, So far the best ones I have had are the Starbucks,Caribou,and Newmans Own (bold).I hope this helps with your future buying decision. John from Buffalo

I was unhappy with the smell and taste of the kcups. There wasn't any.
This product has such a great smell when you open the package and bold
flavor when you drink it. I missed it maybe due to the no fuss package.
I didn't need or want the extra box it comes in but the plactic package
it comes in should be air tight but it wasn't. Other than that, the price
was good as well at the timely manner it was rec'd.

While I am happy with the coffee itself, I find the description of this item as "for Keurig K-Cup Brewers" to be slightly misleading.

As a recent reviewer points out that these OneCup pods are mesh pouches with a foil top. Twelve of these pods are contained in a sealed plastic bag. Once the bag is opened, the coffee does seem to be more "exposed" to air which raises the possibility that they then go stale faster than a sealed K-Cup.

Comments on the previous review said that the coffee has noticeable degradation in quality after 14 days of opening the sealed plastic bag. This seems unacceptable to me because the point of a Keurig Brewer is choice - having to use all 12 OneCups within 14 days limits my ability to choose other coffees.

All considered, the company is using this "OneCup" packaging to expand their market to other brewing systems and save the costs associated with multiple types of packaging (and possibly multiple licensing agreements?). They pass this savings on by pricing these cups a couple cents less per cup than K-Cups - the price can be further reduced a few cents with Subscribe and Save. Subscribe and Save was the initial reason why I chose these cups - being a convenient way to keep a steady supply of a "house" coffee for myself and guests. This convenience is reduced by the fact that the packaging is not ideal for maintaining freshness. As noted by other commenters, the solution may be to put the rest of the OneCups into a Ziplock bag and hope that this will maintain freshness until I use up the others - not exactly elegant.
This has become one of my favorite K-cup coffees. It has a great bold taste. I will certainly be buying again.

ProfileName: Dave "Brevity is the soul of wit"
Text: What some think is residue is actually crema, though not as heavy as in an espresso shot. Crema is a flavorful, aromatic, reddish-brown froth made when air bubbles combine with fine-ground coffee's soluble oils. The strong presence of crema indicates a quality, well-ground coffee Crema helps give espresso a fuller flavor, longer aftertaste than drip coffee. This is excellent coffee and the crema makes it better.

Summary: Not the best, not the worst.
Text:
I recently ordered this because I was excited about the reduced plastic in the packaging. Interestingly, the day I ordered it my husband came home with the same brand from the grocery store, so I've now tried 2 different flavors. I would give both the same review. The coffee is okay. It's not horrendous, as some people seem to imply, and its not amazing either. The smell is good and smells like nice fresh coffee when you open the box. The flavor is nice enough too. I also love super strong coffee. I drink Revv, Jet Fuel, Wake Up Call, etc. I would not say that this coffee rivals them, but it is stronger than some other medium roast coffees.

Big reasons why I wouldn't give this 5 stars:

1) The coffee gets very watered down when brewed on a larger cup size. I usually do the 10 oz size and this coffee just doesn't cut it for that. I feel it becomes more like coffee flavored water at that point. 8 oz is better, but its ideal at 6 oz. So, now I just save it for when I want a small cup.

2) There is a strange film that brews with the coffee. You can see it floating on top and it sticks to the sides of the mug when you tilt it, so there is like a ring of residue that gets left around the edge where the coffee moved away. You can also see it as darker specks floating on top after you add creamer. I don't know what this is. I have no other coffee that does this. It doesn't really change the taste or texture or anything, but I just don't like it.

I think the packaging is a big plus though. I am not sure why the cups being open is such an issue for people. I just put all mine in a zip lock bag (that I can just keep reusing) to keep it air tight. It's really not that difficult. Plus I think it's important to cut down on plastic waste.

So all in all, I do plan to buy this coffee again. I like that I can reduce waste and I like it enough that its good for a midday refresher since it has to be a small cup. We are also on a tight budget so that helps as well. However, I don't see myself replacing all my coffee with it, because I want a much larger and stronger cup of coffee in the morning and brewing two of these eliminates both the value and the positive aspects of less waste.

San Francisco Bay 'Fog Chaser' is true to it's name. It will definitely lift the morning fog and get you going. It's a very strong brew, but isn't harsh. You will not question whether you have had a cup of coffee though. You will know.

I like it so well that I've got it on a subscription.

This was a repeat purchase, so nothing more need be said!  Although this is a very pleasing coffee, it is not Jet Fuel.  This is not a knock, but rather a statement of fact!  Fog Chaser has its own taste, one you don't have to search for.  Once the pak of 12 has been opened, store the remaining pods in a seal-tight container.  And the PRICE is RIGHT!  :o)

San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser coffee is one of the best coffees my husband has ever had. If you like a bold coffee that is not the least bit bitter, he says this is the one. It is my husbands favorite. Buy it and enjoy.San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Fog Chaser, 36-Count

Summary: Compared to other dark or bold brews...
Text:
Like many others, the price point of this coffee got my attention but what's the point of cheaper coffee that's all but undrinkable... Grove Square, anyone?

So before ordering on price alone I wanted to see other reviewers contrast and compare this blend to other k-cups such as Timothy's Midnight Magic, Emeril's Extra Bold or Jet Fuel. After all, given the wide disparity of opinion about which k-cup blend is bold, strong or rich in flavor, at least finding common ground with others who enjoy the aforementioned brands you can estimate the appeal of the flavor to your own palate.

At the time I placed my order I didn't find any clear indicators from other reviewers along these lines, hence for what it's worth, as one who enjoys the previously mentioned k-cups, I can say that overall San Francisco Bay French Roast measures up pretty darn well to the more expensive brands.

Now if cost were not a factor I'm not certain this would be my first choice as this blend has a somewhat smoky after taste and I prefer a more fruity or sweet flavor. But hey, this is French Roast and as such the taste seems well suited.
Nevertheless, no regrets...it's a nice bold brew (with an appealing price) that I look forward each morning.

Summary: not a bold cup of coffee
Text: When I purchased this I wasn't concerned about not being a traditional k cup and I was looking for a cheaper bold coffee. This just doesn't do it. It's a medium at best and not very consistant from pod to pod. I won't be purchashing this again..

I thought I would try these K-cups because they were about 15% less expensive than the other ones available.  I was a little concerned with the packaging in that the bottom of the K-cup is a filter and not solid plastic like a standard one.  However, aside from a very fine trace at the bottom of my coffee mug, there is no mess and no fuss.  The coffee is very smooth, too.  I will be making this one of my regular choices for K-cups from now on.

I was ready to order a bunch more of this but then they jacked the price, from 36 cents s&s to 45 a cup. I can get coffee for this price at Costco. So I'm cancelling my s&s. Too bad, because it is really great coffee.

Summary: Not a Real K Cup packaging//DO NOT BUY
Text:
I bought these expecting a standard K cup. What I received was a coffee pod that is smaller in size than a K cup and appears to be a "filter" type material vice a plastic container. As a result, they do not fit in the standard K cup dispensers and the coffee does not stay fresh like the standard K cup. It appears the "filter" type material (like fine rice paper) of this coffee pod allows free flow of air and allows the coffee to go stale. Requires you to store the coffee pods in a zip lock bag to ensure freshness remains.

I will not buy these type K coffee pods again and I am surprised that the Amazon web site does not clearly identify the K cup material issue

++++++++++++++++++
UPDATE-I emailed Amazon regarding the web site issue not being clear as to KCup packaging type. Amazon refunded my money since they want the customer happy. Amazon is a great place to shop and has high customer focus and is very much appreciated.

I'm shocked at all the good reviews for this sludge...I found it to be akin to VERY watery mud. Horrible, and not an item eligible for return with Amazon unfortunately. A total rip off! Now, I'll splurge for the keurig k-cups; lesson learned the hard way :(
Im a little disappointed. These aren't really k-cups and I find that they do not stay as fresh. Unless I leave them in a sealed bag they taste stale quickly, which means I can't use my carousel.
if you buy this coffee you will know you made a mistake when you open the first plastic bag it comes packaged in. You can tell by the smell that it's.......NOT!

I must be doing something wrong because I feel this coffee is way too strong for a single 8oz. cup of coffee.  But, I bought it so I'm shoveling some of the coffee out of the container before I put it in my Rival single cup maker (which has no piercing device).  Some have called this a full bodied medium roast coffee; I call it strong.  The cups are more rounded on the bottom but they do fit in my device.  I'll use up the ocffee and then try something even milder as this is too strong for my taste buds.

Summary: not good at first, but grows on you...
Text: the coffee was not that good at first; it had a strong smell that kind of reminded me of an ashtray (seriously, it did)! But after a couple of cups it became very tasty and it had a nice kick to it. So, give it a chance and you'll probably like it.

These are not K-Cups in the traditional sense, a filter vice the plastic cup bottom. A big surprise when I opened the box that didn't make me happy.

But they do take ya home to a night out camping under the stars and a morning sunrise to a cup of coffee over the fire. A bit gritty, strong, and full of flavor.

This has got to be the worst thing I've tasted out of my Keurig, ever!! I couldn't even finish the cup I brewed.

I don't really mind that they're not actually K-Cups. Who cares if they get stale? You're not going to want to drink the coffee even if it's fresh.

I just wanted to edit to describe the flavor better. It tastes burnt. It tastes like someone put their cigarette out in my coffee. I'm out of my good Timothy's K-Cups so I had to use these again tonight, and once again, I'm bot going to be able to finish it.

I'd like to be able to review this product - however, San Francisco Coffee did not include it in my shipment. Although noted on the invoice, along with the French Roast ordered, they sent two boxes of French Roast and did not correct the shipment when notified. Therefore, one star it is!
BTW - the French Roast is a 4 star.

this has a chemical taste that ruins it for me, have to put in extra creme. will not buy again, will go back to
dognut shop, which is excellent.
First of all the way the K-cup is pakaged tends to let the product dry out.Also found the coffee weak tasting......

The cups are smaller and hold less coffee than the competitors. They also are not airtight so will degrade once the package is opened unless used quickly.  But even if used quickly they are weak and watery.  Actually, more like dishwater.  They should come with a warning label.  I would have wanted to know that they were weak and watery by design.
Extremely disappointed in the quality of this brand's brewing quality.  Will not order this particular brand again.  Will dispose of, instead of being disappointed the majority of the time.

Thought I was getting a good deal on these K-cups...but this is the worst coffee we have ever had!  The taste is so strange and for it to be called Fog Chaser, I thought it would be strong.  It's not very weak...see through coffee.  Will never buy again.

I bought these at the grocery store just to try them. They are probably the worst k cups ever. The taste is terrible. I tried both the fog chaser and rainforest blend. They both taste awful, like bark and dirt. There is dark brown "sediment" left in the bottom of the cup when you drink this brand. I find that the taste is strong in the dirt department, but highly lacking in the coffee flavor area. I will never buy these again. I like my coffee in the morning, but I actually dread having to use these if there is nothing else available.

Its not a real K cup.

There is no way to store them except in a air tight container or ziplock bag, also when you get to the bottom of your coffee cup there is alot of sediment and grounds,its really gross.

I would stick the real K Cups and skip this.Remember amazon does not offer refunds on this either since its a grocery item.

I believe this coffee tastes as good as any brand of K-Cup I've ever tried while currently costing about a third less (using subscribe and save on Amazon).  It actually tastes fresher to me than other K-Cups, possibly because it arrives packed in a plastic bag which seems airtight until opened.

Summary: Not your average K-cup, but worth a taste
Text:
I have my concerns about this coffee's packaging, but the important part first: It tastes good. Fog Chaser is a little more robust than I like for a morning blend (I tend toward a Dunkin Donuts style coffee first thing in the AM), but is perfect for afternoon or evening. The nonstandard pods fit into my B70 and while there has been occasional sediment, it's not been a problem with the majority of my 36-pod pack; at least, not as bad as (say) Grove Square. Yes, I'd buy these again.

Now the negatives. As has been stated, the pods aren't plastic cups with embedded filters, sealed by a foil cover, but rather filter pouches with a plastic ring and foil cover. There's no need to punch a drain hole in the plastic cup, since there isn't one. I've heard concerns about the Keurig success causing more spent K-cups to be dumped in trash tips and landfills; I'd also guess that the construction makes it a non-trivial recycling task. So a redesign with less plastic would seem like a good thing.

However, one of the charms of Keurig is that the cup is packed in a relatively inert gas: I've heard nitrogen, which would make sense. Oxygen is the enemy of coffee. Old coffee goes stale because it oxidizes. Keeping air away from coffee keeps it fresh... but the coffee in the San Francisco Bay Coffee company's packaging hasn't this feature. The bags (containing twelve pods each) are heavy-duty plastic with a metal button of unknown purpose, and perhaps those bags are filled with something other than oxygen... but as soon as you take them out, the coffee begins to deteriorate.

Not that this happens in a matter of seconds, or even days. After all, keeping the lid on a pound can of coffee (I can actually remember when a pound was sixteen ounces, not 13.5) kept the coffee fresh enough, assuming you were a regular drinker. If you use a ziploc bag to store the unused pods from an opened bag, I'm sure that they'll stay fresh enough in the week or two that the bag lasts.

My concern, though, is for occasional coffee drinkers, for whom the Keurig system is a godsend. For example, I dated a woman who hated coffee, but wanted me to have some when I visited. Having fresh coffee in an inert storage container would have been great. These, though, might go bad in between my visits to her house.

So in conclusion, go ahead and buy these if you're a frequent coffee drinker who will finish a whole 12-pod bag in less than a month. Keep a couple of ziploc bags (sandwich bags hold 6) for storage. Companies that go through a whole lot of K-cups ought really to like these, especially since they're about 10% under the cost of most K-cups.

Summary: Great Coffee - Does not store well/Porous Bottom
Text:
The K-cups have a plastic ring around the top but the bottom part is porous - I could smell the coffee when I
opened the pack...cannot store in KCup rack and must keep them in a ziplock bag to keep coffee fresh..that is why I gave it only 4 stars Each order comes in three 12-pack bags...Oh...the taste is great...nice and strong, and dark as well.

I ordered this on a whim when I received an e-mail from Amazon about new deals in k-cups. I'm always looking to mix up my selection because that is one of the true benefits of the Keurig machines. I read the reviews trying to determine how dark/strong Fog Chaser was and could not quite nail down the strength. I relied on the name and thankfully knew about the packaging. I keep mine in a canister after realizing I had an extra one to spare, which will keep the air out. I quite liked the k-cup design, it looks like it creates less waste.

Fog Chaser clearly says on the side that it is a darker brown but does not show that it is the strongest. I will have to investigate which is stronger. This k-cup did give me a nice smooth strong 12 oz cup of coffee. It had no weird after taste and it wasn't bitter. I forgive bitter strong coffees because that is a product, often enough, of stronger coffees that could be manufactured better. I'm no snob but I also don't drink watered down coffee (i.e. Starbuck's new Blonde coffee).

I will definitely order this again. I've never had coffee from this company before but I think I'm quite the fan. I also ordered the 3 12 packs because they shipped sooner and the idea that they would stay fresher longer was appealing. The price was slightly higher though, of course. Now that I have a canister that fits 36, I will go ahead and buy the other packaging and likely subscribe.

I purchased this 3 pack for my parents as a pre-Christmas gift. (I did not want to be late or it the shipping date to get away from me!)

They LOVE the taste and aroma, both are in sync.

It is worth it as a gift and for yourself if you are a true coffee lover and especially a "K-Cup" fan!

Summary: My wife thinks it tastes like Maxwell House
Text:
That's not a compliment. Maxwell House isn't exactly top shelf. Personally, it's not as good as Donut Shop but it is 13 cents per cup less when you subscribe and save.

I love the packaging where the bottom is a coffee filter and not a k cup. Since it's not the proprietary k cup design, they can probably avoid royalties to Keurig. But in the end you drink coffee not for looks or cost but taste. And while it tastes OK, there are tastier options out there.

I was a little worried about this k-cup since it is shaped differently from the regular k-cups. Instead of being in a fully plastic container, only the top is plastic. The bottom part is enclosed in a coffee filter type holding. While this means that when I opened the sealed wrapper I was hit with the delicious aroma of coffee, something I miss when I open a regular pack of k-cups, it also means I have to store the remaining cups in a tupperware or storage ziploc type bag to keep the remaining cups from going stale. This isn't a big deal, just something to mention. These also wouldn't fit in the normal k-cup carousel.

I have a b60 and the cup fit perfectly, brewed up great, disposal was easy and the filter didn't tear or leak as I was throwing it way.

Fog chaser is a bold deep brew (I brew on the middle button of my keurig) The coffee is very smooth and mellow with a terrific aroma. There is no bitter or burned taste. This is quickly becoming my favorite keurig coffee and I can't wait to try the other offerings from this company.

Summary: Doesn't fit in all Keurig makers
Text: This is decent coffee at a good price, but the K-cup is made different and doesn't fit in all Keurig brewers.  The instructions on the package actually tell you that but the description when you buy it does not. I have two brewers and it only fits in one of them

Summary: WARNING - open mesh coffee pods, NOT K-Cups
Text:
I've urged Amazon to change this product's listing so as not to trick anyone else into buying it, but until they do, I want to add my voice to the revelations hidden in a few reviews that are already here. Please be warned that while the first cup of this coffee is tasty, the second is unlikely to be as good, and the twelfth is almost guaranteed to be disappointing unless you're the twelve-cup-a-day sort of household.

Why? Simply put, these are not K-Cups. They are not individually sealed portions, but instead are open mesh coffee pods, not dissimilar to Senseo pods, topped with a K-Cup-like plastic ring and foil cover. That cover does make them work in Keurig brewers, but you lose the important freshness-preserving feature of K-Cups. The company could lessen this problem by putting its pods in a resealable plastic bag, but they chose to instead use a plastic bag reminiscent of those in cereal boxes -- just much, much harder to open. That's especially ironic given Amazon's recent move toward frustration-free packaging.

I strongly encourage you to move on to another product until the San Francisco Bay Coffee folks can temper their (laudable) green-focused pod design with some reasonable solution for keeping the coffee fresh for more than a day or so once you open the box.

I have not picked this item up on Amazon but in a retail store in my area in North Carolina.  I had seen it on Amazon but when I saw it local I gave it a try and I am glad I did.  This is a rich and robust flavor, with a note of nuts, one that wipes the cobwebs away in the morning.  Yes it is nice that the product uses less plastic but that is only a side note the quality of the coffee is top notch.  The only negative side comment I can make is that sometimes the top gets stuck on the upper needle of the Keurig but no problem just pull it off from the top rather than picking it up out of the brewing basket, and if you close the machine and open again it is always off the needle anyway.

This is my second favorite flavor from SFBC.  Breakfast blend is still the best.  All flavors have plenty of flavor for a 16oz travel mug. (If you don't have the larger cup size on your machine, brew at the small cup setting and lift the handle and brew again) Can't beat the value especially if you get them via Amazon subscription.  Hey Amazon when are you going to sell these in the 80 pack?

Summary: Very good coffee, nice alternative to k-cup
Text: Having a cup, soon to be two cups, of Fog Chaser from San Francisco Bay Coffee this morning. Very good. They call these "OneCup" but they work in Keurig brewers. Guessing this is a result of the k-cup patent or copyright, whatever it is, running out but wow, this is some good good coffee.

Summary: Good Coffee at Good Price (good=not GREAT)
Text:
We've ordered the Fog Chaser OneCup twice now. The first time we ordered it, I LOVED it. We are avid coffee drinkers in my house, and both love a nice bold coffee. Since the price was right and we liked the coffee, we ordered again. The 2nd shipment we received was still "good" coffee, but it wasn't as great as the first. My husband says he couldn't tell much difference, but the 2nd shipment did not have the same smooth finish and mouth-watering aroma as the original. That being said, it did not stop us from drinking it all, but I do have to wonder which is the abnormality! I rated this at a 4 since we were so impressed by the first shipment, and I really like the way the OneCup brews. As other reviewers mentioned, there is a "crema" produced by the OneCup that you rarely see with a K-Cup, which is NICE! I like the less packaging, and don't mind the occasional sediment in my cup (when we brew coffee, we generally do French Press, so we can handle that!). If I had the option of rating 3.5 I would have, since the quality of the 2nd shipment would definitely rank a 3 most likely. I do think we will try this again and see if "the third time is the charm". I will try to remember to update on what we think so that we can provide some feedback as far as consistency goes.
Thanks for reading!

Bold and rich. LOVE this coffee for a fast wake-me-up in the morning, and pick-me-up mid day. The name is perfectly suited to the delightful temperament of this brew. MUST store in airtight container after opening the plastic bags though, or coffee will lose it's potency.

Summary: finally coffee for my picky palate!
Text:
Recently I have become more and more choosy with my coffee. I own a Keurig one-cup brewer as well as a traditional coffee maker.
For years, I have been using the same coffee brand ( med or dark, middle-of-the road priced) and it was affordable and it tasted just fine. Lately, I was lacking depth and body when brewing in the keurig( I have the cup you can put your own coffee in, which saves resources and $). It seemed like I couldnt' pack enough flavor into the little chamber to really have the right strength. The pre-packed, ready to use K cups were much better, but at 3 cups/day for me not feasible in the long run.
I read the reviews of the San Francisco Bay coffee ( fog chaser) and the price appealed to me and also what customers had described, so I tried it. Besides the much more affordable price and far more "green" packaging, I find the flavor fantastic!
Bold, yet sophisticated, not just strong- really pleasant flavor ! A very good choice at an attractive price!. These cups look different, but I like them much better with their filter-like body and 12-count bagging. Now I don't feel guilty when I indulge with more than 1 K cup. For loose coffee to put into the reusable cup I choose a def. dark roast like italian or french, which is very comparable to the Fog chaser's aroma.

There are so many k cups and flavors out there...for a baseline, my go to cup was donut shop by the coffee people, until now.  I really enjoy this coffee and will purchase again.  Smells very fresh, like the packaging (not just 50 thrown in a box), lower price than competitors, and the flavor is perfect for me.  Great job San Francisco Bay!

SFBC's Fog Chaser is on the bold side... dark, rich, but not too much aftertaste. A great daily coffee. Be aware that the entire cup is not plastic, but the bottom portion is almost filter material. This might affect how long you keep the cups before using. The cups are vacuum sealed into a larger plastic bag, so that should help with freshness...

The cost is on the low end for k-cups and makes this coffee even more inviting!!! I definitely recommend as a staple daily coffee.

All the best,

Jay

The Keurig cups always had something missing. They reminded me of coffee but always tasted a little funny. I really do think it's all the plastic surrounding the coffee. I didn't get much use out of my Keurig until I found this coffee. I am reordering today!
Can't beat this price and tastes decent! Impressed with the k cup design, no mess. Will be buying more for sure

Fantastic Coffee, at a a fraction of the price of the freeze dried Keurig K-cup's, all of which are made by the same company, with the same tasteless coffee bean, no matter what the name of the coffee.  I can't imagine paying a dollar a cup for a "donut house" k-cup that is made of Folgers.  What a joke.

This is a great pod to reduce some of the wear and tear on the keurig, the coffee tastes good, no grounds in contrast with other reviews, less packaging, and it's a nice size package to keep "in reserve".  Better than Folgers, better than Donut House, not as good as Newman's Own.  That's about the limit of my K-cup experience so far.
I love this coffee. I started buying it in the grocery store, but this is a lot cheaper at Amazon. Rich, flavorful, and smells just like I ground the beans myself. Going to re-order right now.

I just received my 80 count box of San Francisco Fog Chaser K-Cups. I ripped open one of the dated/sealed packets, pulled out one of the 10 coffee pods.
I made a cup of coffee, perfecto. Best coffee I've had from this machine hands down, and I've probably put 50 different brands and made over 1000 cups from this guy.

Highly recommended.

The coffee comes in the K-cup filters without a bottom. I assume this is to save money and reduce plastic. It works fine in all K-cup brewers that I've tried.

The coffee itself is really good. It has a very bold taste but not too bitter. Tastes much better with some cream and sugar.

I ended up subscribing to these because I like them so much. Definitely worth a try for coffee drinkers. I only give items 5 stars if they far exceed expectations, so this gets 4 stars.

I was looking for a good quality coffee in a K-cup to use with my Kuerig. I have the reusable cup and love it but was looking for the convenience of the pre-filled K-cups for workday mornings.

These K-cups were exactly what I was looking for, convenience and delicious coffee! I prefer a bolder coffee and this Fog Chaser fit the bill. I also felt this was an excellent deal considering most K-cups retail for $10.00-$16.99 for a package of 12 K-cups (and sometimes 10) and this was 80 cups for just over $30.00. The other thing I love about this is being able to have it on the subscription program. You can set up your delivery to be delivered whenever you like beginning with 1 month intervals and you get a small discount on the price when you order through a subscription. With a quantity of 80, I've set my deliveries to come every 4 months but it may turn out that I will have to shorten it to every three months.

If you have a Kuerig and love the convenience of the pre-filled K-cups, you can't go wrong with this product. It is a bold coffee but this company makes several types that are available in several blends. I highly recommend this product and the added value of the subscription option.

Summary: Replaced Starbucks as my all time favorite!
Text: When I got my Keurig, I couldn't wait to get my favorite Starbucks coffee in K Cups. When I saw this, I liked the design of the cup and the price is much better too. I'm so glad I decided to give it a try. Doing a side by side comparison, Fog Chaser wins hands down! If you like a bold cup that lingers on your tongue and hold up under creamer too (I use unsweetened coconut milk), you will be happy you tried this coffee. Oh! A huge added bonus of the new environmentally friendly K Cup design is that you get that heavenly coffee aroma from the minute you open the vacuum sealed bag! You don't have to wait until its brewing to "wake up and smell the coffee!" :)

This is the best coffee I've had since my Mom's percolator brand. The best part though is the cup can be re-used. I have a K-cap My-Kap Green Reusable 3 Piece Cap Set for K-Cups and I just clean out the cup and refill with whatever coffee I choose. It's really the perfect design for re-use as the grounds dry out completely overnight and dump out very easily. I'm buying the whole bean San Francisco coffee to grind and refill the cup. The possibilities are endless!

Personally, I received this product by going down the list of K-Cups trying to find that perfect cup to put on scheduled delivery.  This is a nice bold coffee, and oddly fiscal.  I personally like the first brew, and the house mate likes the second and third, now THAT is a good deal.

Cheaper than typical k-cups, more environmentally friendly, and better, fresher, stronger coffee. This stuff is dynamite.  They're priced where the traditional k-cups used to be priced, but they're better coffee.

Summary: SIMPLY THE BEST COFFEE OUT THERE & THE BEST PRICE!!
Text: I adore this coffee!!! I also tried the french roast style (which i usually drink in other brands) BUT I LOVE this FOG LIFTER roast so much better! It's simply the best K-Cup I've had! And the cost is amazing, especially if you sign up for auto delivery, which is cool because you can choose your delivery time and not just a default one!!! LOVE IT! WILL KEEP PURCHASING FOR SURE!

Summary: Decent product but not a good way to keep fresh
Text: Bought this product however it doesnt seem like a great way to keep the coffee airtight. I tried the other K-cup similar cups and they seem to keep it fresher.
This is a robust roast. Definitely a morning coffee.  We love the flavor and the value! Be sure to store in an airtight container to maintain the flavor.

Summary: Don't let the smell fool ya. It's pretty awesome.
Text: I don't usually write a review unless I think a item deserves it but this coffee deserves it. It came in 3 separate vacuum sealed bags. Make sure you store them in a proper container after you open them or they will go bad. When I opened one, the smell was super strong. I thought the coffee was going to be bitter but after brewing it in my Keurig B130 a few times I was hooked. Not bitter at all but the smell is a little strong. But it grew on me. I brew it with 8oz. of water and the strength is good enough for me. Just a bit of creamer or milk and no sugar. I drink only a cup a day. Also, its cheaper than normal K cups and less waste. I'm not going to say that this will be my favorite forever, but it is good and if you are looking at trying something new with your K cup maker then these are worth a shot. I will keep these stocked along with other the flavors of K cups I have enjoyed.

I recently purchased these K-Cups, I have to admit, because of the price per cup. And now I can honestly say I will never go back to the regular K-Cups again! I usually run a K-Cup through the largest setting and then through the smallest (my coffee cup is rather large :). This Fog Chaser coffee holds up rather well. I've gotten a great, bold cup of joe every morning since receiving these. There have been no problems with grounds in the cup as sometimes happens with regular K-Cups or the refillable K-Cups.

The 80 count box came with a reusable storage container that holds a week of pods. It's just a flimsy, clear plastic container but it does keep the coffee fresh.

Summary: Great cup of coffee and the price is right!
Text: This is the second month we've ordered this coffee and love it!  If you like a strong cup of coffee, this is it.  And, the price can't be beat!
The fog chaser has a great bold body taste,unlike some brands which leave a harsh after taste.Great product which I recommend.
I have tried 5 or 6 different brands and found this brand to be the better one. I am sticking with this for now.

First time trying SF coffee and found it to be a good coffee with a reasonable taste. Yes, the coffee smells burned prior to use but I believe thatunless you are a  connoisseur of coffee I believe most might smelled "burnt".  Good coffee for the price and the "K-Cup" new packaging works just as well as the original stle K-Cup packaging. I believe I will try another brand for taste but would stay with SFbay if the price were 5 cents less per cup.  I drink alot of coffee.!!

Summary: Beware even if you don't open you can't return
Text: Not the coffee for us. Very strong. Did the subscribe and save, for got to cancel the next shipment, went to and complete the return forms- No such luck. Great idea, just tastes awful. First item that I could not return, back to buy coffee at QVC, they will take it back if we do not like it.

Ahhh...nothing like a good cup of coffee! I'm a bargain hunter and have considered going back to my drip coffee due to the rising prices of K cups.I read all the reviews,and feeling there was nothing to lose I debated between French Roast and Fog Chaser. San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser did not disappoint (haven't tried the French Roast yet). Fog Chaser is a moderatly bold coffee, smooth, with no hint of bitterness. As for the skeptics concerned with the "netted" base of the cup affecting taste and freshness...the product is packaged in mini packs ( sealed thick plastic) of 8 cups to protect freshness. In addition, I feel the netting (not flimsy by any means) offers a better fitration system that the typical K cup. I only write reviews about products that excite me, or repulse me. Obviously, I am a San Francisco Bay Coffee fan. If you choose to try this product, I'm pretty sure you will be pleasantly surprised.

Summary: Excellent Taste and More Robust Brewing with These Type of Pods
Text:
I decided to give these a try based on the price, the favorable reviews here on Amazon, and its sales rank in the K-cup store. I was not disappointed as this is a strong, but not too strong, good-tasting coffee that not only tastes great but has a nice aroma.

The pods are a little different than your traditional plastic K-cup portion as, instead of any plastic around the sides or bottom you have basically a mesh coffee filter holding the coffee grounds. This appears to make a more complete brew, and allows more of the flavor to come into the actual coffee. You will see a dirty residue at the bottom of your cup due to this filtration system vs. a "clean" look from a normal K-cup pod. This seems to make sense as the normal K-cup pod has all of the brewed coffee escaping through the pinprick hole vs. the full brewing experience of these pods.

As the pods are in this filtration medium the coffee is not air-tight sealed after you open the package of pods. I have put the unused ones in a sealed Ziploc bag to keep them fresh.

I also shared this with some folks in the office, who liked it so much they ordered their own so it's not just me who likes this stuff. Who knows, I may have found a new favorite coffee!

Summary: Good Alternative to More Pricey "Bold" K-Cups
Text: SF Bay Coffee's Fog Chaser was a nice "bold" surprise.  I am a big fan of Amazon's Subscribe & Save program and have been getting my K-cups this way for over a year.  Of course, once you find one you absolutely love (Timothy's World Midnight Magic), poof!  The Magic's gone!  Midnight Magic is still available on Amazon, though no longer offered through Subscribe & Save, and I refuse to pay $35 for 48 K-cups of any brand.  S & S now offers SF Bay Coffee's Fog Chaser and based on the quantity of favorable reviews, I decided to give it a shot.  The pods are far different than what we've all been used to, but they work like a charm, have less waste, and deliver a pretty bold, smooth cup of coffee.  My morning coffee always consists of two pods at the 6 oz. setting each for one eye-opening 12 oz. mug of coffee.  On that setting, Fog Chaser lives up to its name.  I have noticed some residue occasionally, but it certainly is minimal.  The pods come packed in plastic bags (12 pods/bag).  Once cut open, I just fold over the edge, clip it and store the bag in the fridge.  Strength is a personal decision, and to me, more than 6 oz. of water with ANY pod is too weak.  If you are a fan of Rev of Jet Fuel, this coffee is comparable.
This coffee was really good Fogchaser will get you going. It's a strong bold cup of coffee.  This cofee is valued price with a great taste!

Summary: Great Price, but change in concept....
Text: Decided to give these a try based on price.  The coffee tastes great but since the 'cups' don't have the plastic bottoms (a filter element), we had to store in a sealed jar to keep them fresh and not have the coffee bean smell thru-out the house.  (or you could use a plastic ziploc - original bag was not re-sealable).  They did one thing finally right - you don't have to pay MORE for going green when buying LESS packaging.  Kudos.
My new favorite!  A few Gr. Mtn. are great: Br. Blend, Half/Caff especially.  Most other brands are more like Folgers than real flavor brews.  How do I get free shipping?

Summary: Love the packaging! Could be a smoother coffee
Text: These k cups are great for being green!  I love less plastic and don't get grounds in my cup. That being said the coffee is pretty good.  It's hard to find a really strong K cup coffee that's not burnt or harsh tasting.  This one is pretty close to being smooth.  I wish Amazon would offer B***sta kcups on auto delivery!

i dont no what the big fuss is about a lot of bad reviews but if u read the description you shoulld no it comes revealed and not in plastic like regualr kcups anyhow i ordered the fogchaser and they were great i amade iced coffee with mine and the flavor was perfect i just keep it in some tupperware to keep fresh is all i plan on buying all 3 flavors and encourage they should come out with even more flavors the price is awsome beats paying 15 bucks for 18 kucps when i just paid 14 for 36 kcups i will def keep on buying these

The price was the initial reason for my purchase but I would have to say now that my reorder is based on the taste. Coffee is very rich and fresh tasting even without the sealed k-cup design. I will continue to reorder if the price stays down under the other k-cups.

Summary: Very Good K-Cup Coffee at a nice price
Text: Fog Chaser has a very good flavor, and it is reasonably strong especially for a K-Cup.  I like it better than their French Roast version, which seems stronger but more harsh to me; and I like very strong coffee.  Their Rainforest version has a more mellow taste that is also very good, but it is weaker strength than Fog Chaser.  The price for any of the versions, especially for the "subscribe and save", is very good.  The packaging, which is a box of 3 sealed bags of 12 is fine to deal with; once you open a sealed bag (you can't reseal the bag), just use a ziplock to seal the remainder for the week.

I have been a picky Keurig fan for about ten years, have always bought my coffee from either onegreatcup or amazon (because stores just don't have the selection), and until now had settled on Jet Fuel as my favorite -- just so you know what I like. FogChaser is in that league: rich, deep, dark, zesty, overall INTERESTING and best of all (unlike the plastic-bottomed K-cups) brewing it makes my kitchen smell good again. I'm putting it on subscription.  A good find; a keeper -- glad I tried it.

25 lbs. of hard licorice pieces were dumped into kitchen trash bags, unsealed, then put into a cardboard box. The most disgusting, unsanitary packaging I've ever seen. I tossed the entire thing in the trash.
To top it off, the first ingredient in the whole thing was corn syrup. Yuk.
Avoid like the plague.

Summary: A nice step up from plain rice cereal
Text: Our nine-month-old daughter is ready for a more substantial breakfast than plain cereals.  We want her to get the nutrients and vitamins she needs (especially iron), so plain fruit or vegetables aren't enough.  This blend of fruit and grains (and, in some cases, yogurt) provides everything she needs for a good breakfast and keeps her full for several hours.  Plus, the flavors are not overly sweet.  One note:  at least two of these flavors include yogurt.  Some babies younger than 1-year may have a reaction to yogurt and other dairy foods, so just watch out for that.

Summary: Buyer Beware - Jars break in transit!
Text: My daughter loves Earth's Best food items but after two broken shipments from Amazon, I decided to buy from the grocery store.  I sent an email to Amazon but my issue was never resolved.
My son loves all the food by earths best but would like to mention that it's way cheaper buying in store than amazon. Amazon charges 2 - 3$ more than stores.

We feed our baby this Wholesome Breakfast at any time of the day, not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  We particularly like that this food contains yogurt.  When she was young (~6 months old), our baby loved yogurt but couldn't eat it plain because it would cause a rash around her mouth.  She was never bothered by the yogurt in this food, though, perhaps because it was mixed with other things.  Now that she's older (10 months), our baby can eat all the yogurt she wants without a skin reaction, but for awhile, this variety of Wholesome Breakfast was the only source of her favorite food.

We're not sure why, but this this flavor of Earth's Best Wholesome Breakfast (Peach, Pear, and Barley) is our baby's favorite flavor.  She'll eat this any time of the day, and we're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  Also, our baby is a picky eater, so we're thrilled to find something she likes that's more substantial than Puffs!

My daughter loves the entire Earths Best line.  I taste everything before I feed it to her and each item tastes pure and fresh.  Very happy.  We've tasted other popular name brands, and Earths Best is really good in comparison.

My son is lactose intolerant but he's able to eat this for some reason!  Moreover, it's great to start off a day with a nutritious meal versus eating empty calaries with little to no nutritional benefit.  Regardless, I'm very pleased with the quality and taste.  Yes, I tasted this and it is delish!

Summary: Fruit, dairy & grains...what more could you ask for!
Text: My little guy just loves this jar. I love the line of breakfast blends.  I am happy with Amazon's "grocery" business. It is great to have the convenience to order these on-line and have home delivery.  I can't imagine going the store and having to get a whole case and go through check out. I try to make him some meals, but I trust Earth's Best and love the flavor combo's and they are so convenient.

Summary: Earth's best Organic Pears and apple oatmeal
Text: I tried all kinds of oatmeal to give my LO but this is her favorite one. I also love the fact that it comes on time.

If I had only figured out to order baby food online before.  The price is right on the money and the convenience of the shipping to the house is great.  No need to go to the store and have baby jars flying all over the cart.  This flavor is my baby's favorite.  It's a go to when she is not in the mood for anything else.

I love Earth's Best products and only use them to feed my baby, besides home made foods. I rate this one one star because the seller didn't specify that this product contains milk, which my baby cannot tolerate since he is lactose-intolerant. So for us, it was a waste of money, and I bought two packs...

This baby food, labeled for 6+ months, contains heavy cream. My baby could not digest it; we had a very bad day. Maybe I missed that in the description, but in any case, everywhere I've read and according to my pediatrician, you're supposed to avoid cow's milk products before age 1 (why they make formula using cow's milk and not a much more digestible milk like goat baffles me and is a rant for another time--my son drinks the lactose free kind, in any case). I ordered another variety of "Wholesome breakfast" too: Pear, Apple, Oatmeal. Same thing there. I'm guessing they all have heavy cream in them.
My daughter likes it now, but when she was younger she did not want to have it! Go figure! Now she is almost 14 months she digs the flavor.
My son hated it. I tasted some and saw why. It's tart and the barley gives it a weird smell and flavor. Yuck!

I wish Amazon would include a list of ingredients on baby food in bulk. This has cream in it and my baby has a cow's milk intolerance. I had already opened the jar when I read the ingredients and now I'm stuck with 15 jars of food I can't use. So disappointing.
I bought quite a lot of these in the past. My son loved them. I like the fact that they are organic and the combination of fruits and vegetables in them is just right.

Summary: Good breakfast, especially on the go.
Text: We do fruit and cereal for breakfast daily.  This comes in handy when we are on the go, since i dont have to bring cereal long.  I also like that it is 4.5 ounces, since some of the earth's best fruit and cereal combos are only 4 ounces.
My son eats these for breakfast every morning and he seems to really enjoy them. It is a nice alternative to fruit and rice cereal and it has all the nourishment my son needs to start his day.
Price was great, variety, flavor was good, baby likes it! She takes a while to eat, but it's safe and clean to leave in the refrigerator.
Great baby foods!  I like the variety pack.  Much cheaper than buying it from the local grocers or co-op!  I Just wish they came in the squeezie pouches!

Summary: Great and easy food for the baby
Text: Right combination. We originally thought our baby had some allergies. However, as we fed these food baby got used to them and she liked them all.
Little one loves these and glass is recyclable forever which plastic (Gerber) is not. About the same price, food is healthier and she's more likely to eat this stuff.
We love the organic baby food. It costs just a small amount more, but it is totally worth it.  Our son loves the different choices.
I love how it's thicker than other Stage 2 baby food. My son gobbles it down! Way better than the lunch or dinner varities!
This was by far my daughters favorite Earth's Best breakfast.  It's nice that it contains organic fruit and whole grains.  Plus the prices on amazon can't be beat, especially with subscribe and save!

Summary: My son loves it! Very nutritional!
Text: This is one of my sons favorites. Even though it's called "wholesome breakfast" he usually has this for lunch. It is packed with nutrients, including 35% of his daily iron. This is a staple in our baby's diet!

We initially tried few sample from Ralph's and our Baby started liking it .. We don't give formula to our Baby and we give only Mom's milk.
i think when we combine that with this wholesome breakfast you will have a satisfaction that you are really taking a good care of the Baby..
What's more it had got more calories than the regular baby foods and it had got 35% iron which i consider important.. It has dates in it. Very few baby foods for breakfast have dates in them.. on the whole it's really a wholesome breakfast.. Add organic on top of that what else can you ask for.. I had only one thing to complain about.. it's availability is rare.. i had to wait for a month to get it.. I don't find it in the store shelves either..

We feed our baby this Wholesome Breakfast at any time of the day, not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  Also, our baby is a picky eater, so we're thrilled to find something she likes that's more substantial than Puffs!
I enjoy most of the Yogi teas but this particular one tastes almost sinful. I don't know that it necessarily tastes a lot like vanilla or hazelnut but it has a very delicious spicy taste.

The title above refers not only to a semi-obscure Damon Runyan-based movie with Bob Hope (we ALL knew that), but to these classic lemon drops with a truly international pedigree:

Made in Spain; owned by the French(Cadbury France, located at 143 Boulevard Romain Rolland, Paris; imported by New Jersey's own "Euro-American Brands," Paramus, NJ 07652.

All the way from Paris to your local candy seller or movie theater (which is where I experieced my first taste of La Vie en Lemon). They were everything a lemon drop should be: A sugary entrance, developing into a deeply satisfying, soul-stirring essence of pure lemon. The mouth-watering joy of the lemon drop is seductive and addictive, and I am nearly certain that sucking on these golden gems made Kurosawa's "Savage Dogs" even more enjoyable.

They're hard candies. but not so hard that you couldn't cheat and bite into one, breaking it up into ten or so smaller candies, zig-zagging around your mouth like offshoots from a single magnificent fireworks explosion.

One 2-ounce tin lasted longer than the 2 hours or so of Kurosawa's brilliant detective drama, one of his first with Toshiro Mifune, who once again delivers a compelling performance. Although the packaging is a bit precious, there's nothing pretentious about the taste of Les Citrons, and as for value, these drops are the working man or woman's workhorse. They're far less expensive than other candy (to say nothing of popcorn), and their staying power is extraordinary.

Still, this vendor charges more than some others, and with the added shipping fee one may wish to purchase these at a local outlet (or occupying it until your lemon drop demands are met). If you're serious about your lemon drops, tt's Paris 1968 all over again.

Nutritional Information per Package (30 pieces; you could try to eat the suggested serving size of 3 drops, but I find this highly unlikely). 240 calories, no fat or sodium, 60 grams carbohydrates, 60 grams of sugar, no protein, and no trace of food allerges. Sugar, corn syrup, citric acid, natural flavor, and tumoric for color. THh lemon-decorated little tin adds a touch of Europe to any room, and is ideal for holding cuff links, tickets, keys, small, delicate make-up products, or quarters for the laundry. To paraphrase the great Margaret Dumont:
"Les Citrons, Toujours...Les Citrons!"

I bought 4 high end dry foods that my miniature poodle simply would not eat. I tried mixing it with canned food and broth, but she'd lick off the canned food and leave the kibble. I was worried that she wasn't getting the nutrients she needed. Then I found Utramix and I am thrilled. She loves it, actually cleans her bowl. I merely drizzle a little warm water on it since I'm no longer mixing in canned food and she gobbles it up. There are chunks of bananas, peas, carrots, etc. that she seems to love. The mix even contains probiotics. Highly recommended.

Summary: NOH Haupia is the greatest desert ever mande
Text:
In 2006, I was assigned to a project in San Francisco. A co-worker/friend introduced me to a coconut pudding. I hate coconut but fell in love with this stuff.

I recently found some in World Market, but it is no longer a offered product. I searched on Amazon and found it. I am so happy I know where I can find when I want.

A extremly healthy plant that has grown dramatically since its arrival. It should be an exceptional plant for blooming if it casts blooms as readily as it grows vegatatively. I have high expectations for this one!

Some years ago my husband and I were lucky enough to visit Ireland several times. While there we discovered Bewley's Tea Shop in Dublin, and also their Irish Afternoon Tea. It was better than any other tea I have ever had -- and I am a committed tea drinker. The 'finish' is incredibly smooth, with just the right 'body' for an afternoon pick me up.

We bought several boxes to take home in our suitcases;then when we ran out, we had coworkers who were going to Ireland bring more of it back to us. When our Irish trips ended and our sources dried up, we were truly disheartened, since we had only found it in one location in the States [a little tea shop in Alexandria, Virginia.]

When I found out that it is now available through Amazon/Sullivan's I was elated and placed my order that day. Unfortunately I didn't see that the large box of it [80] teabags would soon be available until after I had placed my order for smaller boxes. The large boxes are a MUCH better value [80 teabags for $8.99 as oppossed to 25 teabags for $5.99]. That is certainly the way I will order in the future. But I'm delighted to find a source for Bewley's teas, especially Irish Afternoon. And I am anxious to try the Dublin Morning tea, which I also ordered. Happy Nonnie!

About 10 years ago while visiting disneyworld in orlando florida my wife and I met a nice english couple. Being a tea drinker I inquired about good english teas and they gave me a napkin with the names of bewleys tea on it and about 6 teabags for me to try. I put the napkin in my back pocket and the teabags got wrapped up in an old sandwich bag and put in my wife's purse. We parted with the nice english couple and as we traveled around disneyworld it began to rain that afternoon and we got soaking wet. I found what was left of the napkin that evening at the hotel and it was unreadable. About 6 months later at home the bag fell out of my tea closet as i was fixing to make a cup and I decided to finally try the tea those nice folks from england raved about. I loved the tea and I believe I have finally found it in bewleys. Some of the best tea I have had. The english surely know their tea.

So far, my all time favorite teas come from Bewley's. Not quite as strong as PG Tips (i like that too, but a bit of a kick). This tea is more rounded out than Lipton and stronger. A wonderful flavor. -- Those Irish have got it going on!

I have been drinking Taylors of Harrogate, Yorkshire Gold Tea until I tried Bewley's. I have always like my tea very strong using double the amount of most people. I drink it with cream and sugar and this tea is perfect for me. I do not have to put in extra because it is full bodied and stands up to cream and sugar wonderfully. I have been drinking it in the morning and have been using the Yorkshire Gold for the afternoon. Bewley's is my favorite now, not that Yorkshire Gold sucks or anything but I like it strong. I will still search for another tea perhaps as good. Life is an adventure and you never know when you're going to bingo.

If you like a strong, not bitter brew try Bewley's! After you've had Irish it is hard to go back, teawise that is.

Summary: WARNING! Made all four of my dogs sick
Text: Recently purchased these treats for my 4 dogs from local grocery store. After giving my dogs these chews, my 3 month old puppy threw up the treat. By the next day at lunch time, he was exhibiting neurotoxic symptoms. We immediately took him to the vet for blood work, which all came back below normal limits. He was given IV therapy and monitored over night. Over the next two days, my older dogs (ages 4, 7 and 9)began vomiting and acting lethargic, but with no neurological symptoms. We traced the cause back to these chews, as it is the only coomon thing among all the dogs (puppy eats different food than adult dogs, puppy is walked on a leash not allowed to run around in yard yet, puppy is not out of his crate unless he is beig observed, etc.). After speaking with someone at a pet store, we learned some rawhide chews are pressed with water, while others are pressed with formaldehyde. While it is not listed which method these use, we are concerned it is the formaldehyde. In the case of the older dogs, their GIs are rejecting them due to the toxins. With the puppy, his immature renal and hepatic system exhibited neurotoxicity.

I ordered these tails a while back for my Parents to be shipped to St. George, Utah. The customer service and express shipping were excellent. The tails were recieved on time and still frozen. The best part is the tails are very large and sometimes from other sources, I have recieved tails this size that were "Soft" and not firm meat. These were fantastic and were saved up to 3-4 months with a couple retrived from the freezer and broiled....perfectly every time..Thank
s for the great product and service!!

Summary: Yes, it is like chewing on a sponge!
Text:
I confirm another review here that perfectly describes the texture and taste of this product as like chewing on a cellulose sponge! OMG! I love tofu, by the way. This is the first tofu I've eaten in decades that I did not like.

I bought this after reading that review and thinking the person was maybe not familiar with the taste of tofu, or perhaps tried to eat this without re-hydrating this first. No, it is like chewing on a sponge (Have we all by accident done this, or is it an early childhood memory of times when we tested everything with our mouths?) At any rate, you will instantly think "sponge" if you ignore these warnings and buy this tofu. I do not mean just the texture, it really tastes like a cellulose sponge!

I am also a fan of Eden Foods and enjoy many of their products, they make great tamari, for instance. I was looking for that texture and taste I find in freeze dried tofu pieces that come in soup mixes as in instant miso tofu soup packets or soup cups. This isn't that tofu! It will not be wasted, it has good protein and I can chop it in very small pieces and mix it with Creamy Tomato Soup by Pacific Naturals, that makes it innocuous enough. But I'll never buy this again!

I am looking into buying a food dehydrator to make my own. The cost of tofu is much lower that this item reflects. I will update this if I have success drying my own tofu. Believe the reviews here, this isn't good.

Summary: This is really bad - sponge like when rehydrated.
Text: If you feel compelled to buy this, get it from Whole Foods so you don't waste money buying the 6 pack. Buyer beware that you cannot return many food items. The texture of this after rehydration was like a cellulose sponge.If you must have dehydrated tofu for hiking or camping trips, make your own or buy the tofu in the sealed boxes.  On the flip side, I love many of Eden products but this was a waste of my money.

Summary: You Need to Learn How to Cook Dried Tofu
Text:
Koya Dofu, or freeze-dried tofu, requires a specific approach to cooking. It not only has to be rehydrated in a particular way, but also will not taste good without proper cooking to flavor and soften it. Even at that point, it will have a chewy, slightly spongey texture, but if cut and cooked appropriately, it is not a strange texture and is very delicious as a side dish.

Google recipes for Koyadofu and try one that involves simmering it (after rehydration) in a broth made of katsuobushi (if you are not vegetarian -- if you are, then use mushroom or vegie stock), shouyu or tamari, mirin, and a little sweetner. My child loves this, and I pack it in her school lunch box along with rice, and some vegies that have been simmered in the same broth.

I really enjoy flavored coffees, and like how mild Melitta coffees are. (I am not a fan of French roast (i.e., Starbucks) - it's too bitter and burnt tasting for me.) Melitta's French vanilla flavor, however, is my least favorite of the Melitta flavored coffees (behind hazelnut and morning decadence). I find that the flavor is too overwhelming and cloying. For those who like strong flavor, this will be a hit, but I find that I have to mix it (1 spoon of flavored to 2 spoons of regular) in order to enjoy it.

I've tried almost every ground coffee there is, and I have to say that Melitta French Vanilla (and Hazelnut) is the best tasting coffee ever. You don't have to use a lot of coffee, so the can lasts longer than leading brands. The taste is a non-powerful, strong blend with a subtle vanilla. Even when the coffee is brewing it's out of this world!

Amazon has a great price for this item. WHEN my store has it on sale, they ask $4.89 for a can, so this is a nice price plus the wonderful free shipping offer. I received my coffee two days after I ordered it! I will now add this to the list of groceries I now order through Amazon.

Highly recommend you to try this coffee and see if you agree too!
This coffee is nice and strong, but not bitter. Buttery smooth and just the right touch of vanilla.

We'd been buying the four-pack of Melitta French Vanilla coffee once a month for the past 2 years. We won't be any more. In the last month they changed their packaging, which is fine, but also changed the grind. All of a sudden, these four packs come in "extra fine grind," which simply doesn't work well at all in our drip coffee maker. The whole pot tastes weak until you get to the last couple of cups, which taste more like mud because all of the coffee has settled. Here's hoping they switch back at some point, because this is just bad.

When it comes down to so many Americans, they are right now skipping going to Starbucks to get their favorite flavor of coffee and lattes, and having them right at home. Fortunately, Melitta knows that feeling with their coffees, and make them well from the heart. Their French Vanilla is a delightful tast that just melts your heart away. It is delicious after the first cup, and just everlasting. My one and only gripe with Melitta though is that with their ground coffees is that they are very hard to open the cans, considering you'd have to use a regular can opener to get them open, rather than peel the top off from Folgers or Maxwell House. That definitely is the only thing that is not only frustrarting, but can easily cause the consumer to break the can. Still, the taste is great and if you want a nice soulfully delightful cup of joe, Melitta can take you there.

Price: B-

Taste: A-

Convience: B-

Overall: B

If you love good medium-roasted and well balanced coffee then you will love Melitta.

PROS:

1. Melitta only uses the top 2% of the world's supply of 100% Arabica coffee and it tastes it. (and NO, I don't work for the company!) Arabica is the finest grade of coffee available on the market. The other grade, "Robusto" is generally less expensive, lower quality and used by most other major coffee processors such as Chock Full O' Nuts, Folgers, Maxwell House and almost all generic and store brands to name a few).

2. The 11.5 oz. cans are nitrogen-flushed and well-sealed to retain its integrity and fresh roasted flavor upon opening. I have found consistently that coffee packaged in plastic or paper bags or pouches DOES NOT, in my opinion, retain its flavor and freshness well.

3. If you have a drip coffee maker (Like Bunn, Mr. Coffee or others), Melitta's fine grind works exceptionally well. Remember...the finer the grind, the more flavor you will extract from the coffee. In addition, the finer the grind, the more efficiently your coffee maker will use coffee. Since you can generally use less coffee per cup, Melitta is a winner for price per ounce.

4. Melitta seems to be a very transparent and consumer responsible company. They place clear "Best By" dates on the bottom of each of their products.

CONS:

1. Some of Melitta's flavors, like French Vanilla and a seasonally-offered coffee called "Morning Decadence", are very hard to find but well worth investigating and sampling if you have a chance.

BOTTOM LINE:

The best commercially available coffee for drip coffee makers. Outstanding grind, well-balanced flavors and consistent freshness can after can.

First of all, 10 days ago Amazon ran this coffee on a great special, about $4.70 per pound.  This was my first try; I should have bought more because Amazon has about doubled the price in less than two weeks.  This is a medium blend and grind as advertised.  The top is tightly sealed; it was the hardest pull off top that I've ever encountered, and you could hear the air express as it was opened.  The aroma is great in the can, when brewing, and in the cup. The taste is, for me, somewhat artificial although not obnoxious, but it cost a star in my book.  There is no residual acidity or aftertaste.  The expiration date is fine, at May 2012; it won't last anywhere near that long.
Excellent coffee, great price, delivered to my door. The subscription program is flexible so you can buy sooner or push back the delivery dates. What else can you ask for!
Good but still not as good as Maxwell House Vanilla.  This is for those who like a strong cup of coffee.

I have been a big Starbucks fan for a long time now, but thought I would try something that I could do the subscribe and save deal on. I chose this one because of the great reviews and thought it would make a change to have a flavored coffee. I am so glad I did! I love it. It is so smooth and the aroma when you open the can is wonderful. Can't wait to try the other types of Melitta coffee now too.

I am a fan of Melitta's other coffees, especially hazelnut, but they just didn't get French Vanilla right. There is something of a chemical aftertaste to it that contradicts the nice aroma. It's noticeable enough to make you wonder if something is "not quite right" with it. Not disgusting, you can definitely get through your cup but not delicious either.
We use this in our Keurig coffee machine in the reusable filter.  Comes out great every time, just make sure not to fill past the line.
Yes the coffee is good but why do you raise the price without letting anyone know??  I expect 1 price to be debited from my account and then the price goes up $5 without warning or notice!  Not Cool!

I was a little apprehensive about ordering coffee online.  I had never heard of this brand, but to my delight, it is absolutely delicious.  I love it and my husband enjoys the Vanilla and also one of the other blends.  I would recommend if you are fan of any flavored coffee.

I love it! Great smell and exceptional taste! I've tried lot of different sorts/tastes of coffee from cheap to exclusively expensive, but this one remains one of my faorite for years.
Great Coffee! Worth to try and you will not be disappointed!

The Melitta French Vanilla has been a hit with both family and with guests. Great aroma, balanced and smooth coffee with a rich taste. We ordered more to give as gifts and ordered other Melitta blends because we were so impressed with this one and like changing our coffee every week or so.

Summary: smaller than the ones in the stores
Text: I thought these were going to be the same size as the ones in the grocery store. I found they were smaller and more expensive to buy online then if I just bought the bigger ones for 99 cents each at the grocery store.

Summary: Twix King Package a little old...
Text: We got a super deal (under $12) on this box of Twix King Size candy, so I can't really complain... BUT the caramel was a tad harder/chewier than it should be for fresh bars. Perhaps they were clearancing them out.

$23.52 for ten pounds of these beans???  I just bought a bag of these at Sam's Club for $8.95.  If you want to pay nearly 4 times the going rate, by ALL MEANS, purchase this!  Seriously, how STUPID would a person need to be to pay $2.53 for a pound of dried beans?

but WHY would you package the product into four separate pouches (which I love) and have a nutrition label say the box contains "about 10 servings"???? I may agree that one pouch is enough for two small servings, great with milk warmed up by the way, but how do you get 2 1/4 servings from a pouch?

Summary: Yummy and good on the go
Text: I like variety in my gf cereals and this granola is a nice addition to my shelf. The granola comes in packets inside the box so it is handy for travel. It's sweet but not too sweet. I eat it in a bowl with milk and it is just the right amount. Granola is more dense so a portion is smaller than a bowl full of cereal.

I've been eating Glutenfreeda's Granola for breakfast the past two months and I love it!
especially the individual packaging, keeps it fresh.

Glutenfreeda's gluten free granola is an ideal breakfast food for people who have to eat gluten free.  It also makes an on the road snack that is easy to pack in your purse or carry on luggage.  The oats in it are guarrenteed to be gluten free.

The Melitta Java Pods Have a slightly smaller circumference than the Senseo pods and are thicker. If you are using a Senseo coffee machine, you probably should moisten the Java pod and smooth it before attempting to latch the lid. Otherwise, you risk breaking the latching mechanism. The resulting decaf coffee is not bad and seems to this reviewer to have a richer taste than the Senseo decaf pods. The Melitta Java pods are not really designed for the Senseo machine and several other brands such as Halo, Fratello and Millstone work better in the Senseo machine.
Although this coffee tastes fine there is nowhere enough coffee in the pod.  The cup that is brewed even with a smaller amount of water is weak and watery.
The Parisian Cafe blend is wonderful but it is too thick to fit correctly in the Senseo machine.  The box advertises universal fit but it is not.

Coffee has a great flavor and is not too acidic. Fits perfectly in out "Juan Valdez" pod maker that was purchased at Target several years ago! So hard to find these so was glad to find them on Amazon!

Summary: Good but a bit big for senseo
Text: Smooth coffee, but a bit to big for senseo, interestingly all the other Melitta One pod flavors fit just fine in senseo, my fav are french kisses and vanilla haze.
My husband didn't care for this coffee at all.  He complained it lacked flavor and aroma.

Summary: Best home-brewed coffee on the planet!
Text: We love Melitta coffee pods.  Makes a perfect cup of coffee every time. The coffee is always delicious, even the decaf blend!  If you have a coffee pod machine, try all of their blends...they're great!
I love coffee and at night really miss out if I don't have the decaff.
This decaf pod has wonderful flavor.  It is much better than their previous decaf "Skip the Buzz".  I'm glad they upgraded their product.

I had bought a Black and Decker one-cup coffee maker that used these pods.  It didn't work properly, but I have managed to use the pods with my old, stand-by coffee maker and am please with the flavor and convenience.  Someone had commented about a problem with some of the pods being sealed in the outer packaging.  I have not encountered that problem.  Overall, I am pleased with this purchase.

Some issues with the product -- some of the pods are not sealed properly so the grounds spill out (either before use or after use into your coffee); it is wasteful that each pod is individually sealed -- would rather they be packaged like the Senseo pods; the pods don't really fit my Senseo coffee maker -- too fat for the single and too small for the double which causes problems sometimes when I brew a cup.  On the plus side -- price.

Melitta pods are full flavored; however, they do not fit my senseo coffee machine.  One pod in a two pod holder is too small and two pods are too large.  Sure do wish senseo was still readily available in the super markets!

My mom has the Hamilton Beach single cup coffee maker and was using Senseo pods in it. They were too strong / bitter for her and I was searching for something else.  Found these and Wolfgang Puck's and decided to get both for her.  These Melitta Breakfast Blend pods are her favorite! She says they have a smooth taste and great flavor. Granted, neither of us would ever be mistaken for a coffee judge by anyone (I don't even drink coffee so my opinion means nothing), but she really likes these and is happy to have them.

To make a decent cup of coffee I have to use two pods at a time. I prefer a strong cup of coffee even if it IS decaf.
What happened to Senseo decaf?
this was delicious coffee for a great price which i could not find at any store in my area or areas nearby
Enjoying my Java Pods very much. Easy and fast. Medium strong to wake me up. I get positive comments on the convenience of making coffee.

This coffee .Melitta One:One Java Pods,Breakfast Blend Coffee, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4) is terrible. Cheap beans, bad roast, whatever, my lot actually tastes like it is moldy. Maybe I just got a bad batch. I have tried the Buzzworthy dark roast Melitta Pods and they are drinkable, even though I prefer medium roast coffees. Suggest you try one box of these, not the 4 box lot I'm stuck with. Also, to help you evaluate this response better, you should know that I like quality roast Kenya AA or Sumatra or Columbian Supremo, etc. rich flavor type coffees.
