These are hands down the best cookies I've had in my life, including "regular" cookies, and this is the first time I can actually say a gluten free item tastes better than its gluten counterpart.

My WalMart sells these for 3.38/bag and I got them here for a bit over 2.00/bag with subscribe and save. This will definitely be a staple in our household! We've eaten an entire bag in less than 24 hours. Nobody could ever guess that these cookies are gluten free, they are AMAZING!!

REALLY ENJOY THE 'SNAPPY GINGER' TASTE IN MI-DEL GLUTEN-FREE GINGER SNAPS.
THIS CASE SEEMED TO ONLY HAVE ABOUT 5-8 WHOLE, IN TACT COOKIES IN EACH PACKAGE. THEY WERE MOSTLY GINGER SNAP CRUMBS!
I HAVE ORDERED THESE GLUTEN-FREE COOKIES OFTEN AND THE MOSTLY CRUMBS WAS A FIRST. I HAVE BEEN PLEASED WITH OTHER MI-DEL GLUTEN-FREE COOKIES I HAVE ORDERED IN THE PAST.
HAVEN'T DECIDED IF I WILL ORDER A CASE OF THEM AGAIN.

I love this company and what they are trying to do. However, when I first got my celiac diagnosis, though, I got glutened by these.

A couple of years passed. The buzz on the celiac boards was that Mi-Del had really cleaned up their act, and that their cookies were safe. From about 2004-2009, I ate these without incident. I even figured out how to make cookie pie crusts in them and put the recipe in my gluten-free cookbook. Then, I got a bad batch two times in a row, and got glutened again.

Maybe they have problems with suppliers? I understand they've been a lot more careful with the actual manufacturing process.

It's sad, but I would buy Pamela's ginger cookies (available on Amazon!) instead.

We love these cookies, better than "K" vanilla.  My husband is not gluten free, and this is his favorite cookie too.  Yes, they are a crisp cookie (some may call hard), but that is why I like them.  They have a rich vanilla flavor which the "K" cookies do not. I carry these in my purse when when we are dining out so I have a gluten free dessert, restaurants never mind this.  For chocolate, we still like the "K" chocolate the best. Note: I use the auto delivery every 6 month for a better price.

Summary: All six gluten free people in our house love them!
Text: These are so tasty! Just the perfect amount of sweetness! They are nicely brown around the edges, so delicious!

Mi-Del Gluten-Free Ginger Snaps are the only gluten free cookies I've found that I would put on par with really good regular cookies. Besides a taste that I enjoy, they have a nice slightly chewy texture. You'll be doing double takes to make sure the label actually says gluten-free.

Summary: Review of Mi-del Chocolate Sandwich Cookies
Text:
These are the best "wheat" free cookeis.
This was a great price and availabiltiy.
Would love to business again! Thanks.

These ginger snaps are delicious with a lot of ginger flavor. They are good alone or with fruit, and they make an excellent substitute for graham cracker crumb crust, especially with lemon merengue pie. We love them. No one would ever guess they were also gluten-free.

Summary: Great to use in cheesecake crusts
Text:
I use these cookies to make gluten free cheesecake crusts.
I turn them into crumbs using a chopper and then use these crumbs in place of the graham crackers in the recipe.
I also use less butter than the recipe asks for in the crust as the cookies have some oil already in them.
Anyway the cookies taste great as a gluten free cheesecake crust and everyone gives compliments ;-)

My husband and I also like to eat these cookies with pudding by Kozy Shack, which is also gluten free.
The flavor of my first bite was unbelievably intense.  I've tried numerous GF cookies, these are my favorite by a long shot. The package has been redesigned, it is now cream & blue in color.
I will buy these cookies again. I am glad that I order them regardless of the not so good reviews.

To date, this is the only gluten free cookie I've tried and absolutely loved.  They have a livelier flavor than vanilla wafers and are sweeter (but not too sweet) than what you expect from regular animal crackers.  I subscribed to these and am glad they come in the bulk quantity they do, since even my gluten-loving coworkers devour them as soon as they see they're out for taking.

Delicious? Check!
Gluten free? Check!
Good price? Check!

Thank you, amazon, for making these great cookies available! It is difficult finding things to eat when you have a gluten intolerance and it is even HARDER finding things to eat that TASTE GOOD!

All of the celiacs in my family enjoy these animal crackers! Five stars!

Mi-Del Ginger Snaps are far better in texture and flavor than any I have ever purchased. I have eaten many varieties of ginger snaps in my 85 years of life, and appreciate this as an exceptionally good product.  The only problem I have is that I can't stop eating them!

My grandson's gluten allergy led me to these cookies because animal cookies are a tradtional Christmas gift for children in our family. Our entire family loves them, but the real test is on unsuspecting gluten consuming individuals and they past the test. Recently the contractor came by in the afternoon with his son's 8 and 10 years old.  They looked hungry and so I offered cookies, with Dad's permission.  They almost wiped out the bag. Good Cookies!
These animal cracker cookies taste the most like the "other" kind that I have tried so far.  So much fun to eat with the grandchildren.
My son loves these cookies! They're tasty and reasonable-2 traits which often don't describe gluten free baked goods! Enjoy!
These are great cookies.  I have two girls with celiac disease, one is a toddler. Finding foods that are like the "real" thing is tough these are a great treat and we love them!

These cookies are a wonderful replacement for any kid ( or grown up ) wanting to eat a long time favorite. There is about 80 cookies per bag, so it makes it well worth the money spent. They are light, buttery and crispy making them great for milk. These pack well in bags for lunch  ( don't break up easily ) so they would do great in a kid's lunch for school or daycare. I actually give these cookies to people to show them gluten free doesn't mean cardboard.

Summary: You can eat ginger snaps again!
Text: These ginger snaps aren't too overpowering on the ginger and go great with some milk. Really enjoyed having these in the house and they are a great buy - so affordable compared to most alternative diet foods. They'll last for at least a week or so and store well.
I love these cookies.  I can't eat gluten and they are a healthy treat. Family members who can eat gluten enjoy them also.
Ginger Snaps are delicious.  Not too sweet and loaded with flavor. Wonderful texture, great with a nice cup of tea.
Very good gluten free animal cookies... We use them as re-inforcers for my son.  Very good product.

I picked the Cinnamon Snaps up at my Grandma's local health food store the last time I visited and loved them.  I have yet to try the ginger snaps but I'm sure they are just as good.  Hopefully Amazon will start carrying the Cinnamon Snaps.

These are one of the two best gluten free animal cookies on the market. The other being: EnviroKidz Organic Gluten-Free Animal Cookies, Vanilla, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) I prefer Mi-Del because they are more economical than EnviroKidz and my daughter loves these cookies.

Even if you're able to eat regular cookies (not Gluten free) you'll love these. Really sweet, and incredibly tasty. Since I can't have Gluten in my diet, these have become my staple desert. I buy them two cases at a time so I'll never run out.

Summary: Both my 5 yr old son and I love them.
Text: Hard to find products that my son's diet allows him to eat.  This is a great treat.  He loves them.  I have a hard time keeping out of the opened bag of cookies myself.  They are crunchy but we love them.
These ginger cookies are great if you are on a gluten-free diet. They are spicy, not too sweet and are great for dunking!

Summary: Not pleased with these att all!
Text: This cookie is too hard to bite into and the center is like eating crispy sugar.  I did not care for these at all and now I have a whole case of them.  Guess they will end up as a pie crust or something.
These are spicy, and my kids love them too. They are crispy and I am SO glad I found these after being diagnosed with Celiac.

Thanks to hubby's recent diagnosis of gluten allergy, I've begun to explore the world of gluten free foods. While some are quite bland, these little cookies pack a flavorful punch! Nothing "depriving" here.

These Ginger Snaps were very good but I ordered the gluten free ginger snaps and they were shipped in error and all my complaints to Amazon were ignored.
Bill

I ordered these for my son (age 11). He doesn't like them at all. I thought they would be similar to the Kinnikinnick cookies we get at our local health food store, but they're not. These are rock hard and although sugary, otherwise have no flavor. We'll stick with the Kinnikinnicks. I'm just hoping maybe I can use these for making a cookie crumb crust.
I love these and it is the best treat.  I love cookies and couldn't find one that was very good until I found these.  I can eat a whole bag in one day!  Matter of fact, I need to order another case.

These cookies are so good - you'd never know that they were wheat free!  The bags are not filled anywhere near full (my only compliant - too much packaging) so a package of 8 is not really too much.  2 bags of cookies will fit in a medium clamp-top glass jar (which is how I store them in my kitchen)  Looking forward to trying the Chocolate cookies next...

I have a 4 yr old and a 2 yr old that can't eat gluten and this is an awesome products for them. We always have some with us where ever we go and they absolute love them. They are moderately sweet and crunchy.
They also make a wonderful pie crust. 1 1/2 cup cookie crumbs, 5 TBS margerine, 1 TBS surgar. Mix and pat into pie plate. Bake 10 min at 350 degrees.
We couldn't live without them. Thanks Mi-Del!!!

Summary: A Comparison to Nature's Path EnviroKidz Animal Crackers
Text:
Mi-Del: Slightly cheaper per ounce, crackers are actually animal shaped, butter cookie taste (like those that come in a tin around the holiday season)

Envirkidz: Square cookie/cracker, vanilla flavor
Nature's Path EnviroKidz Organic Gluten-Free Animal Cookies, Vanilla, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Both have similar nutrition profiles (calories, fat, grams of carbohydrate) and are GF.

My shipment was not stale, unlike the other reviewer's complaint. Both taste fine and I find I can't put the box down sometimes, but I am not a big sugar/butter cookie fan, so I think I prefer the Envirokidz. Definitely a better deal than the local health food store and, trust me, you WILL be able to eat the whole box before they expire.

Great replacement for traditional animal cookies.  My daughter, like me, cannot have gluten but loves these cookies.  I even serve them as a snack for the nursery at church.  The kids love them.... and here at Amazon, they are the right price for sharing.

Summary: A favorite of my autistic son
Text: Although made with butter (my son is GF/CF), my son has no digestive or behavior problems after eating these.  He's thrilled to be able to have animal crackers again.  They are perfect for school snack or in the car.  The cookies are tasty enough that Mom and Dad (who do eat wheat) will snack on them as well.  They are quite pricey in the store, but Amazon's subscription price makes them fairly affordable - and much easier than always making homemade.

Summary: Great for everyone in the family.
Text: Both my kids (8 and 4) love these cookies.  They have always been really crunchy.  We've never had them mushy like in another review.  They are not too sweet and have fun shapes.  Great for anyone gluten sensitive, and everyone else in the family.
Sadly, the cookies in this shipment  were soft (they should be crunchy).  I now only buy them from the store self where they are fresh.
Recently diagnosed with celiac disease. Bought these at a grocery store, but the ginger flavor is very strong. The tecture is good, though.
If you are looking for mild ginger flavored snaps...these are not it.  If you however, enjoy a very strong ginger taste, give these a try.

These cookies were AWFUL!  Really bad.  My co-worker and I each bit into one and we couldn't finish it.  I tried one a week or so later when I was really hungry and it was still terrible.  Not only do they not taste good, but instead of being bland, they actually taste BAD and leave a horrible aftertaste.  I buy a lot of Gluten Free products and almost everything is really good but this was far from it.

I love me the regular Mi-Del Ginger Snaps... but out of a fluke I picked me up a gluten free bag once and thought it tasted not so yummy.  like ginger flavored sweetend hard dirt.  so unless you have to have the gluten free for some reason go get you the normal ginger snaps which as of Sep 2006, Amazon offers
Took FOREVER to arrive and the case is way too many cookies to consume! Will stick to my local organic grocery next time. Once again, ordering food from Amazon has fallen far below expectations.

Wow! I've been buying dog treats for over 40 years and this one takes the cake! Pay no attention to the photo in the advertisement for this product. What you get is two (2) small chews in each of three (3) shrink wrapped over cardboard packages. That's a total of six (6) small chews for $30.00 not including shipping! I couldn't return my order quick enough.

I was not impressed about this product (Made in China). Cheaply made and not very good quality. Outside was coated with redish brown sweet something which stained the carpet.  My dog first tried to lick the coating and then bit the "bone".  It was like hard leather, more than bone, and left a mess of shreds about as well.

Summary: Only rawhide my dog will chew
Text: Okay, my chihuaha is finicky...i have wasted lots of money on other rawhide chews and finally found one! Thank you beefeaters.

My little yourkie absolutely loves these treats. He chews all the chicken off first, which I think helps keep his teeth clean, and then goes to work on the rawhide.

GREAT product, but the packaging wasn't too great. The bones were falling out when I got them... a little concerning.
Each evening before going to bed my dog gets a chick n top.  It relaxes her with a treat that she really enjoys.
My hound is surprisingly picky about treats.  But these are his all time favorites.  He, Wimsey, likes all the chicken top/treated Beefeater products
THIS IS NOT A PACK OF 12 BUT OF 3. I AM VERY UNHAPPY. PRODUCT IS NOT AS DESCRIBED  DO NOT ORDER IF YOU EXPECT 12 BONES. RIP OFF.  AMAZON SHOULD BE ASHAMED.

Summary: wonderful treat but doesn't last as long as other rawhide
Text: My 30 pound puppy goes crazy for these, he really loves them.  He's just in heaven when he's chewing on one of these, but they only last about 20 minutes.  If you're looking for something that lasts much longer than a biscuit but doesn't need to last for hours like other rawhide treats then this is perfect.

Summary: Very convenient box sizes with good price
Text:
I like the convenience of subscribe & save along with the box sizes which makes it convenient to give to day care for our son as well as carrying it with you in his diaper bag (either the full box or a few of the packets inside the box). Even when traveling it was convenient to carry the packets rather than a box which when opened is always spilling out.

As for the taste, our son loves it. We have tried other Earth's organic product like the food jars and our son loves all their products.

Summary: Prefer the rice Earth's Best over this one
Text:
We've used this cereal many times for our twins and have had no problems. It's a great brand. Earth's Best rice cereal is made from whole brown rice whereas this one lists organic whole oat flour as the first ingredient. Flour compared to whole grain, for the same price. That first ingredient is a qualitative difference, whole rice versus oat flour, is the reason we go for the rice one when we can.

I have to load up at the store when they have Earth's Best rice cereal. They always have this one, the Whole Grain Oatmeal Cereal though. This one is never sold out.

Both of the two above-mentioned cereals work perfectly in formula, mixing right in as you'd want. Our babies are growing and they liked these cereals the moment they were introduced. Of course, one has to test a food out on one's baby(s). You never know if for some reason your baby will have a negative reaction. But we've had a very positive experience with Earth's Best. We also subscribe through Amazon to several Earth's Best baby food jars.

Summary: Not bad for diet, if you like the regular Moxie
Text: I was thrilled when they developed Diet Moxie as I usually drink diet soda. This is faithful to the recipe of the regular Moxie, without sacrificing too much of what makes Moxie Moxie. For a very limited product (only really available in scattered locales in New England), I was frankly surprised that they would produce a diet edition, but am very happy that they have. I understand all the reservations the full-octane drinkers have about diet drinks, but if you love Moxie as I do, your avenue is not cut off for enjoying the flavour of it if you need a diet variety.

I was very pleased to discover a few years ago that HometownFavorites continues to sell Moxie, which according to Wikipedia has "a unique flavor that is not as sweet as that of most modern soft drinks and that is described by some as bitter". Most sodas are too yucky sweet for my taste, but Moxie has a zingy flavor that I really like.

Even so, I don't drink any non-diet soda (non-nutritional junk, imho), so I'm glad that a diet version is available. I've bought it both directly from HometownFavorites and via Amazon.

Some of its appeal to me is undoubtedly nostalgia for a regional brand from New England, where I grew up. (I don't recall actually drinking the stuff as a kid. It was out of fashion by that time, and like most kids, I probably wouldn't have liked the slightly bitter taste.) If you're looking for a soda for grownups, you might like Moxie.

I don't care for Moxie, but my husband remembers it from when he was young and loves it.  We order a couple of times a year for him to enjoy.  My 10 year old grandson loves the taste also.  Will buy again from seller, very fast shipping.  Shipping costs are a little expensive.

Summary: This is the one for you!
Text: If you ever wanted the fine taste of used motor oil in a soft drink then Moxie is the One for you!  And now you can get Diet Moxie with the same old flavor with none of whatever diet drinks are supposed to take out!

I originally purchased from my local Wegmans supermarket in mid-March 2011, but they no longer carry it. My brother and I found this to be a delicious sauce, though much spicier than other Kung Pao sauces we were used to.

I highly recommend it, and will be ordering from Amazon as it is actually less expensive than ordering from Starport directly.

The "heat level" is probably closer to or slightly more than the "heat" of a product like Gold's Szechuan Duck Sauce, which is usually easier to find in the Philadelphia area.

One other note: this has the unusual name of "GENERAL Kung Pao Sauce", which I had never seen associated with "Kung Pao" before. I only every saw "General" with "Tso", as in "General Tso's Sauce". And, as I inquired about availability from other local retailers, they invariably thought I meant "General Tso". Surprisingly, Starport did not provide an image; I copied this from their website in case you want to share with friends or show to a local retailer ~ hope Starport doesn't mind...).

Summary: Superior flavor and easy to use
Text: Our local Bristol Farms market offers a stir fry bar with various asian sauce flavors.  I tried their kung pao sauce and was quite impressed with its spicy, intense and smoky flavor.  I wanted to find out what was in the sauce in the hopes of making it at home.  When I inquired of the person behind the counter he showed me a large bottle of the General Kung Pao sauce.  I ordered several bottles from Amazon.com and found it just as delicious as the offering at Bristol Farms.  You need do little more than cut up your favorite vegetables (and meat, if so inclined), place some oil in a wok, and pour in this pre-made sauce.  I usually make my stir fry sauces from scratch.  When time is short I now reach for the General Kung Pao sauce.

I ordered this for a friend for Mothers Day and she cannot stop raving about it!
The shoe is well crafted and the packaging well done. It's a delightful gift, something definitely different and I just ordered another one for a Birthday present!
Jayme Wills

The description says 12/5 oz bottles, but you only get one bottle. What a rip off! The sauce is delicious, but you'd be better off buying from the manufacturer ([…]). Or if you are in Boulder, stop by Vitamin Cottage ([…]).

This is great hot sauce, but this is false advertising. Only one bottle will be sent, and they'll charge  $10 for shipping it--$20 per 5 oz of hot sauce. Totally absurd. Notice that they still haven't changed the description!

I remember whipping up a batch of these bad boys when I was about 14 years old (I'm 22 now) I went to town on the whole batch! After a while I noticed almost everyone stopped selling these even Wallmart who usually tries to provide products for as long as they can. I almost thought they were discontinued and I was heartbroken when everyone stopped selling them at local stores, but Amazon is like my retail hero! They keep all of the best stuff in stock and they stay in contact with people who distribute. I even found U.S. military issue meals ready to eat here on Amazon.com. I don't trust eBay with anything! Thanks for keeping these available Amazon.com! I Will be ordering them when i have the money! They seem a bit pricy tome here.

WOW!!!!  these are Easy and fantastic!!!!  I will be buying these again.  If you need a quick desert this is it!  3 step process and then put them in the fridge for 30 minutes to firm up.  The end result is fantastic.  they were much better than I expected.  Everything in the process worked just as easy as it looked from the instructions.  Usually I make this kind of thing from scratch but not anymore.

I've been using Turmeric powder for years after I read how beneficial it is for many health problems.  Prevention  is my way, whenever possible, to combat the possibilities.  At least I can try and be in control of my own health care.  It's tasteless and add a nice color to eggs.

First Impression: The friendly folks over at "Exclusively Dog" heard about my website and sent me 5 of their products to test.
Let me just start off by saying that I Love how sweet all of these treats taste. Dad was/is considering trying one because they look and smell so much like human cookies. Plus the ingredients are very straight forward, they are probably healthier than most the stuff Mom eats... But there in lies the problem. Dad thinks that they are too sweet for a puppy of any age. The second ingredient in almost all of them is sugar. As we all know puppies have a hard time processing sugar, and just like humans can develop diabetes.

Conclusion: Your puppy is nearly guaranteed to LOVE the taste. However these should only be used as an occasional treat! If you were to feed your puppies these sugary sweet morsels every day, they would soon plump up. If you puppy is already overweight or does not exercise regularly, you may want to think twice. On the PRO side they are all natural, with no animal bi-products! 3 out of 4 paws, because Dad made me! If we were judging on taste alone they would be a 4.
They look and smell like human cookies so keep away from children (or your dog will be upset!).

A family member brought this product to St. Martin where we were vacationing.  The six of us ate it with a variety of crackers and it was delicious!  We finished the whole thing in one sitting.  The foi gras is thick but fairly easy to spread as long as you have a sturdy cracker, and it has a delicate flavor that I love.  There is a nice layer of fat at the top.

As a California resident who feared the loss of access to Foie Gras  mandated in July, I stocked up on Rougie Duck Foie Gras.  It is not as good as the product we purchased in Paris and brought back with us in January, but it was all I could find that was affordable.  Store in Refrigerator and note the long shelf life. Very tasty.

So, Amazon, you're back to selling whale meat, fois gras, and other gross foods?  What gives?  Is it because few American's eat it, or even know what it is?  And, it's expensive which helps your bottom line.  So, why not take stuff American's don't or are forbidden to eat (remember the ban on whale slaughter is now world wide and it makes your selling of it illlegal).  People are becoming more informed on a daily basis, and finding this kind of stuff on Amazon is little less than appalling, much less, law disregarding.

The item was received in only a few days of placing the order, and it was in excellent condition.  As it was milk for cats, I personally have no knowledge as to the quality, taste, etc (I love the cat but there are limits!) but the only important qualification was that my cat enjoyed it, and he surely did, so it's a winner all around.  Thank you very much.

Summary: Diabeti Sweet IS the answer for baking for your Diabetic!
Text:
My husband has been a Diabetic for years........and until Diabeti Sweet came out.......it was a real problem to try and bake any items for him, that would taste, bake and LOOK like the item was supposed to.

Diabeti Sweet looks like real sugar....feels light real sugar....and weighs like real sugar....thus when you make a cake, or cookies or any other item......it comes out looking just like the original recipe made with real sugar. When you use "those other" sugar substitutes, they don't have any weight, as a result, your cake is flat both is looks and taste....your cookies never set up, because there is no volume to them.

Diabeti Sweet IS the best thing since sliced pickles!

the raisins were dry but, flavorful. I figure it is because they don't have all the oils and preservatives that other raisins have. they are black and vary in size, some looking like they are grapes that went bad, which I just toss. Don't think that I would buy them again.

We love these!  This was a great deal as these are sold for much more at our supermarket as I bought this at about ten bucks here.  Chewy and very spicy so beware..if you love cinnamon you'll like these. Mine don't expire until 2013.

I have been purchasing the cinnamon Mentos from my local stores, but they no longer handle the product, plus it cost over a $1 a roll when I could find them.  I was very happy to find them because cinnamon is my favorite and the grandchildren love them too.
Cinnamon mentos are my favorite flavor! We can't find them in the stores anymore. This is great to buy them by the box and at a good price. Thanks for my place to shop.
I got these cause of the reviews,these are not cinnamon enough for me,just okay. But great for gifts for halloween.
I love the cinnamon mentos and they are hard to find in my area. I would probably not purchase them again unless the price goes down.
Could beat this deal - I will buy it again if it shows up under the deal of the  day.  Enjoyed my everyone.  Watch for this to go on sale again.

Summary: beautiful and delicious - a perfect gift
Text: This is the second time I've sent this assortment as a gift and both recipients (one age 20 and one age 50) raved about the beautiful arrangement and the delicious taste of each and every piece of fruit.  Both times the present was shipped promptly and arrived exactly on time as promised and in excellent condition.

I ordered this dried fruit selection as a Chanukah gift for my mother. She loved it. Her gift was well packed and arrived (after a serveral day delay due to mishandling by USPS) in perfect condition. The fruit quality was excellent. She and her friends have really enjoyed it.

Summary: Not as healthy as I would have liked
Text: I bought this during the lightning deals specials and thought it would make a nice snack tray for everyone to pick at instead of eating junk. I was rather disappointed when I read the ingredients and found that the fruit not only has fake color (I'm allergic to Red 40) but is also injected with High Fructose Corn Syrup. Why do manufacturers constantly seem to seek out new ways to ruin something that should be good? Overall, the pineapples (and cherries, according to my kids) are too sweet and taste a little wrong, but I'm pretty happy with the figs and apricots.
This item arrived a day ahead of my friend's birthday.  She had it in time to save herself a lot of trouble preparing for some guests.  They all loved the fruit and the beautiful presentation.

Summary: Fruit basket not exactly as pictured or described and not so great
Text:
While this fruit basket looks nice enough, it is not exactly as it is described here.

According to my inventory and the actual product label, the basket contains:

dates, apricots (preserved with sulphur dioxide), prunes (preserved with potassium sorbate), pineapple (processed with cane sugar and citric acid, preserved with sulphur dioxide), coconut date roll (dates, almonds and coconut), cherries (processed with corn syrup, high fructose corn syrup, water citric acid, natural and artificial flavor, preserved with potassium sorbate, sodium benzoate and sulphur dioxide, artificial color - FD&C red no. 40).

The basket does not contain:

Apples, Figs, Pears or Peaches

- All of which are listed as included in the Amazon product description.

Also the Amazon description says "Made of assorted dried fruit from the fertile California Valley" and "This generous, large basket provides two pounds, 12 ounces of sweet, healthy, and delicious dried fruit from the fertile California Valley," but according to the actual product label, the product contains fruit from The Philippines, Thailand, Turkey and the USA (in that order). I wouldn't have even purchased it if I knew that. At least China isn't listed.

Additionally, some of the fruit just isn't that great. For instance, some of the dried apricots were moist and some of them were tough and dry - some of the dates were moist but some were bone dry. The cherries are basically maraschino cherries without the jar - IMO, they don't really belong in there. The prunes were all pretty good and the dried pineapple was okay. The coconut covered dates were also good, but there are only six of those.

Also, it's not really "healthy" to consume all of those preservatives (that aren't mentioned in the description) such as sulphur dioxide, potassium sorbate or sodium benzoate. I'm not even going to get into the problems with those colored fructose soaked cherry hulls.

If you spent $40 on assorted dried fruits and made up your own baskets, you could probably make four of five baskets of fruit of better quality than this. It's not that this basket is bad, but it just wasn't worth $40. I's say $15, tops.

Please see my photos of the actual item and the label to see for yourself.
Hate to give a gift that turns bad...and this was horrible.  The absolute worst fruit.  I tried this and the only thing that was decent were the apricots and pineapple rings.

Better fruit then you can get at the grocery store.  The dates rolled in coconut are very good.  All of the fruit is soft and sweet.  I would recommend this as a gift and I will probably buy it again.

Summary: Misleading item picture by Amazon or the vendor
Text:
The actual package received is not at all as shown in the product picture. This seriously reduces the value.

Beware the other Black Friday or Cyber Monday savings from this company.

Shame on Amazon for kicking off the holiday season with this bait and switch.

I'm happy with Amazon 95% of the time. They missed on this one.

Postscript: Amazon refunded a large enough portion of the purchase price to satisfy me. Kudos for their honorable response.

My mother loves dried fruit, and was thrilled with this fruit tray. It was as beautiful as in the pictures, and the quality of the fruit was unrivaled. I will be buying from Broadway Basketeers again.

This basket of dried fruit was very good. It arrived before the date promised, and was in excellent condition. I have had dried fruit from other merchandisers,but this was the best I have ordered in quite a while. I order quite a bit of merchandise from Amazon and am well pleased with their suppliers. I recommend Amazon to all my friends.
very pleased with this item.  Had almost everything I was looking for, packaged nicely, and the product was delicious!  Definitely would do it again!
I thought these were going to be dried fruit. Turns out it is dried but full of sugar. Not what I needed. Taste is ok though.

Summary: Broadway Basketeers Dried Fruit Round Basket
Text: My mother in law loved the agreement of the basket and the assortment of the fruit.  I was pleased how quickly it arived.  Thank you.

This was purchased for the "fruit wedding anniversary" (4th year)  gift. It was perfect since the couple had everything they needed and something edible would not clutter their home. The fruit basket for the most part looked like the image, but the plastic wrapping was poorly done which cheapened the overall aesthetic. The fruit was mostly tasty. There was some that I didn't like, but it could be a matter of personal taste. Everyone else who tried it loved it.

Item arrived with no problems. It was packaged well and looked wonderful.
I don't know if the fruit was any good, since it was a gift for my boss and his wife. They said they liked it, but would have said that even if they hadn't.
I was happy with the purchase.

Summary: Couldn't Have Asked for Anything Better
Text: I ordered this a month or so ago as a bereavement gift, wanting the family to have something other than the arboretum of slowly dying flowers one usually gets at a time like that. It was very well-received and greatly appreciated--and as I was told, VERY delicious. What I initially thought might be odd for the occasion turned out to be the perfect gift.

Ahmad fruit flavored teas are my favorite. So glad that Amazon is carrying them now. I had to rely on one box here and there in Marshalls but now I can stock up.

All the flavors are very natural tasting and the tea is full bodied and satifying.

Summary: My family loves Ahmad Strawberry Iced Tea
Text: Here in North Texas we drink iced tea almost every day throughout the year.  I first tried Ahmad Strawberry Tea when it was enclosed with a tea set I purchased for our daughter.  My whole family loved it.  The mango and peach/passion fruit teas are also good, but strawberry ranks as our favorite flavor.  After our local market stopped carrying the Ahmad line, we have been half-heartedly trying other fruit teas, but they don't compare; many of them seem more like Kool-aid with a slight tea flavor.  I look forward to trying other flavors that we weren't able to find in our area.

Summary: Best Taste & Best Value By Far
Text: This product is by far the best brand flavored tea I have ever tasted.  I find that other brand flavored teas have such a wonderful aroma, however, the tea tends to be bitter--tasting nothing like the intended fruited flavor.  The Ahmad strawberry tea has a rich and smooth strawberry flavor, no matter how long I allow the tea bags to steep.  My family loves it as iced tea--as do I. We enjoy it so much, I make full, three-quart pitchers at a time and its always gone by the end of the day.  This year, I have already purchased four large boxes--20ct/6 bx--120 tea bags per box and now am purchasing the last of the 10 ct/12 bx box. I've gotten some great deals on here (as low as $.12 cent/tea bag)--on the internet, this tea runs $.18-.20/tea bag which adds up when you are buying 120-240 ct boxes.

Summary: Didn't receive tea that I ordered
Text: Have ordered the strawberry tea bags for over a year, this order I received strawberry sensation tea bags. Don't like the strawberry sensation, wanted just strawberry.

with some teas, most i've tried actually you have a tinny odd taste once the tea starts to go cold...  with this tea however it kept its flavor to the last bit in the cup, which by then was cool in temp..  i couldn't believe it really how consistent it was.. and the aroma right out of the package was phenomenal.. each bag is individually wrapped as well.  I really don't think i can drink anything else now that i've had this tea..

I RECEIVED A VALENTINE GIFT, AND 2 BAGS OF THS TEA WAS IN IT.......I TRIED IT AND IT IS THE BEST..I AM A TEA LOVER AND I JUST HAD TO HAVE MORE OF THIS...SO I ORDERED IT AND STILL LOVE ITS TASTE..I DRINK ONE EVERY MORNING TO START MY DAY.....LOVE IT....

I never thought I'd like fruit flavored tea until I had the Ahmad brand products. This one is my favorite with the peach passion fruit and mango being my other favorites. The flavor is that of a black tea with an aroma of strawberry that isn't overpowering or artificial tasting. This is a superb tea to drink before bed. The price on Amazon is almost half that of the stores so I hope they continue to carry it!
My MOM has been drinking this tea for years.  Was paying WAY too much.  Since I found this on amazon she is thrilled!  SUPER FAST delivery!  I hope to continue ordering.  Thanks.  Great seller!
I really enjoy this tea as an afternoon treat with a little honey. I love the strawberry flavor, it doesn't taste fake or tinny.

This Tea is just the best ever. I originally bought this tea in London, I struggled to find it here. Until I found it on Amazon. I have had a subscription for about a year now. The only problem is that the last 2 shipments have been for Strawberry Sensation and not for the Original Strawberry they are both good but I prefer the Strawberry. DOES ANYONE KNOW HOW TO CONTACT AMAZON REGARDING THIS CONCERN? I wouldn't mind having a subscription for both, but amazon.com doesn't have the option for the Strawberry Sensation and it's shipping me the wrong type of tea. DOES ANYONE KNOW HOW TO CONTACT AMAZON REGARDING THIS CONCERN?
This is my favorite tea.  Who knew strawberry tea could be so juicy.  Give it a try.  You will be pleasantly surprised.
This tea has a Smooth and Fruity flavor. Great flavor. Tastes like drinking strawberry jam. It's always a favorite in my tea chest.
This is my favorite Ahmad Tea.  Very light strawberry flavor.  Perfect for an afternoon treat or nightime with cookies.  I order this because I can't get it locally.

Summary: The tastiest of the Ahmad flavored teas
Text: Authentic strawberry scent and flavor, very tasty both hot or iced, the best one in the Ahmad lineup of flavored teas, not because I'm a fan of strawberry fruit but because this tea is mild tasting yet full of flavor (while the other Ahmad varieties have a less authentic flavor and leave a generic bitter taste in the mouth which the strawberry one doesn't)

Pros:
Has a great strawberry aroma

Cons:
Wasn't as naturally sweet or strawberry tasting as I thought it was going to be.
I was hesitant ordering something live unseen.  The plant came sturdily packed, promptly and healthy.  I was very pleased!

I really do wish money grew on trees because then the taller the tree got, the more money I'd get! lol! All kidding aside, when I bought this MONEY TREE from Amazon it arrived as a "baby plant". It is now a tall plant/tree. I have repotted it once. Cannot wait to see how tall it really gets. I would say that it has grown at least 6 or 7 inches, and looks healthy and unique!
~S. Plaza

It is a cute little plant, but the pot looked like it was bought from the store and was waaay too small for the plant. Had to re-pot it right away. Also, there were no instructions on how to take care of it. I like it, but should have gotten a cheaper one.

I really enjoy this flavor! Its great over ice, refreshing and much less sugar and carbs than regular juice. If you need to cut down on carbs, sugar, calories this is a unique alternative to orange juice. I bought it on sale because it is very expensive otherwise.
You can tell its a good quality product.

I happen to love acai and blueberries. So I was happy with this juice. Heck I'd even use it as a mixer. My family, not so much. One of them referred to it as my "Enya Juice." Clearly I was being made fun of for being "earthy" and perhaps tree hugging. I let this one go. I settled for fresh oj not made from concentrate. Everyone is happy and I still get to be secretly earthy... And make good screwdrivers.

Summary: Best bags for iced tea, excellent deal
Text:
First, Luzianne makes the best classic brewed iced tea, hands down. The family sized bags make 1 quart per bag, 48 quarts per box, 12 gallons of iced tea x 6 boxes @ $4.72 a box, thats 72 gallons of iced tea, certainly enough for the summer season and then some, plus free shipping if you play your cards right and order something else; you just can't beat that. You can't get Luzianne cheaper anywhere else.

So stop buying the instant iced tea mix crap, get some of these bags and brew your own.
I love this tea.  It's so yummy for making iced tea with.  I can't find it in the grocery stores in Seattle, so I order it through amazon.  With a 48-count box I will not run out for a long time!

Summary: Best ice tea bags for automatic tea brewers
Text: Besides the fantastic taste, these are the only ice tea bags that I have been able to use in my Mr Coffee tea brewer that do not cloud up the liquid after refrigeration!

Just had this tea with dinner, iced. This tea beats Lipton hands down. I would wager that in a blind test taste anyday. In my opinion these tea bags when steeped, make a bolder tasting tea.

It has a great dark color, and when made as iced tea, tastes great and is refreshing. One 48 ct package seems to last my household forever.

Great way to add even more flaver: After you are done brewing a batch of tea, add fresh mint trimmings to the mixture, let it sit for a while. Adds a great mint flaver to an already great tasting tea. We do this in the summer time on a weekly basis.

This deal that Amazon is offering is actually a GREAT offer and I may have take advantage of this soon.

If you are a die hard Lipton drinker, I beseach you to try this just once, I believe you will find it better in quality than what you have been drinking.

Remember tea is relatively healthly, drinking this instead of Coke is always a good substitution. After all Coke-Cola will rust a nail to nothing if you leave it submerged, what's drinking it doing to your body?

Hope this helps, and have a good day.

Summary: THE One and Only Iced Tea
Text:
There is no other suitable alternative. If your are making Southern Sweet Tea, the options are use Luzianne or don't bother. I'm not really sure what to say other than that. The discrepancy in quality between Luzianne and its next closest competitor is huge. It is such a big difference that Luzianne is worth ordering if it is not available in your area.
THE Southern Sweet Tea recipe is:
- 1 part boiling water
- 3 parts hot water(not boiling)
- 1 family-size Luzianne tea bag per cup of boiling water (use more bags for more flavor)
- 0.25-0.75 part granulated sugar (depending on taste)

1) Pour boiling water over tea bags (DO NOT AGITATE, JUST POUR)
2) Let steep for 5 minutes without agitation (don't stir, don't squeeze, don't do anything!)
3) Remove tea bags quickly without squeezing or draining and discard
4) Pour steeped tea into hot water
5) Mix in sugar and stir until dissolved
6) Serve over ice

Summary: My Favorite Black Tea for Sweet Iced Tea
Text:
I'm from the south and Cold Sweet Iced Tea is like water. I'm very picky about it and it has to be freshly brewed and sweet'n to perfection while it's still warm. I do use a tea maker to brew it nearly daily. I like to add a little Mint as well (Celestial Seasonings Herb Tea, Mint Magic, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)). Not to strong either.

Obviously being so picky I've tried many different kinds of black teas and this is just my favorite. 2 Family bags to a gallon, one Mint tea bag and little over a cup of sugar pure cane. Some people like it like liquid candy and others I know like it just barely sweet. I'm in the middle. I want to be able to taste the tea herb flavor but for it not to be bitter.

Hope this helps. I highly recommend it ;)

Living here in the Pacific Northwest it is hard to find this brand so I had to settle for Lipton. When I saw this on Amazon I couldn't pass it up. Quick delivery too.

I make mine the sun tea way and it comes out perfect. No bitter taste like I used to get with Lipton. Nice color too.

I highly recommend this to anyone that enjoys their ice tea.

Summary: This is the best tea for iced tea
Text: I use these bags exclusively to make iced tea with either an iced tea pot or hot water in a reusuable bottle.  It has the best flavor of any tea on the market and amazon has the best price and quick shipping.  This is a great item for a subscription if you use as much iced tea as I do.

Summary: End your shopping for tea now
Text:
Lipton and Nestea have nothing on Luzianne.

This is the best tea for daily brewed tea, or iced tea. Period.

This pack of six boxes of 48 count bags is a bargain, even with shipping costs.

We in the south make the best iced tea you'll find so here is how to make souther-style iced tea:

Ingredients
6 to 8 tea bags of Luzianne tea
1 & 1/2 qurts of cold water
1 Cup of sugar
lemon slices
lots of clean clear ice

Equipment: large-sized well cleaned and strerilized pickle or maynoise jar with screw lid.

Directions

Place the water in the jar and add the tea bags. Place in a sunny locqtion for one to three hours. Pour warm tea into empty pitcher. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Fill remaining pitcher with ice!!! and lemon slices.

New Jersey equals Lipton Tea which equals yucky. I missed my southern tea.
Amazon, as always, saved my life. I now buy it by the case.
I love you Amazon and I LOVE Luzianne Tea. best in the world.

LOVE IT, LOVE IT LOVE IT!!! I'm so happy with the Luzianne Iced Tea Family size tea bags. The flavor is wonderful. I had forgotten that Luzianne had Burl Ives promote this lovely tea back in the 50's-60's. Recommend to anyone who is skeptical of the price.  Well worth it....

Summary: There is no better Iced tea than Luzianne
Text: After moving to California I was shocked that I couldn't find Luzianne tea anywhere. Thank goodness for amazon. A 6 pack of 48 bag/boxes may seem like a lot but the boxes are all wrapped and have stayed fresh for me for over a year now. Whenever my friends are over and have tea they all ask how I make it so good, their lipton sun tea just doesn't taste the same!
The only tea bags we use and at this price it sure is nice having it delivered and not running out.  Love the taste!
This makes a great iced tea.  Three bags steeped for 3-5 minutes with a teapot of hot water in a gallon container then cut with cold water to make a gallon works for me.

We were a little hesitant going with this brand, but it is fantastic.  The bags are large so you only need to use four of them in a tea maker.  We also make two batches of tea with the same 4 bags and do not notice a difference in taste or potency.  We got this tea about a month ago and are still on the first of the six boxes we received.  I have us set up on the automatic shipment every six months and I think that will plenty of time in between.

Summary: Lots of tea in this family.
Text: My son and I drink ice-tea almost constantly through the day (in addition to coffee).  He and I go through about 4+ gallons of tea a week and we have tried many brands.  Luzianne is by far our favorite.

I am sorry to say this product does not live up to its positive reviews that are listed.  Lipton makes better ice tea products.  The worst part about this product is you can NOT get a refund or even a credit.  Once you have bought it.... it is yours!  I did not like the taste or brewing instructions. Amazon obviously knows something I didn't about this product......Probably explains why there isn't any recourse......or refund.....
Since we drink so much tea, I buy the best!  It is smooth and never bitter. I always make sure we have it stocked in our pantry.
Love the product... Great sweet tea... And easy with the family sized tea bags. You cannot find this tea up north.

This is the best iced tea you can buy, you can't get it up here in Portland Oregon that I have found but getting on Amazon was easy and I have a casr of this great Iced Tea. Should last at least a year.

You can't get better tea than Luzianne. Tetley, Lipton, Rose Red, etc. don't even compare. I love the delicious Orange Pekoe/Black Tea blend because it is the perfect combination of fruity and roast flavor. My family has been buying Luzianne for years. I've been drinking almost nothing but tea and water for about a week now because I am trying to wean myself of soda. It has the perfect amount of caffeine to not cause headaches and it is really good for you -- if you don't sweeten it. Tea has been shown to prevent cancer and diabetes! Brew some Luzianne and you'll never look back!

Just a helpful tip:

I have tried several different brewing methods -- stovetop boiling, microwave boiling, iced tea maker -- but the best one that works is just heating the water until it is hot (not boiling). I've had problems with it coming out too strong and this is just right. Let it steep for the full 5 minutes.

Summary: Great for Summer Iced Tea Lovers!
Text:
I am new to brewing iced tea at home, and I must say, Luzianne tea is fantastic for this very purpose. The flavor profile is not too robust, but not weak. It's a perfect balance of black tea that will leave you wanting more! I use subscribe and save and take advantage of the great price.

Some people use home brewers, but they take all the fun out of tea making. I've adopted the below strategy for the perfect cup of iced tea.

Place six cups of tap water in a pot. Pour 2/3 cup of sugar into the pot, and then bring this simple syrup to a rolling boil, with an occasional stir. When you reach the rolling boil, steep three of the family sized teabags for about 10 seconds, then remove from heat. Allow the bags to sit in the pot for 5-10 minutes. Use a wooden spoon to squeeze any remaining tea out of the bags, and discard. Allow your tea concentrate to cool to room temperature. Pour six cups of fresh water into an empty gallon jug (preferably glass, but BPA free plastic works as well). Then, pour your tea concentrate into the same jug. You now have delicious iced tea - refrigerate, and serve with ice and a wedge of lemon! Variations: 1 cup of sugar for southern sweet, 1/4 cup of sugar for sunkissed sweet, or no sugar at all if you like unsweetened tea.

Enjoy!
Tastes great - using for Ice Tea. Will also now try the decaf good deal bigger bags are nice nice nice
Luzianne tea makes, in my expert opinion, the best iced tea on the planet. It's a must buy in conjunction with any iced tea maker.

This package of six boxes of forty eight bags per box is listed in the area of large tea bags suitable for making a gallon at a time of tea. In fact it is just small single use bags. The box and web page says "family size" bags. There is nothing family sized about single use bags.
This is a bad advertisement and you should not buy them. Read these misleading ads carefully.
I hope this company will go out of business.
These are amazingly yummy! There are good balances of chocolate and peanut butter and of chewy and crunchy.  And all that and not that bad and maybe even sort of good for you.  Great job!

I can honestly say this is a first for our family, but certainly not the last as Rocky's has become a staple on the table for every meal. Thank You for creating such an amazing hot sauce and FOR THOSE WHO HAVE NOT TRIED IT: ORDER NOW!

Lime Notes: Zingy with a fresh lime (not that awful concentrated flavor)... It goes perfectly on salad when mixed with some olive oil and chicken with a mexican twist or as a marinade for pork (that's the ways I've tried and loved it).

Tried Rocky's for the first time not too long ago and was really impressed.  Tried countless other brands and nothing comes close to the flavor of Rocky's.  The consistency and taste is perfect for wings.  Most hot sauces are too watery with lacking flavor but Rocky's is exactly where it needs to be!  Highly reccomended!

I was surprised at how plump and sweet they are. These are much better than the drier non-organic red box version. Certainly it is more cost effective to buy them in larger containers such as Newman's organic raisins which are also very good, but this product meets my needs for individual packs, plus they'd be great to give out at Halloween.
The little boxes of organic sweet raisins are just right for a good-for-you snack, or as an addition to cold or hot cereal or to top off a peanut butter sandwich.

Loved the product though a bit pricier.

The package is excellent and the small packs make a good portable snack available to anyone whenever needed.

This shipment, however, I have been disappointed.  Every box we've opened has been full of dry, hard, and very light colored raisins.  They still get eaten, but I'm hesitant to order again.

These Sun Maid organic raisins are very tasty and moist. I have not found any problems with them and love that the packages are the perfect size for sticking in my purse. I usually combine these raisins with some cashews, almonds, and walnuts or pecans for a quick, nutritious snack or eat in my organic oatmeal for breakfast.
This is a very tasty gluten-free product.  The noodles are comparable to those with gluten and are never mushy.  They also have "green" cooking instructions.
We have tried several other GF pastas and this one tops them all.  The whole family loves it!!  Great taste & texture...not mushy, like others.

Summary: DELICIOUS & made with rice from North America!!
Text: I was a little nervous at first, trying out this pasta, but it was DIVINE!  I looove this pasta, and have purchased all different varieties/shapes that they have.  Yes, as other person said, do not boil it for the same duration as you're used to boiling regular pasta.  Taste is EXCELLENT, and it's an added plus that they are using rice made in the US, or Can. title says it all. Great exchange for wheat pasta. I prefer it wamr rather than cold in salads. But it is still tasty.

I tried Tinkyada pasta at the urging of my favorite health food store.  I have switched our whole family over to it because it is healthier than regular pasta and it tastes great, even though only one of us needs a gluten free diet.  All of the Tinkyada pastas are great. A friend of mine was sweet enough to buy these for me when she discovered them in a tiny market, and I'm still very grateful to her for being willing to buy them (expensive pasta!) without knowing if they were any good or not.

Even my favourite spaghetti sauce could not hide the pasty, wet-dog odour this pasta gives off -- and the "flavour"? Forget it. Directions followed to a T, but this stuff just isn't worth it. No one at the table liked this stuff. Another disappointing gluten free pasta; don't waste your money.

Summary: Better as an udon noodle alternative
Text: I cooked these for 16 minutes on medium high and rinsed well after draining. These noodles are thick, squishy, and chewy. That might not be what you're looking for in a pasta noodle, but these reminded me of udon noodles I had before going gluten free. As someone who used to love wheat based udon noodles, Takyada noodles are really great. That's why I still give these 4 stars.

Text: I am allergic to wheat and thought i would die, Italian food was my favortie. All rice pastas are mushy and taste much like health food. This one is far better than all of the rest. And that is high praise as I have not been able to say that I like any gluten free products more than their gluten-filled counter parts (but I haven't tried all the products yet!) We have five kids.  Three out of five can't tell the difference.  One hates all pasta and the other will eat it as long as their is sauce on it.  We make a big batch and reheat in the microwave.  It holds up nicely and doesn't dry out like regular pasta.  Highly recommend if you are looking for an alternative to regular noodles.

Summary: Tinkyada Pasta always deserves Five Stars
Text: The tittle says it all. Tinkyada is the best gluten free pasta company in the world. PERIOD. All tinkyada products are exceptional. Their pasta tastes better (by quite a bit) than wheat based pasta. (And I don't have to eat gluten free pasta).

Summary: Tinkyada Brown Rice gluten free products are great!
Text: Tinkyada Brown Rice gluten free products are simply some of the best imitations of wheat noodles.  Our one child has gluten sensitivities so we're switched to some alternatives.  Tinkyada is one of the best finds.  The noodles cook over a reasonable length of time (around 15-17 minutes) and have a firm texture and a taste that is quite indistinguishable from regular noodles.  We've enjoyed the noodles with spaghetti, macaroni and cheese, and casseroles. There is a slight taste difference when tried side by side with regular noodles but not pronounced at all unlike the yucky after taste of noodles made from bean flour.
Tinkyada makes the best gluten free pasta.  We tried many other brands before this and most were mushy.  This pasta is excellent.  My entire family loves it!

If you've tried any other GF pasta's and been disappointed, you'll jump for joy with Tinkyada!

You need to watch how long you cook it, don't over cook any gluten free pasta or you get mush. I have tried other gluten free brands and rice pastas, Tinkyada beats them all.
Have tried many products this is by far the best Rice Pasta!

this product is by far the best rice pasta I have ever tried,cooks up al dente and not mushy like some of the rice pasta's

Just follow the directions on the package, and get great results every time. They also include "Easy and Energy-Saving Cooking" instructions (boil for 2 minutes, cover and let sit for 20), which I use during hot weather - the pasta still comes out great, and my kitchen stays cooler. Win-win!

Summary: Best Pasta for Gluten Free there is!
Text: Best Pasta for Gluten Free there is! It's a huge plus to have this aviliable to order through amazon at 1/2 the cost per package than the markets.  Best tasting gluten free pasta, and great to buy in bulk to save a lot of $$$.

Summary: The best rice pasta out there
Text: This brand of rice noodles is the most like wheat pasta. It is delicious, the texture is perfect, it doesn't get mushy when it's cooked. I really enjoyed it!

Summary: Great taste, great texture, great product
Text: I am sensitive to wheat and corn, and it's hard to find a wheat-free product that doesn't use corn! So I stumbled upon this at our local health food store and fell in love with it. Even my husband (who has no allergies and is a picky eater) found it to be palatable. He couldn't taste the difference in his favorite "old world" recipe. I am so thankful that we found this product AND that we can buy it in bulk through Amazon!

Summary: The best gluten-free pasta there is
Text:
In my opinion, Tinkyada is the one of the best gluten-free pastas there is. I no loger get anything else. The fettucini is wonderful as well as the spaghetti.
If one did not know it was not "regular" pasta, they would not tell the difference. It does not get mushy although it takes alittle longer to cook and you need to stir it often so it doesn't get stuck together. I ordered a case of 12 because whenver you have to have a special diet the costs in the health food stores can be outrageous, and this way you get a better price (even with shipping)

This is a great substitute for regular pasta - doesn't go gummy and taste funny like some brands (I'm lookin' at you, DeBoles). My significant other and a friend who often eats with us can barely tell the difference in the taste.

It's not so great for leftovers, though - unlike regular pasta it doesn't save very well (although it does save better than most gluten free brands I've tried). Save your leftover sauce separately and boil a new batch of pasta to serve it over.

Summary: Not bad as a subsitute, but not the best
Text: Before being GF, my main pastas were DiCecco, a common imported brand which cooks up authentically al dente, and Barilla, which in American comes from the mid-west (not as good as the real-Italian Barilla that we don't import).  Tinkyada pasta has a pretty strong brown rice tase and a slightly off aftertaste.  The texture is a little slippery, and it disintegrates a bit while cooking.  It's still pretty good if you serve it with a sauce that you would put on a plate of brown rice, i.e., a sauce with its own texture and assertive flavor.  It's not as good if the pasta is the star of the dish.  Of the brands I've tried, Jovial is by far the best.  The brown rice taste is minimal, even nice, and it cooks more al dente than the regular wheat American brands.

Summary: No need to miss wheat spaghetti anymore
Text:
I highly recommend this to anyone who eats a gluten-free diet. Other than price, it stacks up quite well to wheat spaghetti, though the taste is slightly different. My pasta-loving kids eat it happily and I can enjoy "spaghetti night" with them now. The texture is very good with either the normal or energy-saving cooking directions. However, I've found that there are a few things that make a difference in the final quality.

First, regardless of which cooking method you use, after you add the pasta to the boiling water, STIR until you're sure all of the noodles are completely separated. If you don't separate them when you first add them to the boiling water, they might stick together and not cook properly. (This is true of wheat spaghetti, too, but the Tinkyada pasta seems a little more prone to it.) After they are all separate, you don't have to stir again if you're using the energy-saving method. With the normal method, I recommend a quick occasional stir to make sure none of the noodles are sticking to the bottom of the pot.

Second, don't skimp on the rinsing. You'll see the water goes very cloudy when the pasta cooks - a lot of starch is being released into the water. You have to get that rinsed off or the pasta will stick together after you drain it. If you do the rinsing right, it won't stick together - even leftovers that have been refrigerated won't be sticky. The cold water rinse seems to be particularly important. Since I like to serve spaghetti noodles hot, I start rinsing with cold water and then finish with hot water. The result is hot spaghetti with no stickiness.

Third, unless you're on a low-sodium diet, I recommend salting the cooking water as directed on the package. Salting improves the taste (it's slightly sweet if you don't salt the cooking water) and it also seems to improve the texture slightly.

About the energy-saving cooking method: This is great in the summer time since you can turn off the burner sooner and not dump as much heat into the house. But when it's time to rinse you may find that not only is the water very cloudy, but a skin of starch has developed on the surface of the water. It's not pretty, but it rinses right off. (I mentioned this because it freaked my husband out the first time he saw it; I thought I'd save someone else from that surprise.)

Summary: I am VERY Picky About Texture
Text:
I have heightened sensitivity to touch/texture. It can make enjoying food a little difficult sometimes unless the texture is JUST RIGHT.

And this pasta, in my opinion, is great.

I cooked it according to the energy-saver directions (where you boil water, place noodles in, cook for a couple minutes and then turn OFF stove, cover and let sit for 20 minutes). The package says it can withstand a lot of overcooking, but they were a TAD mushy when made this way. They were still VERY tasty, despite being a tiny bit too soft. (I would have subtracted 1/2 star for this, but since we can't do that I decided it was still worth the 5 stars)

It had a nice flavor too. Slightly sweet and mild, it's best when you salt the water- it balances this out nicely. The price may seem expensive to some, but my husband is very picky about pasta and usually wants us to buy a certain brand that is just about the same price as this stuff- so it's not much of a difference for us.

MOST importantly, after eating a fair amount, I did NOT feel "bloaty" like I usually do after eating wheat pasta. I felt very satisfied without feeling overfull.

I don't know, my husband is one of the pickiest eaters when it comes to pasta and even HE liked it.

I think next time I will just cook it a little less. Will definitely be getting this on a regular basis now.

This is the only gluten free pasta product that I have eaten (I have eaten most of the pastatutes out there)that tastes like real pasta. Cook it according to the conserving energy method listed on the package as this delivers the best taste and texture.

My family loves pasta and this brand is outstanding.  I have learned to treat any hollow (penne, etc.) pastas gently when I rinse them as they will tear if you shake the colander too vigerously.  Celiacs take note - Tinkyada is the one you have been looking for!  This gluten free product is every bit as good as a wheat product.

Summary: Best gluten-free pasta I have tried!
Text: This pasta is really tasty and doesn't get so soft that it falls apart, like other ones. The cooking method where you boil it and then turn it off to sit for 20 minutes works best and is so easy!  We also like the twist, lasagna, and macaroni noodles.

When I had to give up gluten I thought that I would never be able to enjoy a great pasta dish again. All the other GF pastas I have tried were gritty, mushy, or just tasted offal, but Tinkyada Brown Rice Spaghetti has a wonderful texture and flavor. My whole family enjoys this pasta.

My husband is wheat-intolerant, and I'm always looking for healthy alternatives. Most of the gluten-free pastas I've tried had been just awful, until a friend recommended the Tinkyada brand. It's easy to cook, and has a taste and texture so close to ordinary pasta that most folks can't tell the difference when it's smothered in pasta sauce. (Some of the pasta shapes -- like the lasagna noodles -- tend to fall apart more easily than their wheat counterparts, but still taste great.)

I don't have a problem with wheat or gluten, but I do face a challenge managing my blood cholesterol, and Tinkyada pastas -- made from brown rice with added rice bran for fiber -- are much better for me than ordinary (refined) wheat pastas.

The one problem with Tinkyada products is their price. As of now (August 2012), the price for a 16 oz package of spaghetti in our local health food stores is close to $5 USD. I was happy to see the product available in cases of a dozen at a significant discount. It's still pricier than wheat semolina pasta, but much more affordable.
I am pleased with the spaghetti.  I am trying to keep away from gluten & it is nice to be able to have spaghetti.

I'm Italian and I freaked out about pasta when I was diagnosed with celiac disease. Thankfully I found Tinkyada right away. I have an Italian neighbor and I fed it to him. He said he couldn't tell the difference. It's great stuff.

Best brown rice pasta that I ever tasted! It's not mushy at all as you may concern it may be when it comes to rice pasta. Flavor, taste, texture, and pretty much everything, I prefer this pasta over regular pasta! I don't have any problem with wheat or anything, but I keep buying this pasta after I tried once. Great with any kind of pasta dish, creamy or tomato-based. Totally recommended!

Perfect texture, and I love that it is made from brown rice!  It makes it that much healthier - I don't feel junky when eating it since I know it is healthier.  Plus it is gluten free!  Perfect for our GF family!

I am not gluten intolerant nor is anyone in my family but we thought we'd try to reduce the amount of gluten in our diets. I tried this pasta not knowing what to expect. We actually tried the white rice version and the brown rice version (in separate dishes) and we LOVED IT. The kids couldn't tell the difference.

The one thing I did notice about it is that it is more filling than traditional pasta. So I didn't need as much pasta on my plate to be full (which I also liked). We're switching to this pasta for everything not because we have to but because we love it!

I was diagnosed with gluten intolorence 7 months ago and have had fun trying to find all of the gluten things that taste good and have ran across all the things that taste bad untill now! Our family has some kind of pasta atleast once a week and had a melt down when we didnt think it would happen anymore. Finally I was in a health food store and ran across a long time celiac and she told me about this pasta. The entire family loves this pasta including a very picky husband and very picky 4 and 6 year olds. I live in a small town and after many requests the local store started to carry this for me and the local gf group and they cant keep it on the shelves. I have yet to try the other pastas by this company but I trust they will be good to. The sticky issue I never have bacause I usually add plenty of water and a little oil. love this pasta and always have atleast 2 or three packs stowed away in the pantry!

I can't emphasize how happy I am that I found Tinkyada. For years I haven't been able to enjoy pasta without the side effects that gluten sensitivity can bring on. I also searched fruitlessly for a good substitute, but alas everything tasted like something from a different planet. Yech.

Then came Tinkyada :) It cooks just like regular wheat pasta, and the texture, taste, consistency is the same. I've made this numerous times for people without telling them that it's gluten-free pasta, and they never suspected a thing (always a fun thing to see their post-meal astonishment).

Quick weeknight meals are back again :)

ProfileName: i'm a book maven "i'm a book maven"
Text:
My attempts to find a healthy alternative to regular pasta were to no avail until I found this "brown rice" pasta in the organic section of my local Publix Supermarket. I had already tried "whole wheat" pasta and even though I eat, and actually prefer, whole wheat products like pizza and breads, the TEXTURE of the spaghetti was awful. I found whole wheat egg noodles and that was better, but I missed the look and twirl of spaghetti. I saw this; I like brown rice, it's organic, it looked edible as I measured it up in my mind and, alright, I put it into my shopping cart. I followed the instructions and boiled it for 16 minutes. I rinsed it well with cold water and added it to a large hot frying pan which had olive oil. After mixing for a minute and a half, I added Lucini brand marinara and mixed it, covered it and, when hot, ate it. My review, excellent; be proud to serve and not have to apologize that it's healthy.
Like that old TV commercial used to say, "Try It, You'll Like It."

Three of my four children have been diagnosed with Celiac Disease.  Over the years, we have tried many different gluten-free pastas.  Tinkayada is the absolute best we have tried.  The taste and texture is fantastic. I recommend this pasta to anyone who must be on a gluten-free diet.

I have yet to find a noodle by Tinkyada that wasn't really good.  The flavor doesn't collide with or overpower the foods you serve with them.  Other GF noodles have fallen apart but not these.  Don't be alarmed the cooking water goes cloudy but the noodles are great.

I've tried several rice pastas since eliminating gluten from my diet. This is by far the best pasta! It tastes just like the "real" pasta and it doesn't turn gooey on me like many of the other rice pastas. My family cannot believe it's rice past and I like that I can get the brown rice variety versus the white.

Tinkyada brand is hands down the best GF pasta around.  I hear Biaglut is also good, I have not tried that one, and I hear it is much more expensive then Tinkyada.  So I will stick with this one!! I love it!!

These are good!  One of my Celiac children rated it better than corn pasta and one didn't.  The consistancy reminds me a little of spagettio's.  I will probably alternate between these and corn based pasta.

Finally a gluten free spaghetti that is just as good, if not better, than wheat spaghetti. I tried soybean spaghetti but it doesn't taste like spaghetti to me, and the flavor doesn't mingle well with spaghetti sauce. I love Tinkyada Brown Rice elbows as well.

I've known about my celiac disease for over 25 years, tried many brands and varieties of gluten free pasta, and Tinkyada - hands down - has the best in this variety and all others they make. It's not particularly sticky, and very much like "regular" semolina pasta in texture. The taste is excellent. My (non-celiac) wife loves it! She doesn't even bother making two different pots of pasta anymore because she finally found one of "my" pastas that was quite satisfactory for her too. I don't feel like I'm giving up ANYthing with Tinkyada's products over what I used to to eat in my "BC" (Before Celiac) days.

One other nice feature is the price. It seems to be a bit more expensive than some other gluten free pasta products, but compare the price AND the weight. Once both are taken into consideration, I've found that Tinkyada doesn't cost much if any more than the much less desirable brands of gluten free pasta, and it's often less expensive. This truly earns 5 stars, and I try to reserve that for the best of the best.

This spaghetti is the best ever.... it is even tastier than wheat varieties....
It does not get gummy like regular wheat spaghetti...
Even if I were not gluten intolerant, I would choose it over wheat spaghetti. It is that good. I love it!!!!

My husband got us this since we are avid eaters of brown rice. We love it. The secret is that it is closer to whole wheat pasta, and it does not stick together to form a big noodle bundle! If you are into wheat-free stuff, this is just for you.
My husband, who doesn't have to eat gluten-free, loves this spaghetti. Other than an awesome flavor and texture, it reheats very well, allowing leftovers to save money.

Honestly, I cant understand why this pasta gets such high marks. I tried it and it is nowhere close to normal pasta.

Since being told I have to be gluten free, finding a good pasta substitute has been difficult.
All these rice pasta brands are glue-y, sticky and slimey in texture. this one is a little less so but it still has that wierd slimy, sticky quality. the rice noodles are pasty colored too. not appetizing at all. And all this gluten free marketed stuff is hideously expensive so trying all the different brands gets costly.

I have found the quinoa+corn based noodles to be the closest thing to real pasta -- The texture is much better. I'm still trying to find something I can live with but so far, the quinoa pasta seems to be the most acceptable.

Summary: Not Bad - But Not So Good Either
Text: The reviews were so good I just had to try this - and the result was the usual fat cold noodles tasting like rice (i.e., nothing much). Tinkyada isn't any worse than any of the others - but I find the thickness of conventional spaghetti makes the rice taste much more noticeable. Take this with a grain of salt, since I preferred vermicelli even before I went on a gluten-free diet (about 15 years ago), but to me, vermicelli works a lot better than conventional spaghetti, because it's thinner, making the taste (or lack thereof) less noticeable when coated with sauce. People not on the diet notice the pasta when I use rice spaghetti, but no one has ever found fault with the Ener-G Foods Rice Vermicelli, 10.5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12) I used to use, or the Annie Chun's Brown Rice Noodle, Pad Thai, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6) (more like linguini) I've been using in place of spaghetti recently. I still buy the Tinkyada spaghetti to use in soups - fine for chicken noodle soup, etc. - but am going back to the above products that I've been using quite happily as spaghetti for years. Not only is the rice taste less noticeable, but the vermicelli cooks in 4 minutes or so - 1/3 the time it takes to cook Tinkyada spaghetti. (Given my attention span, this also makes it easier for me not to forget and overcook it into a gooey mess.)

I really have to question the bias of the people who wrote the previous 25 reviews. They must have been Tinkyada employees, friends, or family because there is no way that it tastes five-stars.

To be fair, I do eat gluten and it is my wife who has the gluten allergy. So I do have my own biases as I eat gluten on a daily basis. My wife tells me that she forgets what gluten tastes like after months of going on the gluten-free diet, and she is able to eat alternatives that I believe do not taste as good as the wheat-full version. However, my wife is not particularly fond of this product either.

Based on the reviews, I bought this thinking this spaghetti was going to taste exactly the same as regular pasta, but the consistancy, though constant, is kind of slimy. Additionally, the "energy saving method" turns the pasta especially gooey, so I do not recommend that method of cooking should you be persuaded based on the other 25 reviews.

There are lots of other gluten-free pastas out there, like corn-based, or a mixture of potato, soy, and rice that taste a lot closer to the "real-thing." I haven't found too many alternatives on Amazon yet, but my local grocery store has a few and my wife prefers them over this brand. So at the moment, I have 11 packets of gluten-free spaghetti that I would be happy to get rid of.

All Tinkyada brown rice pasta products have been wonderful!  You do need to learn not to overcook them.  I find using the energy saving technique (boil a minute or two and then cover pot and wait about 15 minutes) works perfectly.  We love this pasta and find it better than the pasta we ate before our gluten free days.

Summary: You better like your pasta AL DENTE, otherwise forget it ..
Text:
Most of the grocery stores in my neighborhood sell this product, so I've been buying it locally for the past year. I really enjoyed it up until recently.
Tonite, I realized there are two things I don't like about this pasta.
#1 - It takes too long to cook. I have to boil it for at least 20 minutes to get it the texture I like. That's a long time when you can boil angel hair pasta in 6 minutes and stir fry some veggies in less than 2 miinutes.
#2 - Even after 20 minutes of boiling, this pasta is super AL DENTE. It just always seems like it's not cooked enuf.
I wish they had a thin angel hair version.
I couldn't even finish my dinner tonite. After boiling 20 minutes, this stuff was just too hard. It was almost as gross as eating UNDERCOOKED rice. Yes, it is gluten-free, but, it's got a thick, starchy texture that I can't stand chewing and it takes too long to cook.
IMHO, corn-quinoa pasta is better.

Edit: 6-28-12
Tinkyada's FETTUCCINI in the red package is better.
