The DHA is derived from Tuna Oil which is not so bad, however it also contains Gelatin, derived from pork, not vegetables!.  The product ingredients above does not state that, and is very misleading.  I didn't notice this until my 3 year old ate 3 containers of it!  I ended up throwing out the rest of the box that was purchased.

We've been eating these pears for over 2.5 years at least twice a day.  Gerber's organic variety is the cheapest price per oz I've found for an "organic pear-only" baby food.  Amazon's price (without Prime) is slightly less than our local grocery store when purchased at regular price.  This is the best price I've found outside special sales.  Contrary to the other review, almost all baby food is "cooked" via some method, usually steaming - even if homeade - which I did for a long time before switching to packaged versions for convenience and inaccessibility to organic produce.  The homeade raw puree works better for her child, but this product has been great for us.  It's been solving our constipation issues for over two years, and it works wonderfully!

I've been giving my daughter Gerber fruits, veggies, and meat as everyday-meals since she was 6 months old, thinking that she's got enough vitamins and prebiotics. However, she developed digestive problem and chronic constipation; she almost stopped gaining weight since she was 9 months old. I took her to GI and she told me that those packed fruits are all cooked! And there are additives to keep them fresh for long period of time! I started to puree fruits and veggies using Vitamix, and only use Gerber fruits&veggies when we are out and about. Now, after half a year of probiotics and wholesome food, she's slowly getting better and opens her mouth to food.
Now, think about this: if you puree an apple and leave it alone for 5 minutes, it'll change color due to oxidation. So, how can Gerber's apple puree keep the same color for so long a time?

I've been giving my daughter Gerber fruits, veggies, and meat as everyday-meals since she was 6 months old, thinking that she's got enough vitamins and prebiotics. However, she developed digestive problem and chronic constipation; she almost stopped gaining weight since she was 9 months old. I took her to GI and she told me that those packed fruits are all cooked! And there are additives to keep them fresh for long period of time! I started to puree fruits and veggies using Vitamix, and only use Gerber fruits&veggies when we are out and about. Now, after half a year of probiotics and wholesome food, she's slowly getting better and opens her mouth to food.
Now, think about this: if you puree an apple and leave it alone for 5 minutes, it'll change color due to oxidation. So, how can Gerber's apple puree keep the same color for so long a time?

Its taste and smell is good.
Maybe my Babe likes the strawberry in it.
We have taken several types of Gerber 2nd foods.
Like that is it organic, don't like that it comes in plastic containers.  Earth's Best was always our first choice, but Gerber Organics comes a close second.

Summary: Be warned: this has tuna oil in it that is not organic.
Text: When you get this home and read the ingredients list, you will see: This product has "organic" stamped all over it, but when you read the ingredients list, it includes tuna oil that is not organic. I called the company, and they said the product "does not have harmful levels of mercury."  I prefer my bananas with NO mercury, thanks. They include tuna oil to provide a source of DHA, but there are several baby products that have plant-based sources of DHA. We are vegetarian, and I don't want to feed fish oil to my baby. I recommend other brands like Earth's Best which seem to be more careful about their ingredients. I'm sure this is fine for people who are feeding tuna fish to their babies anyway, but we don't plan to give ours tuna fish.

I've been giving my daughter Gerber fruits, veggies, and meat as everyday-meals since she was 6 months old, thinking that she's got enough vitamins and prebiotics. However, she developed digestive problem and chronic constipation; she almost stopped gaining weight since she was 9 months old. I took her to GI and she told me that those packed fruits are all cooked! And there are additives to keep them fresh for long period of time! I started to puree fruits and veggies using Vitamix, and only use Gerber fruits&veggies when we are out and about. Now, after half a year of probiotics and wholesome food, she's slowly getting better and opens her mouth to food.

Same food as in the store, but delivered right to your door.  This came in handy when we were nearly out of baby food and didn't have time to go to the store.  Two days later, a package of food arrived.  Very convenient.

I've been giving my daughter Gerber fruits, veggies, and meat as everyday-meals since she was 6 months old, thinking that she's got enough vitamins and prebiotics. However, she developed digestive problem and chronic constipation; she almost stopped gaining weight since she was 9 months old. I took her to GI and she told me that those packed fruits are all cooked! And there are additives to keep them fresh for long period of time! I started to puree fruits and veggies using Vitamix, and only use Gerber fruits&veggies when we are out and about. Now, after half a year of probiotics and wholesome food, she's slowly getting better and opens her mouth to food.
Now, think about this: if you puree an apple and leave it alone for 5 minutes, it'll change color due to oxidation. So, how can Gerber's apple puree keep the same color for so long a time?
yum, yum. yum!!!!  have ordered these often, for birthday parties, funeral, `I Love You'.  It is a lot of candy & can be shared for a long time.

I LOVE foie gras in pretty much any form, however its honestly not for anyone on a budget or middle class for sure. I decided to go with grade B because of the $30 difference. I assumed it with just be veinier. It was veinier but also lacked that great earthy duck taste that you get with grade A and with the canned product. I felt like i was eating chicken liver or something. It wasnt worth the price. I suggest you continue to splurge on grade A. But if you are making a pate' then grade B might suffice- hope this helps

Evanger's Super Premium Pheasant and Brown Rice is a wonderful food for dogs.  I own a Shiba Inu who is very picky about the food we feed her.  It was a challenge finding the right combination of food that would not make her sick or have an upset stomach.  I put this food in front of her and now she paws at the pantry requesting more.  For all dog owners who own a dog who is particular about their food this may be the answer.  I try not to feed my dog table scraps and instead invest in a good dog food with the right nutrients.  My girl is currently eating the Evanger's brand mixed with Stella and Chewey's raw patties.  She absolutely loves the combination!

The pet food store gave me five different samples so I thought I'd let Louie, my standard poodle, make the decision. I put the five samples in five bowls. He went for the Evangers and wolfed it down. First time I have seen him enthusiastic about dry dog food. Of course, this is a dog that drinks out of the toilet.

We adopted a standard poodle about a year and a half ago.  She had a hard time just surviving until we discovered she couldn't eat chicken or beef without getting sick.  It's very hard to find a commercial dog food that doesn't have one of those as a major ingredient.  Even many of the lamb and rice formulas have chicken in some form as a major ingredient.  I was making her food fresh twice a week, approximately a three hour process each time.  We had to hand feed it to her most of the time.  Then one day she decided she was done with the food she'd been eating for months.  I had some sample packets of Evanger's Pheasant and Brown Rice.  She ate it!  And she has continued to eat it, a big step for her.  Finally, a quality food, commercially prepared, that she can eat without getting sick and will eat all by herself.  And it's wonderful to have it available on Amazon.  Life's gotten so much easier.
Great product! This dog food has a very healthy rating from professional canine associations..  My Jack Russell loves the taste,  the price is right and the shipper very reliable.

I have a Shitzu and a Papillion who have tried many good brands of dog food and never like them.  THey would only eat a little bit at a time throught the day. THe foods which contained peas never agreed with their stomach and so many foods have them.  Why? I don't understand as they are not people and don't need peas. They were both a little on the light side.  Recently I switched to Evangers Pheasant Brown Rice dry dog food.  THey both gobbled it up. I was mixinbg it with their old food and they picked out the Evangers and only ate it.  Their stomachs were fine right away with no problems making the change in diet.  THey both now feel like they should.  THe gained a little weight and look wonderful. I am also giving them a little of the canned Duck that they make as a treet in the food.  THey love it all.

Summary: Bob's Stonewall Hot Pepper Jelly Review
Text: First of all, I usually don't write reviews but I've always been a fan of spicy food and of course pepper jellys. I purchased the Stonewall Hot Pepper Jelly recently and was impressed.  I use it with butter on crumpets and muffins and often a small bit on a Ritz cracker and brie cheese.  That's good!  The flavor is sweeter than others I've tried but the spicy pepper flavor still jumps out and enhances the sugar on my tongue.  We'll serve it at our Superbowl party by warming slightly and pouring over a wedge of Brie placed on a wedge shaped triangular plate with crackers or those mini toasts.
I agree that this jelly is delicious.  I serve it spread on cornmeal crepes filled with goat cheese.  Everyone always loves them
This pepper jelly is my favorite. Just the right amount of sweet with a small kick. Perfect with just cream cheese and crackers.

Summary: Tasted great when I was a kid and still do
Text: I loved this candy when I was a child but could only get 3 on any given day.  I used to say that when I became grown, I would buy a room filled with coconut long boys (I always did exaggerate. When I saw that large tub of long boys it took my back to my days as a child and the taste was just like I remembered.
These candies are addicting~!......down here in Miami they are only available in certain neighborhood, so this tub was perfect. You won't be disappointed if you  like coconut and caramel....
This candy is hard to find in stores nowadays. Long Boys were packaged well. They were fresh and as good as I remember. I'm glad I purchased them.

This is my favorite candy from way back, I was so excited when I found it on Amazon.com The candy was very fresh, it was shipped really fast and the quantity was just right, enough to have on hand for quite a while before its time to re-order.

Summary: great taste and broken into pieces
Text: Unfortunately the product is packed in a box that is not substantial enough to protect the crackers from breaking in transit.  Only about half of the crackers in each package remain in tact.  The cost is a really good deal as long as you don't need the crackers to be in tact.

While the product itself is a great tasting gluten free food. Amazon did not securely ship these fragile crackers. The package comes in a case of 12. When the box arrived to my home, ten of the trays where completely crushed into tiny cracker fragments. Amazon did not make the effort to enclose the crackers in a safe shipping box. And when I looked into returning the crackers, the website informed me that this was a non-returnable product. After further searching on the Amazon website, to find a way to return a damaged product, and not having any luck, I gave up. I ended up using the crackers as cracker crumbles in soups and such - This was not my initial intent. Based on this one bad experience, I will never order another food item through Amazon again.

These are great and totally adictive. I agree with other reviews that unfortuantly they do often come a bit broken but I can live with that. The alternative would be to have massives of packaging to protect them and surely we don't want any more excessive packaging.
Let's not encourage suppliers to do that. What's a broken cracker compared to a broken planet?
I just save the whole ones for entertaining and enjoy the broken ones as my snack! They are delicious whole or broken!

These crackers are DELICIOUS!!!!
I bought some at my local organic food mart for $4.25 a pack. I searched Amazon and now can buy them a case at a time for about $3.36 a pack. WHAT A GREAT DEAL!!
These crackers have the best taste. They are addicting. They go great with many cheeses and wines. I really love them.
These are yummy. Black sesame, cheddar, and vegetable flavors are all excellent, low fat, and gluten free. Hard to find in local grocery stores around here at least....
this is a really good snack especially when you can't eat wheat. Not as salty as the other type of rice cracker. I am enjoying them.

Good taste, great crunch, some broken crackers, just a little too salty (for me) to use with dips that are also plenty salty.  I think I'll try the unsalted organic brown rice snaps since the unsalted sesame brown rice snaps are discontinued.

I love these crackers.  They are my absolute favorite, I was so happy to find them on Amazon for a good price, and so sad to have them arrive mostly broken.  If they were just broken in half I wouldn't mind, but the debris is (for the most part) inedible.

Hey couch potatoes and lovers of pure food!  These are dynamite crackers!  Get 'em!  They are made with rice flour, so all of you who need to avoid gluten can enjoy them.  They are unique and delicious.  Gormet and organic.  And the case price is perfect.  The only problem is that they do arrived a bit broken up.  :-(  It seemed that about 1/3 of the crackers were not in whole pieces.  We could live with this, especially for the price, but some folks might find that offensive.  However, we LOVE these crackers and will order them again.  They are not available in our local stores, so ordering them from amazon.com is the way to go for us.

Summary: LOVE KENYA AA K-CUPS!  ONE OF THE BEST!
Text: Excellent, simple cup of morning coffee that is not bitter nor truly extra bold as advertised.  I consider it to be a medium roast/breakfast blend kind of coffee.  If you are into heavy, dark roasts like French, Italian, or Sumatran, then the Kenya AA may be fairly mild for your taste.  However, I love it.  Unfortunately, the one-star review is an angry comment regarding price and has nothing to do with the quality of the coffee.

Summary: Maybe the best Green Mountain coffee
Text: We own two Keurig Platimun coffee machines. One at home and one at the office. The preponderance of people who do not care for the flavored blends prefer the Kenyan blend, myself at the top of the list. I have had Kenyan from Timothy's and Gloria Jean's and they do not begin to compare.

I bought these expecting a replacement for my beloved but discontinued Van Houtte Kenya Kilimandjaro K-Cups. Those were dark, robust, and fruity with plenty of flavor to stand up to cream.

Well, these are not close at all. At best, it is a medium roast and cream just dilutes the flavor. Maybe OK if you drink your coffee black, but not all Kenyan coffees are the same. If it didn't say "Extra Bold," I would not have guessed this was an Extra Bold K-Cup; the flavor just isn't there.

This was a nice Strong cup of coffee even on the largest setting, it arrived on time as promised well packaged, and I will order this item again. Satisfactory tasting bold morning coffee, wake me up smooth blend not bitter.  I will recommend this product to my friends.
My husband and I really enjoyed this coffee and were disappointed when I couldn't find it again to purchase on Amazon.  Hope it comes back cuz it's really a great coffee.

I have always liked Kenyan coffee since I visited Nairobi and Green Mountain Coffee is an excellant product too.  I am currently in Afghanistan and it really picks up the spirits to have a good cup of coffee whenever you feel like.

Unless I'm missing where this is for 2 boxes or something, this is WAY overpriced!  You can buy this directly from Keurig for $15, $13 is you're a member!  Do people really fall for this?  Amazon, why do you let them get away with it?

If you like ginger, there is not much here. We were trying to find large ginger pieces surrounded by chocolate like that found at a small candy store in Hilo. These were nothing like that. Look for an Australian supplier.

ProfileName: J. Hanna "There is nothing more enjoyable tha...
Text: I enjoyed the garlic flavor of these noodles, but it is quite a small portion.  I used these noodles in a stir fry dish with broccoli and red bell peppers, which was quite tasty.

I got these at a local grocery store and love the flavor. The crunch is also excellent. I picked up the Kettle Brand as well, which were not as good as these. The Kettle brand were way too pungent with the vinegar flavor and not as crispy. These seem to have buttermilk in them that adds to the overall flavor. Lay's Kettle cooked have become my favorite chips.

My cat loves these. If I can't find her all I have to do is shake the bottle and she comes running unless she is trapped in a closet which she is prone to do. The treats are really cheap  and according to my kitty yummy too.

For what ever reason my two dogs just love these little Pounce real chicken treats for cats - We give them each 4 of these treats prior to bedtime, at it appears that the dogs have learned to count them?

This is the only treat my Red Persian will eat.  She is very large, and will eat everything in sight from the other cats in my home,  But this treat is the only one for her.  If I put out something else for the other cats, she will leave it alone, and wait for this one.  I'll be in Big trouble if this is ever discontinued.
The best Yerba Mate ever. Healthy and with some herbs that make you feel good! I've been using it since for ever.

Looking forward to the tasty results, but these cannot be used in a hotair popper. We tried them in our our new Presto and they just fell out in to the bowl uncooked. Called Presto; they immediately knew what was wrong - "Are you using a gourmet corn that is small? There is not enough weight for them to be exposed to the hot air long enough......!" This is not the seller's fault but be aware you can't pop these in - at least - a Presto hotair popper.

I could not disagree more with the other reviewer!  I think that this is the best popcorn.  Purple, Red and Baby Whites are my favorites.  I can't even eat Orville since having this.  There is just no comparison. Worth every penny and then some!

I ordered this popcorn directly from the company and it pops up to be the best. Ladyfinger and purple are wonderful. Won't be eating any other brand. I did pop with oil so maybe it's different in a hotair popper.

Summary: A simple trick to get your air popper to work with this popcorn!
Text: I just finished eating my first batch of this great popcorn made in my presto air popper. The trick to getting it to pop properly with minimal un-popped kernels is to tilt the air popper back at an angle while waiting for the first dozen or so to pop. After the chamber starts filling with popped corn, set the popper upright and you are good to go! Hope this helps. Really great popcorn too by the way.

Summary: Popcorn Cheaper than their own website
Text:
Popcorn is the same as from the Amish Popcorn website.
your big benefit is that it has regular shipping costs and not high shipping like the website.

In this package you get three varieties of popcorn, all of which are different, light, fluffy, and fun to eat. Two are of the hulless variety (very tasty and won't stick in between your teeth as much), and the purple kind has a thick kernel and a uniquely nutty taste. All of these stand up to any kind of butter, salt, or seasonings that you might throw their way, and I highly recommend this as a starter package for yourself or a nice gift for one of your corn-poppin' friends.

When I came across this Amish Country Popcorn I thought, well why not have some fun and diversity for a change. Ol' Orville looks like a fun-loving guy, so he would agree I'm sure. Heck, he is probably living in Malibu, floating in his horizon pool with his companion Bonita...

Started out with the smallest variety, the Ladyfinger. Tiny yellow kernels pop into tiny tender popcorns. Hardly a hull, nothing sticks in your teeth. Harder to eat because of the small size. Cute and delicious. Little kids would like this, cooked just for them.

Next was the Baby White. These barely yellow kernels are sort of medium size and like the Ladyfinger variety have little in the way of hulls and are very tender. A quality choice and easier to eat because it pops up larger. Probably more like popcorn from the old days.

Lastly, the Purple. Most seem to like this the best. Full size and easy to eat. Again, not too much in the way of hulls. The kernels are purple and they pop to white with purple flecks. Attractive and full size, easy to eat. Nice sort of nutty taste, although popcorn is pretty mild stuff no matter what brand you get.

I used a Whirly Pop, a device I recommend. Coat the bottom with olive oil, almost cover the bottom with seeds, turn the heat up to around medium (not too low) and slowly turn the crank. Stop when the popping stops, as it does pretty abruptly, and pour it into a bowl. I season with sea salt and ground pepper. For the butter part, I mix about a small spoonfull of real butter with a slug or three of olive oil, heated together in the micro. Definite butter flavor without all the fat. Not a bad compromise at all.

All varieties popped almost completely, not many duds.

This makes a great breakfast, takes just a few minutes.

This popcorn is advertised as from Amish country and presumably is more a traditional style of corn, maybe a heritage variety, not a genetically modified product like Orville's. This is a controversial subject, important to many people and this product is an alternative to "Corporate Popcorn" for them.

I'd never tried fancy corn before and can say that it was strictly ok. If you like the small popped version you get it. I don't think it was worth the money, but lesson learned. I'll by regular corn from now on or look for cheap pricing.
Great product, probably a couple dollars pricey. I think PURPLE, BABY WHITE and then LADYFINGER were my favorite in that order.

This was a gift to my grandson (7) and he loves it, especially the colors. He is a Cub Scout and the Pack sold popcorn, but my son thought having different colors to experiment for him after the sales would be fun to have. I'm sure he will want more when the bags are all eaten.

This was a Verified Amazon Purchase
Very tender and light popcorn. I use the Back to Basics stainless steel stove top popcorn popper.

I purchased 50 lbs of the Ladyfinger Popcorn
It is awesome popcorn!!
If you use 1/2 cup of popcorn in a pot and just
cover with oil...leave the lid off until it
starts popping then cover until it almost
stops popping...remove the lid. It comes out
perfect with hardly no unpopped kernels. I
use an old pressure cooker pot with a hole
where the gauge would go. Works Great!!!!
I wouldn't buy any other popcorn... This is
the best...small kernels...hulless...

I was looking for popcorn with less hulls.  Have been using Oroville R's microwave popcorn for years and have noticed more and more hulls which are not great for the teeth!  I found the Amish country popcorn somewhat as advertised.  The purple were tasty with larger kernels.  However, the smaller kernels did poorly in air popper.  Kernels kept flying out because of being so much smaller and lighter weight.  Did like the taste and give an A+ for less hulls.

VERY YUMMY POP CORN I GOT THIS
FOR MY SON WE MADE IT THAT NITE ALL THE
CORN POPED AND A GREAT TASTE THEY WHERE SO GOOD
THAT YOU DIDNT NEED TO ADD BUTTER

I'd heard and read great things about the Amish Country Popcorn so I ordered this set with the 3 different 1lb bags of kernels. They ALL were very delicious, and popped up wonderfully (we are using the outstanding West Bend 82306 Stir Crazy 6-Quart Electric Popcorn Popper [..] by the way).

My kids really enjoy the lady finger popcorn due to the miniature size of the kernels.

While all 3 kinds are delicious, we've decided that the purple are our favorite (large, firm kernels, great for buttering) and will be ordering just the purple next time.

This set was a great way to try out several kinds of kernels at once :)

The blue corn is great, extra flavorful and apparently more nutritious than white popcorns; but, the other 2 pop as very very small and their flavor isn't that much better than larger kernels to make it worthwhile.  Just get the blue corn on its own.

Our family loves popcorn.  The Amish Country Popcorn is wonderful...tender, tasty and delightful.  We love the nearly hull less kernels and the tiny size of the popped product.  So good to enjoy while watching movies or even just curling up and reading a good book.

Regular popcorn shreds my gums and gets stuck deep down in them. This popcorn is a dream. It is easy on my gums and nothing gets stuck.

I like to put 1/4 cup of kernels into a paper lunch bag and microwave it. The flavors are fantastic without adding anything to it. I'll never buy regular popcorn again.

Save your money.
Go buy yellow or white popcorn from your local grocery store (under a $1.00 a lb.).
They are charging $4.80 a pound here.
I found two of the three verities they are selling here are no more than yellow and white popcorn which cost less than $1.00 a lb. at your local grocery store.
Their third verity here the 'Purple' has no significant different taste or flavor than yellow or white popcorn.
Popcorn is popcorn after being popped.
Also save your money on their caramel topping. You are just buying brown sugar.
They are charging ($11.58) for a 10 oz. jar of what amounts to brown sugar.
A 2 lb. bag of brown sugar is around $2.00 at your local grocery store.
By the way brown sugar a very good popcorn topping in my opinion. As good as I have found.
So there you are.
My opinion for what it's worth.
This does not work in a hot Air Popper.  It is light in weight and size. and the hot air blows it out of the popper.  Might be okay for other type of poppers, but not Hot Air, like the Presto Units.

Summary: Amish Country Popcorn, Set of 3 1lb. bags
Text: you cant use an air popper for these because they are to small and just fly out I dont know how they taste I gave them away to a friend who had a kettle popper

Summary: Good Popcorn even in a hot air popper
Text:
Please take the numbers in this review with a pinch of salt (and maybe a little butter).

My pack came today. The directions said that a serving was 3 tablespoons, so I took one tablespoon of each of the three varieties and put them in my (very old) hot air popper and turned it on. It popped fine with only a few un-popped kernels and the number of old maids more numerous but also very small -- perhaps 1/3 of the number that I get with "regular" popcorn. The popped kernels are about half the size of regular popcorn when popped, but the that's to be expected since they are about 1/2 the size when it starts out. The flavor of all three varieties is good and I could tell that there were at least two different varieties based on the taste. I could not distinguish between the three varieties visually (but I didn't do a careful inspection, I just grabbed a handful and glanced at it as I was putting it in my mouth. I used about half a tablespoon of melted (real) butter and a decent size pinch of salt. I thought the three tablespoon serving was reasonable, perhaps not as much as I usually eat by volume but probably slightly more than I usually eat in terms of number of kernels. I'll try some tomorrow popped in oil and post an edit to this review.

In summary, it's a touch pricy for popcorn, but the flavor is slightly different from grocery store popcorn and I'd buy it again (especially with free (Prime) shipping).
Popcorn very good, I did not get all the kernels to pop. May have been my popper. Price was a little high for the amount of popcorn received.
Popcorn tastes OK -- but the kernal pop way too small.  It's like a whole bowl of the bottom of the tub of popcorn crumbs.  Regular Orville Redenbacher popcorn is much better
I won't be ordering again.  Maybe it is my popcorn popper, but there was too many un-popped hulls in every batch that I used.  Could be they weren't very fresh.

We bought this for our air popper and we "LOVE" the Purple corn! The smaller corns like the baby white is too small to pop in an air popper, I had it all over my kitchen when I tried. However we have a LOVE for that great PURPLE corn! We need to support more Amish farms that care about the integrity of the foods they grow (not trying to make a buck on GMO's). It is well worth every penny spent. Tried the Blue corn too recently and that was awesome, the family loves this stuff.
After popping the Amish Country corn I found many hulls that did not pop.  The corn wasn't very fluffy and tough to eat.

I had expected a large popped pot of popped corn but what I received after popping was a "fresh, but small popped kernals. They were rather tasteless. I still have 2 3/4 lbs. left and probably will seek another brand.
One of three packages, LADY FINGER TYPE,  was inedible and did not pop. Could not determine until used other two types which were ok.

I am disappointed in this product. For reasons unknown to me, it doesn't pop well at all in my electric air popper.
I've never had a problem with other brands. Perhaps it has to do with the small size of the kernels. But rather than pop, they pretty much just fly around the kitchen...unpopped!!

I don't pretend to be a popcorn expert but either fresh or even  a few days old, salted, I'll eat it. Of the three offered in this package, I don't have a favorite. They are all tasty in their own way.

This popcorn pops up in very small kernals.  However, the flavor is very good and much better than the "store" bought popcorn.  The small baby white is my favorite.  The purple is the most bland.  Overall though, worth buying if you like good popcorn.

I was on-line looking for a popcorn popper for a wedding gift.  The Amish country popcorn came up as a match for my search.  My family loves popcorn so I thought I would try it.  I love this popcorn.  They a little pieces of popcorn.  They are almost hull free, which is something I really like.  The popcorn kernels are fresh!  I will be purchasing more of this product!
I still had the same amount of unpopped seeds in my microwave popper.  however, the taste is super. I enjoy the hulless 100% better and will continue to purchase.

Summary: Tried the all & here's my advice
Text: I got the combo starter pack. Flavor is good with all of the varieties, but they have their pros and cons. Baby White are very tiny and a bit hard to eat with fingers, so I ended up using a big spoon to eat (also too many unpopped kernels).  Gourmet red IS less hulls, but a bit larger than Baby White, but still too small for my tastes, but it DOES have great flavor. Gourmet White medium is an excellent choice, pops well, crunchy, flavorful, easy to pick up. My Favorite is Purple Popcorn with good sized kernels, nutty flavor almost, tender, perfection and looks good in the bowl (not that it matters).  All of their popcorn is grown so much better than conventional popcorn - no doubt due to their old-fashioned ways of farming.... thank you Amish Community for being this way. No more Jolly Time or Orville's for me.  My only negative review is that glass corn popper device they sell, does not work well in microwaves... too many un-popped kernels and if you put too much it'll burn real easy and ya end up with a very stinky microwave and kitchen UGH!  IF they know how to make it work, give very detailed instructions or discontinue.
Received this set as a gift and they are a wonderful tasting product.  Perfect for my West Bend popcorn maker.

This popcorn is sweeter and more flavorful than the cheapo brand we used to buy at the store. I'm hooked. My favorite is the purple, but I usually mix all three together and that's just as good. Tastes excellent and is healthy when cooked in expeller pressed coconut oil.

I love popcorn and eat it almost everyday. Great source of fiber and low in calories. I never had Amish popcorn before, so when I ordered the popper, this was recommended. Will be ordering more and different kinds.

I got this as a small gift for my girlfriend who was always forgetting to buy more cheap popcorn at the store. I thought she would enjoy some unique and gourmet popcorn and I was right - she really liked them, especially the purple kind. We cook it on the stove with oil and it worked perfectly. However, don't be an idiot like me and splash oil all over your face! Does NOT feel good. Popcorn has a great, distinct flavor and I think we will be returning for more.
It was a Christmas gift and the recipients were very happy to receive it.  It also came in a timely manner.  Thanks.

When I bought my popcorn popper I figured I'd try this popcorn just to see how it was.  Please dont waste your money on this stuff.  The colonels were very very small and tough.  I thought maybe since it was my first time using it  wud try it again in case it was me with a new popper....and again it was awful.  Threw the popped popcorn out and even the birds wudnt eat it....

Summary: wrong popcorn for the airpop I bought
Text: I purchased an airpop popcorn maker.  This is a small kernal popcorn that did poorly in the machine.  Kernals were flying out and many didn't pop.

I was ripped off! Promised a superior product. I purchased the medium yellow, small kernals, lots unpopped, flavor: below average, texture: odd sandy. would love to get my money back for this obvious tourist trap crap.
I was looking forward to the popcorn and was disappointed it never arrived.  Possibly it is back ordered.  Hoping to have fresh pop corn soon.
not at all worth the cost...purchased a great hot air popper and used this corn in it...tried all three varieties with same results...popcorn was stale and tasteless...using Orville from now on.
This was a very nice gift for my mother and father in law. They really enjoyed it!

If you ever go to an Indian restaurant with me, order your own papadams (English spellings vary). Once these delicious wafers get to the table, I suddenly become sharing-impaired.

You've certainly seen them at Indian restaurants. They're the saucer-sized crispy wafers. Thin, crunchy, and often seasoned with big flavors (black pepper, cumin, garlic, or chilis, to name a few), these call to mind some Western crispy snacks, all of which pale in comparison. Made with bean flour, these offer a bit of protein with their crunch, but without a bean-y flavor. And, if it matters, you don't have to be a chemist to pronounce any of the ingredients.

I've had a few flavors in the Lijjat line, including plain. I've had other brands, too, but this is the one I keep coming back to. These can be cooked many ways, including frying or toasting over an open flame - but a stack of three in the microwave for a minute come out very nearly as good, and with fewer calories than you might expect. Each package contains about 15 wafers, so the 20-pack is only for large families or the truly fanatical. If you can't get to an Indian grocer, though, consider splitting with some friends. They'd better be good friends, though, because sharing is a real problem.

-- wiredweird

These are the best brand of poppadoms, and I have tried many. I am in a rural area and recently unable to find them in the local stores. I even watched a video on how to make poppadoms. Living in Florida, I knew the sun-dried aspect was obtainable. But as it is winter, I decided to wait until summer before attempting this.
Not wanting to wait until summer to have poppadoms with curry, I went back to searching online. As they are called many things by many different people, I now search for poppadom (yes, many different spellings), udad, papad. I was really happy to find these on Amazon.
These are fresh and "bendy", unlike the more famous brands which are truly brittle and dried out. I can almost see these by Lijjat being sun dried a few weeks before I use them. After cooking, they are larger, lighter and more crisp than the usual poppadoms, and taste wonderful.
I may never try to make my own, as these are probably much better than I could ever make.

Lijjat Papad is the only brand I trust to consistently perform well for me. I tend to roast mine over an open flame (god bless gas stoves!), but my sister-in-law likes to do hers in the microwave. It's the papad that my mother bought in India, and it's the one that I buy in New York. We're trying to watch our weight, so these are a much tastier, lower fat, higher nutrition, version of potato crisps that you see in the stores all the time.

Like the other reviewer, I have a tough time sharing these, so the 20 pack isn't unreasonable for me. Think about it: you have a snack that's ready in seconds, and can be eaten with pickles, with chutneys, with meals, or all by itself. AND it's not dripping with fat. I have a lot of friends over, so I tend to run through papad fairly quickly.
We ordered the twenty pack and split it with another household.  No one could eat them.  They tasted like plastic.  We tried several from a few different packages and had the same results.

Summary: You have to do it right!
Text:
This stuff is great, my kids love it! No artificial colors, flavors, no sugar, and no harmful chemicals like the blue stuff, pink stuff, or yellow stuff.

You have to know how to do it right though!

First off, use about half of what they suggest. You can always add more later if you want more, but with Stevia if you use too much it will taste bitter. Some flavors require more than 1/2 strength. With orange for example I use their recommended amounts, but the other flavors are anywhere from 1/2 to 2/3 the recommended amounts. Always start with less and add more until it tasts right for you.

Secondly, it takes a long time for it to dissolve. Mix it in and let it sit for at least 10 minutes before trying any, and really it is best after sitting in the fridge overnight. If you just dump some in the top and take a drink you will be VERY disappointed as it will clump and just sit there.

We use a dispensing refrigerator container so the kids can serve themselves. I make 5L at a time, one of each flavor and it is always a hit.

ProfileName: Glitter Girl "Amy Elizabeth Gibb Gish, Esq."
Text: OK, I know, I know, I know . . . drink more water.  Only problem is . . . I hate water.  This solves my problem.  Natural sweeteners without any sugar. No artificial colors. The light strawberry flavor is like cotton candy if you use a little less mix than recommended. I love it. I actually look forward to drinking this at the office all day. Makes my water a lovely pale pink (sort of like pink lemonade) that makes every one ask "what are you drinking?"
This product is pretty delicious.  I love using stevia instead of other fake sugars because it's a natural product and seems less likely to cause cancer.  I wish more things would use it instead!

So far I've only tried it in plain yogurt and it was AMAZING!!!  It was very strawberry tasting and just the right amount of sweet.  I started slowly by only putting in half the recommended and then added in a little more.  It is a little strong so start low and add to your desired taste.  :)

Summary: I don't leave home without it
Text: i like the strawberry, lime, and cherry, but i think i like the strawberry best.  This drink solves my problem of getting enough fluids, and aside from coffee i don't drink anything else anymore.  Take the suggestions other positive reviewers have done - let it dissolve (I shake the container), and DON'T USE TOO MUCH POWDER!  It is delicious if you get the quantity right - just use a measuring spoon.

We recently got this product, not knowing what to expect.  If you like flavored waters, than this is the stuff for you.  You're not really going to get a kool-aid type of beverage from it.  I have a quart sized water bottle, and I put in about 1/4 tsp of the product then add water.  I don't have the clumping issue, because I shake my water bottle.  I get a nice drink that isn't too sweet and is refreshing.  I'm going to try other flavors too. =)

Summary: not a good value at 9.95, but passable for half price
Text:
I was dissapointed with this product's retail price. While the bitter taste known to accomplany stevia was reduced in this product, I felt that there just wasn't enough powder to make it worth the cash compared to other non-aspartame based powdered drinks out on the market. The usage directions are abysmal on the bottle, so I went with what most people stated here and started with a small quantity of powder. I blended it very well using a blendy bottle, which is a 28oz bottle that contains a coiled circular spring inside that slices through the water, stirring with every shake. While I can't comment on how well it tastes if you mix and let settle for long periods of time, I never had an issue with clumping or not having enough flavor.

As for flavors, all I bought were pretty tasty. I ordered cherry, orange, lemon-lime, strawberry, and grape all at once when there was a decent sale going. this was in september 2009.

Even though you don't need much powder to get a good taste, the company doesn't give any estimation as to how much you should use or how much a bottle makes. With that in mind at the price its at, I find it hard to give this product more than 3 stars. If it was four dollars I'd think it was a steal and easily give another star, as I estimate each jar will make upwards of 2-3 gallons, maybe more if used sparingly. at $9.95, sorry, I just can't. I'm back to my old ways of using a touch of stevia from packets to sweeten my water and topping it off with whichever citrus fruits are on sale (a squeeze of lemon, lime, or orange for flavor).

I would have given this product a 2 star. The taste is not that good... so it gets a 2* for flavor. However, the health value is tremendous. For people with diabetese, this is a miracle.

What is nice about the flavor is that it is NOT overpowering. Therefore, if you want to add you own flavoring to it... I suggest something like unsweetened kool aid... or something like it that is healthier.

This product has a great potential and it's health benefits are superb!

This product is delicious, not to mention all-natural, and I use it almost every single day.  I mix it into plain yogurt and it makes it downright addictive. I'm slowly collecting all the flavors of Stevita (I only wish there were more!!) and this one might just be my favorite; it's the perfect balance of sweetness and authentic strawberry flavor!

This product has a great flavor and it even has vitamin C in it.  Most water flavorings don't offer that except Propel; and propel has artificial sweetener in it.  I prefer using Stevia products because they have no chemicals in it.  The only problem I had was with it dissolving in really cold water.

For someone who is trying to slowly switch over from regular diet sodas/drinks to all natural diet substitutes, I have tried a variety of stevia flavored drinks (aka stevia sweetened sodas and teas). This my first time trying a powdered drink. And it's better than what I expected. I was bit wary after reading some of the reviews. You can add just a little bit and it's enough to sweeten my tea or just water. I am not a fan of drinking water (except fiji or while working out) and this can easily quench my thirst when I add the right amount. If I add too much its a mix between bitter and sweet and it's not that good. It's something I add for flavour and a great alternative for a healthy diet nut who likes tasty drinks. I would like to try the orange so I can add it to tea and make it DIY iced orange tea.

This stuff makes a very mildly flavored water. I was hoping for something like kool-ade, and did not get that with this product. The amount of sweetness it gives is ok, I just wish the fruity flavor was a lot more intense.

I really hoped that this would be good for milk and yogurt like Quik or Hersheys syrup, but sadly, it is not.
Being a newly minted diabetic, I am
very limited on things I can have, that of course, I used to love.
Like Strawberry Ice Cream, or a Strawberry shake. I had hope that this product
with Stevia would be a good alternative.
I am afraid however that this stuff tastes nothing like strawberry at all, frankly I am not sure what it
tastes like.

I ordered this after I had purchased their Chocolate product, which is AMAZING.
I loved it so much I had just assumed the strawberry would be
just as good, so much so I had bought 2 containers of it.
Well, you live and you learn. Will I buy it again? not a chance. Will I buy the Chocolate
stevita again? darn right I will.
That stuff tastes great in skim milk, and that greek zero fat yogurt ( which I can have ) and makes that stuff taste
fantastic.

So. Strawberry Sevita NO.
Chocolate Sevita YES YES YES.

As usual, taste is an personal thing, and you might like the strawberry stuff, so Your Milage May Vary.

I will start by saying I love stevia! I have used it for years in just about every form there is (powder, liquid, packets, teas, etc) so I do understand it's taste and concentration. Unfortunately, this stuff just taste nasty no matter how you mix it! I've tried using less, I've tried using more, nothing helps. So far, I have only tried the strawberry so I'm hoping other flavors are better, but this one is just not drinkable, sorry.
Do they test their product before selling it? This wont dissolve, it lumps up into chunks on top. Total waste of money.

Summary: Amazon come through in the clutch!
Text: My local grocers quit carrying this product AFTER I had already developed an affinity for it. It's quick, easy, tasty, and if you put it together with a package of ramen noodles you have a meal in a snap! I work a lot of hours and I greatly value resources that put a meal in front of me with a minimum of hassle and adequate value. This hits the spot! Thanks Kikkoman, thanks Amazon!
This is an outstanding product that I add to and makes the best Hot and Sour soup going
This Hot and Sour soup is excellent! We like to enhance it some with a little extra spice (habanero powder), some firm tofu, chinese dried black mushrooms, egg and scallions.

This soup is so light and filling at the same time and has a wonderful flavor that is balanced with just the right amount of hot and sour. It is not overbearing on either side that would leave you wanting more of the hot or more of the sour, it is very delicious.

Summary: Hot & Sour Egg Flower soup Mix
Text: This makes a tasty, low-calorie soup.  I often add extra vegetables and even a few noodles. Love this product.

This is a Kikkoman product and the quality is apparent.  Quick and easy to make and very tasty, certainly as good as or better than I've had at most Asian restaurants.  I like to add crushed Tien Tsin peppers to give it a little more kick.
This is the best hot and sour soup mix we have ever found.  We add a few sliced mushrooms, and often a little pork and/or seafood, and it's nothing short of wonderful.

I love this soup!  And my grocery store stopped carrying it, so I am very grateful that I can order it here, and have it shipped to my home!  It arrives in perfect order, right on time every time!  TY TY TY
I love this soup, I used to be able to buy it at Walmart and then they discontinued selling it. So thanks to Amazon I can still get my soup.

For taste, enjoyment, and ease of preparation, I would have given this soup 5 stars.  However, I was disappointed to learn that it contains MSG (Monosodium Glutamate).  I really wish this did not have MSG, as I have to try and avoid the stuff.
After buying this product for under $1.50 each, I cannot see paying that price. It's a good soup mix ,,,But not $3.41 good.

I was really tired of going through all of the recalls & not knowing if or when either my dog or myself was going to get sick! I have bought the best dog foods on the market literally and nothing even came close to making my very picky Australian Cattle Dog happy. Then a friend suggested that I try Annamaet.  The day I took it out of the mailbox, he started jumping up & down bumping the box with his nose - I figured that he was only trying to amuse me.  So, we did the usual routine: Take a little of the food put it in the bowl & see if I get the evil stare, bent ears and disgusted look as if to say "Really, are you kidding me?" Not this time! When he saw that I had some of that wonderful smelling food in my hand, he immediately sat down and barked - he actually ate it out of my hand. His coat is incredibly soft & shiny and he looks great.  Also, he does not shed or blow his coat hardly at all like a normal blue heeler. I can not say enough about this food - I only wish that there was a store that sold it in my state, but that's ok - I will continue to order through amazon.

I am spoiled because I caught, marinated, smoked and packaged my own salmon in the NW for years. I ordered the small packages for stocking stuffers for the holidays. I live in Louisiana (although salmon do not migrate to the Gulf) these days but salmon can be purchased semi-fresh all season. Should have bought some fillets and smoked them myself. I do know why it so overpriced it is a very easy process and never had a bad batch.
This Alaska salmon I purchased is (without going into details) would make a nice pet treat or crab bait after sampling it...I would not give it as a gift. Nice, authentic style packaging...gives you a star. But I trust Amazon, however I do not believe it was sampled by anyone in QA.

Jim Kansier
New Iberia, LA
Super easy to make and the flavor is awesome!  We love the restaurant in Chicago and were happy to see this in the grocery store.  Love this!

I am so happy to see these carried on Amazon. I have been buying them from my local health food store, but I am going to start buying them in bulk here.

Let me start by saying that I buy very few processed foods. I make nearly everything from scratch including: pasta, bread, tortillas, crackers, ground meat, baked goods, marshmallows, etc. I feel like I have very high standards for grocery items. The only reason I even tried these was that I have a ton of respect for Rick Bayless. I have several of his cookbooks and I have enjoyed many awesome meals and learned a ton from them.

Anyway I have tried 4-5 varieties of these pouches: the red enchilada, the green enchilada, the fajita, and the beef taco. All four of them blew me away! To the point where I actually wonder if I should even bother with making any of it from scratch anymore.

Take my word for it.... these are totally worth the money! I will always keep them on hand.
My wife brought five different flavored. They are all excellent! We used the taco flavor last night and it is some of the best tacos we have made yet.

If you love the flavor of toasted pecans, this coffee is for you.  Great flavor, good coffee taste.  It was very easy to brew the right strength. What a pleasure to wake up to the smell of toasted pecans and freshly brewed coffee! This is the second time I've purchased this coffee and I'll definitely do it again.
Came upon Cameron's Coffee strickly by chance at a local store. Loved the flavor so later did an Internet search and found it on Amazon, PLUS it's available as a subscription. Talk about convenience!

This coffee will blow your hair straight back. Make sure to wear a ball cap while drinking. It's just that good. As with any coffee good drinking water is the key ingredient to perfecting a great cup of coffee. Hence, lousy water, lousy coffee. I try to stick with distilled water to make my coffee or invest in a good countertop water filter to at least get the lousy chlorine out of the water. But for those of you who are lucky enough to have excellent well water you probably won't have to bother with distilled or filtered water. Lucky you!!

Summary: I'm Hooked on Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan Coffee
Text: I first saw this coffee at Amazon. I had never heard of Cameron's and this particular flavor sounded good. The aroma of the beans is wonderful. The aroma while brewing awakens me clear in the bedroom as its' set using the built in timer. My first cup and that was it ! Although I still like a strong dark French roast, this medium roasted Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan is now my favorite brew. The Aroma and Flavor is GREAT ! I would like to try some other roast by Cameron's, but I can't seem to make a change since I like this soooo much ! Really good coffee ! I highly recommend !Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan Whole Bean Coffee, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 3)
Coffee arrived on time, was fresh and the value was good. I always use Amazon to purchase my specialty coffee.

Summary: My Favorite-Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan Coffee
Text: This is the only coffee I've bought for a few years.  I grind the beans myself and make it strong with a little half-and-half.  The flavoring is not necessarily noticeable, you might think that it is an unflavored coffee.  It tastes smooth and creamy, not bitter.  I prepare this coffee the same way when my parents visit and they ask, "Why is your coffee so good?"  So I now give them bags of this coffee for gifts.  I prefer the whole-bean coffee, I think it tastes fresher.

Too mild and I'm not sure that it tastes of pecans at all.  We ended up mixing with stronger dark beans to give it some heft, but that doesn't make me want this again.  The price is good (esp given the rising price of coffee beans), but we won't re-order this one.

This coffee is fantastic and each cup makes me craving for more. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars - the smell is much less when the coffee is ready, the beans themselves smell much stronger and better. But over all it is pure pleaser and I am now a returning customer. We live in the Dominican Republic and when I first have ordered this coffee beans, my husband was very irritated, said - we live in the coffee republic, to order coffee via Internet is equal as to try selling snow to Greenland. But now he is the first one, who reminds me that our coffee stock is coming to an end and we need to order some more.
I don't like flavored coffee that has a strong taste.  This is extremely good with a mild pecan taste and a great smell.

Summary: Camerons Toasted Southern Pecan is the best flavored coffee around.
Text: This coffee has enough real coffee taste to please real coffee drinkers and enough flavor to please those who only like flavors!  Simply put, one pot will please everyone in your house or at your party.  Great for every day or at a party; morning or dessert.  I love it and it is the only flavor I order now!  I am a bold/espresso drinker and my mom is a weak coffee drinker, but we can agree on this.  You won't be disappointed!

I figured this coffee would be great from seeing the good reviews. I'm starting to think they are from the company. I was looking for a good southern pecan coffee and this tastes nothing like pecans. It tastes like hazelnut. If I wanted hazelnut, I would buy it. The coffee itself tastes okay, but it doesn't taste how it should. I expected better from this company since I love their other flavors.

I was unable to buy the particular brand of Southern Pecan coffee locally that I've bought for years so started researching on Amazon for a replacement. Read the various customer reviews and this brand seemed to be the perfect choice.

This is what I've found since purchasing it: The coffee is very weak in flavor, watery in taste and........when you grind more coffee beans to compensate........it doesn't improve. No creamy, rich flavor - not even close.

For my money, I will never buy this coffee again. It's just not worth it.

Summary: totally agree, it is restaurant quality!  SUPER!!!!
Text:
believe all the 5-star reviews, this broth is restaurant quality...I'm thinking some restaurants are using this broth???

Make sure you buy all the additions (greens, beef slices, bean sprouts, hot peppers, siracha, hoison sauce, etc...)

Only thing I would modify is to add more water. It's a little salty for my taste. Water it down. So, one package suggests 2 gallons of water...I would add an additional gallon of water. Or whatever you like to get it just right.

But it is awesome, it's got the aroma of Pho, it's semi-oily at the top of the broth...I mean...good, good, good!!!

I didn't know how to cook Pho & tried a few ways until I found this product. It made my cooking so fun & interesting as it's so easy to prepare a delicious bowl of Pho at home. "My Pho" was so delicious that my husband (American who came to VN regularly for business) wanted me to cook Pho 3 times/week until we both were fed up eating Pho :) Now we only cook Pho at home once/month or cook it for our American guests to introduce :)
Any way, I strongly believe you can save time & energy & will get compliments by using this product to cook Pho at home :)

Summary: As good as, or better than my favorite Pho restaurant
Text: I have NEVER left a review for anything and have been buying stuff online for years. This soup base makes the most authentic and delicious pho! My family was amazed that it tasted exactly the same as our favorite restaurant. ****Use high quality beef-it makes all the difference!

Summary: Anyone can make Real Pho with this
Text: My wife and I have been trying to make Pho like the ones at the Vietnamese restaurant but no sucess.  When comes to Pho, I am very, very picky on how it should taste.  I've gone to many restaurants and even some of their pho does not meet my expectation....only a few select restaurants actually does.  First time I found VV Foods' Pho base was in an asian store.  Unfortunately, they don't always have it in stock.  I guess someone else found out the "secret" base as well.  I called up VV Foods and they said that I can order directly through them or through Amazon.  Best Pho base ever.  Even if you can't cook, this pho base will make you a pro.

Summary: This is the only way I make Pho!
Text: This is the only way I make Pho!  All you need is the beef bones and add this soup base then you're all set.  This is even better than the restaurant.

I've been trying to make beef Pho at home for several months now with zero success. I finally did some extra searching when looking for some type of Pho base and found this. I read the reviews and ordered instantly.
It's so good. It's as good as our local restaurant. I followed some advice such as using less base so I made a gallon and used 4oz (5oz or half jar is what it calls for) or base and one spice packet. I let the spice packet boil for about an hour. I tasted it after the first boil as the instructions say but it didn't have as much flavor as I like.
My whole family loved it.
The only thing is I used rice stick noodles that weren't very good. I've tried thin rice noodles but those were about the same as the sticks. My local restaurant uses rice noodles that are very soft and look close to an angel hair pasta size. Maybe I'm not cooking the rice noodles long enough because they didn't get as soft as I like.

Flavor of this broth was spot on!  I have been to many Vietnamese restaurants for this soup and the flavor was quite similar to this product.  My only complaint was that it was a bit too salty for my taste.  I added an extra quart of water to dillute but it was still too salty.  Next time, I may use a bit less of the beef base.  I would definately recommend this product.

Yes! I don't have a pho restaurant anywhere near me.  This is the next best thing.  It truly has the pho flavor.  It comes with a jar of pho "paste" and two packets of seasoning.  I make two batches out of these and it makes a lot. I can also freeze any extra broth for later use.  I don't follow the directions regarding the onion and ginger.  I just simmer one seasoning packet for an hour to really pull out the spicy flavor, then I add half the paste mix.  Serve with the traditional pho ingredients.  YUM.

I fell in love with Pho on the east coast and when I moved to Texas one of the saddest moments was realizing there was no Vietnamese restaurant. I could not even get some of the spices in the recipes I found online. I tried five different times to make it from scratch, or from other Asian mixes, etc. and failed miserably.

THIS IS IT! It's perfect. It tastes JUST LIKE the Pho at Pho Vung Tau... a perfect broth. JUST GREAT. With beef, chicken, or seafood, and romaine, sprouts, rice noodles plus fish, hoisin, limes and srichia (sp?) sauce, it's amazing!! I introduced this dish to my neighbors and Texas family and they're all Pho addicts now too. Especially fun with sweet fish dip and Chun's shrimp spring rolls. :) Can't say enough how great this stuff is if you love Pho and want to have it at home.

Did I mention this is VERY YUMMY???? I wish I could post a picture to show how incredibly *pretty* this broth is when it's completed - such a rich color with a great sheen.

A-plus!

Summary: Check the expiration date on bottom of jar.
Text:
Altho this is a good pho base to make at home, however, the expiration is not visibly outside on the box but on the bottom of the jar inside the box. I bought a couple of these from a local store and have been using them last week. Just now I notice that they have expired three months ago. I checked the box and see no dates so I made a call to VV Foods asking why expiration is not outside on the box instead. The lady told me that the FDA's law that they have to have an expiration date stamped on the bottom or on the lid of the jar and not the outside packaging. Also, it's the store's responsibility to check and rotate the products. She then educate me that consumers have the right to open the boxes to check on expiration dates and take back to store for refund if products expired. Uh, each box contains 2 spice packages inside and for a customer to open the boxes up just to get a non-expired product would look very weird and even a waste of time. And really made no sense at all.

What if you buy from online because they're not available at local stores? I don't think it would be a problem with Amazon to refund and/or resend but if it is Amazon's responsibility to open up the packaging to check for expiration dates before sending them to their customers would cause a problem in their shipping lines.
Health concerns due to heaps of MSG and animal fats aside, this is one good tasting soup base that will last you for quite a while.

when i first received this product, i was psyched.
but after making the broth then i realized there's tons of
msg enbedded in the paste. we had to down tons of water afterwards.
i will not purchase or recommend this product to anyone who enjoys
a flavorful bowl of pho.

Summary: Good Product; Buy it at Costco!
Text: This is a very handy product that I always have on hand.  Price here is a little high, but if you do not have access to it from Costco Warehouse, then you should buy it here....Same product at Costco is sold for $3.99 each jar.

Here's an item that we like keeping on the kitchen shelves. It's a 13.5 ounce plastic jar of Kirkland Signature Dried and Chopped onions. We usually use fresh onions wherever possible, but these fine-grained chopped onions lend themselves for using in meat balls, meat loaf, soups where the fine grain size is important and in a variety of dips. Nice taste. Easy to store. Long shelf life. Ours is now over the "best by" date, but the still work fine and I wouldn't think of throwing them out. It's a good, useful product to have around.

Gary Peterson
So glad to have dried onions grown in U.S.A.  For most purposes, I chop up fresh onions, but I like to have dried on hand.  These have excellent flavor.
